1 Genealogy of Jesus Christ, son of David, son of Abraham:

15 Womesia akaɖi dana ɖe kusi te o, ke ɖe akaɖiti dzi boŋ, eye wòklẽna na ame siwo katã le aƒea me. 16 Nenema kee mina miaƒe kekeli naklẽ le amewo ŋkume, ale be woakpɔ miaƒe dɔ nyui wɔwɔwo, eye woakafu mia Fofo si le dziƒo.

12 And after the removal to Babylon Jeconiah had a son Shealtiel; and Shealtiel, Zerubbabel; 13 and Zerubbabel, Abihud; and Abihud, Eliakim; and Eliakim, Azzur; 14 and Azzur, Sadok; and Sadok, Jachin; and Jachin, Elihud; 15 and Elihud, Eleazar; and Eleazar, Mattan; and Mattan, Jacob; 16 and Jacob, Joseph, the husband of Mary who had for her son Jesus, known as the Messiah.
17 "Migasusu be ɖe meva Se la kple Nyagblɔɖilawo ƒe nyawo ɖe ge ɖa o. Nyemeva wo ɖe ge ɖa o, ke boŋ be mana woava eme.

17 So there are in all fourteen generations from Abraham down to David, and fourteen generations from David down to the removal to Babylon, and fourteen generations from the removal to Babylon down to the Messiah.
18 Mele egblɔm na mi le nyateƒe me be, ne dziƒo kple anyigba nu ate ŋu ayi gɔ̃ hã la, Sea ƒe ŋɔŋlɔdzesi suetɔ kekeake alo ŋɔŋlɔdzesi aɖe ƒe kakɛ aɖeke nu mayi o, va se ɖe esime nu siawo katã va eme.
18 And the birth of Jesus Christ was thus: His mother Mary being engaged to Joseph, before they came together it was found that she was pregnant by the Holy Spirit.
19 Eya ta ame si daa se suetɔ siawo dometɔ ɖeka pɛ dzi, eye wòfiaa amewo be woawɔ nenema la, madze na Dziƒofiaɖuƒea me yiyi o.
19 And Joseph her husband, being an honest man and unwilling to make a spectacle of her, wanted to divorce her privately.
20 Elabena mele egblɔm na mi be, ne miaƒe dzɔdzɔenyenye meƒo agbalẽfialawo kple Farisitɔwo tɔ ta sãa o la, miele Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la me yi ge akpɔ o.
20 But while he was thinking of this, lo, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying "Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take your wife Mary.

21 "Miese wogblɔ na blematɔwo be: ‘Mègawu ame o, ke ame si wu ame la, adze ʋɔnudɔdrɔ̃.’ 22 Ke nye la, mele egblɔm na mi be, ame si le dɔmedzoe dom ɖe nɔvia ŋu la, woabia akɔntae le ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe; eye ame si agblɔ gbɔɖiamenya ɖe nɔvia ŋu atsɔ ado vloe la, woabia akɔntae le Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe Kɔkɔtɔ; eye ame si agblɔ be: ‘Èdzɔ lã ŋutɔ!’ la, adze na Gehena ƒe dzo la me yiyi.
For what has been generated in her is by the Holy Spirit; 21 and she shall bear a son, and you shall name him Jesus, for he shall save his people from their sins.
23 "Eya ta ne ètsɔ wò nunana va vɔsamlekpuia gbɔ, eye nèɖo ŋku edzi le afi ma be nya aɖe le nɔviwò si ɖe ŋuwò la, 24 gblẽ wò nunana la ɖe afi ma le vɔsamlekpuia ŋgɔ, eye nàdzo ayi.

22 And all this has come to pass in order that what was said by the Lord through the prophet in the words 23 ‘Lo, the maiden shall be pregnant and bear a son, and they shall name him Immanuel’ " which means "God-is-with-us " "should be fulfilled. " 24 And on waking from his sleep Joseph did as the angel of the Lord directed him, and took his wife 25 and did not know her until she bore a son, and named him Jesus. Matthew

Wɔ ŋutifafa kple nɔviwòa gbã, eye ne ètrɔ gbɔ la, nàtsɔ wò nunana la ana. 25 "Dzra wò kple ame si sama wò la dome ɖo kaba esi miele mɔa dzi yina, ale be ame si sama wò la nagatsɔ wò ade asi na ʋɔnudrɔ̃la, ne ʋɔnudrɔ̃la hã natsɔ wò ade asi na kpovitɔ, eye woade wò gaxɔ me o.

2:1-23 2 And after Jesus was born at Bethlehem in Judea in the days of Herod the king, lo, magi from the East arrived in Jerusalem 2 saying "Where is the King of the Jews that has been born? for we saw his star coming up and have come to do him reverence. " 3 And at hearing it King Herod was alarmed, and all Jerusalem with him; 4 and he called together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, and inquired of them where the Messiah was to be born.

26 Vavã mele egblɔm na wò be, màdo go le afi ma akpɔ o va se ɖe esime nàxe gaku suetɔ kekeake hã. 27 "Miese wogblɔ be: ‘Mègawɔ ahasi o.’ 28 Ke nye la, mele egblɔm na mi be, ame sia ame si le ŋku lém ɖe nyɔnu ŋu, eye wòdzroe la, ewɔ ahasi kplii xoxo le eƒe dzi me.

5 And they said to him "At Bethlehem in Judea; for so it is written through the prophet, 6 ‘And you, Bethlehem, land of Judah, are by no means least among the chieftains of Judah; for out of you shall come a ruler who shall govern my people Israel.’ " 7 Then Herod called the magi privately and got from them the precise time of the star’s appearing, 8 and sent them to Bethlehem and said "Go and learn the precise facts about the child, and when you find him bring word to me, so that I may come myself and do him reverence. " 9 And they listened to the king and went; and lo, the star that they had seen coming up went ahead of them till it came and stood still over where the child was; 10 and when they saw the star they were glad, and their gladness was very great.
29 Eya ta ne wò ɖusimeŋku hea wò dea nu vɔ̃ me la, hoe ɖa nàtsɔ aƒu gbe. Elabena anyo na wò be nàbú wò ŋutinuwo dometɔ ɖeka wu be woatsɔ wò ameti blibo la aƒu gbe ɖe Gehena.

11 And they came to the house and saw the child with Mary his mother, and prostrated themselves and did him reverence; and they opened their coffers and offered gifts to him, gold and frankincense and myrrh.
30 Nenema ke ne wò nuɖusi hea wò dea nu vɔ̃ me la, lãe ɖa nàtsɔ aƒu gbe. Elabena anyo na wò be nàbú wò ŋutinuwo dometɔ ɖeka wu be wò ameti blibo la nayi Gehena.
12 And, it being revealed to them in a dream that they should not go back to Herod, they withdrew to their own country by another route.

31 "Wogblɔ hã be: ‘Ame si gbe srɔ̃a la, nena srɔ̃gbegbalẽe.’ 32 Ke nye la, mele egblɔm na mi be, ame si gbe srɔ̃a ne menye le ahasiwɔwɔ ta o la, ede nyɔnua ahasiwɔwɔ ƒe tetekpɔ me, eye ame sia ame si ɖe nyɔnu si wogbe la, ewɔ ahasi. 33 "Miese hã be wogblɔ na blematɔwo be: ‘Mègaka atam nàgbe edziwɔwɔ o, ke boŋ nàxe wò adzɔgbeɖefewo na Yehowa.’ 34 Ke nye la, mele egblɔm na mi be: Migatà naneke o, eɖanye dziƒo o, elabena Mawu ƒe fiazikpui wònye; 35 alo anyigba o, elabena eƒe afɔɖodzinue; alo Yerusalem o, elabena Fiagã la ƒe due.

13 And when they had withdrawn, lo, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream saying "Rise, take the child and his mother, and flee to Egypt, and be there till I tell you; for Herod is going to be looking for the child to make away with him. " 14 And he rose and took the child and his mother by night and withdrew to Egypt, 15 and was there till Herod’s death, in order that what was said by the Lord through the prophet in the words "Out of Egypt I called my son " should be fulfilled.
36 Eye mègatà wò ta hã o, elabena màte ŋu atrɔ ɖakui ɖeka wòazu ɣie alo yibɔ o. 37 Mina miaƒe ‘Ɛ̃’ nanye ɛ̃, eye miaƒe ‘Ao’ nanye ao, elabena nu si wu esiawo la, vɔ̃ɖitɔ la gbɔe wòtso.

16 Then Herod was greatly enraged at seeing that he had been made a fool of by the magi, and sent and took the lives of all the boys in Bethlehem and in all its territory, from two years old down, to correspond to the precise time which he had got from the magi.
38 "Miese wogblɔ be: ‘Ŋku ɖe ŋku teƒe, eye aɖu ɖe aɖu teƒe.’ 39 Ke nye la, mele egblɔm na mi be: Migatsi tsitre ɖe ame vɔ̃ɖi la ŋu o, ke boŋ ame si ke ƒo wò ɖusitome la, trɔ ekemɛ hã nɛ.

17 Then what was said through the prophet Jeremiah in the words 18 "A sound was heard in Ramah, weeping and much lamenting Rachel weeping for her children and not letting herself be comforted, because they are not " was fulfilled.

40 Eye ne ame aɖe di be yeahe wò ayi ʋɔnu ne yeaxɔ wò awutewui la, tsɔ wò awudziwui hã nɛ; 41 eye ne ŋusẽtɔ aɖe zi dziwò be nàwɔ dɔ aɖe na ye ahazɔ kpli ye agbadroƒe ɖeka la, zɔ agbadroƒe eve kplii. 42 Na nu ame si le nu biam wò, eye mègatrɔ megbe de ame si di be nàdo nu na ye la o.

19 And after Herod’s death, lo, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in Egypt in a dream, 20 saying "Rise, take the child and his mother, and go to the land of Israel; for those who were seeking the child’s life are dead. " 21 And he rose, took the child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

43 "Miese wogblɔ be: ‘Lɔ̃ hawòvi, eye nàlé fu wò futɔ.’ 44 Ke nye la, mele egblɔm na mi be: Miyi edzi mialɔ̃ miaƒe futɔwo, eye minɔ gbe dom ɖa ɖe ame siwo tia mia yome la ta, 45 ne miazu mia Fofo si le dziƒowo la ƒe viwo, elabena enana eƒe ɣe dzena na ame vɔ̃ɖiwo kple ame nyuiwo, eye wònana tsi dzana na ame dzɔdzɔewo kple ame madzɔmadzɔwo siaa. 46 Elabena ne ame siwo lɔ̃a mi koe mielɔ̃na ɖe, fetu kae le eme na mi?

22 But, hearing that Archelaus was king of Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there, and, a revelation being made to him in a dream, he withdrew to the parts of Galilee, 23 and came and settled in a city called Nazareth, so that what was said through the prophets, "He shall be called a Nazarene, " should be fulfilled.

6 "Mikpɔ mia ɖokui dzi nyuie be miagaɖe miaƒe dzɔdzɔenyenye afia le amewo ŋkume be woakpɔ o; ne menye nenema o la, fetu aɖeke manɔ mia Fofo si le dziƒowo la gbɔ na mi o. 2 Eya ta ne èkpɔ nublanui na amewo hena nu wo la, mègana kpẽ naɖi le ŋgɔwò abe ale si alakpanuwɔlawo wɔna le ƒuƒoƒewo kple kpɔdomeewo be amewo nakafu yewo la ene o. Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, woxɔ woƒe fetu blibo la xoxo. 3 Ke wò la, ne èkpɔ nublanui na amewo hena nu wo la, mègana wò miasi nanya nu si wɔm wò nuɖusi le o, 4 ale be wò nunana la nanɔ ɣaɣla. 5 "Nenema kee ne miele gbe dom ɖa la, migawɔ nu abe alakpanuwɔlawo ene o, elabena wolɔ̃a gbedodoɖa le tsitrenu le ƒuƒoƒewo kple mɔ gãwo ƒe dzogoewo dzi be amewo nakpɔ yewo.

"‘Mía Fofo si le dziƒowo, wò ŋkɔ ŋuti nakɔ. 10 Wò Fiaɖuƒe nava.
10 And the ax is already lying at the root of the trees, so every tree that does not produce good fruit is to be cut out and thrown into a fire.
Wò lɔlɔ̃nu nava eme le anyigba dzi abe ale si wòle le dziƒo ene. 11 Na míaƒe abolo si asu mía nu egbe la mí; 12 tsɔ míaƒe fewo ke mí, abe ale si míawo hã míetsɔe ke ame siwo nyi fe le mía ŋu ene.

11 I am baptizing you in water to repentance, but he who is coming behind me is stronger than I, whose shoes I am not fit to carry: he will baptize you in Holy Spirit and fire 12 he whose winnowing-fork is in his hand, and who will clean up his threshing-floor and gather his wheat into his barn, but burn up the chaff with inextinguishable fire. "

Ðe atikpo la ɖa le wò ŋutɔ wò ŋku dzi gbã, ekema àte ŋu akpɔ nu nyuie aɖe ati fefee si le nɔviwò ƒe ŋku dzi la.
4 Then Jesus was brought up to the wilderness by the Spirit to be tempted by the Devil.
6 "Migatsɔ nu siwo le kɔkɔe la na avuwo o, eye migatsɔ miaƒe dzonu xɔasiwo ƒu gbe ɖe hawo ŋkume o, ne woaganya avuzi le wo dzi, eye emegbe woatrɔ avuvu mi o.
2 And upon fasting forty days and forty nights he afterward grew hungry.

7 "Minɔ ebiabia dzi, eye woana mi; minɔ edidi dzi, eye miakpɔe; minɔ ʋɔƒoƒo dzi, eye woaʋui na mi; 8 elabena ame sia ame si le nu biam la, exɔnɛ; eye ame sia ame si le nu dim la, ekpɔnɛ; eye ame sia ame si le ʋɔ ƒom la, woaʋui nɛ. 9 Mia dometɔ kae li, ne via bia aboloe la, wòatsɔ kpe ade esi? 10 Alo ne ebia tɔmelãe la, wòatsɔ da ade esi? 11 Eya ta ne mi ame vɔ̃ɖiwo kura gɔ̃ hã mienya ale si miana nunana nyuiwo mia viwo la, ɖe mia Fofo si le dziƒo la mana nu nyuiwo ame siwo bianɛ la geɖe wu oa? 12 "Eya ta nu sia nu si miedina be amewo nawɔ na mi la, miawo hã miwɔ nenema ke na wo.

3 And the tempter approached him and told him "If you are Son of God, say the word for these stones to become bread. " 4 But he answered "It is written ‘Not upon bread alone shall man live, but upon every word that comes out of God’s mouth.’ " 5 Then the Devil took him to the sacred city and set him on the wing of the temple-precinct, 6 and said to him "If you are Son of God, throw yourself down; for it is written ‘He will give his angels commands about you, and they will lift you on their hands, for fear you should strike your foot against a stone.’ " 7 Said Jesus to him "It is written again ‘You shall not put the Lord your God on trial.’ " 8 Again the Devil took him to an exceedingly high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory, 9 and told him "All this I will give you if you will drop down and do me reverence. " 10 Then Jesus said to him "Go, Satan: for it is written ‘You shall do reverence to the Lord your God, and worship him alone.’ " 11 Then the Devil left him: and lo, angels came to him and waited on his needs.

Le nyateƒe me la, nu siae Se la kple Nyagblɔɖilawo ƒe nyawo fia. 13 "Mito agbo xaxɛ la nu yi ɖe eme, elabena agbo la keke eye mɔ si kplɔa ame yia tsɔtsrɔ̃ me la le gbadza, eye ame geɖewoe toa enu yina; 14 ke agbo la le xaxɛe eye mɔ la hã xaxa, si kplɔa ame yia agbe me, eye ame ʋɛ aɖewo koe kpɔnɛ. 15 "Mikpɔ nyuie le aʋatsonyagblɔɖila siwo vaa mia gbɔ le alẽgbalẽ me, evɔ le ememe la, wonye amegãxi nyanyrawo la ŋuti. 16 Woƒe kutsetsewoe miatsɔ adze si woe.

12 But upon hearing that John was committed to prison he retired to Galilee, 13 and left Nazareth and came and settled in Capernaum on the seacoast, in the territory of Zebulun and Naphtali, 14 that what was said through the prophet Isaiah in the words 15 "The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, seaward on the other side of the Jordan, Galilee of the nations 16 the people that was sitting in darkness has seen a great light, and to those who were sitting in the country and shadow of death a light has risen, " might be fulfilled.
Womegbea waintsetsewo le aŋɔkawo dzi alo gbowo le srẽwo dzi gbeɖe o ɖe? 17 Nenema kee ati nyui sia ati nyui tsea ku nyui, gake ati manyomanyo tsea ku manyomanyo.
17 Thenceforth Jesus began to proclaim "Repent, for the Reign of Heaven is almost here. "

19 Ati sia ati si metsea ku nyui o la, wolãnɛ dea dzo me. 20 Eya ta woƒe tsetsewoe miatsɔ adze si woe. 21 "Menye ame sia ame si le gbɔgblɔm nam be, ‘Aƒetɔ, Aƒetɔ,’ ye ayi ɖe Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la me o, negbe ame si le Fofonye si le dziƒowo ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu wɔm la koe.

18 And in walking by the Sea of Galilee he saw two brothers, Simon, the one who is known as Peter, and his brother Andrew, throwing a casting-net in the sea for they were fishermen 19 and said to them "Come here after me, and I will make you fishers of men "; 20 and they left their nets at once and followed him.

22 Ame geɖewo agblɔ nam le ŋkeke ma dzi be: ‘Aƒetɔ, Aƒetɔ, ɖe míegblɔ nya ɖi le wò ŋkɔ me, eye míenya gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo do goe le wò ŋkɔ me, eye míewɔ ŋusẽdɔ geɖewo le wò ŋkɔ me oa?’ 23 Ke nye hã maʋu eme na wo bena: ‘Nyemenya mi kpɔ o!

21 And he went on from there and saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee and his brother John, in their boat with their father Zebedee putting their nets to rights, and called them; 22 and they left the boat and their father at once and followed him.
Mi sedzimawɔlawo, mite ɖa le gbɔnye!’ 24 "Eya ta ame sia ame si sea nye nya siawo, eye wòwɔa wo dzi la, anɔ abe ŋutsu dzeaɖaŋu si tu eƒe xɔ ɖe agakpe dzi la ene.
23 And he went around in all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the gospel of the Reign and curing every disease and every ailment among the people.

26 Ke ame sia ame si sea nye nya siawo, eye mewɔa wo dzi o la, anɔ abe ŋutsu tsibome si tu eƒe xɔ ɖe ke dzi la ene. 27 Eye tsi gã aɖe dza, tɔwo ɖɔ, eye ya ƒo va lɔ xɔ ma, eye wòmu dze anyi gbloo. " 28 Esi Yesu wu nya siawo nu la, amehawo ƒe nu ku le eƒe nufiafia la ta, 29 elabena efia nu wo abe ame si si ŋusẽ le ene, ke menye abe woƒe agbalẽfialawo ene o.

24 And the report about him went to all Syria; and they brought to him all who were ill with various diseases and suffering agonies, demoniacs and epileptics and paralytics, and he cured them; 25 and there followed him great crowds from Galilee and Decapolis and Jerusalem and Judea and the other side of the Jordan.
Mateo
Matthew
2 Eye kpɔ ɖa, anyidɔléla aɖe va bɔbɔ nɛ gblɔ be: "Aƒetɔ, ne èlɔ̃ ko la, àte ŋu ana ŋutinye nakɔ. " 3 Ale wòdo asi ɖa ka asi eŋu gblɔ be: "Melɔ̃!
5 And when he saw the crowds he went up on the mountainside; and he sat down, and his disciples came to him, 2 and he opened his mouth and taught them, saying
Ŋutiwò nekɔ. " Enumake eƒe anyidɔ la vɔ nɛ.
3 "Happy are the poor at heart, because the Reign of Heaven is theirs.
4 Eye Yesu gblɔ nɛ be: "Mègagblɔe na ame aɖeke o, ke boŋ yi ɖatsɔ ɖokuiwò fia nunɔla, eye nàna nu siwo Mose ɖo be woana la, be wòanye kpeɖodzi na wo. "
4 Happy are mourners, because they shall be comforted.
23 Azɔ Yesu kple eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo yi ɖaɖo tɔdziʋu aɖe.
5 Happy are the meek, because they shall inherit the earth.
27 Ewɔ nuku na nusrɔ̃laawo ale gbegbe, eye wogblɔ be: "Ame ka gɔ̃e nye esia?
6 Happy are the hungry and thirsty for righteousness, because they shall have their meal.
Wowɔa adã ale gbegbe be dzi menɔa ame aɖeke ƒo wòtoa mɔ ma o.
7 Happy are the pitiful, because they shall be pitied.
8 Esi amehawo kpɔ esia la, vɔvɔ̃ ɖo wo ŋutɔ, eye wokafu Mawu, ame si tsɔ ŋusẽ sia gbegbe na amegbetɔwo.
8 Happy are the clean in mind, because they shall see God.
9 Esi Yesu tso afi ma va yina la, ekpɔ ŋutsu aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Mateo wòbɔbɔ nɔ adzɔxɔƒe, eye wògblɔ nɛ be: "Dze yonyeme. "
9 Happy are peacemakers, because they shall be called sons of God.
Enumake wòtso dze eyome. 10 Emegbe esime Yesu kple eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo le nuɖukplɔ̃ ŋu le Mateo ƒe me la, kpɔ ɖa, adzɔxɔlawo kple nu vɔ̃ wɔla gbogbo aɖewo va nɔ kplɔ̃a ŋu kpli wo.
10 Happy are the persecuted who have been persecuted on account of righteousness, because the Reign of Heaven is theirs.

11 Ke esi Farisitɔwo kpɔ esia la, wobia eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo be: "Nu ka tae miaƒe nufiala ɖua nu kple adzɔxɔlawo kpakple nu vɔ̃ wɔlawo? " 12 Esi wòsee la, egblɔ be: "Ame siwo le lãmesẽ me la mehiã gbedala o, ke boŋ dɔnɔwoe hiãe.

11 Happy are you when they twit you and persecute you and say everything vile about you falsely on my account; 12 be glad and exult, because your reward is great in heaven, for thus they persecuted the prophets who came before you.
13 Eya ta miyi ɖasrɔ̃ nu si nya sia fia: ‘Nublanuikpɔkpɔ dim mele, menye vɔsa o.’ Elabena menye ame dzɔdzɔewo yɔ gee meva o, ke boŋ nu vɔ̃ wɔlawoe. "
13 "You are the salt of the earth; but if salt loses its strength, with what shall it be salted? it will no longer do for anything but to be thrown out and trodden underfoot by men.

14 Eye Yohanes ƒe nusrɔ̃lawo va egbɔ hebiae be: "Nu ka tae míawo kple Farisitɔwo míetsia nu dɔna, evɔ wò nusrɔ̃lawo ya metsia nu dɔna o? " 15 Yesu ɖo eŋu na wo be: "Alo ɖe ŋugbetɔsrɔ̃ la xɔlɔ̃wo afa konyi ŋkeke ale si ŋugbetɔsrɔ̃ la le wo gbɔa?

14 You are the light of the world; a city located on a mountaintop cannot be hidden, 15 nor do they light a lamp and put it under the peck measure, but on the stand and it shines for everybody in the house.
16 Ame aɖeke metsɔa avɔ yeye ƒe nuɖeɖi kaa avɔ xoxo o; elabena avɔnuɖeɖi yeyea aho ɖa, eye teƒe vuvua alolo wu tsãtɔ.
16 Let your light shine thus before men, so that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
17 Eye womekɔa wain yeye ɖe lãgbalẽgolo xoxowo me o. Ne wowɔe nenema la, ekema lãgbalẽgoloawo awó, eye wain la aƒu gbe, eye lãgbalẽgoloawo hã dome agblẽ.
17 "Do not suppose that I came to tear down the law or the prophets; I did not come to tear down but to fill up.
18 Esi wòle nya siawo gblɔm na wo la, kpɔ ɖa, amegã aɖe te ɖe eŋu, eye wòbɔbɔ nɛ gblɔ be: "Vinyenyɔnuvi la anya ku ɖaa fifia; ke va da asi ɖe edzi ne wòagbɔ agbe. "
18 For I tell you verily, till the heavens and the earth pass away, not the dot of an i nor the cross of a t in the law shall pass away, till everything is done.
19 Ale Yesu tso dze eyome, eye eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo hã yi kplii.

19 So whoever breaks one of the pettiest of those commandments, and teaches men so, shall be called petty in the Reign of Heaven; but whoever does them and teaches them shall be called great in the Reign of Heaven.

20 Eye kpɔ ɖa, nyɔnu aɖe si le ʋusisidɔ lém ƒe wuieve sɔŋ la to emegbe va ka asi eƒe awu toga, 21 elabena egblɔ le eɖokui me be: "Ne menya ka asi eƒe awudziwui ŋu ko la, mahaya. " 22 Ke esi Yesu trɔ, eye wòkpɔe la, egblɔ be: "Vinyenyɔnu, wò dzi nedze eme, wò xɔse na nèhaya. "

21 "You have heard that it was said to the ancients ‘You shall not commit murder; and whoever commits murder shall be liable to judgment.’ 22 But I tell you that anyone who is angry with his brother shall be liable to judgment; and whoever says ‘Raka’ to his brother shall be liable to the Sanhedrin Court; and whoever says ‘You fool’ shall be liable to the fire of hell.

Eye nyɔnu la ƒe lãme sẽ tso gaƒoƒo ma dzi. 23 Ke esi wòva amegã la ƒe me hekpɔ dzekulawo kple ameha siwo le konyi fam kple ɣli hoo la, 24 Yesu gblɔ be: "Mido go, elabena nyɔnuvi la meku o, ke boŋ alɔ̃ dɔm wòle. "

23 So, if you are offering your gift on the altar and there remember that your brother has something against you, 24 leave your gift there before the altar and go and make up with your brother first; then come and offer your gift.
Ale wode asi ekoko me. 25 Esi wònya ameha la do goe vɔ la, ege ɖe eme eye wòlé nyɔnuvi la ƒe alɔnu, eye nyɔnuvi la fɔ ɖe tsitre. 26 Eye nudzɔdzɔ sia ŋu nya kaka ɖe nuto ma katã me.

25 Be quick to make friends with your antagonist while you are on the road to court with him, for fear your antagonist should hand you over to the judge, and the judge to the officer, and you be thrown into prison; 26 I tell you verily, you shall not get out from there till you pay the last copper.

27 Esi Yesu dzo le afi ma va yina la, ŋkuagbãtɔ eve kplɔe ɖo le ɣli dom be: "David Vi, kpɔ nublanui na mí. " 28 Esi Yesu yi aƒe aɖe me la, ŋkuagbãtɔawo va egbɔ, eye wòbia wo be: "Miexɔe se be mate ŋu awɔ nu sia? "
27 "You have heard that it was said ‘You shall not commit adultery.’ 28 But I tell you that anyone who looks at a woman to desire her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
Woɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Ɛ̃, Aƒetɔ. " 29 Eye wòka asi woƒe ŋkuwo ŋu gblɔ be: "Neva eme na mi le miaƒe xɔse la nu. " 30 Ale woƒe ŋkuwo ʋu.
29 And if your right eye is tripping you up, take it out and throw it from you; for it is well for you that one of your organs should perish and not your whole body be thrown into hell.
Eye Yesu de se na wo vevie be: "Migana ame aɖeke nanya o. " 31 Ke esi wodo go la, wona eŋkɔ ɖi hoo le nuto ma katã me.
30 And if your right hand is tripping you up, cut it away and throw it from you; for it is well for you that one of your organs should perish and not your whole body go to hell.
32 Esi wole dzodzom la, kpɔ ɖa, amewo kplɔ aɖetututɔ aɖe si me gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃ aɖe le la va egbɔ; 33 eye esi wònya gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃a do goe vɔ la, aɖetututɔ la ƒo nu.

31 "And it was said ‘Whoever divorces his wife, let him give her a certificate of divorce.’ 32 But I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife, except on grounds of unchastity, causes her to commit adultery, and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery.

Eye amehawo ƒe mo wɔ yaa wogblɔ be: "Míekpɔ nu sia tɔgbi le Israel kpɔ o. " 34 Ke Farisitɔwo gblɔ be: "Gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo ƒe fia dzie wòtona nyaa gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo. " 35 Eye Yesu yi ɖato duawo kple kɔƒeawo katã me le nu fiam le woƒe ƒuƒoƒewo hele gbeƒã ɖem Fiaɖuƒe ŋuti nya nyui la, eye wòle dɔléle ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi kple lãmegbegblẽ ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi dam.

33 "Again, you have heard that it was said to the ancients ‘You shall not perjure yourself, but discharge your oaths to the Lord.’ 34 But I tell you not to swear at all; neither by heaven, because it is God’s throne, 35 nor by the earth, because it is the footstool of his feet, nor by Jerusalem, because it is the city of the great King.
36 Esi wòkpɔ amehawo la, woƒe nu wɔ nublanui nɛ, elabena wowɔ fu wo, eye wotsi yame abe alẽ siwo nu kplɔla mele o la ene.
36 And do not swear by your head either, because you cannot make one hair white or black.
37 Eye wògblɔ na eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo be: "Nyateƒee, nuŋeŋe la sɔ gbɔ, ke dɔwɔlawo ya mede ha o.
37 But let your language be yes, yes, no, no; anything in excess of this is so much of bad.
38 Eya ta miɖe kuku na nuŋeŋe ƒe Aƒetɔ la be wòaɖo dɔwɔlawo ɖe eƒe nuŋeŋe la me. "
48 "So you are to be thorough as your heavenly Father is thorough.
Mateo
Matthew
10 Eye wòyɔ eƒe nusrɔ̃la wuieveawo vɛ hena ŋusẽ wo ɖe gbɔgbɔ makɔmakɔwo dzi, be woanya wo ado goe, eye woada dɔléle ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi kple lãmegbegblẽ ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi.
6 But beware of doing your righteousness before men, to be viewed by them; if you do, you have no reward with your Father in heaven.

2 Apostolo wuieveawo ƒe ŋkɔwoe nye: Gbãtɔe nye Simon, si wogayɔna be Petro, kple nɔvia Andrea; Yakobo, Zebedeo vi, kple nɔvia Yohanes; 3 Filipo kple Bartolomeo; Toma kple Mateo, si nye adzɔxɔla la; Yakobo, Alfeo vi, kple Tadeo; 4 Simon Veviedola la; kple Yuda Iskariot, ame si va dee asi emegbe.

2 So when you give charity do not have a trumpet blown before you as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, so that they may be glorified by men; I tell you verily, they have got their reward.
5 Ame wuieve siawoe Yesu dɔ hede se siawo na wo be: "Migayi dukɔwo me tɔwo gbɔ o, eye migage ɖe Samariatɔwo ƒe du aɖeke me o; 6 ke miyi ɖe Israel ƒe aƒe la me tɔ siwo nye alẽ siwo bú la, ɖeɖe ko gbɔ.
3 But at your giving charity let your left hand not find out what your right is doing, 4 so that your charity may be under cover, and your Father who sees under cover will repay you.
7 Ne mieyi la, miɖe gbeƒã be: ‘Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la gogo.’ 8 Mida gbe le dɔnɔwo ŋu, mifɔ ame kukuwo ɖe tsitre, mina anyidɔlélawo ŋuti nakɔ, minya gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo do goe. Faa miexɔe, faa minae.

5 "And when you pray you are not to be as the hypocrites are; for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and at the corners of the main streets, so that they may be visible to men; I tell you verily, they have got their reward.
9 Migadi sika alo klosalo alo akɔbli de miaƒe gabutuawo me o, 10 eye migadi nuɖuɖu de akplo me na mɔzɔzɔa o, alo awu eve, alo afɔkpawo loo alo atizɔti o, elabena dɔwɔla dze na eƒe nuɖuɖu.
6 But do you, when you pray, go into your closet, and shut the door and pray to your Father who is present in hidden places; and your Father who sees in hidden places will reward you.
11 "Du sia du alo kɔƒe sia kɔƒe si me mieyi la, midi ame siwo dze le eme la, eye minɔ afi ma va se ɖe esime miadzo. 12 Ne miege ɖe aƒe aɖe me la, mido gbe na aƒea me tɔwo.
7 And in praying do not parrot off words like the heathen; for they think they will get themselves listened to by the quantity of what they say.
13 Eye ne aƒea dze la, ekema ŋutifafa si miedi nɛ la nava edzi, ke ne medze o la, miaƒe ŋutifafa negbugbɔ va mia dzi.
8 So do not be like them; for your Father knows the things you need before you ask him.

14 Afi sia afi si ame aɖe mexɔ mi alo ɖo to miaƒe nyawo le o la, ne miele dzodzom le aƒe ma alo du ma me la, miʋuʋu ke le miaƒe afɔwo ŋu ɖe anyi. 15 Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, anɔ bɔbɔe na Sodom kple Gomora nyigba le Ʋɔnudrɔ̃gbe la wu ale si wòanɔ na du ma.

9 Do you, then, pray in this way: ‘Father in heaven, may thy name be kept holy, 10 thy reign come, than will be done on earth as in heaven; 11 give us today our next day’s bread, 12 and forgive us our debts as we too have forgiven our debtors, 13 and do not have us fall under temptation but deliver us from evil.’ 14 For if you forgive men their offenses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you; 15 but if you do not forgive men, no more will your Father forgive your offenses.
16 "Kpɔ ɖa! Mele mia dɔm abe alẽwo ene ɖe amegãxiwo dome; eya ta midze aye abe dawo ene, eye midza abe ahɔnɛwo ene.

16 "And when you are fasting do not be lugubrious like the hypocrites; for they make their faces unsightly so that it may be seen by men that they are fasting; I tell you verily, they have got their reward.

17 Mikpɔ mia ɖokui dzi nyuie le amewo ŋu, elabena woakplɔ mi ayi ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒewo, eye woaƒo mi kple atam le woƒe ƒuƒoƒewo. 18 Woakplɔ mi ayi nutodziɖulawo kple dufiawo ŋkume le tanye, be wòanye ɖaseɖiɖi na wo kple dukɔwo.

17 But do you in fasting put oil on your head and wash your face, 18 so that it may not be seen by men that you are fasting but by your Father who is present in secret places; and your Father who sees in secret places will reward you,

19 Ne wode mi asi la, migatsi dzimaɖi le ale si miaƒo nui alo nya si miagblɔ ŋuti o, elabena woatsɔ nya si miagblɔ la ana mi le gaƒoƒo ma me, 20 elabena menye miawo ɖeɖee aƒo nu o, ke boŋ mia Fofo ƒe gbɔgbɔ la aƒo nu to mia dzi. 21 Azɔ hã, nɔvi ade nɔvi asi be woawu, eye fofo ade via asi, viwo atsi tsitre ɖe wo dzilawo ŋu ahana woawu wo.

19 "Do not lay up stores for yourselves on earth where moth and decay consume, and where thieves break in and steal, 20 but lay up stores for yourselves in heaven where neither moth nor decay consumes and where thieves do not break in nor steal; 21 for where your stores are, there your heart too will be.

23 Ne woti mia yome le du aɖe me la, misi yi du bubu me; elabena vavã mele egblɔm na mi be: Miele Israel duawo katã kpe ge ɖo hafi Amegbetɔvi la nava ɖo o. 24 "Nusrɔ̃la mewua eƒe nufiala o, eye kluvi hã mewua eƒe aƒetɔ o. 25 Esɔ gbɔ na nusrɔ̃la be wòazu abe eƒe nufiala ene, eye na kluvi be wòazu abe eƒe aƒetɔ ene.

22 The lamp of the body is the eye; therefore if your eye is free your whole body will be light, 23 but if your eye is mean your whole body will be dark, so if the light in you is darkness, what must the darkness be! 24 No one can belong to two masters, for he will either hate the one and love the other or be attentive to the one and despise the other: you cannot belong to God and money.

Ne amewo yɔa aƒea tɔ be Beelzebul la, ɖe womayɔ eƒemetɔwo ya nenema geɖe wu oa? 26 Eya ta migavɔ̃ wo o, elabena wometsyɔ nu naneke dzi, si dzi womava klo nu le o, eye naneke mele ɣaɣla, si womava nya o. 27 Nya si megblɔ na mi le viviti me la, migblɔe le kekeli me, eye nya si medo dalĩ gblɔ na mi la, miɖe gbeƒãe le xɔwo tame.

25 For this reason I tell you, do not fret over your soul what you shall eat or what you shall drink, nor over your body what you shall put on; is not the soul more than the food, and the body than the garment? 26 Look at the birds of the air, that they do not sow nor reap nor gather into barns, and your heavenly Father feeds them; are you not more important than they? 27 and which of you by fretting can add to his height one foot? 28 And why do you fret about dress?

28 Eye migavɔ̃ ame siwo wua ŋutilã, gake womate ŋu awu luʋɔ o la o; ke boŋ mivɔ̃ ame si ate ŋu atsrɔ̃ luʋɔ kple ŋutilã siaa le Gehena. 29 Ðe womedzraa atsutsrɔe eve xɔa gaku ɖeka, si ƒe home le sue ŋutɔ oa?
Observe the lilies of the field, how they grow: they do not labor nor spin, 29 but I tell you not even Solomon in all his glory was clad like one of these.
Gake wo dometɔ ɖeka pɛ hã mage adze anyigba le mia Fofo ƒe manyamanya me o. 30 Ke woxlẽ miaƒe taɖawo katã gɔ̃ hã.

30 But if God robes the plants in the field so, that are there today and are thrown in a firepot tomorrow, will he not much more you, little-faiths? 31 So do not fret and say ‘What shall we eat?’ or ‘What shall we drink?’ or ‘What shall we wrap ourselves in?’ 32 for the foreigners hunt after all this.
31 Eya ta migavɔ̃ o; miexɔ asi sãsãsã wu atsutsrɔe geɖewo.
For your heavenly Father knows that you want all this.
33 Ke ame si gbe nu le gbɔnye le amewo ŋkume la, nye hã magbe nu le egbɔ le Fofonye si le dziƒowo la ŋkume.
33 But seek first the Reign, and his righteousness, and you will have all this added.
34 Migabu xaa bena ɖe meva ŋutifafa na ge le anyigba dzi o; nyemeva ŋutifafa na ge o, ke yi boŋ.
34 So do not fret over tomorrow, for to morrow will do its own fretting; a day’s evil is a sufficiency for that day.
Mateo
Matthew
11 Esi Yesu na mɔfiamewo eƒe nusrɔ̃la wuieveawo vɔ la, edzo le afi ma be yeaɖafia nu eye yeaɖe gbeƒã le woƒe duawo me.
7 "Do not be judging, 2 that you may not be judged; for the judgments that you pass shall be passed upon you, and the measure that you give shall be given to you.

2 Ke esi Yohanes, ame si le gaxɔ me la, se dɔ siwo wɔm Kristo la le ŋu nya la, edɔ eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo ɖa 3 be woabiae be: "Wòe nye Ame Si Gbɔna laa, alo ɖe míakpɔ mɔ na ame bubua? " 4 Yesu ɖo eŋu na wo be: "Miheyi ɖagblɔ nu siwo sem miele kple nu siwo kpɔm miele la na Yohanes: 5 Ŋkuagbãtɔwo le nu kpɔm, bunɔwo le zɔzɔm, anyidɔlélawo ŋuti le kɔkɔm, tokunɔwo le nu sem, wole ame kukuwo fɔm ɖe tsitre, eye wole nya nyui la gblɔm na ame dahewo.

3 And why is it that you can see the particle of straw in your brother’s eye, but do not observe the beam of timber in your own eye? 4 or how will you say to your brother ‘Let me get the particle out of your eye,’ when in your eye there is the timber? 5 Hypocrite, first get the timber out of your eye, and then you will have good eyesight to get the particle out of your brother’s eye.
6 Dzidzɔtɔe nye ame si mekpɔ nuɖiaɖia le ŋunye o. "
6 "Do not give sacred things to the dogs, nor throw your pearls before the hogs, for fear they should trample them with their feet and turn and tear you to pieces.
7 Esi ame siawo dzo yina la, Yesu gblɔ na amehawo tso Yohanes ŋu be: "Nu kae miedo go yi gbedzi be yewoaɖakpɔ?
7 "Ask, and you will have things given to you; look, and you will find; knock, and you will be opened to.
Aɖa si ya le ƒoƒom loo? 8 Ekema nu kae miedo go yi be yewoaɖakpɔ?
8 For every asker receives, and the seeker finds, and the knocker will be opened to.
Ame si do awu nyuiwoa? Mienyae ɖe, fiasã mee awu nyui dolawo le.
15 Beware of pretended prophets who come to you in the garb of sheep but are rapacious wolves inside.
9 Ekema nu ka ta koŋ miedo go ɖo?
18 A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor a foul tree good fruit.
Be miakpɔ nyagblɔɖilaa?
19 Every tree that does not produce good fruit is cut out and thrown into a fire.
Ɛ̃, mele egblɔm na mi be ewu nyagblɔɖila sãsãsã.
20 Hence you will recognize them by their fruits.

10 Eya ŋue woŋlɔ ɖi le be: ‘Kpɔ ɖa, mele nye dɔla dɔm ɖe ŋgɔwò, ame si adzra wò mɔ dzi ɖo le ŋgɔwò!’ 11 Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, le ame siwo nyɔnuwo dzi dome la, ɖeke medo kpɔ, si nye gã wu Yohanes Amenyrɔɖetsimela o; gake ame si nye suetɔ le Dziƒofiaɖuƒea me la nye gã wui.

21 Not everyone who says to me ‘Lord, Lord’ will get into the Reign of Heaven, but he who does the will of my Father in heaven: 22 many will say to me in that day ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy by your name and expel demons by your name and work many miracles by your name?’ 23 and then ‘I will avow to them ‘I never knew you; begone from me, you that practice wickedness.’
12 Gake tso Yohanes Amenyrɔɖetsimela ƒe ŋkekeawo dzi va se ɖe fifia la, Dziƒofiaɖuƒe lae nye taɖodzinu si gbɔ amewo le ʋiʋlim vevie be yewoaɖo, eye ame siwo le ʋiʋlim vevie la ƒe asi le edzi sum.

26 And everyone that hears these words of mine and does not do them will resemble a foolish man who built his house on the sand; 27 and the rain came down and the rivers ran and the winds blew, and they beat against that house and it fell, and its fall was great. "
13 Elabena woɖe gbeƒã Se la kple nyagblɔɖilawo ƒe nyawo va se ɖe Yohanes dzi; 14 eye ne mielɔ̃ be yewoaxɔe ase la, eyae nye ‘Eliya si wogblɔ ɖi be ava la.’ 15 Ame si to li na la, nesee.
28 And when Jesus had finished these words the crowds were astonished at his teaching; 29 for he taught them as having authority, and not like their scribes. Matthew 8:1-34
16 "Ame kae matsɔ dzidzime sia asɔ kplii?
8 And when he came down from the mountain great crowds followed him.

Woɖi ɖevi siwo bɔbɔ nɔ ablɔ me, eye wodo ɣli gblɔ na wo nɔewo 17 be: ‘Míeku dze na mi, ke mieɖu ɣe o; míedzi konyifaha, ke miefa avi heƒo akɔta o.’ 18 Nenema kee Yohanes va, meɖua nu o, menoa nu o, eye amewo gblɔ be, ‘Gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃ le eme.’ 19 Amegbetɔvi la va, eɖua nu noa nu, ke amewo gblɔ be, ‘Kpɔ ɖa!

2 And lo, a leper approached him and did him reverence, saying "Sir, if you will you can cleanse me. " 3 And he reached out his hand and touched him, saying "I will; be cleansed "; and at once his leprosy was cleansed.
Nu tsu ɖula kple wain tsu nola, adzɔxɔlawo kple nu vɔ̃ wɔlawo xɔlɔ̃.’ Gake nunya ƒe dɔwɔwɔwo tsoa afia dzɔdzɔe nɛ. "
4 And Jesus said to him "See that you do not tell anybody, but go show yourself to the priest and offer the gift that Moses directed, for an attestation to them. "
20 Azɔ Yesu he nya ɖe du siwo me wòwɔ eƒe ŋusẽdɔ akpa gãtɔ le la ŋu le esi wometrɔ dzi me o ta hegblɔ be: 21 "Baba na wò, Korazin!
14 And Jesus came into Peter’s house and saw his mother-in-law down with a fever; 15 and he touched her hand, and the fever left her, and she rose and waited on his needs.
Baba na wò, Betsaida! elabena ne ɖe wowɔ ŋusẽdɔ siwo wowɔ le mewò la le Tiro kple Sidon la, anye ne wotrɔ dzi me le akpanya kple afi me gbe aɖe gbe ke.

19 And a scribe approached him and said to him "Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go. " 20 And Jesus said to him "The foxes have dens and the birds of the air have roosts, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head. "
22 Gake mele egblɔm na mi be: Anɔ bɔbɔe na Tiro kple Sidon le Ʋɔnudrɔ̃gbe la wu mi.
21 And another of his disciples said to him "Sir, permit me first to go and bury my father. " 22 But Jesus said to him "Follow me, and leave the dead to bury their dead. "
23 Ke wò Kapernaum, ɖe woado wò ɖe dzi yi ɖatɔ dziƒo loo?
23 And when he got into the boat his disciples followed him.
24 Gake mele egblɔm na wò be: Anɔ bɔbɔe na Sodom-nyigba le Ʋɔnudrɔ̃gbe la wu wò. "
24 And lo, there came a great commotion in the sea, so that the boat was being covered by the waves; and he was asleep.
25 Ɣemaɣi la, Yesu gblɔ be: "Fofo, dziƒo kple anyigba ƒe Aƒetɔ, mekafu wò le dutoƒo, elabena èɣla nu siawo ɖe nunyalawo kple tagbɔɖaɖɛtɔwo, eye nèɖe wo fia ɖeviwo.
25 And they approached him and roused him, saying "Help, sir! we are lost! " 26 And he said to them "Why are you timorous, little-faiths? "
26 Ɛ̃, Fofo, elabena nenemae dze ŋuwò.
Then he rose and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there came a great calm.
27 Fofonye tsɔ nuwo katã de asi nam, eye ame aɖeke menya Vi la nyuie o negbe Fofo la ko; eye ame aɖeke menya Fofo la nyuie o negbe Vi la kple ame si Vi la lɔ̃ be yeaɖee afia ko.
27 But the men wondered, saying "What a man this is, that even the winds and the sea obey him! "

28 Miva gbɔnye, mi ame siwo katã le dagbadagbam, eye agba le mia wum la, eye nye la, mana gbɔdzɔe mi. 29 Mitsɔ nye kɔkuti la ɖo mia ɖokui dzi, eye misrɔ̃ nu tso gbɔnye, elabena mefa tu, eye mebɔbɔ ɖokuinye ɖe anyi le dzi me, eye miakpɔ gbɔdzɔe na mia ɖokuiwo.

And they came out and went into the hogs, and lo, all the herd bolted down the steep bank into the sea, and lost their lives in the water; 33 and the men who were tending them ran away, and went to the city and reported everything, including the part about the demoniacs.
30 Elabena nye kɔkuti la tsɔtsɔ le bɔbɔe, eye nye agba la le wodzoe. "
34 And out came all the city to meet Jesus; and when they saw him they appealed to him to pass on away from their territory;
Mateo
Matthew
12 Ɣemaɣi la, Yesu zɔ to lugblewo me le Sabat dzi.
9 and he got into a boat and crossed over and came to his own city.
2 Esi Farisitɔwo kpɔ esia la, wogblɔ nɛ be: "Kpɔ ɖa!
2 And lo, they brought him a paralyzed man lying helpless on a couch.

Wò nusrɔ̃lawo le nu si mele se nu be woawɔ le Sabat dzi o la wɔm. " 3 Ebia wo be: "Ðe miexlẽ nu si David wɔ esime dɔ wu eya kple eŋutimewo oa? 4 Ale si wòge ɖe Mawu ƒe aƒe la me, eye woɖu ŋkumeɖobolo la, evɔ se meɖe mɔ le eŋu na eya ŋutɔ loo alo eŋutimewo be woaɖui hafi o, negbe nunɔlawo ko la oa? 5 Alo ɖe miexlẽ le Se la me kpɔ be, le Sabat ŋkeke dzi la, nunɔla siwo subɔna le gbedoxɔa me la wɔa dɔ, gake womebua fɔ wo oa? 6 Ke mele egblɔm na mi be ame si lolo wu gbedoxɔa la le afii.

And Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralyzed man "It is all right, my child, your sins are forgiven. " 3 Said some of the scribes to themselves, "This man is blaspheming. " 4 And Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said "What are you inwardly thinking wicked thoughts for? 5 why, which is easier, to say ‘your sins are forgiven’ or to say ‘rise and walk’? 6 But, that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins " then he said to the paralyzed man, "Rise, take up your couch and go home. " 7 And he rose and went off to his home.
7 Ke ne ɖe miese nya si nye, ‘Nublanuikpɔkpɔ dim mele, menye vɔsa o’ gɔme la, anye ne miebu fɔ ame maɖifɔwo o. 8 Elabena Sabat ƒe Aƒetɔe Amegbetɔvi la nye. "

8 And at this sight the crowds were afraid and glorified God who had given such authority to men. 9 And in passing on his way from there Jesus saw sitting in a customhouse office a man known as Matthew, and said to him "Follow me "; and he rose and followed him.
9 Esi wòdzo le afi ma la, eyi woƒe ƒuƒoƒe la, 10 eye kpɔ ɖa, ŋutsu aɖe si titi lé asi na la le afi ma.
10 And as he was eating a meal in the house, there came to the table with Jesus and his disciples many customhouse officers and people of bad character.

Esi wodi be yewoakpɔ nya aɖe atsɔ atso Yesu nu ta la, wobiae be, "Ðe se ɖe mɔ be woada dɔ le Sabat dzia? " 11 Egblɔ na wo be: "Ne alẽ ɖeka le mia dometɔ aɖe si eye wòge ɖe do me le Sabat dzi la, mado asi ɖa aɖee ado goe oa? 12 Azɔ ɖe amegbetɔ mexɔ asi sãsãsã wu alẽ oa?

11 And the Pharisees, seeing it, said to his disciples "Why does your teacher eat with the customhouse officers and people of bad character? " 12 But he, hearing it, said "Not the able-bodied, but the ill, need a physician.
Eya ta se ɖe mɔ be woawɔ nu nyui le Sabat dzi. " 13 Eye wògblɔ na ŋutsua be: "Mlo asi. " Eye wòmloe, eye asi la ɖɔ ɖo keŋkeŋ abe asi kemɛa ene.
13 But go and learn what ‘I want pity, and not sacrifice’ is; for I have not come to call saints, but sinners. "

14 Ke Farisitɔwo do go, eye wode adaŋu be yewoawui. 15 Esi Yesu kpɔ esia dze sii la, edzo le afi ma. Ame geɖewo hã dze eyome, eye wòda gbe le dɔnɔ siwo katã le wo dome la ŋu, 16 ke ede se na wo vevie be woagana woadze si ye o, 17 ne nya si wogblɔ ɖi to nyagblɔɖila Yesaya dzi la nava eme, ame si gblɔ be: 18 "Kpɔ ɖa!

14 Then John’s disciples came to him with the words "Why is it that we and the Pharisees fast, but your disciples do not? " 15 And Jesus said to them "Can the wedding guests mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? but there will come days, when the bridegroom is taken from them, and then they will fast.
Nye subɔla si metia, si gbɔ nyemelɔ̃a nu le o, si ƒe nu dze ŋunye! Matsɔ nye gbɔgbɔ la ada ɖe edzi, eye ana dukɔwo nase nu si dzɔdzɔenyenye fia la gɔme.
16 But nobody puts a patch of unfulled cloth on an old cloak; for the filler takes away some from the cloak, and a worse hole is made.
19 Mawɔ dzre o, mado ɣli o, eye ame aɖeke mase eƒe gbe le ablɔwo dzi hã o. 20 Maɖe aƒla si ŋe vɔ kloe la ɖa le enu o, eye matsi ɖovu bibi si le tsitsim la o, va se ɖe esime wòna dzɔdzɔenyenye ɖu dzi.
17 Neither do they put new wine in old skins; if they do, the skins burst, and the wine runs out and the skins are wasted; but they put new wine into fresh skins, and both together are preserved. "
21 Vavãe, eƒe ŋkɔ ana mɔkpɔkpɔ dukɔwo. " 22 Eye wokplɔ ŋkuagbãtɔ aɖe si nye aɖetututɔ, si me gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃ le la, va egbɔ, eye wòda gbe le eŋu, ale be aɖetututɔ la ƒo nu hekpɔ nu.

18 While he was telling them this, lo, a ruler approached him and did him reverence, saying "My daughter is just passing away; but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live. " 19 And Jesus and his disciples rose and followed the man.

23 Ale ameha blibo la ƒe nu ku eye wobia be: "Manye David Vi lae nye esia oa? " 24 Esi Farisitɔwo se esia la, wogblɔ be: "Gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo ƒe fia Beelzebul dzie ame sia tona nyaa gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo. " 25 Esi wònya woƒe susuwo ta la, egblɔ na wo be: "Fiaɖuƒe ɖe sia ɖe si ma ɖe eɖokui ŋu la zua aƒedo, eye du sia du alo aƒe sia aƒe si ma ɖe eɖokui ŋu la mate ŋu ali ke o.

20 And lo, a woman who had had a flow of blood for twelve years came up behind and touched the tassel of his cloak; 21 for she said to herself, "If I only touch his cloak I shall be made well. " 22 But Jesus turned and saw her and said "It is all right, daughter, your faith has made you well. "
Esia tae mia viwo adrɔ̃ ʋɔnu mi ɖo.
And the woman was well from that moment.
28 Ke ne Mawu ƒe gbɔgbɔ dzie metona nyaa gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo doa goe la, ekema Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la ɖi ɖe mi ŋutɔŋutɔ.
23 And when Jesus came into the ruler’s house and saw the flute-players, and the crowd making a commotion, 24 he said "Stand aside, for the girl is not dead but asleep "; and they laughed at him.
29 Alo aleke ame awɔ age ɖe ame sesẽ aɖe ƒe aƒe me aha eƒe nuwo, ne mebla ame sesẽ la gbã hafi o?
25 But when the crowd was put out he went in and grasped her hand, and the girl woke up.
Ema ko hafi wòate ŋu aha eƒe aƒe la.
26 And the rumor of this went out to that whole land.
30 Ame si mele dzinye o la, tsi tsitre ɖe ŋunye, eye ame si meƒoa amewo nu ƒu kplim o la kaa wo hlẽna.
They said to him "Yes, sir. " 29 Then he touched their eyes, saying "Have it as you have faith for "; 30 and their eyes were opened.
31 "Esia ta mele egblɔm na mi be, woatsɔ nu vɔ̃ kple busunyagbɔgblɔ ɖe sia ɖe ake amewo, ke womatsɔ busunya si wogblɔ ɖe gbɔgbɔa ŋu ya ake o.
And Jesus said to them sternly "See that nobody finds it out. " 31 But they went out and spread the report about him in that whole land.
33 "Mido ati nyui la, eye eƒe kutsetse anyo, alo mido ati manyomanyo, eye eƒe kutsetse manyo o, elabena ati ƒe kutsetsee wotsɔna dzea sii.
32 And as these were going out, lo, they brought him a dumb man who was demon-ridden; 33 and when the demon was expelled the dumb man spoke.
34 Dzakpatawo ƒe dzidzimeviwo, aleke miate ŋu agblɔ nya nyuiwo, esi mienye ame vɔ̃ɖiwo? Elabena nya si wu dzi lae nu gblɔna.
And the crowds wondered, saying "Never was the like seen in Israel "; 34 but the Pharisees said "It is by having the head of the demons that he expels the demons. "
35 Ame nyui ɖea nu nyuiwo ɖe go tso eƒe nu nyui dzraɖoƒe, ke ame vɔ̃ɖi ɖea nu vɔ̃ɖiwo ɖe go tso eƒe nu vɔ̃ɖi dzraɖoƒe.
35 And Jesus went the round of all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the gospel of the Reign and curing every disease and every ailment.
36 Mele egblɔm na mi be, nya dzodzro sia nya dzodzro si amewo gblɔna la, woabu akɔnta le eŋuti le Ʋɔnudrɔ̃gbe la; 37 elabena wò nyawoe woatsɔ atso afia na wò, eye wò nyawoe woatsɔ abu fɔ wò. "
36 But at seeing the crowds he was sorry for them because they were harassed and homeless like sheep without a shepherd.
41 Niniwetɔwo afɔ ɖe tsitre le ʋɔnudrɔ̃ɣi la kpe ɖe dzidzime sia ŋu, eye woabu fɔe, elabena wotrɔ dzi me le nya siwo Yona ɖe gbeƒãe la ta.
37 Then he said to his disciples "The crop to harvest is great, but the workers are few; 38 so beg the owner of the crop to send out workers to his harvest ";
Mateo
Matthew
13 Yesu do go le aƒea me gbe ma gbe, eye wòyi ɖabɔbɔ nɔ ƒua nu.
10 and, calling to him his twelve disciples, he gave them authority over unclean spirits to expel them, and to cure every disease and every ailment.

2 Eye ameha gã aɖe ƒo ƒu ɖe eŋu, eya ta ege ɖe tɔdziʋu aɖe me, eye wòbɔbɔ nɔ anyi, ke ameha blibo la le tsitre ɖe ƒua nu. 3 Eye wògblɔ nya geɖewo na wo le lododowo me be: "Mikpɔ ɖa! Nukuwula aɖe do go yi nuku wu ge. 4 Esi wòle nukua wum la, nuku aɖewo ge ɖe mɔ to, eye xeviwo va fɔ wo mi.

2 And these are the names of the twelve apostles: first Simon known as Peter, and his brother Andrew, and James the son of Zebedee and his brother John, 3 Philip and Bartholomew, Thomas and Matthew the customhouse officer, James the son of Alpheus and Thaddeus, 4 Simon the Kananee and Judas Iscariot the same who was the agent in his arrest.
5 Bubuwo ge ɖe kpenyigba dzi, afi si womekpɔ anyi sɔgbɔ le o, eye womie enumake, elabena anyia mede to o.
5 These twelve Jesus sent out, instructing them thus:
6 Esi ŋdɔ ʋu la, ŋdɔkutsu ɖu wo, eye woyrɔ, elabena woƒe ke meyi to o. 7 Bubuwo hã ge ɖe ŋùwo me, eye ŋùawo vu tsyɔ wo dzi.

"Do not go off on any route among the nations nor into a city of the Samaritans; 6 go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel, 7 and as you go proclaim that the Reign of Heaven is almost here.
8 Bubu aɖewo hã ge ɖe anyigba nyui dzi, eye wode asi tsetse me, ɖewo teƒe alafa ɖeka, ɖewo blaade, ɖewo blaetɔ̃.
8 Cure sick men, raise dead men, cleanse lepers, expel demons.
9 Ame si to li na la, nesee. "
You received gratis, give gratis.
10 Eye nusrɔ̃lawo va biae be: "Nu ka tae nèƒoa nu na wo le lododowo me? " 11 Eɖo eŋu na wo be: "Miawo la, wona mi be miase Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la ƒe nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔeawo gɔme, ke womena woawo ya o.
9 Do not get gold nor silver nor copper to take in your belts, 10 no traveling-wallet nor two coats nor shoes nor a walking-stick; for a worker deserves his food.
12 Elabena ame si si nu le la, woatsɔ geɖe akpee nɛ, eye wòagba go nɛ; gake ame si si nu mele o la, woaxɔ nu si le esi la gɔ̃ hã le esi.
11 And whatever city or village you come into, find out who in it is deserving, and stay there till you come out.
13 Esia tae meƒoa nu na wo le lododowo me ɖo; elabena togbɔ be wole nu kpɔm hã la, dzodzroe wole ekpɔm, eye togbɔ be wole nu sem hã la, dzodzroe wole esem, eye womesea egɔme o.
12 And in coming into the house salute it; 13 and if the house is deserving let your peace come upon it, but if it is not deserving let your peace come back to you.

15 Elabena dukɔ sia ƒe dzi ku atri; wose nu kple woƒe towo, ke womewɔ edzi o, eye womia woƒe ŋkuwo, ne woagakpɔ nu kple woƒe ŋkuwo, eye woase nu kple woƒe towo ahase nu gɔme kple woƒe dziwo, eye woatrɔ, ne mada gbe le wo ŋu o.’

14 And whoever does not receive you nor hear your words, shake out the dust from your feet in coming out from that house or city; 15 I tell you verily, it will be more bearable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city.
16 "Ke dzidzɔtɔwo mienye, elabena miaƒe ŋkuwo kpɔa nu eye miaƒe towo hã sea nu.
16 "Here I am sending you out like sheep among wolves; so be as cunning as snakes and as innocent as doves.
17 Elabena vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, nyagblɔɖila kple ame dzɔdzɔe geɖewo di vevie be yewoakpɔ nu siwo kpɔm miele la, gake womekpɔ wo o, eye wodi be yewoase nya siwo sem miele la, gake womese wo o.

17 But beware of men; for they will have you arrested and taken into court, and flogged in their synagogues; 18 and you will be brought before governors and kings on my account, for an attestation to them and the nations.

18 "Azɔ miɖo to miase nukuwula ŋuti lododoa ƒe gɔmeɖeɖe. 19 Ne ame aɖe se Fiaɖuƒea ŋuti nya la gake mesea egɔme o la, vɔ̃ɖitɔ la va ɖea nu si wowu ɖe eƒe dzi me la dzonae; nuku siae nye esi ge ɖe mɔ to la.

19 But when they have you arrested, do not fret over how or what you are to speak; for it will be given to you at that moment what to speak, 20 for it is not you that speak but your Father’s Spirit that speaks in you.

21 Gake meli ke le eɖokui me o, enɔa anyi ɣeyiɣi aɖe ko, eye ne xaxa alo yometiti va le nya la ta ko la, edea megbe enumake. 22 Ke nuku si ge ɖe ŋùwo me la, esiae nye ame si le nya la sem, gake nuɖoanyi sia me dzimaɖitsitsi kple kesinɔnuwo ƒe amebleŋusẽ vuna tsyɔa nya la dzi, eye metsea ku o.

21 "And a brother will have a brother arrested and put to death, and a father a child; and children will stand up against parents and have them put to death; 22 and you will be hated by all because of my name; but he who holds out to the end, he will come safe through.
23 Eye nuku si ge ɖe anyigba nyui dzi lae nye ame si le nya la sem, eye wòsea egɔme, eye wòtsea ku geɖe, ɖewo teƒe alafa ɖeka, ɖewo teƒe blaade, ɖewo teƒe blaetɔ̃. "
23 But when they persecute you in this city flee to the other; for I tell you verily you will not finish the cities of Israel till the Son of Man comes.
24 Egado lo bubu na wo be: "Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la le abe ame aɖe si wu nuku nyui ɖe eƒe agble me ene.
24 "A pupil is not above his teacher nor a servant above his master.
25 Esi amewo dɔ alɔ̃ la, eƒe futɔ va wu gbe vɔ̃ɖi ɖe luawo dome, eye wòdzo.
25 It is sufficient for the pupil that he be made like his teacher, and the servant like his master.
26 Esi luawo to aŋgba hetse la, gbe vɔ̃ɖiawo hã do.
If they have dubbed the head of the house Beelzebul, how much more will they the rest of his family! 26 So do not fear them.
27 Eye aƒetɔ la ƒe kluviwo va gblɔ nɛ be: ‘Aƒetɔ, menye nuku nyui ye nèwu ɖe wò agblea me oa?
27 What I tell you in the dark, say in the light; and what you hear whispered in your ear, proclaim on the roofs.
Aleke wɔ gbe vɔ̃ɖiwo va le eme?’ 28 Egblɔ na wo be: ‘Futɔ aɖee wɔ nu sia.’
28 And do not fear those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul, but fear rather him who can destroy both soul and body in hell.
30 Mina wo kple evea siaa natsi va se ɖe nuŋeɣi la, eye ne nuŋeɣia ɖo la, magblɔ na nuŋelawo be: Miho gbe vɔ̃ɖiawo gbã, eye miabla wo tatata atɔ dzo wo, emegbe miaƒo lu la nu ƒu ɖe nye nudzraɖoƒe.’ "

29 Why, sparrows are sold two for a penny, and not one of them will fall to the earth without your Father; 30 but of your heads even the hairs are all counted; 31 so do not fear, you are more important than a great many sparrows.

31 Egado lo bubu na wo be: "Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la le abe sinapi-ku si ame aɖe ƒã ɖe eƒe agble me ene. 32 Le nyateƒe me la, eyae nye nuku suetɔ, ke ne etsi la, eyae nyea abɔ me nu miemie si lolona wu, eye wòzua ati, ale be dziƒoxewo va nɔa eƒe alɔwo me. "

32 Everyone who shall acknowledge me before men, then, I myself will acknowledge before my Father in heaven; 33 but whoever repudiates me before men I myself will repudiate before my Father in heaven.

34 Yesu gblɔ nya siawo katã na ameha la le lododowo me. Le nyateƒe me la, meƒoa nu na wo ne menye le lododo me o, 35 ale be nya si wogblɔ ɖi to nyagblɔɖila la dzi nava eme, egblɔ be: "Make nu aƒo nu le lododowo me; magblɔ nu siwo le ɣaɣla tso keke gɔmeɖoanyiɣi ke. " 36 Esi wòɖe asi le amehaa ŋu vɔ la, eyi aƒe me.

34 "Do not suppose that I came to launch peace on the earth: I did not come to launch peace, but the sword, 35 for I came to put a man in antagonism to his father and a daughter to her mother and a daughter-in-law to her mother-in-law, 36 and the members of a man’s family shall be his enemies.

Eye eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo va egbɔ gblɔ nɛ be: "Ðe lo si nèdo le gbe vɔ̃ɖi siwo le agblea me ŋu la gɔme na mí. " 37 Eɖo eŋu na wo be: "Ame si le nuku nyuia wum lae nye Amegbetɔvi la, 38 eye agble lae nye xexea.

37 He who loves father or mother above me is not worthy of me; and he who loves son or daughter above me is not worthy of me; 38 and he who does not take his cross and follow after me is not worthy of me.
Nuku nyui lae nye Fiaɖuƒe la ƒe viwo, ke gbe vɔ̃ɖiawoe nye vɔ̃ɖitɔ la ƒe viwo, 39 eye futɔ si wu wo lae nye Abosam.
39 He who finds his self shall lose it, and he who loses his self on my account shall find it.
40 Eya ta abe ale si woho gbe vɔ̃ɖiawo hetɔ dzo woe ene la, nenema kee wòanɔ le nuɖoanyia ƒe nuwuɣi.
40 "He who receives you is receiving me, and he who receives me is receiving him who sent me.
41 Amegbetɔvi la adɔ eƒe dɔlawo ɖa, eye woaƒo amenuɖianuwo kple sedzimawɔlawo nu ƒu tso eƒe Fiaɖuƒe la me, 42 eye woatsɔ wo aƒu gbe ɖe kpodzo bibi la me.

41 He who receives a prophet as being a prophet shall get a prophet’s reward, and he who receives a saint as being a saint shall get a saint’s reward; 42 and anybody who gives one of these little ones just a cup of cold water to drink as being a disciple, I tell you verily, shall not lose his reward. "
Afi mae woafa avi ahaɖu aɖukli le.
Matthew 11:1-30
43 Ɣemaɣi la, ame dzɔdzɔewo aklẽ abe ɣe ene le wo Fofo ƒe Fiaɖuƒe la me. Ame si to li na la, nesee.
11 And when Jesus had finished giving directions to his twelve disciples he passed on from there to teach and make the proclamation in their cities.

44 "Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la le abe kesinɔnu aɖe si woɣla ɖe anyigba aɖe me ene, eye ame aɖe va ke ɖe eŋu hetsɔe ɣla; eye le dzidzɔ si wòkpɔ ta la, eyi ɖadzra eƒe nuwo katã eye wòƒle anyigba ma. 45 "Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la gale abe asitsala mɔzɔla aɖe si le dzonu nyuiwo dim la ene. 46 Esi wòke ɖe dzonu xɔasi aɖe ŋu la, eyi ɖadzra eƒe nuwo katã enumake eye wòƒlee.

2 And John, hearing in his prison the deeds of the Messiah, sent by his disciples 3 and said to him "Are you the Coming One or are we to expect another? " 4 And Jesus answered them "Go and report to John what you hear and see: 5 blind men are recovering their sight and cripples are walking, lepers are being cleansed and deaf men are hearing, and dead men are being raised and poor men are being given the gospel; 6 and happy is anyone who is not staggered over me. "

47 "Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la gale abe ɖɔ si woɖi ɖe ƒu me, si ɖe tɔmelã ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi la ene. 48 Esi ɖɔa yɔ la, wohee va gota, eye wonɔ anyi heƒo tɔmelã nyuiawo nu ƒu ɖe nugowo me, ke wotsɔ manyomanyoawo ƒu gbe.

7 And while these were on their way Jesus began to say to the crowds about John "What did you go out into the wilderness for? to gaze at reeds shaking in the wind? 8 But what did you go out for? to see a man robed in soft fabrics? for the wearers of soft fabrics, go to kings’ houses.
49 Nenemae wòanɔ le nuɖoanyia ƒe nuwuɣi.
9 But what did you go out for? to see a prophet?
Mawudɔlawo ado go, eye woama ame vɔ̃ɖiwo ɖa tso ame dzɔdzɔewo gbɔ, 50 eye woatsɔ wo aƒu gbe ɖe kpodzo bibi la me.

Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet; 10 this is he of whom it is written ‘Lo, I am sending before your face my messenger who shall prepare your road before you,’ 11 I tell you verily, there has not arisen among all that are born of women a greater than John the Baptist; but the littlest in the Reign of Heaven is greater than he.
Afi mae woafa avi ahaɖu aɖukli le. 51 "Miese nu siawo katã gɔmea? "
12 But from John the Baptist’s days till now the Reign of Heaven is being forced and violent men are pouncing on it.

Woɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Ɛ̃. " 52 Egblɔ na wo be: "Ne nenemae la, minyae be dutoƒonufiala ɖe sia ɖe si wofia nui tso Dziƒofiaɖuƒea ŋu la ɖi aƒetɔ aɖe si ɖea nu yeyewo kple nu xoxowo siaa doa goe tso eƒe kesinɔnudzraɖoƒe. " 53 Esi Yesu do lo siawo vɔ la, edzo le afi ma.

23 And you, Capernaum, are you to be lifted up to heaven? you are to go down to the world of the dead, because if the miracles that have been done in you had been done in Sodom it would have lasted till today; 24 I tell you, though, it will be more bearable for Sodom at the day of judgment than for you. "

54 Esi wòva wo de la, ede asi nufiafia wo me le woƒe ƒuƒoƒe la, eye woƒe mo wɔ yaa wobia be: "Afi kae ame sia kpɔ nunya sia kple ŋusẽ tsoe tsɔ le ŋusẽdɔ siawo gbegbe wɔm? 55 Menye atikpala la ƒe vie nye esia oa?

25 At that time Jesus answered "I give thee praise, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou didst hide these things from the wise and discerning and disclose them to infants; 26 yes, Father, because such was thy pleasure.
Menye dadaa ye woyɔna be Maria, eye nɔviaŋutsuwoe nye Yakobo, Yosef, Simon kple Yuda oa? 56 Eye ɖe nɔvianyɔnuwo katã mele mía dome oa?

27 Everything has been committed to me by my Father; and no one is acquainted with the Son except the Father, nor is anyone acquainted with the Father except the Son and he to whom the Son chooses to disclose him.
Ekema afi kae wòkpɔ nu siawo katã tsoe? " 57 Eya ta eƒe nyawo ɖia wo nu.
28 Come to me, all you toilers, all who are loaded down, and I will give you rest.
Ke Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Wodea bubu nyagblɔɖila ŋu le afi sia afi negbe le wo de kple eya ŋutɔ ƒe aƒe me ko womebunɛ le o. " 58 Eye mewɔ ŋusẽdɔ geɖewo le afi ma o, le woƒe dzimaxɔse ta.
29 Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, because I am meek and lowly in heart; and you shall find rest for your souls. 30 For my yoke is easy, and my load light. "
Mateo
Matthew
EMENYAWO ƑE TOTOƉEME 14 Ɣemaɣi la, nutodziɖula Herodes se Yesu ŋu nya, 2 eye wògblɔ na eŋumewo be: "Yohanes Amenyrɔɖetsimela lae nye ame sia.
12 At that time Jesus went through the grainfields on the sabbath.

Wofɔe tso ame kukuwo dome, eya tae wòte ŋu le ŋusẽdɔwo wɔm ɖo. " 3 Do ŋgɔ na esia la, Herodes lé Yohanes heblae de gaxɔ me le Herodia si nye nɔviaŋutsu Filipo srɔ̃ la ta. 4 Elabena Yohanes gblɔna nɛ enuenu be: "Mele se nu be nàxɔe aɖe o. " 5 Gake togbɔ be edi be yeawui hã la, enɔ vɔvɔ̃m na ameha la, elabena wobua Yohanes nyagblɔɖilae.

And his disciples grew hungry and began to pick ears and eat them; 2 and the Pharisees, seeing it, said to him "There, your disciples are doing what it is not lawful to do on a Sabbath. " 3 But he said to them "Have you not read what David did when he and those who were with him were hungry? 4 how he went into the house of God and they ate the showbread, which it was not allowable for him to eat nor for those who were with him, but only for the priests? 5 or have you not read in the law that on the sabbath the priests in the temple profane the sabbath and are guiltless? 6 but I tell you there is something greater than the temple here.
6 Ke esi wole Herodes ƒe dzigbezã ɖum la, Herodia vinyɔnu va ɖu ɣe le azãɖuƒea wòdze Herodes ŋu ale gbegbe, 7 eya ta eka atam do ŋugbe na nyɔnuvia be yeana nu sia nu si wòabia lae.
7 But if you knew what ‘I want pity, and not sacrifice’ is, you would not have condemned the guiltless; 8 for the Son of Man is master of the sabbath. "

8 Esi dadaa de gbe to me nɛ ta la, egblɔ be: "Tsɔ Yohanes Amenyrɔɖetsimela ƒe ta de agba sia me nam. " 9 Togbɔ be ete ɖe fia la dzi hã la, le atam si wòka le ame siwo le kplɔ̃a ŋu kplii ŋkume ta la, eɖe gbe be woatsɔe anae.

9 And he passed from that place to their synagogue; 10 and lo, there was a man there with a shriveled hand, and they put the question to him "Is it lawful to cure on the sabbath? " that they might arraign him.

10 Eya ta edɔ woyi ɖatso ta le Yohanes nu le gaxɔa me. 11 Eye wotsɔ eƒe ta de agba me vɛ, eye wotsɔe na nyɔnuvia wòtsɔ yi na dadaa. 12 Emegbe eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo va kɔ eƒe kukua yi ɖaɖi, eye wova ka eta na Yesu.

11 But he said to them "What man will there be of you that will have one sheep, and if that falls into a pit on the sabbath will not catch hold of it and get it on its feet? 12 How much more important, then, is a man than a sheep!
13 Esi Yesu see la, eya ɖeka ɖo tɔdziʋu dzo le afi ma yi teƒe tsoabo aɖe. Gake esi amehawo see la, woto afɔ tso duawo me dze eyome.
So that it is lawful to do a good turn on the sabbath. " 13 Then he said to the man "Stretch out your hand "; and he stretched it out and it was restored, sound like the other.
14 Esi wòɖi go la, ekpɔ ame gbogbo aɖewo, woƒe nu wɔ nublanui nɛ, eye wòda gbe le woƒe dɔnɔwo ŋu.
14 But the Pharisees went out and laid a plot against him to make away with him; 15 but Jesus, finding it out, retired from that place.

15 Ke esi fiẽsi ɖo la, eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo va gblɔ nɛ be: "Teƒe sia tso abo, eye zã le dodom; ɖe asi le ameha la ŋu ne woayi kɔƒeawo me aɖaƒle nu aɖu. " 16 Ke Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Mehiã be woadzo o; miawo ŋutɔwo mina nu wo woaɖu. " 17 Woɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Naneke mele mía si le afi sia o, negbe abolo atɔ̃ kple tɔmelã eve ko. " 18 Egblɔ be: "Mitsɔ wo vɛ nam. " 19 Eye wògblɔ na amehawo be woanɔ anyi ɖe gbeawo dzi.

And many followed him, and he cured them all, 16 and told them peremptorily not to make him known, 17 that what was said through the prophet Isaiah in the words 18 "Here is my servant whom I like well, my dear one in whom my soul takes pleasure; I will put my Spirit upon him, and he shall announce judgment to the nations.
20 Ale wo katã woɖu nu ɖi ƒo, eye woƒo kakɛ siwo susɔ la nu ƒu, eye woyɔ kusi wuieve.
19 He will not wrangle, nor shout, nor will anyone hear his voice on the streets.
21 Ke ame siwo ɖu nua la anɔ ŋutsu akpe atɔ̃, womexlẽ nyɔnuwo kple ɖeviwo ya o.
20 He will not break a crushed reed, and will not put out smoldering flax, till he brings judgment out to victory; 21 and in his name shall nations hope " should be fulfilled.
22 Emegbe ena eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo ɖo tɔdziʋua dze eŋgɔ yi go kemɛ dzi, eye eya ŋutɔ do mɔ amehawo.
22 Then there was brought to him a blind and dumb demoniac; and he cured him, so that the dumb man spoke and saw.
23 Esi wòdo mɔ amehawo vɔ la, eya ɖeka yi to la dzi be yeado gbe ɖa. Esi zã do la, eya ɖeka nɔ afi ma.
28 But if I expel the demons by the Spirit of God, then the Reign of God has overtaken you.
24 Afi si tɔdziʋua ɖo ɣemaɣi la gbɔ didi ʋĩi tso gota, eye ƒutsotsoewo nɔ tɔdziʋua nyamam, elabena ya ƒo va le wo kpem.
29 Or how can one enter a strong man’s house and carry off his goods unless he first binds the strong man? and then he shall plunder his house.
25 Ke le zã ƒe ŋudzɔɣi enelia me la, ezɔ to ƒua dzi gbɔna wo gbɔ.
30 He who is not with me is against me, and he who does not gather with me scatters.
26 Esi nusrɔ̃lawo kpɔe wòle ƒua dzi zɔm la, dzika tso wo ƒo eye wogblɔ be: "Drɔ̃e yea? " Eye vɔvɔ̃ ɖo wo wodo ɣli.
31 Accordingly I tell you, men will be forgiven every sin and blasphemy, but not the blasphemy of the Spirit.
27 Ke Yesu ƒo nu kpli wo enumake be: "Milé dzi ɖe ƒo! Nyee; migavɔ̃ o. " 28 Petro ɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Aƒetɔ, nenye wòe la, ekema na mazɔ tsia dzi ava gbɔwò. " 29 Egblɔ be: "Va! "
32 And anyone who says a thing against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but one who says it against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven either in this or in the future age.
Ale Petro ɖi le tɔdziʋua me, eye wòzɔ tsia dzi ɖo ta Yesu gbɔ.
33 Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or make the tree foul and its fruit foul; for the tree is known by the fruit.
33 Eye nusrɔ̃la siwo le tɔdziʋua me la bɔbɔ nɛ gblɔ be: "Mawu Vie nènye vavã! " 34 Eye wotso ƒua va ɖi go ɖe Genezaret-nyigba dzi.
34 Spawn of vipers, how can you be bad and speak good? for what the mouth speaks comes out of what is overflowing in the heart.
35 Esi afi ma tɔwo kpɔe dze sii la, woɖo du ɖe woƒe nuto blibo la katã me, eye wokplɔ dɔnɔwo katã va egbɔ.
35 A good man brings out good things from his good stock, and a bad man brings out bad things from his bad stock.
36 Eye wova ɖe kuku nɛ vevie be yewoaka asi eƒe awu toga teti ko, eye ame siwo katã ka asi eŋu la ƒe lãme sẽ keŋkeŋ.
36 But I tell you, every idle word that men shall speak they shall account for at the day of judgment; 37 for you shall be acquitted on your own words and condemned on your own words. "
Mateo 15:1-39

38 Then some of the scribes and Pharisees answered him "Teacher, we want to see a token from you. " 39 But he answered them "A wicked and adulterous generation is in quest of a token, and will be given none but the token of the prophet Jonah.
15 Farisitɔwo kple agbalẽfialawo tso Yerusalem va Yesu gbɔ hebiae be: 2 "Nu ka tae wò nusrɔ̃lawo daa blematɔwo ƒe kɔnyinyiwo dzi?
40 For as Jonah was in the whale’s belly three days and three nights, so will the Son of Man be in the heart of the earth three days and three nights.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, womeklɔa asi hafi ɖua nu o. "
It will be the same with this wicked generation. "

3 Eɖo eŋu na wo be: "Nu ka tae miawo hã miedaa Mawu ƒe se la dzi le miaƒe kɔnyinyiwo ta? 4 Le kpɔɖeŋu me, Mawu gblɔ be: ‘Bu fofowò kple dawò,’ eye be: ‘Woawu ame si dzua fofoa alo dadaa la.’ 5 Ke miawo ya miegblɔna be: ‘Ame sia ame si gblɔ na fofoa alo dadaa be: "Nu sia nu si le asinye, si aɖe vi na wò la, nye nunana si metsɔ ɖe adzɔgbe na Mawu " la, 6 mele be wòabu fofoa kura o.’

46 While he was still speaking to the crowds, his mother and brothers made their appearance, standing outside and wanting to speak to him. 47 48 But he replied to the one who told him of it "Who is my mother, and who are my brothers? " 49 and he stretched out his hand toward his disciples and said "Here are my mother and my brothers; 50 for whoever does the will of my Father in heaven, he is my brother and sister and mother. "
Ale miena Mawu ƒe nya la zu dzodzro le miaƒe kɔnyinyiwo ta.
Matthew 13:1-58
7 Mi alakpanuwɔlawo, Yesaya gblɔe ɖi nyuie le mia ŋuti be: 8 ‘Dukɔ sia le buyem kple woƒe nuyiwo, ke woƒe dzi te ɖa xaa tso gbɔnye.

13 On that day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the seaside; 2 and great crowds gathered to him, so that he got into a boat and sat in it, and all the crowd stood on the beach; 3 and he spoke much to them in parables, saying "Once upon a time a sower went out to sow.

9 Dzodzroe wole subɔyem, elabena amegbetɔwo ƒe sededewoe wofiana.’ " 10 Eye wòyɔ ameha la va eɖokui gbɔ hegblɔ na wo be: "Miɖo to, ne miase egɔme: 11 Menye nu si yia ame ƒe nu mee ƒoa ɖii o, ke boŋ nu si doa go tso ame ƒe nu me lae ƒoa ɖii. "

9 Let him who has ears hear! " 10 And the disciples approached and said to him "Why do you speak to them in parables? " 11 and he answered "Because it is given to you to know the secrets of the Reign of Heaven, but it is not given to them.
12 Eye nusrɔ̃lawo va biae be: "Ènya be esi Farisitɔwo se nya si nègblɔ la, eɖia wo nua? " 13 Eɖo eŋu be: "Ati sia ati si Fofonye si le dziƒo medo o la, woahoe.
12 For whoever has, more shall be given to him, and he shall have enough and to spare; but whoever has not, even what he has shall be taken from him.
14 Miɖe asi le wo ŋu. Mɔfiala ŋkuagbãtɔwoe wonye.

13 This is why I speak to them in parables, because when they see they do not see, and when they hear they do not hear nor understand; 14 and Isaiah’s prophecy which says ‘Hear you shall, and not understand; and see you shall, and not perceive; 15 for this people’s wits are thickened, and their ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes they have shut, for fear they should see with their eyes and hear with their ears and understand with their wits, and turn back, and I should heal them’ is fulfilled to them.

Ke ne ŋkuagbãtɔ le ŋkuagbãtɔ kplɔm la, wo ame eve la siaa woage dze do me. " 15 Petro gblɔ nɛ be: "Ðe lododoa gɔme na mí. " 16 Eye wògblɔ be: "Ke miawo hã miese nya siawo gɔme haɖe oa? 17 Ðe mienyae be nu sia nu si yia nu me la toa dɔkaviwo me, eye wodenɛ oa? 18 Ke nu siwo doa go tso nu me la tsoa dzi la me, eye nu mawoe ƒoa ɖi ame.

16 But happy are your eyes, because they see, and your ears, because they hear; 17 for I tell you verily that many prophets and saints desired to see what you see and to hear what you hear, and did not. 18 Hear then, you, the parable of the sower.
19 Elabena dzi mee susu vɔ̃wo: amewuwuwo, ahasiwɔwɔwo, matrewɔwɔwo, fififiwo, aʋatsoɖaseɖiɖiwo kple busunyagbɔgblɔwo doa go tso.
19 When anyone hears the word of the Reign and does not understand it, the Evil One comes and carries off what has been sowed in his heart; this is the one that was sowed on the roadside.
20 Nu siawoe ƒoa ɖi ame, ke menye nuɖuɖu asimaklɔmaklɔe ƒoa ɖi ame o. " 21 Esi Yesu dzo le afi ma la, eyi Tiro kple Sidon nutowo me.

20 And the one who has sowed on the rocky ground, he is the one who hears the word and at once receives it with joy, 21 yet has no root in him but is temporary, and when there comes distress or persecution because of the word he is staggered at once.
22 Eye kpɔ ɖa, Foinike-nyɔnu aɖe si tso nuto ma me la va eye wòdo ɣli gblɔ be: "Aƒetɔ, David Vi, kpɔ nublanui nam.
22 And the one who was sowed among the thorns, he is the one who hears the word, and temporal anxieties and the deceits of wealth stifle the word and it becomes unfruitful.
Gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo le fu ɖem na vinyenyɔnuvi vevie. " 23 Gake meɖo nya aɖeke ŋu nɛ o.
23 And the one who was sowed on the good soil, he is the one who hears and understands the word; who bears his crop, and produces one a hundred and another sixty and another thirty. "

Eya ta eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo va ɖe kuku nɛ be: "Do mɔe, elabena ele ɣli dom le mía yome. " 24 Eɖo eŋu be: "Womedɔm ɖe ame bubuwo gbɔ o, negbe ɖe Israel ƒe aƒe la me tɔ siwo nye alẽ búbuwo la gbɔ ko. " 25 Ke nyɔnua va dze klo nɛ gblɔ be: "Aƒetɔ, kpe ɖe ŋunye! " 26 Eɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Mesɔ be woatsɔ ɖeviwo ƒe nuɖuɖu aƒu gbe ɖo ɖe avuviwo o. " 27 Eɖo eŋu be: "Aƒetɔ, ele eme baa; gake avuviwo ɖua nuɖuɖu wuwlui siwo duduna tso woƒe aƒetɔwo ƒe kplɔ̃ dzi. " 28 Yesu ɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Oo aƒenɔ, wò xɔse lolo ŋutɔ; neva eme na wò abe ale si nèdi ene. "

24 He set before them another parable, saying "The Reign of Heaven resembles a man who sowed good seed in his field; 25 but while men were asleep his enemy came and sowed darnel in among the wheat, and went off. 26 And when the stalks began to ear and made heads, then the darnel too showed itself; 27 and the proprietor’s servants came and said to him ‘Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? then how comes it to have darnel?’ 28 And he said to them ‘An enemy did that.’
Eye vianyɔnuvi la haya le gaƒoƒo ma dzi. 29 Esi Yesu dzo le afi ma la, eva teƒe aɖe si gogo Galilea-ƒua, eye wòyi togbɛ aɖe dzi hebɔbɔ nɔ afi ma.
And the servants say to him ‘Then do you want us to go and pick them out?’ 29 But he says to them ‘No, for fear that in picking out the darnel you should pull up the wheat along with it.
30 Eye ameha geɖewo va egbɔ, wokplɔ bunɔwo, nuwɔametɔwo, ŋkuagbãtɔwo, aɖetututɔwo kple dɔ bubu ƒomevi geɖe lélawo ɖe asi, eye wotsɔ wo da ɖe eƒe afɔnu, eye wòda dɔ na wo.
30 Leave both to grow together till harvest; and at harvesttime I will tell the harvesters "Pull out the darnel first and tie it in bundles to burn, but gather the wheat into my barn. "’ "
31 Esi ameha la kpɔ be aɖetututɔwo le nu ƒom, bunɔwo le zɔzɔm, eye ŋkuagbãtɔwo le nu kpɔm la, woƒe mo wɔ yaa, eye wokafu Israel ƒe Mawu la.

31 He set before them another parable, saying "The Reign of Heaven is like a grain of mustard which a man took and sowed in his field; 32 which is the smallest of all the seeds, but when it grows it is the largest of the plants and becomes a tree so that the birds of the air come and perch in its branches. "
32 Ke Yesu yɔ eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo va eɖokui gbɔ hegblɔ na wo be: "Ameha la ƒe nu le nublanui wɔm nam, elabena ŋkeke etɔ̃ sɔŋ ye nye esia wole gbɔnye, naneke mele wo si woaɖu o.
33 He spoke to them another parable: "The Reign of Heaven is like a bit of yeast which a woman took and buried in forty quarts of flour till it all grew yeasty. "

Nyemedi be maɖe asi le wo ŋu woadzo dɔmeɣi o, ɖewohĩ akpo ava tso wo le mɔ dzi. " 33 Ke nusrɔ̃lawo biae be: "Afi kae míakpɔ abolo tsoe le teƒe tsoabo sia wòade ame gbogbo siawo nu? " 34 Yesu bia wo be: "Abolo nenie le mia si? "

34 All this Jesus spoke to the crowds in parables, and spoke nothing to them without parable, 35 so that what was said through the prophet in the words "I will open my mouth in parables, I will emit things hidden since the foundation of the world " should be fulfilled.

Woɖo eŋu be: "Abolo adre kple tɔmelã sue ʋɛ aɖewo. " 35 Eye esi wògblɔ na ameha la be woanɔ anyi ɖe anyigba vɔ la, 36 etsɔ abolo adreawo kple tɔmelãawo, eye wòda akpe, ŋe aboloawo me hemae na eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo, eye nusrɔ̃lawo hã ma wo na amehaawo.

36 Then he left the crowds and came into the house; and his disciples approached him, saying "Explain the parable of the darnel in the field to us. " 37 And he answered "The one who sowed the good seed is the Son of Man; 38 and the field is the world; and the good seed, that is the men of the Reign, and the darnel is the men of evil; 39 and the enemy that sowed it is the devil; and the harvest is the final time, and the harvesters are angels.
37 Eye wo katã woɖu nu ɖi ƒo, eye wofɔ kakɛ siwo susɔ la wode kusi gã adre. 38 Ke ŋutsu siwo ɖu nua la nɔ ame akpe ene, womexlẽ nyɔnuwo kple ɖeviwo ya o.

40 As darnel, then, is picked out and burned up, so it will be at the final time: 41 the Son of Man will send out his angels and they will pick out from his kingdom all snares that trip people up, and men that do wickedness, 42 and throw them into the furnace of fire; there will the weeping and the grinding of teeth be.
39 Mlɔeba esi wòdo mɔ amehaawo vɔ la, eɖo tɔdziʋu yi Magadan-nutoa me.
43 Then will the righteous shine out like the sun in their Father’s reign.
Mateo 16:1-28
Let him who has ears hear!
16 Farisitɔwo kple Zadukitɔwo va Yesu gbɔ be yewoatee kpɔ eye wobiae be wòaɖe dzesi aɖe afia yewo tso dziƒo.
44 "The Reign of Heaven is like a treasure hidden in the field, which a man has found and hid, and in his gladness he goes and sells all he has and buys that field.

2 Eɖo eŋu na wo be: "Ne fiẽ ɖo la, miegblɔna be: ‘Xexea me le kɔkɔ ge, elabena dziŋgɔli biã,’ 3 eye le ŋdi la, miegblɔna be: ‘Vuvɔ le wɔwɔ ge, eye tsi le dzadza ge egbea, elabena dziŋgɔli biã, eye wòxe litii.’

47 "Again, the Reign of Heaven is like a seine that is thrown into the sea and gathers all sorts, 48 and when it is filled they draw it up on the beach and sit down and sort the good into tubs, but throw out the foul.
Mienyaa nu si dziŋgɔli ƒe nɔnɔme fiana, ke mienya nu si ɣeyiɣiawo ƒe dzesiwo ya fia o.

49 So it will be at the final time: the angels will go out and separate the wicked from among the righteous 50 and throw them into the furnace of fire; there will the weeping and the grinding of teeth be.
4 Dzidzime vɔ̃ɖi wɔahasi le dzesi dim, gake womele dzesi aɖeke na gee o, negbe Yona ƒe dzesi la ko. "
51 "Have you understood all this? "
Ale wògblẽ wo ɖi hedzo.
They said to him "Yes. "
5 Nusrɔ̃lawo tso ƒua yi go kemɛ dzi, gake woŋlɔ be wometsɔ abolo ɖe asi o.
52 And he said to them "Accordingly, every scribe who has become a disciple of the Reign of Heaven is like a householder who draws out from his stock new things and old things. "

6 Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Mina miaƒe ŋkuwo nanɔ ʋuʋu, eye mikpɔ nyuie le Farisitɔwo kple Zadukitɔwo ƒe amɔwɔʋãnu la ŋu. " 7 Ale wogblɔ le wo nɔewo dome be: "Esi míetsɔ abolo aɖeke ɖe asi o tae. " 8 Esi Yesu de dzesii la, egblɔ be: "Mi xɔseʋɛtɔwo, nu ka tae miele gbɔgblɔm le mia nɔewo dome be, esi míetsɔ abolo aɖeke ɖe asi o tae? 9 Ðe miekpɔ se egɔme haɖe oa, alo ɖe mieɖo ŋku abolo atɔ̃ siwo mena ŋutsu akpe atɔ̃ woɖu kple kusi ale si nu miefɔ la dzi oa? 10 Alo ɖe mieɖo ŋku abolo adre siwo mena ŋutsu akpe ene woɖu kple kusi gã ale si nu miefɔ la dzi oa? 11 Aleke wɔ miese egɔme be menye abolo ƒe nya gblɔm mele na mi o?

53 And when Jesus had finished these parables he took his departure from that place; 54 and he came to his hometown and taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished and said "Where does this man get this wisdom and these miracles? 55 why, this is the carpenter’s son, his mother is named Mary and his brothers James and Joseph and Simon and Judah, 56 and his sisters are all of them among us so where does this man get all this? " 57 and they were staggered at him.

Ke boŋ be miakpɔ nyuie le Farisitɔwo kple Zadukitɔwo ƒe amɔwɔʋãnu la ŋu. " 12 Ale wose egɔme be menye aboloʋãnu ŋue wògblɔ le be yewoakpɔ nyuie le o, ke boŋ le Farisitɔwo kple Zadukitɔwo ƒe nufiafia ŋuti.
But Jesus said to them "A prophet is not unhonored anywhere but in his hometown and in his house "; 58 and he did not do many miracles there because of their unbelievingness. Matthew 14:1-36

13 Eye esi Yesu va ɖo Kaisarea Filipi nutoa me la, ebia eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo be: "Ame kae amewo le gbɔgblɔm be Amegbetɔvi la nye? " 14 Woɖo eŋu be: "Ame aɖewo be Yohanes Amenyrɔɖetsimela, bubuwo be Eliya, eye bubuwo hã be Yeremiya alo nyagblɔɖilawo dometɔ ɖekae. " 15 Ebia wo be: "Ke miawo ya ɖe, ame kae miegblɔna be menye? " 16 Simon Petro ɖo eŋu be: "Wòe nye Kristo la, Mawu gbagbe la ƒe Vi. " 17 Yesu gblɔ nɛ be: "Dzidzɔtɔe nènye, Simon, Yona vi, elabena menye amegbetɔe ɖee fia wò o, ke boŋ Fofonye si le dziƒo lae.

14 At that time the tetrarch Herod heard the report about Jesus, 2 and said to his servants "This is John the Baptist; he has risen from the dead, and that is why the powers are operating in him. " 3 For Herod had seized John and put him in chains and put him away in prison on account of Herodias his brother Philip’s wife; 4 for John used to tell him "It is not lawful for you to have her "; 5 and, while he wished to kill him, he was afraid of the people, because they regarded him as a prophet.

18 Azɔ hã, mele egblɔm na wò be: Wòe nye Petro, eye agakpe sia dzie matu nye hame la ɖo, eye Tsiẽƒe ƒe agbowo mate ŋu aɖu edzi o. 19 Matsɔ dziƒofiaɖuƒe la ƒe safuiwo ana wò, eye nu sia nu si nàbla le anyigba dzi la anɔ babla xoxo le dziƒowo, eye nu sia nu si nàtu le anyigba dzi la anɔ tutu xoxo le dziƒowo. " 20 Eye wòde se na nusrɔ̃lawo vevie be womegagblɔe na ame aɖeke be yee nye Kristo la o.

6 But when Herod’s birthday came Herodias’s daughter danced before the company, and pleased Herod, 7 whereat he pledged himself with an oath to give her anything she asked for; 8 but she, prompted by her mother, said "Give me here on a platter John the Baptist’s head.
