" 9 And the king, though it grieved him, ordered it given to her because of the oaths and of those who were with him at the table; 10 and he sent and beheaded John in the prison, 11 and his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother; 12 and his disciples went to his corpse and took it up and buried it, and came and reported the matter to Jesus.

21 Tso ɣemaɣi la, Yesu de asi numeɖeɖe me na eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo be ele be yeayi Yerusalem aɖakpe fu geɖe tso dumegãwo kple nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kpakple agbalẽfialawo si me, eye woawu ye, ke woafɔ ye ɖe tsitre le ŋkeke etɔ̃a gbe.

13 And at hearing it Jesus retired in a boat from there to a lonely place by himself; and the crowds heard of it and followed him by land from the cities, 14 and upon landing he saw a great crowd and had pity on them and cured their sick.
22 Eye Petro ɖe kpɔe hede asi nyagbegbe me nɛ be: "Aƒetɔ, di nyui na ɖokuiwò; esia madzɔ ɖe dziwò gbeɖe o. " 23 Ke etrɔ, eye wògblɔ na Petro be: "Te yi megbenye, Satana!
22 And at once he made the disciples get into the boat and go to the other side ahead of him while he dismissed the crowds.
Mɔxenu nènye nam, elabena menye Mawu tɔ susum nèle o, ke boŋ amegbetɔwo tɔ. "
23 And when he had dismissed the crowds he went up on the mountainside by himself to pray.
24 Eye Yesu gblɔ na eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo be: "Ne ame aɖe di be yeadze yonyeme la, negbe nu le eɖokui gbɔ, eye wòatsɔ eƒe fuwɔameti la, eye wòadze yonyeme ɖaa.
And when evening came he was there alone; 24 but the boat was now two or three miles away from the land, having a hard time with the waves, for the wind was contrary.
25 Elabena ame sia ame si di be yeaɖe yeƒe agbe la abui, ke ame sia ame si abu eƒe agbe le tanye la akpɔe.
25 But in the fourth watch of the night he came toward them walking on the sea.
26 Le nyateƒe me la, viɖe kae wòanye na ame, ne xexea katã zu etɔ, gake wòbu eƒe agbe?
26 And the disciples, seeing him walking on the sea, were alarmed, saying "It is an apparition, " and screamed with fear.
Alo nu kae ame atsɔ ana ɖe eƒe agbe ta? 27 Elabena Amegbetɔvi la ava le Fofoa ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe me kple eƒe dɔlawo, eye wòaɖo eteƒe na ame sia ame ɖe eƒe nuwɔna nu.

27 But at once Jesus spoke to them, saying "All right, it is I, do not be afraid. " 28 And Peter answered him "Sir, if it is you, bid me come to you on the water. " 29 And he said "Come "; and Peter, stepping out of the boat, walked on the water and came toward Jesus.
28 Vavãe mele egblɔm na mi be, ame aɖewo le ame siwo le tsitre ɖe afi sia dome, siwo maɖɔ ku akpɔ o va se ɖe esime wokpɔ Amegbetɔvi la wògbɔna le eƒe Fiaɖuƒe la me. "

30 But when he saw the wind he was frightened, and, beginning to sink, cried out "Master, help! " 31 And at once Jesus reached out his hand and took hold of him, and said to him "Little-faith, what did you get uncertain for? " 32 and when they stepped into the boat the wind lulled.
Mateo
Matthew
17 Le ŋkeke ade megbe la, Yesu kplɔ Petro, Yakobo kple nɔvia Yohanes kpe ɖe eɖokui ŋu, eye woawo ɖeɖe woyi to kɔkɔ aɖe dzi.

19 For from the heart come evil designs, murders, adulteries, unchastities, thefts, false testimonies, abusive language: 20 these things are what defile the man; but eating with unwashed hands does not. "
2 Eye eƒe dzedzeme trɔ le wo ŋkume, eƒe mo klẽ abe ɣe ene, eye eƒe awuwo fu tititi abe kekeli ene.
21 And Jesus went out from there and withdrew to the parts about Tyre and Sidon.
3 Eye kpɔ ɖa, Eliya kple Mose dze wokpɔ eye wole dze ɖom kplii.
And her daughter was healed from that moment.
4 Eya ta Petro gblɔ na Yesu be: "Aƒetɔ, enyo na mí be míanɔ afi sia.
39 And he dismissed the crowds and got into the boat and came to the territory of Magadan.

Ne èlɔ̃ la, matu agbadɔ etɔ̃ ɖe afi sia, ɖeka na wò, ɖeka na Mose, eye ɖeka na Eliya. " 5 Esi wògale nuƒoƒo dzi la, kpɔ ɖa, alilikpo keklẽ aɖe do vɔvɔli ɖe wo dzi, eye gbe aɖe ɖi tso alilikpoa me be: "Ame siae nye Vinye, si gbɔ nyemelɔ̃a nu le o, si ƒe nu dzea ŋunye.

Matthew 16:1-28 16 And the Pharisees and Sadducees came to him and, as a test challenged him to show them a token from heaven; 2 but he answered them 3 4 "A wicked and adulterous generation is in quest of a token, and will be given none but the token of Jonah "; and he left them and went away.
Miɖo toe. " 6 Esi nusrɔ̃lawo se nya sia la, wotsyɔ mo anyi, eye vɔvɔ̃ ɖo wo ŋutɔ.
18 And I tell you, you are Peter " [in English, "you are a Rock "], "and on this rock I will build my church; and the gates of the realm of death shall not prevail against it.
7 Eye Yesu te ɖe wo ŋu eye wòka asi wo ŋu gblɔ be: "Mifɔ. Migavɔ̃ o. " 8 Esi wofɔ mo dzi la, womekpɔ ame aɖeke o, negbe Yesu ɖeka ko.
21 Thenceforth Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer a great deal from the elders and chief priests and scribes and be killed, and rise on the third day.
9 Esi wole ɖiɖim tso toa dzi la, Yesu de se na wo be: "Migagblɔ ŋutega la na ame aɖeke o, va se ɖe esime wofɔ Amegbetɔvi la tso ame kukuwo dome hafi. "

22 And Peter took him in hand and began to rebuke him, saying "Away with the thought, sir; this shall not happen to you. " 23 But he turned and said to Peter "Go behind me, Satan; you are my snare, because you do not have God’s ideas but men’s. "
10 Ke nusrɔ̃lawo biae be: "Ekema nu ka tae agbalẽfialawo gblɔna be ele be Eliya nava gbã? " 11 Eɖo eŋu be: "Vavãe, ele be Eliya nava, eye wòaɖɔ nuwo katã ɖo.
24 Then Jesus said to his disciples "If anyone wishes to come after me, let him disown himself and take up his cross and follow me.
12 Ke mele egblɔm na mi be Eliya va xoxo, gake womedze sii o, eye wowɔ nu si dze wo ŋu la ɖe eŋu.
25 For whoever wishes to save his self will lose it, but whoever loses his self on my account will find it.
Nenema kee Amegbetɔvi la hã akpe fu le wo si me. " 13 Ale nusrɔ̃lawo se egɔme be Yohanes Amenyrɔɖetsimela ŋu nya gblɔm wòle na yewo.

26 For what good will a man get if he makes a profit of the whole world and a loss of his self? or what shall a man give as an equivalent for his self? 27 For the Son of Man is to come in his Father’s glory with his angels, and will then repay each one according to his actions.
14 Esi wogbɔna ameha la gbɔ la, ŋutsu aɖe te ɖe eŋu hedze klo ɖe eŋkume gblɔ be: 15 "Aƒetɔ, kpɔ nublanui na vinyeŋutsuvi, elabena kpeŋuidɔ le eŋu, eye dɔa nu sẽ.
28 I tell you verily there are some of those who stand here who shall not taste death till they see the Son of Man coming in his royal reign. "
Edzea dzo me enuenu, eye wòdzea tsi me enuenu.
Matthew 17:1-27
16 Mekplɔe va wò nusrɔ̃lawo gbɔ, ke womete ŋu da gbe le eŋu o. " 17 Yesu ɖo eŋu be: "Oo, dzidzime maxɔse totro kpaɖikpaɖi, ɣeyiɣi didi kae manɔ mia gbɔ ase ɖo?

17 And after six days Jesus took Peter and James and his brother John and brought them up on the side of a high mountain by themselves, 2 and was transfigured before them; and his face shone like the sun, and his clothes became white as light.
Ɣeyiɣi didi kae mado dzi atsɔ miaƒe nuwɔnawo ase ɖo?
3 And lo, there appeared to them Moses and Elijah talking with him.
Mikplɔe va gbɔnye afii. " 18 Yesu blu ɖe gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃ la ta eye wòdo go le eme, ale ŋutsuvi la ƒe lãme sẽ enumake.
Bring him here for me. " 18 And Jesus gave him a peremptory order, and the demon came out of him, and the boy was cured from that moment.

19 Eye nusrɔ̃lawo ɖeɖe va Yesu gbɔ va biae be: "Aleke wɔ míawo ya míete ŋu nyae do goe o? " 20 Eɖo eŋu na wo be: "Le miaƒe xɔse ʋɛ la tae. Elabena vavã mele egblɔm na mi be: Ne xɔse le mia si de sinapi-ku ƒe lolome nu la, ekema miagblɔ na to sia be: ‘Ho le afi sia nàyi aɖadze afi mɛ!’ eye wòaho ayi, eye naneke mate ŋu awu wɔwɔ na mi o. " 21

19 Then the disciples approached Jesus when they were by themselves and said "Why was it we could not expel it? " 20 And he said to them "Because of your little faith; for I tell you verily, if you have faith like a grain of mustard seed you will say to this mountain ‘Pass from here to there’ and it will; and nothing will be impossible to you. " 21
22 Esime Yesu kple eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo ƒo ƒu ɖe Galilea la, egblɔ na wo be: "Wole Amegbetɔvi la de ge asi na amewo, 23 eye woawui, ke woafɔe ɖe tsitre le ŋkeke etɔ̃a gbe. " Esia na woxa nu vevie.

22 And as a body of them were getting together in Galilee, Jesus said to them "The Son of Man is to be given over into the hands of men, 23 and they will kill him, and the third day he will rise "; and they took it very hard.
24 Esi wova ɖo Kapernaum la, ame siwo xɔa drakma eve ƒe adzɔ le amewo si la te ɖe Petro ŋu hebiae be: "Ðe miaƒe nufiala ya medzɔa drakma eve la oa? " 25 Eɖo eŋu be: "Edzɔnɛ. "
24 And upon their coming to Capernaum the men who took the half-shekels came to Peter and said "Does your teacher not pay half-shekels? " 25 He said "Yes. "
Ke esi wòge ɖe aƒea me la, Yesu do ŋgɔ biae be: "Simon, nu kae nèsusu? Ame kawo sie anyigbadzifiawo xɔa adzɔ alo nudzɔdzɔ le?

And when he came into the house Jesus spoke first to him, saying "What do you think, Simon? from whom do the kings of the earth take duties or poll-tax, from their sons or from strangers? " 26 And when he said "From strangers, " Jesus said to him "Hence the sons are free.

Wo viwo si loo alo ame bubuwo sia? " 26 Esi wòɖo eŋu be, "Le ame bubuwo si " la, Yesu gblɔ nɛ be: "Ekema mehiã be viwo naxe adzɔ o ɖe! 27 Ke be míagaɖia wo nu o la, yi ƒuta, nàda ƒu, eye lã gbãtɔ si nàɖe la, lée, eye ne èke eƒe nu me la, àkpɔ klosalogaku.
27 But in order that we may not stagger them, go to the sea and throw in a hook; and take the first fish that comes up, and by opening its mouth you will find a shekel.
Tsɔe yi ɖana wo ɖe nye kpli wò nu. "
Take that and give it to them for me and you. "
Mateo
Matthew

18 Le gaƒoƒo ma me la, nusrɔ̃lawo te ɖe Yesu ŋu biae be: "Ame ka tututue nye gãtɔ le Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la me? " 2 Ale wòyɔ ɖevi aɖe va eɖokui gbɔ, kplɔe va wo dome 3 hegblɔ be: "Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be: Ne mietrɔ hezu abe ɖevi suewo ene o la, miele yiyi ge ɖe Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la me akpɔ o.

18 At that same time the disciples came to Jesus, saying "Who then is greatest in the Reign of Heaven? " 2 And he called a child to him and set it in the middle among them, 3 and said "I tell you verily, if you do not turn and become like the children you shall not get into the Reign of Heaven.
4 Eya ta ame sia ame si abɔbɔ eɖokui abe ɖevi sia ene la, eyae anye gãtɔ le Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la me; 5 eye ame sia ame si xɔa nenem ɖevi siawo tɔgbi ɖeka le nye ŋkɔ ta la, exɔa nye hã.
4 So whoever makes himself small like this child, he is greatest in the Reign of Heaven.
6 Ke ame sia ame si aɖia ɖevi sue siawo, siwo xɔ dzinye se dometɔ aɖe nu la, ade edzi wu be woatsɔ té, si tedziwo trona, atsi ɖe kɔ nɛ, eye woatsɔe aƒu gbe ɖe atsiaƒu me.

5 And anybody who receives one such child in my name is receiving me; 6 but anybody who trips up one of these little ones who believe in me, it would be well for him that an ass-power millstone should be hung around his neck and that he should be sunk in the sea far from land.
7 "Baba na xexea le nu siwo nana amewo dzea nu vɔ̃ me la ŋuti!
7 Woe to the world for trippings-up! for the trippings-up have to come, yet woe to the man through whom the tripping-up comes.
Nu siwo ana amewo nadze nu vɔ̃ me la ava godoo ya, ke baba na ame si ana amewo nadze nu vɔ̃ me! 8 Eya ta ne wò asi alo wò afɔ hea wò dea nu vɔ̃ me la, lãe ɖa eye nàtsɔe ƒu gbe.

8 And if your hand or your foot is tripping you up, cut it away and throw it from you; it is a better thing for you to pass into life one-armed or a cripple than to be thrown into the eternal fire with two hands or two feet.

Enyo na wò be nànye nuwɔametɔ alo nàtsɔ abɔ ɖeka alo afɔ ɖeka ayi ɖe agbe la me wu be asi eve alo afɔ eve nanɔ asiwò, evɔ woatsɔ wò aƒu gbe ɖe dzo mavɔ la me. 9 Eye ne wò ŋku hea wò dea nu vɔ̃ me la, hoe le eto me nàtsɔ aƒu gbe.
9 And if your eye is tripping you up, take it out and throw it from you; it is a better thing for you to pass into life one-eyed than to be thrown into the hell of fire with two eyes.
10 Mikpɔ nyuie be miagado vlo ɖevi siawo dometɔ ɖeka pɛ hã o, elabena mele egblɔm na mi be, woƒe mawudɔla siwo le dziƒo la kpɔa Fofonye si le dziƒo la ƒe mo ɣesiaɣi. 11
10 "See that you do not despise one of these little ones; for I tell you that in heaven their angels continually see the face of my Father in heaven.

12 "Nu kae miesusu? Ne alẽ alafa ɖeka le ame aɖe si, eye wo dometɔ ɖeka bu la, ɖe magblẽ blaasieke vɔ asieke la ɖe towo dzi, eye wòayi aɖadi ɖeka si bu la oa? 13 Eye ne ekpɔe la, vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, akpɔ dzidzɔ ɖe eŋu wu ale si wòakpɔe ɖe blaasieke vɔ asieke siwo mebu o la ŋu.

11 12 What do you think? if some man has a hundred sheep and one of them strays, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the mountains and go looking for the stray? 13 and if he does find it, I tell you verily he is gladder of it than of the ninety-nine that did not stray.
14 Nenema kee menye dzidzɔ na Fofonye si le dziƒo la be ɖevi siawo dometɔ ɖeka pɛ hã natsrɔ̃ o.
14 Just so it is no will of my Father in heaven that one of these little ones should be lost.
15 "Ne nɔviwò wɔ nu vɔ̃ ɖe ŋuwò la, yi nàɖe eƒe vodada fiae le wò kplii ɖeɖe ko dome.
15 "But if your brother sins, go bring it home to him between you and him alone.
Ne eɖo to wò la, ekema èɖe nɔviwò.
If he listens to you, you have gained your brother.

16 Ke ne meɖo to wò o la, kplɔ ame ɖeka alo eve kpe ɖe ɖokuiwò ŋu, ale be le ɖasefo eve alo etɔ̃ ƒe ɖaseɖiɖi nu la, miaɖo kpe nya sia nya dzi. 17 Ne meɖo to woawo hã o la, ekema gblɔe na hamea. Ne meɖo to hamea hã o la, ekema na wòanɔ na wò abe dukɔwo me tɔ kple adzɔxɔla ene.

16 But if he does not listen, take with you one or two more, so that every point may be established at the mouth of two or three witnesses; 17 and if he disregards their words, tell the church; and if he disregards the words of the church too, let him be to you as the heathen and the customhouse officer are.
18 "Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be: Nu sia nu si miabla le anyigba dzi la anye nu si wobla xoxo le dziƒo, eye nu sia nu si miatu le anyigba dzi la anye nu si wotu xoxo le dziƒo.
18 I tell you verily, such things as you declare unlawful on earth shall be declared unlawful in heaven, and such things as you declare lawful on earth shall be declared lawful in heaven.
19 Megale egblɔm na mi hã be: Ne mia dometɔ eve wɔ ɖeka le anyigba dzi ɖe kuku bia nane si hiã vevie la, Fofonye si le dziƒo la ana wòava eme.
19 Again, I tell you verily that if on earth two of you agree about anything that they ask for, they shall have it from my Father in heaven.
20 Elabena afi si ame eve alo etɔ̃ ƒo ƒu ɖo le nye ŋkɔ me la, mele wo dome le afi ma. "
20 For where two or three are met in my name, there am I among them. "

21 Eye Petro va biae be: "Aƒetɔ, zi nenie nɔvinye awɔ nu vɔ̃ ɖe ŋunye eye matsɔe akee? Va se ɖe zi adre loo? " 22 Yesu gblɔ nɛ be: "Nyemegblɔ na wò be va se ɖe zi adre o, ke boŋ va se ɖe zi blaadre vɔ adre.

21 Then Peter came to him and said to him "Sir, how many times shall my brother sin against me and I forgive him? up to seven times? " 22 Jesus said to him "I do not tell you ‘up to seven times,’ but up to seventy-seven times.

23 "Esia tae wotsɔ Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la sɔ kple fia aɖe si di be yeabu akɔnta kple yeƒe kluviwo. 24 Esi wòte akɔntaa bubu la, wokplɔ ŋutsu aɖe si nyi talento akpe ewo ƒe fe le eŋu la vɛ. 25 Ke esi naneke mele esi wòatsɔ axe fea o ta la, eƒe aƒetɔ ɖe gbe be woadzra eya ŋutɔ, srɔ̃a kple viawo kpakple nu siwo katã le esi la atsɔ axe fe lae.

23 For this reason the Reign of Heaven resembles a king who wanted to have an accounting with his servants; 24 and when he began his accounting there was one brought to him who was debtor to the amount of ten thousand talents; 25 and, he not being able to pay, his master gave orders that he be sold, and his wife and his children and everything that he had, and that payment be made.
26 Ale kluvi la bɔbɔ ɖe eŋkume ɖe kuku nɛ gblɔ be, ‘Meɖe kuku, gbɔ dzi ɖi nam, mele nu sia nu xe ge na wò.’ 27 Esi kluvi ma ƒe nu wɔ nublanui na eƒe aƒetɔa la, eɖe asi le eŋu hetsɔ fe la kee.

26 So the servant threw himself down and did him reverence, saying ‘Have patience with me and I will pay you everything.’ 27 And that servant’s master was moved to pity, and set him at liberty and released him from the loan.

28 Ke esi kluvi ma do go eye wòkpɔ ehati kluviwo dometɔ ɖeka si nyi denario alafa ɖeka ƒe fe le eŋu la, elée, lé ve nɛ gblɔ be, ‘Xe fe sia fe si nènyi le ŋunye la nam.’ 29 Eye ehati kluvi la dze klo ɖe kuku nɛ vevie be, ‘Meɖe kuku, gbɔ dzi ɖi nam, mele exe ge na wò.’ 30 Ke melɔ̃ o, eye wòna wodee gaxɔ me be wòanɔ afi ma va se ɖe esime wòaxe fe si wònyi.

28 But when that servant went out he found one of his fellow-servants who owed him a hundred denarii, and he took hold of him and went to choking him, saying ‘Pay whatever you owe.’ 29 So his fellow-servant threw himself down and appealed to him, saying ‘Have patience with me and I will pay you’; 30 but he would not, but went off and threw him into prison till he should pay what was due.
31 Esi ehati kluviwo kpɔ nu si dzɔ la, eve wo ŋutɔ, eye woyi ɖagblɔ nu siwo katã dzɔ la na woƒe aƒetɔ.
31 So when his fellow-servants saw what happened they were greatly grieved, and came and informed their master of all that had happened.

32 Eya ta eƒe aƒetɔa yɔe va eɖokui gbɔ gblɔ nɛ be: ‘Kluvi vɔ̃ɖi, esi nèɖe kuku nam la, metsɔ fe mawo katã ke wò. 33 Ðe mele be wò hã nàkpɔ nublanui na hawòti kluvi abe ale si mekpɔ nublanui na wòe ene oa?’ 34 Ale eƒe aƒetɔ do dɔmedzoe, eye wòtsɔe de asi na gaxɔdzikpɔlawo va se ɖe esime wòaxe fe siwo katã wònyi.

32 Then his master called him to him and said to him ‘You villain, I released you from all that debt, since you had appealed to me; 33 ought not you too to have taken pity on your fellow-servant the same as I did on you?’ 34 and in anger his master handed him over to the torturers till he should pay all that was due him.
35 Aleae Fofonye si le dziƒowo la hã awɔ mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe ne metsɔna kea nɔvia tso dzi me o. "
35 So will my heavenly Father also do to you if you do not each forgive your brother from your heart. "
Mateo
Matthew
19 Esi Yesu wu nya siawo nu la, edzo le Galilea, eye wòva Yudea ƒe liƒowo dzi le Yordan godo. 2 Ameha geɖewo hã dze eyome, eye wòda gbe le wo ŋu le afi ma.

19 And when Jesus had finished these words he took his departure from Galilee and came into the Jewish territory on the other side of the Jordan; 2 and great crowds followed him, and he cured them there.

3 Farisitɔwo va Yesu gbɔ be yewoadoe kpɔ, eye wobiae be: "Ðe se ɖe mɔ na ŋutsu be wòagbe srɔ̃a le nya sia nya ta? " 4 Eɖo eŋu be: "Ðe miexlẽe kpɔ be ame si wɔ ame tso gɔmedzedzea me la, ŋutsu kple nyɔnue wòwɔ woe, 5 eye wògblɔ be, ‘Esia ta ŋutsu agblẽ fofoa kple dadaa ɖi, eye wòaku ɖe srɔ̃a ŋu, eye wo ame evea woazu ŋutilã ɖeka’ oa? 6 Ale be womeganye ame eve azɔ o, ke boŋ ŋutilã ɖeka.

3 And Pharisees approached him to put him to a test, saying "is it lawful to divorce one’s wife on every ground? " 4 And he answered "Have you not read that their Creator made them male and female from the first 5 and said ‘On this account a man shall leave his father and mother and form a connection with his wife, and the two shall become one flesh’? 6 so that they are no longer two but one flesh.

Eya ŋuti nu si Mawu bla ɖekae la, ame aɖeke megama eme o. " 7 Wogblɔ nɛ be: "Ke nu ka tae Mose de se be woana srɔ̃gbegbalẽ nyɔnua eye woagbee? " 8 Egblɔ na wo be: "Miaƒe dzimesesẽ tae Mose ɖe mɔ na mi be miagbe mia srɔ̃wo ɖo, gake menye nenemae wòle tso gɔmedzedzea me o.

So let not a man part what God has joined. " 7 They said to him "Then why did Moses command that one should give her a certificate of separation and divorce her? " 8 He said to them "Because in view of your obduracy Moses did permit you to divorce your wives; but from the first it has not been so.
9 Mele egblɔm na mi be, ame sia ame si gbe srɔ̃a, ne menye le ahasiwɔwɔ ta o, eye wòɖe bubu la, ewɔ ahasi. "
9 But I tell you that whoever divorces his wife, not for unchastity, and marries another, commits adultery. "

10 Nusrɔ̃lawo gblɔ nɛ be: "Ne aleae ŋutsu kple srɔ̃a dome nya le la, ekema manyo be woaɖe srɔ̃ o ɖe! " 11 Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Menye amewo katãe tea ŋu wɔna ɖe nya sia dzi o, negbe ame siwo si nunana ma le la ko.
10 The disciples said to him "If a man’s predicament with his wife is like that, it is not well to marry. " 11 But he said to them "Not all can live up to those words, but they to whom it is given.
12 Elabena ame tata aɖewo li siwo wodzi nenema, eye ame tata aɖewo li siwo amewo ta, eye ame tata aɖewo hã li siwo wɔ wo ɖokuiwo ame tatawoe le Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la ta.
12 For there are eunuchs who were originally born so, and there are eunuchs who were made such by men, and there are eunuchs who have made themselves such on account of the Reign of Heaven.
Ame si ate ŋui la, newɔe. "
Let him live up to it who can. "
13 Azɔ wokplɔ ɖevi suewo va egbɔ be wòada asi ɖe wo dzi eye wòado gbe ɖa ɖe wo ta, ke nusrɔ̃lawo blu ɖe wo ta.
13 Then there were brought to him children to have him lay his hands on them and pray; but the disciples rebuked them.
16 Azɔ kpɔ ɖa, ame aɖe va egbɔ hebiae be: "Nufiala, nu nyui kae wòle be mawɔ be makpɔ agbe mavɔ? " 17 Egblɔ nɛ be: "Nu ka tae nèle nya biamem tso nu si nye nyui ŋu?
14 But Jesus said "Let the children alone, and do not interfere with their coming to me, for to such belongs the Reign of Heaven. " 15 And he laid his hands on them, and went on his way.
Ame ɖeka pɛ koe nye ame nyui. Ke ne èdi be yeayi ɖe agbe la me la, yi edzi nànɔ seawo dzi wɔm. " 18 Ebiae be: "Kawo? "
16 And there came one to him and said "Teacher, what good thing shall I do to have eternal life? " 17 And he said to him "Why do you ask me about the good?
23 Eye Yesu gblɔ na eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo be: "Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, asesẽ na kesinɔtɔ be wòayi ɖe Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la me.
One is the Good. But if you want to pass into life, keep the commandments. " 18 He said to him "Which? "

24 Megale egblɔm na mi hã be: Ele bɔbɔe na kposɔ be wòato abui ƒe vo me wu be kesinɔtɔ nayi ɖe Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la me. " 25 Esi nusrɔ̃lawo se nya sia la, ewɔ nuku na wo ŋutɔ, eye wobia be: "Ke ame ka gɔ̃e ate ŋu akpɔ ɖeɖe? " 26 Yesu kpɔ woƒe ŋkume dũu, eye wògblɔ na wo be: "Amegbetɔwo gbɔ la, manya wɔ be woawɔ esia o; ke Mawu ya tea ŋu wɔa nu sia nu. "

And Jesus said "‘You shall not murder,’ ‘You shall not commit adultery,’ ‘You shall not steal,’ ‘You shall not give false testimony,’ 19 ‘Honor your father and mother,’ and ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ " 20 The young man said to him "I have kept all these; what am I still deficient in? " 21 Jesus said to him "If you want to be thorough, go; sell everything you have and give the money to poor men, and you shall have a fund laid by in heaven; and come and follow me. " 22 But at hearing the words the young man went away grieving; for he owned great possessions.
27 Eye Petro biae be: "Kpɔ ɖa!
23 And Jesus said to his disciples "I tell you verily that a rich man will have hard work to get into the Reign of Heaven.

Míegblẽ nuwo katã ɖi hedze yowòme; ke nu kae ava nye mía tɔ? " 28 Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be: Le nuwo gbugbɔwɔɣi, ne Amegbetɔvi la bɔbɔ nɔ eƒe ŋutikɔkɔefiazikpui dzi la, mi ame siwo dze yonyeme hã mianɔ anyi ɖe fiazikpui wuieve dzi adrɔ̃ ʋɔnu Israel to wuieveawo. 29 Eye ame sia ame si gblẽ aƒewo alo nɔviŋutsuwo alo nɔvinyɔnuwo alo fofo alo dada alo viwo alo agblewo ɖi le nye ŋkɔ ta la, akpɔ wo ɖe eteƒe zi alafa, eye wòanyi agbe mavɔ dome.

24 And I tell you again: it is easier for a camel to get through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to get into the Reign of God. " 25 And at hearing it the disciples showed great astonishment, saying "Then who can be saved? " 26 but Jesus looked at them and said "With men this is impossible, but with God everything is possible. " 27 Then Peter answered him "We here did leave everything and followed you; then what shall we have? " 28 And Jesus said to them "I tell you verily that you who have followed me shall at the rebirth, when the Son of Man sits on his throne of glory, sit on twelve thrones yourselves, judging the twelve tribes of Israel; 29 and everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or lands on account of my name shall receive many times as much, and shall inherit eternal life.
30 "Ke ame geɖe siwo nye gbãtɔwo azu mlɔetɔwo, eye mlɔetɔwo azu gbãtɔwo. Mateo
30 But many of the first will be last, and of the last first.
Matthew
2 Esi wòƒo asi kple dɔwɔlawo eye wolɔ̃ be wòaxe denario ɖeka na yewo ŋkeke ɖeka vɔ la, eɖo wo ɖe eƒe waingble la me.
20:1-34 20 "For the Reign of Heaven is like a proprietor who went out at six in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.
Egado go le gaƒoƒo adelia kple asiekelia me lɔƒo, eye wòwɔ nenema ke.
2 And he agreed with the laborers on a denarius a day and sent them to his vineyard.

8 "Esi fiẽsi ɖo la, waingbletɔa gblɔ na eƒe nuwo dzi kpɔla be, ‘Yɔ dɔwɔlawo nàxe fe na wo, eye nàdze egɔme tso ame mlɔetɔwo dzi va se ɖe gbãtɔwo dzi.’ 9 Esi gaƒoƒo wuiɖekɛlia me tɔwo va la, wo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe xɔ denario ɖeka.
3 And he went out at about nine o’clock and saw others standing idle in the marketplace, 4 and said to those ‘Go to the vineyard too, and I will give you what is right’; and they went.
10 Eya ta esi ame gbãtɔwo va la, wosusu be yewoaxɔ wòasɔ gbɔ wu, ke woxe denario ɖekaɖeka na woawo hã.
5 And he went out again about twelve and three o’clock and did the same way.

11 Esi woxɔe la, woto nyatoƒoe le aƒetɔ la ŋu 12 be: ‘Ame mlɔetɔ siawo wɔ dɔ gaƒoƒo ɖeka ko; ke èna wosɔ kple mí ame siwo kpe fu wɔ dɔ sesĩe le ŋdɔgbe ŋkeke bliboa katã!’ 13 Ke eɖo eŋu na wo dometɔ ɖeka be: ‘Xɔ̃, nyemedze agɔ le dziwò o ɖe.
6 And about five o’clock he went out and found others standing there, and said to them ‘Why are you standing idle here all day?’ 7 They said to him ‘Because nobody has hired us.’
Denario ɖeka dzie nye kpli wò míelɔ̃ ɖoe? 14 Xɔ tɔwò nàdzo. Melɔ̃ be maxe fe na ame mlɔetɔ siawo abe ale si mexee na wòe ene. 15 Ðe nyemekpɔ mɔ azã nye ŋutɔ nye nuwo ale si melɔ̃ oa?

He said to them ‘Go to the vineyard too.’ 8 And when evening came the owner of the vineyard said to his superintendent ‘Call the laborers and pay the wages, beginning with the last and going on to the first.’ 9 And the five o’clock ones came and got a denarius each; 10 and the first came and supposed they would get more, and they too got the denarius each.
Alo nyui si mewɔ lae na nèle ŋu ʋãma?’ 16 Aleae mlɔetɔwo azu gbãtɔwo, eye gbãtɔwo azu mlɔetɔwo. " 17 Ke esi wole mɔ dzi yina Yerusalem la, Yesu ɖe kpɔ nusrɔ̃la wuieveawo gblɔ na wo be: 18 "Kpɔ ɖa!

11 And when they got it they grumbled at the proprietor, 12 saying ‘These last did one hour, and you made them equal to us that bore the weight of the day and the scorching wind.’ 13 But he answered one of them ‘Comrade, I am not wronging you: did you not agree with me for a denarius? 14 take up your money and go, but I choose to give the same to this last one as to you.
Míeyina Yerusalem, eye woade Amegbetɔvi la asi na nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple agbalẽfialawo.
15 Is it not my right to do what I choose with my own things? or do you grudge because I am liberal?’ 16 Thus the last shall be first and the first last. "
Woatso kufia nɛ, 19 eye woadee asi na dukɔwo me tɔwo woaɖu fewu le eŋu, woaƒoe kple atam, eye woahee ɖe ati ŋu; gake woafɔe ɖe tsitre le ŋkeke etɔ̃a gbe. "

17 And when Jesus was about to go up to Jerusalem he took the twelve with him by themselves, and said to them on the road 18 "Here we are going up to Jerusalem; and the Son of Man will be put into the hands of the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn him to death 19 and hand him over to the foreigners to outrage and flog and crucify, and on the third day he will rise. "
20 Eye Zebedeo viwo dada kple viaŋutsu eveawo va Yesu gbɔ, eye nyɔnua dze klo henɔ nane biamee.
20 Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to him with her sons, doing him reverence and asking something of him.
21 Ebia nyɔnua be: "Nu ka dim nèle? "
21 And he said to her "What do you want? "
Eɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Na be vinyeŋutsu eve siawo dometɔ ɖeka nanɔ anyi ɖe wò ɖusime eye evelia ɖe wò miame le wò Fiaɖuƒe la me. " 22 Yesu ɖo eŋu be: "Mienya nu si biam miele o.
Said she to him, "Say that these two sons of mine shall sit one on your right and one on your left in your reign. " 22 But Jesus answered "You do not know what you are asking for.
Ðe miate ŋu ano kplu si no ge malaa? "
Can you drink the cup that I am going to drink? "
Woɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Míate ŋui. " 23 Egblɔ na wo be: "Miano nye kplu la baa, gake anyinɔnɔ ɖe nye ɖusime alo miame ya la, menye tɔnye be mana o, ke boŋ ame siwo Fofonye dzrae ɖo ɖi na la tɔe. "

Said they to him, "We can. " 23 Said he to them, "Drink my cup you shall; but as to sitting on my right and on my left, this is not mine to give, but belongs to those for whom it has been prepared by my Father. "
24 Esi ame ewo susɔeawo see la, dzi ku wo ɖe nɔvi eveawo ŋu. 25 Ke Yesu yɔ wo va eɖokui gbɔ gblɔ na wo be: "Mienyae be dukɔwo ƒe dziɖulawo ɖua aƒetɔ ɖe wo dzi, eye amegãwo kpɔa ŋusẽ ɖe wo dzi.

24 And at hearing of it the ten were offended with the two brothers; 25 but Jesus called them to him and said "You know that the rulers of the nations lord it over them and their great men domineer over them.
26 Meganɔ alea le mia dome o; ke boŋ ame sia ame si di be yeanye gã le mia dome la nanye miaƒe subɔla, 27 eye ame sia ame si di be yeanye gbãtɔ le mia dome la nanye miaƒe kluvi.

26 It is not so among you, but anyone who wishes to be great among you shall be your serving-man, 27 and anyone who wishes to be first among you shall be your slave, 28 just as the Son of Man did not come to be waited on but to wait on the needs of others, and to give his life as ransom for many. "
28 Abe ale si ko Amegbetɔvi la meva be woasubɔ ye o, ke boŋ be yeasubɔ eye yeatsɔ yeƒe agbe ana wòanye tafe na ame geɖewo la ene. " 29 Esi wole dzodzom le Yeriko la, ame gbogbo aɖewo kplɔe ɖo.

29 And as they were going out of Jericho a great crowd followed him; 30 and lo, two blind men sitting by the roadside, hearing that Jesus was passing by, cried out "Son of David, sir, take pity on us! " 31 but the crowd rebuked them, telling them to be still.

30 Eye kpɔ ɖa, ŋkuagbãtɔ eve nɔ anyi ɖe mɔ to, eye esi wose be Yesu va yina la, wodo ɣli gblɔ be: "Aƒetɔ, David Vi, kpɔ nublanui na mí! " 31 Ke ameha la blu ɖe wo ta be woazi ɖoɖoe; ke wogado ɣli ɖe edzi be: "Aƒetɔ, David Vi lee, kpɔ nublanui na mí dzro! " 32 Eya ta Yesu tɔ, eye wòyɔ wo hebia wo be: "Nu kae miedi be mawɔ na mi? " 33 Woɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Aƒetɔ, na míaƒe ŋkuwo naʋu. " 34 Woƒe nu wɔ nublanui na Yesu, eye wòka asi woƒe ŋkuwo ŋu, enumake wogakpɔ nu, eye wodze eyome. Mateo

But they cried out louder "Son of David, sir, take pity on us! " 32 And Jesus stopped and called them and said "What do you want me to do for you? " 33 Said they to him, "Sir, for our eyes to be opened. " 34 And Jesus was moved with pity and touched their eyes; and at once they recovered their sight, and followed him.
Matthew
Eye enumake aɖo wo ɖa. "

4 Nu sia va eme, ale be nya si wogblɔ ɖi to nyagblɔɖilaa dzi la nava eme, egblɔ be: 5 "Migblɔ na Zion vinyɔnu la be: ‘Kpɔ ɖa! Wò fia gbɔna gbɔwò, ame fafa wònye, eye wòle tedzi dzi, ɛ̃, ele tedzivi si nye agbatsɔlã ƒe vi dzi.’ " 6 Eya ta nusrɔ̃lawo yi ɖawɔ pɛpɛpɛ abe ale si Yesu gblɔ na wo ene.

21 And when they drew near to Jerusalem, and came to Bethany on the slope of the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples, 2 saying to them "Go to the village opposite you, and at once you will find an ass hitched and a colt with it; unhitch them and bring them to me.
7 Eye wokplɔ tedzi la kple via vɛ hetsɔ woƒe awudziwuiwo ɖo ɖe wo dzi, eye wòbɔbɔ nɔ tedzivi la dzi.
3 And if anyone says anything to you, you are to say ‘The Lord needs them,’ and he will send them at once.

8 Amehawo dometɔ akpa gãtɔ ɖo woƒe awudziwuiwo ɖe mɔa dzi, eye bubuwo lã atilɔwo ɖo ɖe mɔa dzi keŋ. 9 Ke ameha siwo dze ŋgɔ kple esiwo le megbe la le ɣli dom be: "Míeɖe kuku, xɔ na David Vi la, Woayra ame si gbɔna le Yehowa ƒe ŋkɔ me!

4 And this has come to pass in order that what was said through the prophet in the words 5 ‘Say to the daughter of Sion "Here is your king coming to you, meek, and mounted on an ass, and on a colt an ass’s foal "’ should be fulfilled. " 6 And the disciples went and did as Jesus directed them 7 and brought the ass and the colt; and they laid their cloaks on them, and he took his seat upon them; 8 and the great crowd spread their cloaks in the road, and others were cutting branches from the trees and spreading them in the road.

Míeɖe kuku, xɔ nɛ, wò, ame si le dziƒo ʋĩi! " 10 Esi wòva ɖo Yerusalem la, zi tɔ le du bliboa me, eye amewo le biabiam be: "Ame kae nye esia? " 11 Amehawo le gbɔgblɔm be: "Ame siae nye nyagblɔɖila Yesu si tso Nazaret le Galilea! "

9 And the crowds that went ahead of him and that followed were crying out "Hosanna to the Son of David; blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord; hosanna on high! " 10 And when he came into Jerusalem all the city was shaken, saying "Who is this? " 11 and the crowds said "This is the prophet Jesus from Nazareth in Galilee. "

12 Yesu ge ɖe gbedoxɔa me, eye wònya nudzrala kple nuƒlela siwo le gbedoxɔa me la katã do goe, eye wòmu gaɖɔlilawo ƒe kplɔ̃wo kple ahɔnɛdzralawo ƒe zikpuiwo ƒu anyi. 13 Eye wògblɔ na wo be: "Woŋlɔe ɖi be, ‘Woayɔ nye aƒe la be gbedoɖaƒe,’ ke miawo mietsɔe wɔ adzodalawo ƒe doe. " 14 Ŋkuagbãtɔwo kple bunɔwo hã va egbɔ le gbedoxɔa me, eye wòda gbe le wo ŋu.

12 And Jesus went into the temple-precinct and turned out all those who were buying and selling in the precinct, and threw down the money-changers’ tables and the pigeon-sellers’ seats, 13 and said to them "It is written ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer,’ but you are making it a robbers’ cave. " 14 And blind and lame men approached him in the precinct, and he cured them.

15 Esi nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple agbalẽfialawo kpɔ nu wɔnuku siwo wɔm wòle kple ɖevi siwo le ɣli dom le gbedoxɔa me le gbɔgblɔm be, "Míeɖe kuku, xɔ na David Vi la! " la, dɔme ve wo, 16 eye wobiae be: "Èle nya si gblɔm wole la sema? "

15 But at seeing the marvels that he did, and the children shouting "Hosanna to the Son of David " in the temple-precinct, the chief priests and the scribes took offense 16 and said to him "Do you hear what these are saying? "
Yesu ɖo eŋu na wo be: "Ɛ̃. Ðe miexlẽe kpɔ be, ‘Ðeviwo kple vi nonowo ƒe nu me nèdzra kafukafu ɖo’ oa? " 17 Eye wògblẽ wo ɖi hedo go le dua me yi Betania, eye wòtsi afi ma dɔ.

And Jesus said to them "Yes; did you never read ‘Out of the mouths of infants, and of babies at the breast, thou hast instituted praise’? " 17 And he left them and went out of the city to Bethany and spent the night there.

18 Esi wòtrɔ yina dua me le ŋdi kanya la, dɔ wui. 19 Ekpɔ gboti aɖe le mɔ to eye wòte ɖe eŋu, ke mekpɔ naneke le edzi o negbe aŋgbawo ko, eye wògblɔ nɛ be: "Màgatse akpɔ gbeɖegbeɖe o. " Eye gboti la yrɔ enumake.

18 And in the morning, as he was on his way back to the city, he grew hungry; 19 and, seeing a single fig-tree by the roadside, he went to it, and found nothing on it but only leaves, and said to it "Never again shall there be any fruit from you "; and the fig-tree withered immediately.

20 Esi nusrɔ̃lawo kpɔ esia la, ewɔ nuku na wo, eye wobia be: "Aleke wɔ gboti la yrɔ enumake? " 21 Yesu ɖo eŋu na wo be: "Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be: Ne xɔse le mia si, eye mieke ɖi o la, menye nu si mewɔ gboti la ɖeɖe koe miawɔ o, ke boŋ ne miegblɔ na to sia be, ‘Ho nàyi aɖadze atsiaƒu me’ la, ava eme. 22 Eye ne xɔse le mia si la, nu sia nu si miado gbe ɖa abia la, miaxɔe. "

20 And at seeing it the disciples wondered, saying "How was it that immediately the fig-tree withered? " 21 But Jesus answered them "I tell you verily, if you have faith and do not doubt you will not only do this of the fig-tree, but even if you say to this mountain ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea’ it will be done; 22 and everything that you ask for in prayer, believing, you will receive. "

23 Ke esi wòyi gbedoxɔa me hele nu fiam la, nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple dumegãwo va egbɔ, eye wobiae be: "Ŋusẽ kae nètsɔ wɔa nu siawo? Eye ame kae na ŋusẽ sia wò? " 24 Yesu ɖo eŋu na wo be: "Nye hã mabia nya ɖeka mi.

23 And after he had come into the temple-precinct the chief priests and the elders of the people approached him as he was teaching and said "By what authority are you doing these things? and who gave you this authority? " 24 But Jesus answered them "I will ask you one thing myself, and if you tell me that, so will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
Ne mieɖo eŋu nam la, ekema nye hã magblɔ ŋusẽ si metsɔ wɔa nu siawoe la na mi: 25 Yohanes ƒe amenyɔnyrɔ ɖe tsi me la ɖe, afi kae wòtso?
25 Where was John’s baptizing from? from heaven or from men? "

Dziƒoe wòtso loo alo amegbetɔwo gbɔe? " Ke woda nyaa kpɔ le wo nɔewo dome gblɔ be: "Ne míegblɔ be, ‘Dziƒoe wòtso’ la, abia mí be, ‘Ekema nu ka tae miexɔ edzi se o?’ 26 Ke ne míegblɔ be, ‘Etso amewo gbɔ la,’ ke míedɔ̃ le ameha la si me, elabena wo katã wobua Yohanes nyagblɔɖilae. " 27 Eya ta woɖo eŋu na Yesu be: "Míenya o. "

And they went over the question to themselves, thinking "If we say ‘From heaven’ he will say to us ‘Then why did you not believe him?’ 26 but if we say ‘From men’ we are afraid of the populace, for they all look on John as a prophet. " 27 And they answered Jesus "We do not know. "
Eya hã gblɔ na wo be: "Nye hã nyemagblɔ ŋusẽ si metsɔ wɔa nu siawoe la na mi o.
Said he in turn to them, "And neither do I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
28 "Nu kae miesusu?
28 But what do you think?
Vi eve le ŋutsu aɖe si.
A man had two children.
Eye wòyi gbãtɔ gbɔ ɖagblɔ nɛ be, ‘Vinye, yi ɖawɔ dɔ le waingble la me egbe.’ 29 Eɖo eŋu be, ‘Nyemayi o,’ ke emegbe la evee eye wòyi.
He went to the first and said ‘My child, go today and work in the vineyard’; 29 but he answered ‘I’ll be there, sir’ and did not go.
30 Eye wòva evelia gbɔ gblɔ na eya hã nenema ke.
30 And he went to the second and said the same; but he answered ‘I don’t want to.’
Eya ɖo eŋu be, ‘Mayi,’ ke meyi o.
Afterward he changed his mind and went.
31 Ame eve siawo dometɔ kae wɔ fofoa ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu? "
31 Which of the two did what his father would have him? "
Woɖo eŋu be: "Gbãtɔe. "
They said "The last. "
Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, adzɔxɔlawo kple gbolowo atre Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la me yiyi na mi.
Said Jesus to them, "I tell you verily that the customhouse officers and the prostitutes are passing into the Reign of God ahead of you.

32 Elabena Yohanes va mia gbɔ be yeafia dzɔdzɔenyenyemɔ la mi, ke miexɔ edzi se o. Gake adzɔxɔlawo kple gbolowo ya xɔ edzi se, eye togbɔ be miekpɔ esia hã la, mete ɖe mia dzi emegbe ne miaxɔ edzi ase o.

32 For John came to you along the road to right living and you did not believe him, but the customhouse officers and prostitutes did; and you, when you saw it, did not even afterward change your mind and believe him.
33 "Mise lododo bubu ɖa: Aƒetɔ aɖe de waingble, eye wòtɔ kpɔ ƒo xlãe, ewɔ wainfiãƒe ɖe eme, eye wòtu agbledzɔxɔ ɖe eme; etsɔe de asi na agbledelawo, eye wòzɔ mɔ yi duta.
33 "Listen to another parable.
34 Esi nuŋeɣi ɖo la, edɔ eƒe kluviwo ɖe agbledelawo gbɔ be woaxɔ yeƒe kutsetsewo avɛ.
There was a proprietor who set out a vineyard, and put a fence round it and dug a winepress in it and built a tower, and rented it to farmers and went abroad.
35 Ke agbledelaawo lé eƒe kluviawo, woƒo ɖeka, wowu ɖeka, eye woƒu kpe bubu wòku.
34 And when the season for the crop drew near he sent his servants to the farmers to receive his crop; 35 and the farmers took his servants and beat this one and killed that and stoned that.
36 Eye wògadɔ kluvi bubu siwo sɔ gbɔ wu gbãtɔawo ɖa, ke wowɔ woawo hã nenema ke.
36 Again he sent other servants, more numerous than the first; and they did the same way with them.
37 Mlɔeba edɔ via ɖe wo gbɔ gblɔ be, ‘Woasi vinye ŋkume ɖa.’ 38 Ke esi agbledelaawo kpɔ via la, wogblɔ le wo nɔewo dome be, ‘Ame siae nye domenyila la.

37 But afterward he sent his son to them, thinking ‘They will have some respect for my son.’ 38 But the farmers, when they saw the son, said to themselves ‘This is the heir; come, let us kill him and have his inheritance’; 39 and they took him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.
Miva míawui, ne míaxɔ eƒe domenyinu la!’ 39 Eya ta wolée, hee do goe le waingblea me, eye wowui.
40 Then when the owner of the vineyard comes what will he do with those farmers? "

40 Azɔ ne waingbletɔ la va ɖe, nu kae wòawɔ agbledela mawo? " 41 Woɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Esi wonye ame vɔ̃ɖiwo ta la, atsrɔ̃ wo ŋɔdzitɔe, eye wòatsɔ waingble la ade asi na agbledela bubu siwo atsɔ kutsetsewo anɛ le kutsetseawo ɖiɣi. "
41 They said to him "He will kill them off like the rascals they are, and rent the vineyard to other farmers who will deliver him the crops in their seasons. "

42 Yesu bia wo be: "Ðe miexlẽe le Ŋɔŋlɔawo me kpɔ be, ‘Kpe si xɔtulawo gbe la, eyae va zu dzogoedzikpe vevitɔ; Yehowa gbɔe esia tso va eme, eye wònye nu wɔnuku le mía ŋkume’ oa? 43 Esia tae mele egblɔm na mi be, woaxɔ Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la le mia si, eye woatsɔe ana dukɔ si tsea eƒe kuwo. 44 Ame si adze kpe sia dzi la, aŋe kluikluiklui. Eye ame sia ame si dzi wòage adze la, agbã gudugudu. "

42 Said Jesus to them "Did you never read in the Scriptures ‘The stone that the builders condemned, that stone has come to be the top of the corner: this was from the Lord, and is wonderful in our eyes’? 43 I tell you accordingly, the Reign of God will be taken away from you and given to a nation that produces its fruits. " 44
45 Esi nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple Farisitɔwo se eƒe lododoawo la, wokpɔe dze sii be yewo ŋue wòle nu ƒom tsoe. 46 Togbɔ be wodi be yewoalée hã la, wovɔ̃ amehawo, elabena wobunɛ nyagblɔɖilae.

45 And the chief priests and the Pharisees, hearing his parables, knew that he was speaking about them; 46 and they tried to seize him but were afraid of the crowds, since they looked upon him as a prophet.
Mateo
Matthew
22 Yesu gado lo bubu na wo be: 2 "Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la le abe fia aɖe si ɖo srɔ̃ɖekplɔ̃ na via ene. 3 Eye wòdɔ eƒe kluviwo be woaɖayɔ ame siwo wokpe la ava srɔ̃ɖekplɔ̃a ŋu, gake womelɔ̃ be yewoava o.

22 And Jesus again answered them in parables, saying 2 "The Reign of Heaven resembles a king who made a wedding-feast for his son, 3 and sent his servants to call those who had been invited to the feast, and they would not come.

4 Egadɔ kluvi bubuwo ɖa gblɔ be, ‘Migblɔ na ame kpekpeawo be: "Kpɔ ɖa, ŋdɔnuɖuɖua sɔ gbe vɔ, wowu nye nyitsuwo kple lã damiwo, eye nu sia nu sɔ gbe. Miva srɔ̃ɖeŋkekenyuia ɖuƒe. "’ 5 Ke wometsɔ ɖeke le eme o, eye wodzo, ame ɖeka yi eƒe agble me, bubu yi eƒe adzɔ do ge; 6 ke mamlɛawo lé eƒe kluviawo, wɔ fu wo eye wowu wo.

4 Again he sent other servants, saying ‘Tell those who are invited, "Here I have prepared my lunch, my steers and my fatlings are killed and everything is ready; come to the wedding-feast. "’ 5 And they paid no attention, but went off, one to his field and another to his trading, 6 and the rest seized his servants and maltreated them and killed them.

7 "Ale fia la do dziku, eye wòdɔ eƒe aʋakɔwo ɖa woyi ɖawu amewula mawo eye wotɔ dzo woƒe du la. 8 Eye wògblɔ na eƒe kluviawo be, ‘Nu sia nu sɔ gbe na srɔ̃ɖeŋkekenyuia ɖuɖu, gake ame siwo wokpe la medze o. 9 Eya ta miyi dua ƒe mɔ gãwo dzi ne miakpe ame sia ame si miakpɔ la va srɔ̃ɖeŋkekenyuia ɖuƒe.’ 10 Ale kluvi mawo do go yi mɔwo dzi, eye woƒo ame siwo katã wokpɔ la nu ƒu, ame vɔ̃ɖiwo kple ame nyuiwo siaa; ale amewo yɔ srɔ̃ɖekplɔ̃a ŋu fũu le xɔ si me wole srɔ̃a ɖem le la me.

7 And the king was angry, and sent his troops and destroyed those murderers and burned their city; 8 then he said to his servants ‘The wedding-feast is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy; 9 so go to the crossroads and call to the wedding-feast as many as you find.’ 10 And those servants went out on the roads and gathered everybody that they found, bad and good, and the wedding-hall was filled with feasters.
11 "Esi fia la va be yealé ŋku ɖe ame kpekpeawo ŋu la, ekpɔ ŋutsu aɖe si medo srɔ̃ɖewu o la le afi ma. 12 Ebiae be, ‘Xɔ̃, aleke nèwɔ ge ɖe afi sia evɔ mèdo srɔ̃ɖewu o?’ Ke mete ŋu ke nu o.

11 But the king came in to view the feasters, and saw there a man who did not have on a wedding garment, 12 and said to him ‘Comrade, how is it you have come in here without a wedding garment?’ and he was speechless.
13 Eye fia la gblɔ na eƒe subɔviwo be, ‘Mibla eƒe asiwo kple afɔwo, eye mitsɔe ƒu gbe ɖe viviti la me le xexe.
13 Then the king said to the attendants ‘Tie him hand and foot and put him out into the outer darkness.’
Afi mae wòafa avi ahaɖu aɖukli le.’
There will the weeping and the grinding of teeth be.
14 "Elabena ame geɖewoe wokpe, ke ame ʋɛ aɖewo koe wotia. "
14 For there are many that are called but few that are chosen. "

15 Eye Farisitɔwo dzo yi ɖade adaŋu, ne woatsɔ eya ŋutɔ ƒe nyagbɔgblɔ atre mɔ̃ nɛ alée. 16 Eya ta wodɔ woƒe nusrɔ̃lawo kple Herodes habɔbɔ me nɔlawo ɖe egbɔ gblɔ be: "Nufiala, míenyae be ètoa nyateƒe, èfiaa Mawu ƒe mɔ la le nyateƒe me, eye mèdea ame dzi o, elabena mèwɔa nu ɖe ale si amewo dzena le gotae la nu o. 17 Eya ta gblɔe na mí: Nu kae nèsusu? Ðe se ɖe mɔ be míaxe adzɔ na Kaisaro loo alo se meɖe mɔ o? " 18 Ke esi Yesu kpɔ woƒe vɔɖivɔ̃ɖi dze sii la, egblɔ be: "Alakpanuwɔlawo, nu ka tae miele mɔ̃ trem nam? 19 Mitsɔ gaku si wotsɔna xea adzɔ la vɛ makpɔ. "

15 Then the Pharisees went and laid a plot for entrapping him in talk; 16 and they sent him their disciples with the Herodians to say "Teacher, we know that you are truthful and teach the way of God in truth, and care for nobody, for you do not look at men’s faces; 17 so tell us what you think: is paying taxes to Caesar lawful or not? " 18 But Jesus, discovering their rascality, said "Why are you trying tricks on me, you hypocrites? 19 show me the coin for the taxes. "
Wotsɔ denario ɖeka vɛ nɛ.
And they brought him a denarius.
20 Eye wòbia wo be: "Ame ka ƒe nɔnɔmetata kple nuŋɔŋlɔe nye esia? " 21 Wogblɔ be: "Kaisaro tɔe. "
20 And he said to them "Whose is this portrait and this inscription? " 21 They say "Caesar’s. "
Eye wògblɔ na wo be: "Ekema mitsɔ nu siwo nye Kaisaro tɔ la na Kaisaro, ke mitsɔ nu siwo nye Mawu tɔ la na Mawu. " 22 Esi wose esia la, woƒe nu ku, eye wogblẽe ɖi dzo.
Then he said to them "Then pay what is Caesar’s to Caesar and what is God’s to God. " 22 And at hearing it they wondered, and left him and went away.

23 Gbe ma gbe Zadukitɔwo, ame siwo gblɔna be tsitretsitsi aɖeke meli o la, va biae be: 24 "Nufiala, Mose gblɔ be: ‘Ne ŋutsu aɖe ku, evɔ vi mele esi o la, nɔviaŋutsu naxɔ srɔ̃a aɖe ne wòado ƒome ɖi nɛ.’ 25 Nɔviŋutsu adre nɔ mía dome. Gbãtɔa ɖe srɔ̃ eye wòku, gake esi medzi vi aɖeke o ta la, nɔvia xɔ nyɔnua ɖe. 26 Nu ma kee dzɔ ɖe evelia kple etɔ̃lia dzi va se ɖe wo ame adrea katã dzi.

23 On that day Sadducees (people who say there is no such thing as a resurrection) approached him and put the question to him 24 "Teacher, Moses said ‘If one dies without children, his brother shall marry his widow and set up a posterity for his brother.’ 25 But among us there were seven brothers, and the first married and passed away, and, not having issue, left his wife to his brother; 26 and similarly the second and the third, and so on down to the seventh.
27 Mlɔeba nyɔnua hã ku.
27 And last of all the woman died.

Elabena wo katã woɖee kpɔ. " 29 Yesu ɖo eŋu na wo be: "Mieda ƒu, elabena mienya Ŋɔŋlɔawo loo alo Mawu ƒe ŋusẽ la o; 30 elabena le tsitretsitsia me la, ŋutsuwo maɖe srɔ̃ o, eye womatsɔ nyɔnuwo ana be woaɖe o, ke boŋ woanɔ abe mawudɔla siwo le dziƒo la ene.

28 So at the resurrection which of the seven will she be the wife of? for all of them had her. " 29 But Jesus answered them "You go wrong by not knowing the Scriptures nor the power of God: 30 for in the resurrection they do not marry but are like angels in heaven.
31 Ke le ame kukuwo ƒe tsitretsitsi ŋuti la, ɖe miexlẽ nya si Mawu gblɔ na mi be: 32 ‘Nyee nye Abraham ƒe Mawu, Isak ƒe Mawu kple Yakob ƒe Mawu’ la oa?
31 But as to the resurrection of the dead have you not read what was said to you by God in the words 32 ‘I am the God of Abraham and of Isaac and of Jacob’?
Menye ame kukuwo ƒe Mawue wònye o, ke boŋ agbagbeawo tɔe. " 33 Esi amehaawo se nya siawo la, woƒe nu ku le ale si wòfia nui ta.
He is not the God of dead men but of living men. " 33 And upon hearing it the crowds were astonished at his teaching.

34 Esi Farisitɔwo se be etsi nya ɖe Zadukitɔwo nu la, wolɔ hoo va. 35 Esi wo dometɔ ɖeka si nya Sea nyuie la di be yeadoe kpɔ la, ebiae be: 36 "Nufiala, sedede kae nye gãtɔ le Se la me? " 37 Egblɔ nɛ be: "‘Lɔ̃ Yehowa wò Mawu kple wò dzi blibo kple wò luʋɔ blibo kpakple wò tamesusu blibo.’ 38 Esiae nye sedede gãtɔ kple gbãtɔ.

34 But, hearing that he had silenced the Sadducees, the Pharisees gathered together, 35 and one of them, a lawyer, put the question to him to test him, 36 "Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the law? " 37 And he said to him "‘You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind,’ 38 this is the greatest commandment, the first.
39 Evelia si ɖii lae nye esi: ‘Lɔ̃ hawòvi abe wò ŋutɔ ɖokuiwò ene.’ 40 Wotu Se blibo la katã kple nyagblɔɖilawo ƒe nyawo ɖe sedede eve siawo dzi. "
39 A second like it is this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ 40 On these two commandments hangs all the law and the prophets. "
41 Ke esi Farisitɔwo ƒo ƒu la, Yesu bia wo be: 42 "Nu kae miesusu le Kristo la ŋu? Ame ka vie wònye? "
41 And while the Pharisees were gathered Jesus put the question to them 42 "What do you think about the Messiah? whose son is he to be? "

Woɖo eŋu nɛ be: "David vie. " 43 Egabia wo be: "Ekema aleke wɔ gbɔgbɔ ʋã David wòyɔe be ‘Aƒetɔ,’ esi wògblɔ be: 44 ‘Yehowa gblɔ na nye Aƒetɔ be: "Bɔbɔ nɔ nye ɖusime va se ɖe esime matsɔ wò futɔwo ade wò afɔ te "’? 45 Azɔ ne David yɔe be ‘Aƒetɔ’ ɖe, ke aleke wɔ wònye via? " 46 Ame aɖeke mete ŋu ɖo nya ŋu nɛ o, eye tso gbe ma gbe la, ame aɖeke mete ŋu do dzi gabia nya bubu aɖekee o.

They said to him "David’s. " 43 He said to them "How is it then that David in the Spirit calls him lord, in the words 44 ‘The Lord said to my lord "Sit at my right hand till I put your enemies underneath your feet "’? 45 if then David calls him lord, how is he to be his son? " 46 And nobody could give him any answer, and from that day on no one any longer dared to put any question to him.
Mateo
Matthew

23 Azɔ Yesu ƒo nu na amehawo kple eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo gblɔ be: 2 "Agbalẽfialawo kple Farisitɔwo bɔbɔ nɔ Mose ƒe zikpui dzi. 3 Eya ta miwɔ nu siwo katã wogblɔna na mi la, eye milé wo me ɖe asi, ke migakpɔ woƒe nuwɔna miawɔ o, elabena wogblɔnɛ, gake womewɔa nu si wogblɔna la dzi o.

23 Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and his disciples, saying 2 "The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses’s seat; 3 so do and observe everything that they tell you; but do not imitate their deeds, for they say things and do not do them.
4 Woblaa agba kpekpewo tsɔ ɖoa amewo ƒe abɔta, gake woawo ŋutɔwo medina be yewoƒe asibidɛ ɖeka teti naka wo ŋu o.
4 And they pack heavy loads and lay them on men’s shoulders, but will not move them with a finger themselves.
5 Dɔ siwo katã wowɔna la, wowɔnɛ be amewo nakpɔ; elabena wowɔa nugoe siwo me ŋɔŋlɔawo le la wòkekena eye woblaa wo ɖe ŋgonu kple abɔ be woakpɔ yewo ta, eye wowɔa woƒe awu togawo wòdidina.
5 And all their moral acts they do with an eye to being viewed by men; for they make their phylacteries broad and their tassels long.
6 Wolɔ̃a bubunɔƒewo nɔnɔ le fiẽnuɖuƒewo kple ŋgɔgbezikpuiwo dzi nɔnɔ le ƒuƒoƒewo, 7 eye wodina be amewo nado gbe na yewo bubutɔe le ablɔwo me, eye woayɔ yewo be Rabi.
6 And they are fond of the first place at dinners and the first seats in synagogues, 7 and greetings in the marketplaces, and being called ‘Rabbi’ by men.

8 Ke miawo la, migana woayɔ mi be Rabi o, elabena ame ɖeka koe nye miaƒe Nufiala, ke mi katã la, nɔviwo mienye. 9 Eye migayɔ ame aɖeke be mia fofo le anyigba dzi hã o, elabena ame ɖekae nye mia Fofo, Ame si le dziƒo.
8 But do not you be called ‘Rabbi,’ for one is your teacher and you are all of you brothers; 9 and do not call one your father on earth, for one, the heavenly, is your Father.
10 Eye womegayɔ mi be kplɔlawo hã o, elabena ame ɖekae nye miaƒe Kplɔla, eyae nye Kristo la.
10 And do not be called spiritual directors either; for one, the Messiah, is your spiritual director.
11 Ke ame si nye gãtɔ le mia dome la nanye miaƒe subɔla.
11 But the greatest one of you shall be serving-man to you.
12 Ame si doa eɖokui ɖe dzi la, woabɔbɔe ɖe anyi, eye ame si bɔbɔa eɖokui la, woadoe ɖe dzi.
12 And whoever shall lift himself up will be put down, and whoever shall put himself down will be lifted up.

13 "Baba na mi, agbalẽfialawo kple Farisitɔwo, alakpanuwɔlawo! Elabena mietua Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la ƒe ʋɔwo ɖe amewo nu; eye esi miawo ŋutɔwo mieyina ɖe eme o ta la, mieɖea mɔ na ame siwo le mɔ dzi yina ɖe eme la be woayi ɖe eme o. 14
13 "But woe to you, hypocrite scribes and Pharisees, because you lock the Reign of Heaven in men’s faces; for you do not go in yourselves and neither do you let those go in who are going in.

15 "Baba na mi agbalẽfialawo kple Farisitɔwo, alakpanuwɔlawo! Elabena miezɔ to ƒu dzi kple anyigba dzi be miatrɔ ame ɖeka wòazu Yudatɔ, eye ne ezui vɔ la, miewɔnɛ wòdzena na Gehena yiyi wu miawo ŋutɔwo zi gbɔ zi eve.

14 15 Woe to you, hypocrite scribes and Pharisees, because you go the rounds of the sea and the land to make one proselyte, and when you get him you make him more of a candidate for hell twice over than you are yourselves.

16 "Baba na mi, mɔfiala ŋkuagbãtɔwo, mi ame siwo gblɔna be, ‘Ne ame aɖe tà gbedoxɔa la, mehiã be wòawɔ edzi o; ke ne ame aɖe tà sika si le gbedoxɔa me ya la, ele be wòawɔ eƒe atam la dzi godoo.’ 17 Movitɔwo kple ŋkuagbãtɔwo! Mibu eŋu kpɔ, kae le vevie wu, sika la loo alo gbedoxɔ si na sika la ŋuti kɔ yea? 18 Miegblɔna hã be, ‘Ne ame aɖe tà vɔsamlekpuia la, mehiã be wòawɔ edzi o; ke ne ame aɖe tà nunana si le edzi ya la, ele be wòawɔ edzi godoo.’ 19 Ŋkuagbãtɔwo!

16 Woe to you, blind guides that say ‘If anyone swears by the temple it is nothing, but if anyone swears by the gold of the temple he is bound’ 17 foolish and blind men! for which is greater, the gold or the temple that made the gold sacred? 18 and ‘If anyone swears by the altar it is nothing, but if anyone swears by the gift upon it he is bound’ 19 blind! for which is greater, the gift or the altar that makes the gift sacred? 20 He who swears by the altar, then, is swearing by it and by everything upon it; 21 and he who swears by the temple is swearing by it and by him who lives in it; 22 and he who swears by heaven is swearing by God’s throne and by him who sits upon it.

Mibu eŋu kpɔ, kae le vevie wu, nunana la loo alo vɔsamlekpui si na nunana la ŋuti kɔ yea? 20 Eya ta ame si tà vɔsamlekpuia la, età vɔsamlekpuia kple nu siwo katã le edzi la siaa; 21 eye ame si tà gbedoxɔa la, età gbedoxɔa kple Ame si le eme la siaa; 22 eye ame si tà dziƒo la, età Mawu ƒe fiazikpui kple Ame si bɔbɔ nɔ edzi la siaa. 23 "Baba na mi, agbalẽfialawo kple Farisitɔwo, alakpanuwɔlawo! Elabena mienaa ahamɛ, sikɔni kple adrike ƒe ewolia, ke mieŋea aɖaba ƒua Se la me nu vevitɔwo, siwo nye dzɔdzɔenyenye kple nublanuikpɔkpɔ kpakple nuteƒewɔwɔ dzi. Ehiã be miawɔ nu mawo, gake miagaŋe aɖaba aƒu esiawo hã dzi o. 24 Mɔfiala ŋkuagbãtɔ siwo tsyɔa nu dzodzoe sue, gake mia kposɔ ya! 25 "Baba na mi, agbalẽfialawo kple Farisitɔwo, alakpanuwɔlawo! Elabena mieklɔa kplu kple agba ŋuti, gake wo me yɔ fũu kple ŋukeklẽ kple nu gbɔme wɔwɔ.

23 Woe to you, hypocrite scribes and Pharisees, because you tithe mint and dill and cumin and have let slip the weightier things in the law, judgment and mercy and faith; but you ought to have done these and not let those slip 24 blind guides! strainers-out of a gnat and swallowers of a camel! 25 Woe to you, hypocrite scribes and Pharisees, because you clean the outside of the cup and the dish, but inside they are full with rapacity and sensuality.
26 Farisitɔ ŋkuagbãtɔ, klɔ kplu kple agba la me gbã, ekema eŋu hã aɖi.
26 Blind Pharisee, clean the inside of the cup first, that the outside of it too may come to be clean.

27 "Baba na mi, agbalẽfialawo kple Farisitɔwo, alakpanuwɔlawo! Elabena mieɖi yɔdo siwo wosi akalo na, siwo nya kpɔ ŋutɔ le gota, ke wo me yɔ fũu kple ame kuku ƒuwo kple makɔmakɔnyenye ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi. 28 Nenemae miedzena ame dzɔdzɔewoe le gota le amewo ŋkume, gake mia me yɔ fũu kple alakpanuwɔwɔ kple sedzimawɔmawɔ. 29 "Baba na mi, agbalẽfialawo kple Farisitɔwo, alakpanuwɔlawo!

27 Woe to you, hypocrite scribes and Pharisees, because you are the like of whitewashed graves that appear beautiful on the outside but are full of dead men’s bones and all uncleanness inside; 28 in the same way you appear to men saintly on the outside but are full of hypocrisy and wickedness inside.

32 Ekema miwu dɔ si gɔme mia tɔgbuiwo dze la nu. 33 "Mi dawo kple dzakpatawo ƒe dzidzimeviwo, aleke miawɔ asi le Gehena ƒe ʋɔnudɔdrɔ̃ la nu? 34 Eya ta mele nyagblɔɖilawo kple nunyalawo kpakple nufialawo dɔm ɖe mia gbɔ. Miawu wo dometɔ aɖewo, eye miahe wo ɖe ati ŋu, miaƒo wo dometɔ aɖewo kple atam le miaƒe ƒuƒoƒewo, eye miati wo yome tso du me yi du me, 35 ale be ʋu dzɔdzɔe siwo katã wokɔ ɖe anyi le anyigba dzi la ƒe fɔɖiɖi nava mia dzi, tso ame dzɔdzɔe Abel ƒe ʋu dzi va se ɖe Zakariya, Barakiya vi, ame si miewu le gbedoxɔa kple vɔsamlekpuia dome la ƒe ʋu dzi. 36 Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, nu siawo katã ava dzidzime sia dzi.

29 Woe to you, hypocrite scribes and Pharisees, because you build memorials over the graves of the prophets, and decorate the sepulchers of the saints, 30 and say ‘If we had been there in our fathers’ days we should not have been sharers with them in the blood of the prophets’ 31 so that you testify for yourselves that you are sons of the murderers of the prophets; 32 fill up your fathers’ measure yourselves! 33 Snakes, spawn of vipers, how are you to escape sentence to hell? 34 Accordingly I am sending to you prophets and sages and divines: some of them you shall kill and crucify, and some of them you shall flog in your synagogues and persecute from city to city, 35 that there may come upon you all saintly blood that has been shed on earth from the blood of the sainted Abel to the blood of Zachariah the son of Barachiah whom you murdered between the temple and the altar 36 I tell you verily, all this will come upon this generation.

37 "Yerusalem, Yerusalem, si wu nyagblɔɖilawo, eye wòƒu kpe ame siwo wodɔ ɖo ɖe egbɔ zi nenie nyemehedi be maƒo viwòwo nu ƒu abe ale si koklonɔ ƒoa viawo nu ƒu ɖe eƒe aʋalawo te ene o! Ke mielɔ̃ o. 38 Kpɔ ɖa! Woagblẽ miaƒe aƒe la ɖi na mi.

37 Jerusalem, Jerusalem, killer of the prophets and stoner of those that are sent to her how many times I have wished to gather her children as a bird gathers her chicks under her wings, and you would not! 38 Lo, your house is left to you.
39 Elabena mele egblɔm na mi be: Tso fifia dzi yina la, miegale kpɔ ye ge akpɔ o va se ɖe esime miagblɔ be, ‘Woayra ame si gbɔna le Yehowa ƒe ŋkɔ me!’ "
39 For I tell you, you shall not see me henceforth until you say ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.’ "
Mateo
Matthew
24 Esi Yesu do le gbedoxɔa me dzo yina la, eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo va egbɔ be yewoafia gbedoxɔ ƒe xɔ vovovoawoe.
24 And Jesus came out from the temple-precinct and was going on his way; and his disciples came up to show him the architecture of the precinct.
2 Egblɔ na wo be: "Miele nu siawo katã kpɔma?
2 And he answered them "You see all this, do you not?
Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, womele kpe aɖeke gblẽ ge ɖe kpe dzi le afi sia si womamu aƒu anyi o. "
I tell you verily, there shall not be one stone left upon another here that shall not be torn down. "
3 Esi wòbɔbɔ nɔ Amitoa dzi la, nusrɔ̃lawo ɖeɖe va egbɔ hebiae be: "Gblɔe na mí, ɣekaɣie nu siawo adzɔ, eye nu kae anye wò anyinɔɣi kple nuɖoanyia ƒe nuwuɣi la ƒe dzesi? "
3 And as he was sitting on the Mount of Olives the disciples came to him by themselves, saying "Tell us when this will be, and what will be the sign of your coming and of the final time. "
4 Yesu ɖo eŋu na wo be: "Mikpɔ nyuie be ame aɖeke nagaflu mi o, 5 elabena ame geɖewo ava yɔ nye ŋkɔ ɖe wo ɖokuiwo ŋu agblɔ be, ‘Nyee nye Kristo la,’ eye woakplɔ ame geɖewo atrae.
4 And Jesus answered them "Look out that no one deludes you. 5 For many will come under my name, saying ‘I am the Messiah,’ and delude many.
6 Miase aʋawɔwɔwo kple aʋawɔwɔwo ŋu nyawo. Gake dzika megatso mia ƒo o, elabena ele be nu siawo nava eme godoo, gake nuwuwu la meɖo haɖe o.
6 And you are going to hear of wars and rumors of wars; see that you are not disquieted; for they have to come, but it is not yet the end.
7 "Elabena dukɔ atso ɖe dukɔ ŋu, eye fiaɖuƒe ɖe fiaɖuƒe ŋu, nuɖuɖu ave le teƒeteƒewo, eye anyigba aʋuʋu le teƒeteƒewo. 8 Nu siawo katã nye fuɖuame ƒe gɔmedzedze.
7 For nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom, and there will be famines and earthquakes in one place and another; 8 but all this is the beginning of the birth-pangs.
9 "Eye amewo atsɔ mi ade asi be woawɔ fu mi, woawu mi, eye dukɔwo katã alé fu mi le nye ŋkɔ la ta.
9 Then they will have you arrested and cruelly treated, and will kill you, and you will be hated by all the nations because of my name.

10 Ame geɖewo atra ɖa le xɔse la gbɔ, eye woade wo nɔewo asi ahalé fu wo nɔewo. 11 Aʋatsonyagblɔɖila geɖewo ado eye woakplɔ ame geɖewo atrae; 12 eye le sedzimawɔmawɔ ƒe dzidziɖedzi ta la, ame akpa gãtɔ ƒe lɔlɔ̃ ayi to.

10 And then many will be staggered and have each other arrested and hate each other; 11 and many pretended prophets will arise and delude many; 12 and, because of the increase of wickedness, the love of most will cool; 13 but he who holds out to the end, he will come safe through; 14 and this gospel of the Reign will be proclaimed in all the world of men, for an attestation to all the nations.
13 Ke ame si do dzi va se ɖe nuwuwu la, eyae akpɔ ɖeɖe.
And then the end will come.

15 "Eya ta ne miekpɔ ‘ŋunyɔnu si ahe aƒedozuzu vɛ’ la le kɔkɔeƒe la, abe ale si nyagblɔɖila Daniel gblɔe ene la, (nuxlẽla newɔ gɔmesese ŋu dɔ) 16 ekema ame siwo le Yudea la nasi ayi towo dzi. 17 Ame si le xɔ ta la megaɖi be yeatsɔ naneke tso yeƒe xɔ me ayii o, 18 eye ame si le agble la megatrɔ gbɔ be yeatsɔ yeƒe awudziwui o. 19 Baba na funɔwo kple ame siwo le no nam vi le ŋkeke mawo me! 20 Minɔ gbedodoɖa dzi be miaƒe sisi nagadze vuvɔŋɔli alo Sabat ŋkeke dzi o; 21 elabena ɣemaɣi la, xaxa gã si tɔgbi meva kpɔ tso xexea ƒe gɔmedzedze va se ɖe fifia o la ava, eye etɔgbi megale vava ge ake o.

15 "So when you see standing in a sacred place the desolating abomination spoken of by the prophet Daniel (let the reader note), 16 then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains; 17 let him who is on the roof not go down to take away what is in his house, 18 and let him who is in the field not go back to pick up his cloak; 19 and woe to women who are pregnant and nursing in those days! 20 But pray that your flight may not come in winter or on a sabbath; 21 for then there will be such great distress as there has not been from the beginning of the world till now, nor shall be.
22 Le nyateƒe me la, ne wometso ŋkeke mawo dzi o la, ŋutilã aɖeke makpɔ ɖeɖe o; ke le ame tiatiawo ta woatso ŋkeke mawo dzi.
22 And if those days had not been cut short no flesh would have come safe through; but because of the chosen those days will be cut short.

23 "Ekema ne ame aɖe gblɔ na mi be, ‘Kpɔ ɖa, Kristo la le afii!’ alo ‘Ele afi mɛ!’ la, migaxɔe se o. 24 Elabena aʋatsokristowo kple aʋatsonyagblɔɖilawo ado, eye woawɔ dzesi gãwo kple nukunuwo bena, ne woate ŋui la, woaflu ame tiatiawo gɔ̃ hã. 25 Kpɔ ɖa, mexlɔ̃ nu mi do ŋgɔ. 26 Eya ta ne wogblɔ na mi be, ‘Kpɔ ɖa! Ele gbedzi’ la, migayi o; ‘Kpɔ ɖa!

23 Then if anybody says to you ‘here is the Messiah at this place or this’ do not believe it; 24 for there will arise pretended Messiahs and pretended prophets, and they will exhibit great tokens and wonders, so as to delude even the chosen if possible; 25 now I have told you beforehand.

Ele xɔgã me’ la, migaxɔe se o. 27 Elabena ale si ko dzi kea dzo le ɣedzeƒe eye eƒe keklẽ dea ɣetoɖoƒe ke la, nenema kee Amegbetɔvi la ƒe anyinɔɣi hã anɔ. 28 Afi si nu kuku le la, afi mae hɔ̃wo aƒo ƒu ɖo.

26 So if they say to you ‘here he is, in the wilderness,’ do not go out; ‘here he is, in the closets,’ do not believe it; 27 for as the lightning comes out of the eastern horizon and shines to the western, so shall be the coming of the Son of Man; 28 wherever the carcass is, there the vultures will gather.

29 "Le xaxa si ava le ŋkeke mawo me megbe teti ko la, ɣe ado viviti, eye ɣleti magaɖi o, ɣletiviwo age tso dziƒo, eye woaʋuʋu dziƒowo ƒe ŋusẽwo. 30 Ɣemaɣi la, Amegbetɔvi la ƒe dzesi adze le dziƒo, eye anyigbadziƒomewo katã afa konyi vevie, eye woakpɔ Amegbetɔvi la le dziƒolilikpowo dzi gbɔna kple ŋusẽ kpakple ŋutikɔkɔe gã. 31 Eye wòadɔ eƒe dɔlawo ɖa kple kpẽ ƒe ɖiɖi gã aɖe, eye woaƒo eƒe ame tiatiawo nu ƒu tso ya eneawo dzi, tso dziƒo ƒe go ɖeka dzi yi eƒe go kemɛ dzi.

29 "But directly after the distress of those days the sun will turn dark and the moon will not give its radiance, and the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken; 30 and then will the token of the Son of Man appear in the sky; and then will all the tribes of the earth wail, and see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky with power and great glory; 31 and he will send out his angels with the sound of a great trumpet, and they will gather his chosen from the four winds, from one edge of the sky to the other.

32 "Ke misrɔ̃ nu sia tso gboti ŋu: Ne edze alɔ fẽwo, eye wònya to aŋgbawo ko la, mienyana be dzomeŋɔli gogo. 33 Nenema kee miawo hã, ne miekpɔ nu siawo katã la, minyae be Amegbetɔvi la gogo ʋɔtruawo nu.

32 But learn from the fig-tree this parable: when its twigs come to be tender and put out their leaves you know that the summer is near; 33 so you too, when you see all this, are to know that he is near, at the doors.
34 Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, dzidzime sia nu mele yiyi ge akpɔ o, va se ɖe esime nu siawo katã va eme.
34 I tell you verily that this generation shall not pass away till all this has taken place.
35 Dziƒo kple anyigba nu ava yi, ke nye nyawo ya nu mava yi akpɔ o.
35 The heavens and the earth shall pass away, but my words shall not.
36 "Le ŋkeke ma kple gaƒoƒo ma ŋuti la, ame aɖeke menyae o, mawudɔla siwo le dziƒo la menyae o, eye Vi la hã menyae o, negbe Fofo la ko.
36 But as to that day and hour nobody knows, not even the angels of heaven nor the Son, but the Father alone.
37 Elabena ale si Noa ƒe ŋkekeawo nɔ la, nenema kee Amegbetɔvi la ƒe anyinɔɣi la hã anɔ.
37 For as were the days of Noah, so will the coming of the Son of Man be.

38 Elabena ale si wowɔ le ŋkeke siwo do ŋgɔ na Tsiɖɔɖɔ la me, wole nu ɖum, le nu nom, ŋutsuwo le srɔ̃ ɖem, eye wole nyɔnuwo tsɔm na be woaɖe va se ɖe gbe si gbe Noa ge ɖe aɖakaʋua me, 39 eye womede dzesii o, va se ɖe esime Tsiɖɔɖɔa va, eye wòkplɔ wo katã dzoe la, nenema kee Amegbetɔvi la ƒe anyinɔɣi la hã anɔ.

38 For as in those days before the flood they ate and drank, married and got their children married, till the day that Noah went into the ark, 39 and before they knew it the flood came and carried off one and all, so shall be also the coming of the Son of Man.
40 Ɣemaɣi la, ŋutsu eve anɔ agble me; woakplɔ ɖeka, eye woagblẽ ɖeka ɖi. 41 Nyɔnu eve anɔ wɔ tum le téƒo; woakplɔ ɖeka, eye woagblẽ ɖeka ɖi.
40 Then there will be two men in the field, one is taken along and one is left; 41 two women grinding at the mill, one is taken along and one is left.
42 Eya ta minɔ ŋudzɔ, elabena mienya ŋkeke si dzi miaƒe Aƒetɔ la ava o.
42 "So keep awake, because you do not know on what day your Master is coming.
43 "Ke minya esia be: Ne ɖe aƒea tɔ anya zã ƒe gaƒoƒo si dzi fiafitɔ ava la, anye ne anɔ ŋudzɔ, eye maɖe mɔ woadze kpɔ age ɖe eƒe me o.
43 But be sure of this, that if the man of the house had known at what time of the night the thief was coming he would have kept awake and not allowed his house to be broken into.
44 Esia ta miawo hã minɔ dzadzraɖoɖi, elabena Amegbetɔvi la gbɔna le gaƒoƒo si miesusu be eya dzie wòava o la dzi.
44 Accordingly be ready yourselves, because it will be at the moment when you are not thinking of it that the Son of Man comes.

45 "Ame ka tututue nye kluvi nuteƒewɔla kple aɖaŋudzela si eƒe aƒetɔ ɖo eƒe aƒemesubɔviwo nu be wòana woƒe nuɖuɖu wo le ɣeyiɣi nyuitɔ dzi? 46 Dzidzɔtɔe kluvi ma anye ne eƒe aƒetɔ trɔ gbɔ va kpɔe wòle ewɔm nenema! 47 Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, atsɔe aɖo eƒe nuwo katã nu.

45 Who, then, is the faithful and intelligent servant whom the master has set over his household to give them their food at the right time? 46 Happy is that servant whom his master, when he comes, shall find doing thus: 47 I tell you verily he will set him over all his property.

48 "Ke ne kluvi ma awɔ nu vɔ̃ɖi ahagblɔ le eƒe dzi me be, ‘Nye aƒetɔ mele gbɔgbɔm kaba o,’ 49 eye wòade asi ehati kluviwo ƒoƒo me, eye wòaɖu nu ano nu kple ahanoxewo la, 50 kluvi ma ƒe aƒetɔ ava le ŋkeke si dzi mele mɔ kpɔm nɛ o kple gaƒoƒo si menya o la dzi, 51 eye wòahe to nɛ vevie ahana wòakpɔ etɔnua kpe ɖe alakpanuwɔlawo ŋu. Afi mae wòafa avi ahaɖu aɖukli le.

48 But if that worthless servant says to himself ‘My master is staying late’ 49 and begins to beat his fellowservants and eats and drinks with the drunken, 50 that servant’s master will come on a day when he does not expect it and at an hour that he does not know, 51 and will cut him in two and allot him a part among the hypocrites: there will the weeping and the grinding of teeth be.
Mateo
Matthew
25 "Dziƒofiaɖuƒe la le abe ɖetugbui leaƒe ewo, siwo tsɔ woƒe akaɖiwo, eye wodo go be yewoaɖakpe ŋugbetɔsrɔ̃ ene.
25 "Then the Reign of Heaven will resemble ten maidens who took their torches and went out to meet a bridegroom.
2 Wo dometɔ atɔ̃ nye bometsilawo, eye atɔ̃ nye aɖaŋudzelawo. 3 Bometsilaawo tsɔ woƒe akaɖiwo, ke wometsɔ ami kpe ɖe wo ŋu o, 4 ke aɖaŋudzelaawo ya tsɔ ami ɖe goewo me kpe ɖe woƒe akaɖiawo ŋu.
2 And five of them were foolish and five sensible; 3 for the foolish ones did not take oil with them when they took their torches, 4 but the sensible took oil in pitchers with their torches.
5 Esi ŋugbetɔsrɔ̃ la meva ɖo kaba o ta la, alɔ̃ tsɔ wo katã eye wodɔ alɔ̃.
5 And as the bridegroom was long in coming they all grew drowsy and fell asleep.
6 Le zã titina la, ɣli ɖi be: ‘Ŋugbetɔsrɔ̃ la va ɖo loo! Mido go yi ɖakpee!’ 7 Eye ɖetugbuiawo katã fɔ, eye wodzra woƒe akaɖiwo ɖo.
6 But at midnight there came a shout ‘Here is the bridegroom! come out to meet him!’ 7 Then all those maidens woke up and put their torches in order.

8 Bometsilaawo gblɔ na aɖaŋudzelaawo be, ‘Mina miaƒe ami la ɖe mí, elabena míaƒe akaɖiwo le tsitsim.’ 9 Aɖaŋudzelaawo ɖo eŋu na wo be: ‘Ðewohĩ masu na mía kpli miawo siaa o. Miheyi edzralawo gbɔ boŋ ne miadze ɖe na mia ɖokui.’ 10 Esi woyina edze ge la, ŋugbetɔsrɔ̃ la va ɖo. Ðetugbui siwo le dzadzraɖoɖi la yi srɔ̃ɖekplɔ̃ɖoƒea kplii; eye wotu ʋɔa.

8 And the foolish ones said to the sensible ones ‘Give us some of your oil, because our torches are going out’; 9 but the sensible ones answered ‘It might not be sufficient for us and you both; better go to those who have it to sell and buy yourselves some.’ 10 But while they were away buying, the bridegroom came, and the ones who were ready went in with him to the wedding, and the door was shut.

11 Emegbe ɖetugbui susɔeawo hã va gblɔ be, ‘Aƒetɔ, Aƒetɔ, ʋu ʋɔa na mí!’ 12 Eɖo eŋu na wo be, ‘Vavã, mele egblɔm na mi be, nyemenya mi o.’ 13 "Eya ta minɔ ŋudzɔ, elabena mienya ŋkeke la alo gaƒoƒo la o.

11 And afterward the rest of the maidens also came saying ‘Sir, sir, open to us.’ 12 But he answered ‘I tell you verily, I do not know you.’ 13 So keep awake, because you do not know the day nor the hour.

Eyɔ eƒe kluviwo hetsɔ eƒe nunɔamesiwo de asi na wo. 15 Etsɔ talento atɔ̃ na ame gbãtɔ, etsɔ eve na ame evelia, eye wòtsɔ ɖeka na ame etɔ̃lia hã, ena wo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe ɖe eƒe ŋutete nu, eye wòzɔ mɔ yi duta.

14 "For it is as when a man who was going abroad called his servants and handed over his property to them 15 and gave to one five talents, to another two, to another one, to each according to his individual ability, and went away.

16 Enumake ame si xɔ talento atɔ̃ la yi ɖatsa asi kplii, eye wòkpɔ talento atɔ̃ bubu ɖe edzi. 17 Nenema kee ame si xɔ talento eve hã kpɔ eve bubu ɖe edzi. 18 Ke ame si xɔ talento ɖeka ya dzo yi ɖaɖe do, eye wòɖi eƒe aƒetɔ la ƒe ga la ɖe eme.

16 At once the one who had received the five talents went and set up a business with them and made five more; 17 similarly the one who had received the two made two more; 18 but the one who had received the one went off and dug in the ground and hid his master’s money.

19 "Le ɣeyiɣi didi aɖe megbe la, kluvi mawo ƒe aƒetɔ gbɔ, eye wòwɔ akɔnta kpli wo. 20 Eye kluvi si xɔ talento atɔ̃ la va, eye wòtsɔ talento atɔ̃ bubu vɛ hegblɔ be, ‘Aƒetɔ, talento atɔ̃e nètsɔ nam; kpɔ ɖa, mekpɔ talento atɔ̃ bubu ɖe edzi.’ 21 Eƒe aƒetɔ la gblɔ nɛ be: ‘Kluvi nyui kple nuteƒewɔla, wòe wɔ dɔ kakaka! Èwɔ nuteƒe le nu ʋɛwo me. Matsɔ wò aɖo nu geɖewo nu. Ge ɖe wò aƒetɔ ƒe dzidzɔ la me.’ 22 Ame si xɔ talento eve la hã va hegblɔ be, ‘Aƒetɔ, talento evee nètsɔ de asi nam; kpɔ ɖa, mekpɔ talento eve bubu ɖe edzi.’ 23 Eƒe aƒetɔ la gblɔ nɛ be: ‘Kluvi nyui kple nuteƒewɔla, wòe wɔ dɔ kakaka! Èwɔ nuteƒe le nu ʋɛwo me. Matsɔ wò aɖo nu geɖewo nu. Ge ɖe wò aƒetɔ ƒe dzidzɔ la me.’

19 And after a long time the master of those servants came and had an accounting with them; 20 and the one who had received the five talents came up and brought five talents more, saying ‘Sir, you handed over five talents to me; here I have made five talents more.’ 21 His master said to him ‘Well done, good trusty man; you were faithful over a little, I will set you over much; go in to your master’s rejoicing.’ 22 The one who had received the two talents also came up and said ‘Sir, you handed over two talents to me; here I have made two talents more.’ 23 His master said to him ‘Well done, good trusty man; you were faithful over a little, I will set you over much; go in to your master’s rejoicing.’ 24 And the one who had received the one talent also came up and said ‘Sir, I knew you for a hard man, harvesting where you did not sow and picking up where you did not drop, 25 and I was afraid and went off and hid your talent in the ground; here you have your property.’ 26 But his master answered him ‘You lazy villain, you knew, did you, that I harvest where I did not sow and pick up where I did not drop? 27 then you ought to have deposited my money with the bankers, and when I came I should have got my property with interest.

24 "Mlɔeba ame si xɔ talento ɖeka la hã va gblɔ be: ‘Aƒetɔ, menya be wò nya me sẽ, èŋea nu le afi si mèƒã nu ɖo o, eye nèlɔa nuku le afi mègbɔ nu le o. 25 Eya ta mevɔ̃, eye meyi ɖaɖi wò talento la ɖe to me.

28 So take the talent away from him and give it to the one with the ten talents; 29 for everyone who has shall have more given to him, and shall have enough and to spare, but from him who has not there shall be taken away even what he has.
Ke ame si si nu mele o la, woaxɔ nu si le esi la gɔ̃ hã le esi. 30 Eye mitsɔ kluvi si menyo na naneke o la ƒu gbe ɖe viviti me le xexe.
30 And put out the inefficient servant into the outside darkness; there will the’ weeping and the grinding of teeth be.’

Afi mae wòafa avi ahaɖu aɖukli le.’ 31 "Ne Amegbetɔvi la va ɖo le eƒe ŋutikɔkɔe me, eye mawudɔlawo katã le eŋuti la, ekema abɔbɔ nɔ eƒe ŋutikɔkɔefiazikpui la dzi. 32 Eye woaƒo dukɔwo katã nu ƒu ɖe eŋkume, eye wòama amewo me tso wo nɔewo gbɔ, abe ale si alẽkplɔla maa alẽwo tso gbɔ̃wo gbɔe ene.

31 "But when the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the angel with him, then he will take his seat on his throne of glory, 32 and all the nations will be brought before him; and he will separate them from each other as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats, 33 and will set the sheep on his right, but the goats on his left.

41 "Eye Fia la agblɔ na ame siwo le eƒe miame hã be: ‘Mite ɖa le gbɔnye, mi ame siwo woƒo fi de, miyi ɖe dzo mavɔ si wodzra ɖo ɖi na Abosam kple eƒe dɔlawo la me. 42 Elabena dɔ wum, ke miena num meɖu o; eye tsikɔ wum, ke miena tsim meno o. 43 Menye amedzro, ke miexɔm nyuie o; menɔ amama, ke miena awum medo o; medze dɔ, eye menɔ gaxɔ me, ke mielé be nam o.’ 44 Ekema woawo hã woaɖo eŋu nɛ be: ‘Aƒetɔ, ɣekaɣie míekpɔ be dɔ le wuwòm, alo tsikɔ le wuwòm, alo nènye amedzro, alo nèle amama, alo nèdze dɔ, alo nèle gaxɔ me, eye míesubɔ wò o?’ 45 Ekema aɖo eŋu na wo be: ‘Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, zi ale si miewɔe na ame siawo dometɔ suetɔ ɖeka o ko la, miewɔe na nye hã o.’ 46 Eye ame siawo ayi ɖe tsɔtsrɔ̃ mavɔ me, ke ame dzɔdzɔewo ya ayi ɖe agbe mavɔ me. "

34 Then the King will say to those on his right ‘Come here, blessed of my Father, inherit the empire that has been prepared for you since the foundation of the world: 35 for I was hungry and you gave me a meal, I was thirsty and you gave me a drink, I was a stranger and you lodged me, 36 naked and you clad me, I was sick and you looked after me, I was in prison and you came to me.’ 37 Then the right-doers will answer him ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you a drink? 38 And when did we see you a stranger and lodge you, or naked and clothe you? 39 And when did we see you sick or in prison and come to you?’ 40 And the King will answer them ‘I tell you verily, insofar as you did it to one of the littlest of these brothers of mine, you did it to me.’ 41 Then he will also say to those on his left ‘Go from me, accursed men, to the eternal fire prepared for the Devil and his angels: 42 for I was hungry and you did not give me a meal, I was thirsty and you did not give me a drink, 43 I was a stranger and you did not lodge me, naked and you did not clothe me, sick and in prison and you did not look after me.’ 44 Then they too will answer ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison and not attend to your needs?’ 45 Then he will answer them ‘I tell you verily, insofar as you did not do it to one of the littlest of these, to me also you did not do it.’ 46 And these will go away to eternal punishment, but the righteous to eternal life. "
Mateo
Matthew

26 Ke esi Yesu gblɔ nya siawo katã vɔ la, egblɔ na eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo be: 2 "Mienya be esusɔ ŋkeke eve ne Ŋutitotoŋkekenyui la naɖo, eye wole Amegbetɔvi la de ge asi woahe ɖe ati ŋu. " 3 Ɣemaɣi la, nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple dumegãwo ƒo ƒu ɖe nunɔlagã Kayafa ƒe me, 4 eye woɖo nugbe be yewoato ayemɔ dzi alé Yesu awu. 5 Gake wogblɔ be: "Manye le ŋkekenyuia ɖuɣi o, be zi nagatɔ le dukɔ la me o. "

26 And when Jesus had finished all these words he said to his disciples 2 "You know that in two days the passover comes, and the Son of Man is given to the executioners to be crucified. " 3 Then the chief priests and the elders of the people met in the court of the house of the high priest, who was known as Caiaphas, 4 and planned together to seize Jesus by trickery and kill him; 5 but they said "Not during the feast, so that there will not be a disturbance among the people. "
6 Esi Yesu le Simon anyidɔléla la ƒe me le Betania la, 7 nyɔnu aɖe tsɔ alabastrogoe, si me ami ʋeʋĩ xɔasi aɖe le la va egbɔ, eye wòtrɔe kɔ ɖe tame nɛ le kplɔ̃a ŋu.
6 And when Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper, 7 a woman with an alabaster vial of high-priced perfume approached him and poured it on his head while he was at the table.
