8 Esi nusrɔ̃lawo kpɔ esia la, wodo dziku gblɔ be: "Nudomegbegblẽ kae nye esi? 9 Elabena woate ŋu adzrae ho gã aɖe atsɔ ana ame dahewo. " 10 Esi Yesu dze si nu si gblɔm wole ta la, egblɔ na wo be: "Nu ka tae miele fu ɖem nɛ? Nu nyui aɖee wòwɔ nam. 11 Ame dahewo le mia gbɔ ɖaa, ke nye ya nyemanɔ mia gbɔ ɖaa o.

8 And the disciples took offense at the sight, saying "Why this waste? 9 for this could have been sold for a good deal and given to poor people. " 10 And Jesus, finding it out, said to them "Why are you worrying the woman? for she has done a good deed to me; 11 for you always have the poor with you, but me you do not always have.
12 Nyɔnu sia kɔ ami ʋeʋĩ sia ɖe nye ŋutilã ŋu tsɔ dzram ɖo na ɖiɖi.
12 For she, in putting this perfume on my body, has done this toward burying me.

13 Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, afi sia afi si woaɖe gbeƒã nya nyui la le le xexe bliboa me la, woagblɔ nu si nyɔnu sia wɔ la hã, atsɔ aɖo ŋku edzii. " 14 Eye Ame Wuieveawo dometɔ ɖeka si woyɔna be Yuda Iskariot la yi nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo gbɔ 15 ɖabia wo be: "Nu kae mianam ne madee asi na mi? " Wogblɔ be yewoana klosalo blaetɔ̃e. 16 Eye tso ɣemaɣi la, enɔ mɔnu dim be yeadee asi.

13 I tell you verily, wherever this gospel is proclaimed in the whole world, what she did shall also be spoken of for a memorial of her. " 14 Then one of the twelve, he who was known as Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests 15 and said "What will you give me to put him into your hands? " and they weighed to him thirty pieces of silver, 16 and from that time on he was looking for a good opportunity to put him into their hands.

17 Le Amɔwɔ Maʋamaʋã Bolo Ŋkekenyui la ƒe ŋkeke gbãtɔ dzi la, nusrɔ̃lawo va Yesu gbɔ hebiae be: "Afi kae nèdi be míadzra ɖo na wò be nàɖu Ŋutitotoa le? " 18 Eɖo eŋu be: "Miyi ɖe dua me le asimasi gbɔ, eye migblɔ nɛ be, ‘Nufiala la be: "Nye ɣeyiɣi ɖoɖi la gogo; maɖu Ŋutitotoŋkekenyui la kple nye nusrɔ̃lawo le aƒewò me. "’ " 19 Eya ta nusrɔ̃lawo wɔe abe ale si Yesu de se na woe ene, eye wodzra ɖo ɖe Ŋutitotoŋkekenyui la ŋu. 20 Esi fiẽsi ɖo la, ebɔbɔ nɔ nuɖukplɔ̃ ŋu kple nusrɔ̃la wuieveawo.

17 And on the first day of matzoth-time the disciples approached Jesus saying "Where will you have us make the preparations for you to eat the passover? " 18 and he said "Go into the city to such a man and say to him ‘The Teacher says, "My time is near; I am keeping the passover at your house with my disciples. "’ " 19 And the disciples did as Jesus directed them to, and got ready the passover; 20 and when evening came, he came to the table with his twelve disciples.

21 Esime wole nua ɖum la, egblɔ be: "Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, mia dometɔ ɖeka adem asi. " 22 Esi nya sia te ɖe wo dzi ŋutɔ ta la, wo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe de asi ebiabia me be: "Aƒetɔ, menye nyee o ɖe? " 23 Eɖo eŋu be: "Ame si le asi dem agba me kplim lae adem asi.

21 And while they were eating he said "I tell you verily that one of you will have me arrested. " 22 And, greatly pained, they began each one to say to him "Am I the one, sir? " 23 And he answered "He who dipped his hand in the dish with me, he will have me arrested.

24 Nyateƒee, Amegbetɔvi la le kuku ge abe ale si woŋlɔe ɖi le eŋuti ene, gake baba na ame si ade Amegbetɔvi la asi! Ne ɖe womegaxa ame ma dzi o la, anye ne enyo nɛ wu. " 25 Yuda, ame si le ede ge asi la, biae be: "Rabi, menye nyee o ɖe? "

24 The Son of Man goes as is written of him; but woe to that man through whom the Son of Man is put under arrest! it would have been well for that man if he had not been born. " 25 And Judas, who was to have him arrested, answered him "Am I the one, Rabbi? "
Yesu gblɔ nɛ be: "Wò ŋutɔe gblɔe. "
He said to him "As you say. "

26 Esi wole nua ɖum la, Yesu tsɔ abolo, eye esi wòyra ɖe edzi vɔ la, eŋe eme hetsɔe na nusrɔ̃lawo gblɔ be: "Mixɔe ɖu. Esia le tsitre ɖi na nye ŋutilã. " 27 Esi wòtsɔ kplu ɖe asi la, eda akpe ɖe eta, eye wòtsɔe na wo gblɔ be: "Mi katã minoe le enu, 28 elabena esia le tsitre ɖi na nye ʋu, si nye ‘nubabla ƒe ʋu’ si woakɔ ɖe anyi le ame geɖewo ta hena nu vɔ̃wo tsɔtsɔ ke.

26 And while they were eating Jesus took a cake of bread, and spoke the blessing and broke it, and, giving it to the disciples, said "Take this and eat it; this is my body. " 27 And he took a cup and gave thanks over it and gave it to them, saying "Drink of it, all of you; 28 for this is my covenant blood poured out for many to the pardoning of sins.

29 Ke mele egblɔm na mi be: Nyemegale wain sia no ge akpɔ o, va se ɖe ŋkeke ma si dzi nye kpli mi míano wain yeye le Fofonye ƒe Fiaɖuƒe la me. " 30 Mlɔeba esi wodzi kafukafuhawo vɔ la, wodo go yi Amito la dzi.
29 But I tell you, henceforth I will not drink of this produce of the vine till that day when I drink it new in my Father’s reign with you. "
Nusrɔ̃la bubuawo katã hã gblɔ nenema ke.
30 And they sang a hymn and went out to the Mount of Olives.

36 Yesu kple eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo va teƒe si woyɔna be Getsemane, eye wògblɔ na wo be: "Minɔ anyi ɖe afi sia, ne mayi afi mɛ aɖado gbe ɖa. " 37 Ekplɔ Petro kple Zebedeo vi eveawo ɖe asi, eye wòde asi nuxaxa me eye wòtsi dzi ŋutɔ. 38 Eye wògblɔ na wo be: "Mele nu xam ale gbegbe be ɖeko wòle abe ɖe mele kukum ene. Minɔ afi sia, eye minɔ ŋudzɔ kplim. " 39 Esi wòzɔ yi ŋgɔ vie la, edze klo tsyɔ mo anyi hedo gbe ɖa be: "Fofonye, ne anya wɔ la, na kplu sia nato ŋunye ayi.

31 Then Jesus said to them "You will be staggered over me this night all of you; for it is written ‘I will strike down the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will scatter’; 32 but after my rising I will go ahead of you to Galilee. " 33 But Peter answered him "If everybody will be staggered over you, I never will be staggered. " 34 Jesus said to him "I tell you verily that this night, before a cock has crowed, you will disown me three times. " 35 Said Peter to him "Even if I have to die with you I will not disown you "; and so said all the disciples.

Gake menye abe ale si medi ene o, ke boŋ abe ale si nèdi ene. " 40 Etrɔ va nusrɔ̃lawo gbɔ hekpɔ be wole alɔ̃ dɔm, eye wògblɔ na Petro be: "Ðe miate ŋu anɔ ŋudzɔ kplim gaƒoƒo ɖeka oa? 41 Minɔ ŋudzɔ, eye minɔ gbedodoɖa dzi be miagadze tetekpɔ me o. Nyateƒee, gbɔgbɔ la le lɔlɔ̃m, gake ŋutilãa ya gbɔdzɔ. " 42 Egadzo yi zi evelia, eye wòdo gbe ɖa be: "Fofonye, ne manya wɔ be kplu sia nato ŋunye ayi o, wònye ɖeko manoe godoo la, wò lɔlɔ̃nu nava eme. " 43 Egatrɔ va, eye wòkpɔ wo wole alɔ̃ dɔm, elabena alɔ̃ bla ŋku na wo.

36 Then Jesus came with them to an enclosure known as Gethsemane, and said to the disciples "Sit here while I go there and pray. " 37 And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be unhappy and uneasy; 38 then he said to them "My soul is sad, deathly sad; stay here and keep awake with me "; 39 and he went a little further and threw himself down on his face praying "Father, if it is possible let this cup pass away from me; yet not as I will but as you will. " 40 And he came to the disciples and found them asleep, and said to Peter "Were you so unable to keep awake with me one moment? 41 Keep awake and pray, that you may not fall under temptation: the spirit is enthusiastic but the flesh is weak. " 42 Again he went away for the second time and prayed "Father, if this cannot pass away without my drinking it, your will be done. " 43 And he came and found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy.
44 Eye wògadzo le wo gbɔ yi ɖado gbe ɖa zi etɔ̃lia gagblɔ nya mawo ke.
44 And he left them and went away again and prayed for the third time, saying the same words again.

45 Azɔ etrɔ va nusrɔ̃lawo gbɔ hegblɔ na wo be: "Ɣeyiɣi sia mee mianɔ alɔ̃ dɔm ahanɔ ɖiɖim ɖe emea? Kpɔ ɖa, gaƒoƒo la de be woatsɔ Amegbetɔvi la ade asi na nu vɔ̃ wɔlawo. 46 Mitso, mina míadzo. Kpɔ ɖa!

45 Then he came to the disciples and said to them "Well, then, sleep and rest; the moment is close at hand, and the Son of Man is to be given up into the hands of sinners 46 rise, let us be going; here is the one who gives me up to them, close at hand. "

Ame si dem asi la gogo. " 47 Esi wògale nuƒoƒo dzi la, kpɔ ɖa, Yuda, si nye Ame Wuieveawo dometɔ ɖeka va do, eye ameha gã aɖe tso nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple dumegãwo gbɔ le eyome, eye wolé yiwo kple kpowo ɖe asi.
47 And while he was still speaking, in came Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a great crowd with swords and sticks from the chief priests and elders of the people.
48 Ke ame si dee asi la ɖo dzesi aɖe ɖi na wo be: "Ame si magbugbɔ nu na la, eyae; milée. " 49 Eye wòzɔ tẽe yi Yesu gbɔ gblɔ be: "Medo gbe na wò, Rabi! " Eye wògbugbɔ nu nɛ.

48 And the one who was giving him up had given them a sign, telling them "Whichever I kiss is he; take him. " 49 And at once he went up to Jesus and said "Good evening, Rabbi, " and went to kissing him.
50 Ke Yesu biae be: "Xɔ̃, nu ka tae nèva ɖo? "
50 But Jesus said to him "What you are here for, comrade! "
Ale wote va eye wodze Yesu dzi helée.
Then they came up and put their hands on him and took him.
51 Ke kpɔ ɖa, ame siwo le Yesu ŋu la dometɔ ɖeka do asi ɖa ɖe eƒe yi heda nunɔlagã ƒe kluvi, eye wòkpa to nɛ.
51 And lo, one of those who were with Jesus reached and drew his sword and hit the high priest’s servant and took off his ear.
52 Eye Yesu gblɔ nɛ be: "Gbugbɔ wò yi la de eteƒe, elabena ame siwo katã tsɔa yi ɖe ame ŋu la, yi nue woatsi.
52 Then Jesus said to him "Put your sword back in its place; for all who take the sword will perish by the sword.

53 Alo ɖe nèsusu be nyemate ŋu aɖe kuku na Fofonye be wòaɖo mawudɔlawo ƒe aʋakɔ siwo wu wuieve ɖem fifi laa oa? 54 Gake ne edzɔ nenema ɖe, aleke Ŋɔŋlɔ siwo gblɔe ɖi be adzɔ alea la awɔ ava eme? " 55 Le gaƒoƒo ma me la, Yesu gblɔ na ameha la be: "Yiwo kple kpowoe mietsɔ va be yewoalém abe adzodala enea? Gbe sia gbe menɔa anyi ɖe gbedoxɔa me nɔa nu fiam, ke mielém kpɔ o.

53 Or do you think I cannot appeal to my Father and have him furnish me more than twelve brigades of angels now? 54 so how are the Scriptures to be fulfilled, that it must be this way? " 55 At the same time Jesus said to the crowds "You come out as if it were against a robber, with swords and sticks, to arrest me; I had been sitting in the temple-precinct day by day teaching, and you did not take me.
56 Gake nu siawo katã dzɔ, ale be nyagblɔɖilawo ƒe nya siwo woŋlɔ ɖi la nava eme. "
56 But this has all of it come about in order that the scriptures of the prophets should be fulfilled. "
Eye nusrɔ̃lawo katã gblẽe ɖi hesi.
Then all the disciples left him and ran.
57 Ame siwo lé Yesu la kplɔe yi nunɔlagã Kayafa gbɔ, afi si agbalẽfialawo kple dumegãwo ƒo ƒu ɖo.
57 And those who had taken Jesus brought him to the house of Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders had met.
58 Ke Petro le eyome le adzɔge ʋĩi gbɔna, eye wòkplɔe ɖo va keke nunɔlagã ƒe aƒea me ke; eye wòge ɖe eme henɔ anyi ɖe subɔviawo gbɔ be yeakpɔ nu si ava dzɔ ɖa.
58 And Peter followed him at a distance up to the high priest’s courtyard, and went inside and sat with the officers to see the end.
59 Ɣemaɣi la, nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple Sanhedrin blibo la le ame siwo aɖi aʋatsoɖase le Yesu ŋu la dim, ne woawui. 60 Gake womekpɔ ɖeke o, evɔ aʋatsoɖasefo geɖewo va hafi.

59 And the chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for false testimony against Jesus so that they might put him to death; 60 and they did not find any, though many false witnesses came forward.

Emegbe ame eve va 61 gblɔ be: "Ame sia gblɔ be, ‘Mate ŋu amu Mawu ƒe gbedoxɔ la aƒu anyi agagbugbɔe atu le ŋkeke etɔ̃ me.’ " 62 Ale nunɔlagã la tso hebiae be: "Mèle nya aɖeke ŋu ɖo ge oa? Nya kawoe nye esi ame siawo tsɔ le nuwò tsomee? " 63 Ke Yesu zi kpi.

But in the end two came forward 61 and said "This man said ‘I can tear down the temple of God and build it up in three days.’ " 62 And the high priest stood up and said to him "Do you make no answer? what is it that these are testifying against you? " 63 but Jesus was silent.

Eya ta nunɔlagã la gblɔ nɛ be: "Metà Mawu gbagbe la na wò be nàgblɔe na mí, nenye wòe nye Kristo la, Mawu ƒe Vi la! " 64 Yesu ɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Eyae nye ema nègblɔ. Gake mele egblɔm na mi be: Tso fifia dzi yina la, miakpɔ Amegbetɔvi la wòabɔbɔ nɔ Ŋusẽtɔ la ƒe ɖusime, eye wòanɔ dziƒolilikpowo dzi gbɔna. " 65 Eye nunɔlagã la dze eƒe awudziwuiwo gblɔ be: "Ŋutsu sia gblɔ busunya! Ðe ɖasefo bubuwo gahiã mía? Kpɔ ɖa!

And the high priest said to him "I adjure you by the living God to tell us whether you are the Messiah, the Son of God. " 64 Jesus said to him "As you say; I tell you, though, henceforth it will be sitting at the right hand of Power and coming on the clouds of the heavens that you see the Son of Man. " 65 Then the high priest tore his clothes, saying "He has blasphemed! what further need have we of witnesses? here, you have heard the blasphemy now, 66 what do you think? "
Miese busunya la azɔ. 66 Nu kae miesusu? "
And they answered "It is a case for death. "
Woɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Edze ku. " 67 Eye woɖe ta ɖe mo nɛ hetu kɔe. Ame bubuwo hã ƒo tome nɛ, 68 eye wogblɔ be: "Wò, Kristo, ne nyagblɔɖila nènye la, ekema gblɔ ame si ƒo wò la na mí. "
67 Then they spat into his face and struck him with their fists, and some slapped him 68 saying "Prophesy for us, Messiah, who was it that hit you? "

69 Ke Petro nɔ anyi ɖe xexe le aƒea me, eye dɔlanyɔnuvi aɖe te ɖe eŋu gblɔ nɛ be: "Wò hã ènɔ Yesu Galileatɔ la ŋu! " 70 Ke esẽ nu le wo katã ŋkume gblɔ be: "Nyemenya nya si gblɔm nèle o. " 71 Esi wòdo go yi agboa nu la, nyɔnuvi bubu kpɔe, eye wògblɔ na ame siwo le afi ma la be: "Ŋutsu sia nɔ Yesu Nazaretetɔ la ŋu. " 72 Egasẽ nu heka atam be: "Nyemenya ame la o! " 73 Ɣeyiɣi ʋɛ aɖe megbe la, ame siwo le tsitre ɖe afi ma la te ɖe Petro ŋu gblɔ be: "Nyateƒee, wo dometɔ ɖekae wò hã nènye, gbe si dom nèle kura le ha ɖem wò. " 74 Eye wòde asi fiƒodenyawo gbɔgblɔ me heka atam ƒu edzi be: "Nyemenya amea o! " Kasia koklo ku atɔ. 75 Eye Petro ɖo ŋku nya si Yesu gblɔ nɛ la dzi be: "Hafi koklo naku atɔ la, àgbe nu le gbɔnye zi etɔ̃. " Eye wòdo go yi xexe ɖafa avi vevie.

69 But Peter was sitting out in the courtyard; and one maid came up to him, saying "You were with Jesus the Galilean too "; 70 but he denied it before everybody, saying "I do not know what you are talking about. " 71 And he went out to the porch; and there another girl saw him and said to those who were there "That man was with Jesus the Nazarene "; 72 and again he denied it with an oath, "I do not know the man, " 73 And after a little those who were standing around came up and said to Peter "You positively are one of them yourself your language betrays you. " 74 Then he began to curse and swear that he "did not know the man "; and at once a cock crowed; 75 and Peter remembered Jesus’s word, how he had said "Before a cock has crowed you will disown me three times "; and he went outside and wept bitterly.
Mateo
Matthew
27 Le ŋufɔke ƒe ŋdi la, nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo katã kple dumegãwo de adaŋu le ale si woawɔ awu Yesu la ŋu. 2 Woblae hekplɔe yi na nutodziɖula Pilato.

27 And when morning came all the chief priests and the elders of the people laid their plan against Jesus for putting him to death, 2 and bound him and took him to Pilate, the governor, and handed him over to him.
3 Esi Yuda, ame si de Yesu asi la, kpɔ be wotso kufia nɛ la, evee, eye wòtrɔ klosalo blaetɔ̃ la yi na nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple dumegãwo 4 gblɔ be: "Mewɔ nu vɔ̃ be mede ʋu maɖifɔ asi. "

3 Then, upon seeing that he had been condemned, Judas who had been the agent in his arrest regretted his action and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders, 4 saying "I have sinned in bringing innocent blood to its death. "
Wogblɔ be: "Afi kae nya ma ka na mí? Wò ŋutɔ wò nyae nye ema! " 5 Ale wòtsɔ klosalogakuawo ƒu gbe ɖe gbedoxɔa me, eye wòdzo yi ɖade ka ve.
But they said "What concern of ours is that? you see to that. " 5 And he threw the pieces into the temple and withdrew, and went away and hanged himself.

6 Ke nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo fɔ klosalogakuawo eye wogblɔ be: "Se meɖe mɔ be woatsɔe ade nudzɔɖaka kɔkɔeawo me o, elabena ʋugae. " 7 Esi wolée kpɔ le wo nɔewo dome vɔ la, wotsɔ ga la ƒle zemela ƒe anyigba be wòanye amedzrowo ɖiƒe. 8 Eya ta woyɔa anyigba ma be "Ʋunyigba " va se ɖe egbegbe.

6 But the chief priests took the money and said "It is not lawful to deposit it in the temple treasury, because it is the price of blood "; 7 and they decided on buying the potter’s field with it for a burying-ground for strangers, and did so; 8 for which reason that field has been called the Blood Field to this day.
9 Ale nya si wogblɔ ɖi to nyagblɔɖila Yeremiya dzi la va eme be: "Wotsɔ klosalo blaetɔ̃, ame si ŋu Israel-vi aɖewo do asi ɖo la, ƒe home 10 ƒle zemela ƒe anyigba, abe ale si Yehowa de se nam ene. "

9 Then what was said through the prophet Jeremiah in the words "And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of the Priced whom they priced on the part of the sons of Israel, 10 and gave them for the potter’s field, in accordance with what the Lord directed me, " was fulfilled.

11 Ke Yesu le tsitre ɖe nutodziɖula la ŋkume, eye nutodziɖula la biae be: "Wòe nye Yudatɔwo ƒe Fia la? " Yesu ɖo eŋu be: "Eya tututue nye ema nègblɔ. " 12 Ke esi nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple dumegãwo le enu tsom la, meɖo nya aɖeke ŋu o.

11 But Jesus was set before the governor; and the governor put the question to him "Are you the ‘king of the Jews’? " and Jesus said "As you say. " 12 And while the accusations were being made against him by the chief priests and elders he made no answer.
13 Eya ta Pilato biae be: "Mèle nya gbogbo siwo tsɔm wole ɖe ŋuwò la sem oa? " 14 Ke meɖo nya ɖeka pɛ gɔ̃ hã ŋu nɛ o, ale nutodziɖula la ƒe mo wɔ yaa ŋutɔ.
13 Then Pilate said to him "Do you not hear how many charges against you they are testifying to? " 14 And to not one word of it did he give him an answer, so that the governor wondered exceedingly.
15 Ke le ŋutitotoŋkekenyui ɖe sia ɖe dzi la, nutodziɖula la ɖea asi le gamenɔla ɖeka si amehaa di la ŋu na wo.
15 And every feast-time it was the governor’s custom to release for the crowd one prisoner whom they wanted.
16 Ɣemaɣi tututu la, ŋutsu aɖe si woyɔna be Baraba, si amewo nya nyuie ɖe eƒe nu vlo wɔwɔ ta la le ga me.
16 And they had then a conspicuous prisoner known as Jesus Bar-Abbas.

17 Eya ta esi woƒo ƒu la, Pilato bia wo be: "Ame ka ŋue miedi be maɖe asi le na mi, Baraba loo alo Yesu si woyɔna be Kristo la? " 18 Elabena Pilato nya be ŋuʋaʋã tae wodee asi ɖo. 19 Azɔ hã, esi wòbɔbɔ nɔ ʋɔnudrɔ̃zikpuia dzi la, srɔ̃a ɖo ame ɖee be: "Mègawɔ naneke ame dzɔdzɔe ma o, elabena mekpe fu geɖe le drɔ̃eƒe egbea le eta. " 20 Ke nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple dumegãwo ƒoe ɖe ameha la nu be woabia be woaɖe asi le Baraba ŋu, gake woawu Yesu ya. 21 Eya ta nutodziɖula la bia wo be: "Ame eve siawo dometɔ ka ŋue miedi be maɖe asi le na mi? " Woɖo eŋu be: "Baraba. " 22 Pilato bia wo be: "Ekema nu kae mawɔ Yesu si woyɔna be Kristo la? " Wo katã wogblɔ be: "Hee ɖe ati ŋu! " 23 Ebia be: "Nu ka ta? Nu vɔ̃ɖi kae wòwɔ? "

17 So when they had gathered Pilate said to them "Which will you have me release for you, Jesus Bar-Abbas or Jesus known as the Messiah? " 18 For he knew that it was out of jealousy that they had had him arrested; 19 and while he was sitting on the bench his wife had sent a message to him, "Do not have anything to do with that saint; for today I had a great deal happen to me in a dream because of him. " 20 But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowds to ask for Bar-Abbas and have Jesus perish; 21 and the governor answered them "Which of the two will you have me release for you? " and they said "Bar-Abbas. " 22 Said Pilate to them, "Then what shall I do with the Jesus who is known as the Messiah? "

Gake ɖeko wogado ɣli sesĩe wu be: "Hee ɖe ati ŋu! " 24 Esi Pilato kpɔ be yeƒe agbagbadzedzea meɖe vi aɖeke o, ke boŋ zi di be yeatɔ ta la, etsɔ tsi klɔ asi le ameha la ŋkume gblɔ be: "Nye asi mele ame sia ƒe ʋu kɔkɔ ɖi me o. Miawo ŋutɔwo mikpɔ egbɔ. " 25 Ale ameawo katã ɖo eŋu be: "Eƒe ʋu neva míawo kple mía viwo dzi. " 26 Eya ta eɖe asi le Baraba ŋu na wo, ke ena woƒo Yesu kple atam, eye wòɖe asi le eŋu be woahee ɖe ati ŋu.

They all said "Have him crucified. " 23 Said he, "Why, what harm has he done? " but they screamed more and more "Have him crucified. " 24 And Pilate, seeing that he was doing no good but rather a disturbance was beginning, took water and washed his hands in front of the people, saying "I am innocent of this blood; you shall see to it. " 25 And all the people answered "His blood be on us and on our children. " 26 Then he released Bar-Abbas for them, but scourged Jesus and gave him in charge to be crucified.

27 Azɔ nutodziɖula la ƒe asrafowo kplɔ Yesu yi nutodziɖulaa ƒe fiasã me, eye wona asrafoha blibo la katã va ƒo ƒu ɖe eŋu. 28 Woɖe awu le eŋu hedo awu ʋlaya dzĩ nɛ, 29 wotsɔ ŋù lɔ̃ fiakuku ɖɔ nɛ, eye wotsɔ aɖa de nuɖusi me nɛ. Eye wodze klo ɖe eŋkume le fewu ɖum le eŋu be: "Míedo gbe na wò, Yudatɔwo ƒe Fia! " 30 Woɖe ta ɖe eŋu, eye woxɔ aɖa la le esi tsɔ ƒo tame nɛ.

27 Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the praetorium and got together the whole cohort over him, 28 and stripped him and threw a scarlet cape over him, 29 and braided a wreath out of thorns and put it on his head and a reed in his right hand, and knelt before him and made fun of him, saying "Hail, King of the Jews! " 30 and spat on him and took the reed and beat him over the head.
31 Mlɔeba esi woɖu fewu le eŋu vɔ la, woɖe awu ʋlaya la le eŋu, eye wodo eƒe awudziwuiwo nɛ, eye wokplɔe do goe be woaɖahee ɖe ati ŋu.
31 And when they had had their fun with him they took the cape off him and put his own clothes on him, and led him away to be crucified.
32 Esi wodo yina la, wokpɔ Kirenetɔ aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Simon. Wozi ŋutsu sia dzi be wòatsɔ Yesu ƒe fuwɔameti la.
32 And as they were going out they found a Cyrene man, by name Simon: this man they requisitioned to take up his cross.
33 Esi woɖo teƒe si woyɔna be Golgata, si gɔmee nye Ametakoliƒe la, 34 wotsɔ wain si wotsɔ gbe veve tsakae la nɛ be wòano; ke esi wòɖɔe kpɔ la, egbe enono.
33 And when they came to a place known as Golgotha, which is to say the Skull place, 34 they gave him wine mixed with gall to drink; and when he had tasted it he would not drink.
35 Esi wohee ɖe ati ŋu vɔ la, wodzidze nu ɖe eƒe awudziwuiwo dzi hema wo, 36 eye wobɔbɔ nɔ anyi ɖe afi ma le eŋu dzɔm.
35 And they crucified him and divided up his clothes, throwing lots, 36 and they sat and kept watch over him there.
37 Woŋlɔ enutsonya klã ɖe etame be: "Yesu, Yudatɔwo ƒe Fia lae nye esi. " 38 Wohe adzodala eve ɖe ati ŋu kpe ɖe eŋu, ɖeka le eƒe ɖusime, eye evelia le eƒe miame.
37 And they put up over his head a written statement of his offense, "This is Jesus the King of the Jews. " 38 Then two robbers were crucified with him, one on the right and one on the left.

39 Eye ame siwo to teƒea va yina la dzui heʋuʋu ta 40 gblɔ be: "Wò ame si gblɔ be yeamu gbedoxɔ la aƒu anyi ahagbugbɔe atu le ŋkeke etɔ̃ me, ɖe ɖokuiwò azɔ! Ne Mawu ƒe vie nènye la, ekema ɖi le fuwɔameti la ŋu! " 41 Nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo, agbalẽfialawo kple dumegãwo hã ɖu fewu le eŋu nenema ke be: 42 "Exɔ na ame bubuwo, mate ŋu axɔ na eɖokui o!

39 And those who went past taunted him, shaking their heads 40 and saying "You that were tearing down the temple and building it up in three days, save yourself, if you are Son of God, and get down off the cross. " 41 In the same way the chief priests, making fun of him with the scribes and elders, said 42 "He saved others; he cannot save himself!
Israel ƒe Fia wònyee; neɖi tso fuwɔametia ŋu azɔ, ekema míaxɔ edzi ase.
He is the King of Israel: let him get down off the cross now, and we will believe on him.
43 Eɖo ŋu ɖe Mawu ŋu; ne eƒe nu nyoa eŋu la, ekema nexɔ nɛ azɔ, elabena egblɔ be, ‘Mawu ƒe Vie menye.’ " 44 Nenema kee adzodala siwo wohe ɖe ati ŋu le exa hã do vloe.
43 He trusts in God, let him deliver him now if he wants him for he said ‘I am Son of God.’ " 44 And the robbers too, who were crucified with him, gave him the same twitting.
45 Tso gaƒoƒo adelia dzi la, viviti do ɖe anyigba ma katã dzi va se ɖe gaƒoƒo asiekelia dzi.
45 And from twelve o’clock on there came a darkness over all the land till three.

46 Le gaƒoƒo asiekelia me lɔƒo la, Yesu do ɣli sesĩe be: "Eli, Eli, lama sabaktani? " si gɔmee nye: "Nye Mawu, nye Mawu, nu ka ŋuti nègblẽm ɖi? " 47 Esi ame siwo le tsitre ɖe afi ma dometɔ aɖewo see la, wogblɔ be: "Ame sia le Eliya yɔm. " 48 Enumake wo dometɔ ɖeka ƒu du tsɔ ƒumekutsa de wain tsitsi me, tsɔe ɖo aɖa nu, eye wòtsɔe nɛ be wòano. 49 Ke ame susɔeawo gblɔ be: "Ðe asi le eŋu!

46 And about three o’clock Jesus shrieked out loudly "Elí, Elí, Lemá shabaktáni? " that is, "My God, my God, why hast thou abandoned me? " 47 And some of those who were standing there said when they heard it "That man is calling Eliah " [for that was the way Elijah’s name was then pronounced].

Mina míakpɔe ɖa be Eliya ava xɔ nɛ hã. " 50 Yesu gado ɣli sesĩe, eye wòku. 51 Eye kpɔ ɖa, gbedoxɔmetsovɔ la dze ɖe eve tso etame va se ɖe egɔme, anyigba ʋuʋu, eye agakpewo fe. 52 Yɔdowo nu ʋu, eye ame kɔkɔe siwo dɔ alɔ̃ le ku me la dometɔ geɖe ho ɖe dzi, 53 eye wodze ame geɖewo kpɔ.

48 And at once one of them ran and took a sponge, and filled it with vinegar and stuck it on a reed, and offered him the drink; 49 but the rest said "Let be and let us see if Elijah is coming to save him. " 50 And Jesus again gave a loud cry, and breathed his last; 51 and lo, the curtain of the temple split from top to bottom into two parts, and the earth quaked, and the rocks split, 52 and the tombs opened and many bodies of holy men who had gone to their rest rose, 53 and, coming out of the tombs after his resurrection, came into the sacred city and appeared to many.

(Le Yesu ƒe tsitretsitsi megbe la, ame siwo trɔ tso ameɖibɔa me la gbɔ va du kɔkɔe la me.) 54 Ke esi asrafomegã la kple eŋutime siwo le Yesu ŋu dzɔm la kpɔ anyigbaʋuʋu la kple nu siwo le dzɔdzɔm la, wovɔ̃ ŋutɔ, eye wogblɔ be: "Mawu ƒe Vie ame sia nye vavã. "
54 And when the centurion and those who were with him keeping watch over Jesus saw the earthquake and the rest, they were greatly afraid, saying "This positively was the son of God. "
55 Eye nyɔnu geɖe siwo dze Yesu yome tso Galilea henɔ esubɔm la hã le adzɔge le nu kpɔm; 56 wo dometɔ aɖewoe nye Maria Magdalatɔ kple Maria, si nye Yakobo kple Yose dada, kpakple Zebedeo viwo dada.

55 And there were many women there looking on from a distance, who had followed Jesus from Galilee, waiting on his needs; 56 among them was Mary the Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
57 Ke esi fiẽsi ɖo la, kesinɔtɔ aɖe si tso Arimatia, si ŋkɔe nye Yosef, ame si hã nye Yesu ƒe nusrɔ̃la aɖe la va. 58 Ŋutsu sia yi Pilato gbɔ ɖabia Yesu ƒe kukua.
57 And when evening came there came a rich man from Arimathea, Joseph by name, who had himself become a disciple of Jesus; 58 this man went to Pilate and asked for Jesus’s body.
Eye Pilato ɖe gbe be woatsɔe nɛ.
Then Pilate ordered it turned over to him.
59 Yosef xɔ ame kukua, xatsa aklala biɖibiɖi dzadzɛ aɖe ɖe eŋu, 60 eye wòtsɔe mlɔ eya ŋutɔ ƒe yɔdo yeye si wòna woɖe ɖe agakpe me nɛ la me. Emli kpe gã aɖe tsɔ xe yɔdoa nu, eye wòdzo.

59 And Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen wrapper, 60 and laid it in his new tomb which he had cut out in the rock, and rolled a great stone against the door of the tomb, and went away.
61 Ke Maria Magdalatɔ kple Maria kemɛa tsi afi ma, eye wonɔ anyi ɖe yɔdoa ŋgɔ.
61 And Mary the Magdalene and the other Mary were there, sitting opposite the front of the grave.

62 Le ŋkeke si kplɔe ɖo, si nye Dzadzraɖoŋkeke la megbe la, nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple Farisitɔwo va kpe ta ɖe Pilato gbɔ 63 eye wogblɔ be: "Aƒetɔ, míeɖo ŋku edzi be, esime ameblela ma nɔ agbe la, egblɔ be, ‘Le ŋkeke etɔ̃ megbe la, woafɔm ɖe tsitre.’ 64 Eya ta de se be woadzɔ yɔdo la ŋu nyuie va se ɖe ŋkeke etɔ̃a gbe, ne eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo magava fii adzoe ahagblɔ na amewo be, ‘Wofɔe ɖe tsitre tso ame kukuwo dome o!’ Ne edzɔ alea la, amebeble mamlɛtɔ sia avɔ̃ɖi wu gbãtɔ. " 65 Pilato gblɔ na wo be: "Dzɔlawo neyi kpli mi. Ne miadzɔ eŋu ale si miate ŋui. " 66 Eya ta wodzo yi ɖatre kpe la ɖe yɔdo la nu nyuie heɖo dzɔlawo afi ma.

62 But on the following day that is, after Friday the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered at Pilate’s residence 63 saying "Sir, we recollect that that delusionist, while he was still alive, said ‘After three days I rise,’ 64 So order the grave made secure till the third day, for fear the disciples should come and spirit him away and say to the people ‘He has risen from the dead,’ and the final delusion will be worse than the first. " 65 Said Pilate to them, "You may have a guard: go make it as sure as you know how. " 66 And they went and made the grave sure by sealing the stone, in addition to the guard.
Mateo
Matthew

28 Le Sabat la megbe, le kwasiɖaa ƒe ŋkeke gbãtɔ dzi, esi xexea me de asi kɔkɔ me la, Maria Magdalatɔ kple Maria kemɛa va yɔdoa kpɔ ge ɖa. 2 Eye kpɔ ɖa, anyigba ʋuʋu sesĩe, elabena Yehowa ƒe dɔla ɖi tso dziƒo va mli kpe la ɖa le yɔdoa nu hebɔbɔ nɔ edzi.

28 But at the close of the sabbath, in the twilight of the first day of the week, Mary the Magdalene and the other Mary came to look over the grave; 2 and lo, there came a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord came down out of the sky and went to the stone and rolled it away and sat on it.
3 Eƒe dzedzeme le abe dzikedzo ene, eye eƒe awu fu tititi abe sno ene. 4 Ɛ̃, esia na dzidzi ƒo dzɔlawo, wodzo nyanyanya, eye wozu abe ame kukuwo ene.
3 And his aspect was like lightning, and his dress white as snow; 4 and in their fear of him the watchers shook and became like dead men.
5 Gake mawudɔla la gblɔ na nyɔnuawo be: "Migavɔ̃ o, elabena menyae be Yesu si wohe ɖe ati ŋu la dimee miele.
5 And the angel answered the women "Do not you be afraid; for I know you are looking for Jesus, the one who was crucified.
6 Mele afi sia o, elabena wofɔe ɖe tsitre, abe ale si wògblɔe ene.
6 He is not here, for he has risen, as he said he would.
Miva kpɔ afi si wotsɔe mlɔ la ɖa. 7 Eya ta miɖe abla yi ɖagblɔ na eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo be wofɔe ɖe tsitre tso ame kukuwo dome, eye kpɔ ɖa, edze mia ŋgɔ yina Galilea.
Come and see the place where he lay, 7 and go quickly and tell his disciples ‘He has risen from the dead, and lo, he is going ahead of you to Galilee; there you shall see him.’
Afi mae miakpɔe le. Kpɔ ɖa, gbedeasi siae mehe vɛ na mi. " 8 Eya ta woɖe abla dzo le yɔdoa to, eye wotsɔ vɔvɔ̃ kple dzidzɔ gã ƒu du be yewoayi aɖaka eta na eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo.
Lo, I have told you. " 8 And they went quickly away from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to report it to his disciples; 9 and lo, Jesus met them, saying "Good morning. "
9 Eye kpɔ ɖa, Yesu va do go wo hegblɔ be: "Medo gbe na mi! "
And they came up and grasped his feet and did him reverence.
Wote ɖe eŋu, eye wolé eƒe afɔwo hebɔbɔ nɛ. 10 Eye Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Migavɔ̃ o! Miyi ɖaka eta na nɔvinyewo, ne woayi Galilea, eye woakpɔm le afi ma. "
10 Then Jesus said to them "Do not be afraid: go carry word to my brothers to go to Galilee, and there they shall see me. "
11 Esi wole mɔa dzi yina la, dzɔlaawo dometɔ aɖewo yi dua me ɖaka nu siwo katã dzɔ la ta na nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo.
11 But while they were on their way, in came some of the guard to the city and reported to the chief priests the whole of what had taken place.

12 Eye esi woawo kple dumegãwo kpe ta hede adaŋu vɔ la, wona klosaloga gbogbo aɖe asrafoawo, 13 eye wogblɔ na wo be: "Migblɔ be: ‘Eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo va fii le zã me esime míele alɔ̃ dɔm.’ 14 Eye ne nya sia ɖo nutodziɖula la ƒe to me la, ekema míaɖe eme nɛ, eye mahiã be miatsi dzi o. " 15 Eya ta woxɔ klosalogakuawo, eye wowɔ abe ale si wogblɔ na wo ene; eye nya sia kaka ɖe Yudatɔwo dome va se ɖe egbe.

12 And they held a conference with the elders and decided on a policy, and gave the soldiers a considerable quantity of money, 13 telling them "Say ‘His disciples came in the night and stole him away while we were sleeping’; 14 and if this comes to a hearing before the governor we will see him and make everything all right for you. " 15 And they took money and did as they were instructed, and this story was spread among the Jews to this day.
16 Azɔ nusrɔ̃la wuiɖekɛawo yi Galilea, eye woyi ɖe to si dzi Yesu ɖo be yewoado go le la dzi. 17 Esi wokpɔe la, wobɔbɔ nɛ, ke wo dometɔ aɖewo mexɔe se be eyae o.
16 But the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus made the appointment for them; 17 and when they saw him they did him reverence, but some hesitated.

18 Eye Yesu te ɖe wo ŋu gblɔ na wo be: "Wotsɔ ŋusẽ si le dziƒo kple anyigba dzi la katã de asi nam. 19 Eya ta miheyi ɖawɔ dukɔwo katã me tɔwo woanye nusrɔ̃lawo, mianyrɔ wo ɖe Fofo la kple Vi la kpakple gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe la ƒe ŋkɔ me, 20 miafia wo be woawɔ nu siwo katã ƒe se mede na mi la dzi. Eye kpɔ ɖa, meli kpli mi ŋkekeawo katã va se ɖe nuɖoanyia ƒe nuwuɣi. "

18 And Jesus approached them and spoke to them, saying "I have been given all authority in heaven and on earth: 19 so go and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them into the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, 20 teaching them to keep everything that I commanded you; and I am with you all the days to the end of time. "
Marko
Mark

1 Yesu Kristo, Mawu ƒe Vi la, ŋuti nya nyui la ƒe gɔmedzedzee nye esi: 2 Abe ale si woŋlɔe ɖe nyagblɔɖila Yesaya ƒe agbalẽ mee ene be: "(Kpɔ ɖa, mele nye dɔla dɔm ɖe ŋgɔwò, ame si adzra mɔ dzi ɖo na wò.) 3 Ame aɖe le ɣli dom le gbedzi be: ‘Midzra Yehowa ƒe mɔ dzi ɖo!
1 Here begins the Gospel of God’s son Jesus Christ. 2 As it is written in the prophet Isaiah "Lo, I am sending before your face my messenger who shall prepare your road.

Mina eƒe mɔwo nadzɔ.’ " 4 Yohanes Amenyrɔɖetsimela va gbedzi, eye wòle gbeƒã ɖem nyɔnyrɔxɔxɔ, si nye dzimetɔtrɔ hena nu vɔ̃wo tsɔtsɔ ke ƒe dzesi. 5 Eye Yudea-nyigba blibo la dzi nɔlawo kple Yerusalem nɔlawo katã vaa egbɔ, eye woʋua woƒe nu vɔ̃wo me, eye wònyrɔa wo ɖe Yordan-tɔsisia me.

3 The voice of one calling out in the wilderness ‘Get ready the Lord’s road, make his thoroughfare straight!’ " 4 there came John, who baptized in the wilderness, proclaiming baptism for repentance to the pardoning of sins; 5 and all Judea, and all the Jerusalemites, were going out to him and having themselves baptized by him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.

6 Yohanes do kposɔfuwu, eye wòtsɔ lãgbalẽlidziblanu bla ali dzi, eye wòɖua ʋetsuviwo henoa gbemenyitsi. 7 Eɖea gbeƒã be: "Ame aɖe si tri akɔ wum la le megbenye gbɔna, nyemedze be mabɔbɔ atu eƒe afɔkpakawo o.

6 And John wore camel-hair and a leather belt around his waist, and fed on grasshoppers and wild honey; 7 and he proclaimed "He who is stronger than I is coming behind me, he whose shoestring I am not fit to stoop down and untie.
8 Metsɔ tsi nyrɔ mi, ke eya atsɔ gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe anyrɔ mi. "
8 I have baptized you with water, but he will baptize you with Holy Spirit. "
9 Le ŋkeke mawo me la, Yesu tso Nazaret le Galilea va, eye Yohanes nyrɔe ɖe Yordan-tɔsisia me.
9 And in those days Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized in the Jordan by John.

10 Esi wònya do go le tsia me teti ko la, ekpɔ dziƒowo nu ʋu, eye gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe la ɖi ɖe edzi abe ahɔnɛ ene. 11 Eye gbe aɖe ɖi tso dziƒowo be: "Wòe nye Vinye, si gbɔ nyemelɔ̃a nu le o; wò nu dzea ŋunye. " 12 Enumake gbɔgbɔ la ƒoe ɖe enu wòyi gbedadaƒo. 13 Enɔ gbedadaƒo ŋkeke blaene, eye Satana tee kpɔ.

10 And at once, as he came up out of the water, he saw the sky cleave apart and the Spirit come down to him like a dove; 11 and there was a voice out of the sky, "You are my dear son, in you I take pleasure. " 12 And at once the Spirit drove him out to the wilderness; 13 and he was in the wilderness forty days being tempted by Satan, and was with the wild beasts; and the angels waited on his needs.

Enɔ gbemelãwo dome, eye mawudɔlawo nɔ esubɔm. 14 Ke esi wolé Yohanes megbe la, Yesu yi Galilea hele gbeƒã ɖem Mawu ƒe nya nyui la 15 le gbɔgblɔm be: "Ɣeyiɣi ɖoɖi la de, eye Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la gogo. Mitrɔ dzi me, eye mixɔ nya nyui la dzi se. " 16 Esi wòto Galilea-ƒua nu yina la, ekpɔ Simon kple nɔvia Andrea wole woƒe asabu dam, elabena tɔƒodelawoe wonye.

14 And after John was committed to prison Jesus came to Galilee proclaiming the gospel of God 15 and saying "The time has fully come, and the Reign of God is almost here; repent and believe in the gospel. " 16 And in passing along by the Sea of Galilee he saw Simon and Simon’s brother Andrew fishing in the sea with casting-nets; for they were fishermen.
17 Eye Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Miva dze yonyeme, eye mawɔ mi ameɖelawo. " 18 Enumake wogblẽ woƒe ɖɔawo ɖi hedze eyome.
17 And Jesus said to them "Come here after me, and I will cause you to become fishers of men "; 18 and at once they left their nets and followed him.

19 Esi wòzɔ yi ŋgɔ vie la, ekpɔ Yakobo, Zebedeo vi, kple nɔvia Yohanes wole woƒe tɔdziʋu me le woƒe ɖɔ vuvuwo sam, 20 eye wòyɔ wo enumake. Ale wogblẽ wo fofo Zebedeo kple ɖɔkplɔviawo ɖi hedze eyome. 21 Eye wodzo yi Kapernaum.

19 And he went on a little and saw James the son of Zebedee and his brother John, also in their boat putting their nets to rights; 20 and at once he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and went after him.

Esi Sabat ŋkekea nya ɖo ko la, eyi ƒuƒoƒe la, eye wòde asi nufiafia me. 22 Eye ameawo ƒe nu ku le ale si wòfia nui ta, elabena ele nu fiam wo abe ame si si ŋusẽ le ene, ke menye abe agbalẽfialawo ene o.

21 And they go to Capernaum; and at once on the sabbath he had gone into the synagogue and was teaching, 22 and they were astonished at his teaching; for he taught them as having authority, and not as did the scribes.
23 Ɣemaɣi tututu la, ŋutsu aɖe si dzi gbɔgbɔ makɔmakɔ aɖe kpɔ ŋusẽ ɖo la le woƒe ƒuƒoƒe la, eye wòdo ɣli be: 24 "Nya kae le mí kpli wò dome, wò, Yesu Nazaretetɔ?
23 And at once there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he screamed out 24 "What have you to do with us, Jesus, you Nazarene? have you come to destroy us?

Ðe nèva be yeatsrɔ̃ mía? Menya ame si tututu nènye, Mawu ƒe Kɔkɔetɔ lae nènye! " 25 Ke Yesu ka mo nɛ be: "Zi ɖoɖoe, eye nàdo go le eme! " 26 Esi gbɔgbɔ makɔmakɔ la nyamae vɔ la, gbɔgbɔ la do ɣli sesĩe eye wòdo go le eme.

I know you, I know who you are, the Holy One of God. " 25 And Jesus rebuked him, saying "Silence, and come out of him. " 26 And, after convulsing him and making a loud outcry, the unclean spirit came out of him.
Nufiafia yeyee nye esia! Ŋusẽ le esi wòɖea gbe na gbɔgbɔ makɔmakɔwo gɔ̃ hã, eye woɖoa toe. " 28 Ale eŋuti nya kaka enumake ɖe afi sia afi le Galilea nutoa katã me.

27 And they were amazed one and all, so that they debated it, saying "What is this? a new teaching with authority! and he gives orders to the unclean spirits and they obey him. " 28 And the report about him went out at once everywhere in the whole region of Galilee.

29 Ale wodzo le ƒuƒoƒea yi Simon kple Andrea ƒe me, eye Yakobo kple Yohanes kpe ɖe wo ŋu. 30 Ke asrã lé Simon lɔ̃xo wòle anyimlɔƒe, eye enumake wogblɔ nyɔnua ŋu nya nɛ. 31 Eyi egbɔ, eye wòlé eƒe alɔnu wòfɔ, ale asrã la dzo le edzi, eye wòsubɔ wo.

29 And at once they came out of the synagogue and came to the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John; 30 and Simon’s mother-in-law was in bed with a fever, and at once they told him about her, 31 and he went to her and raised her up, taking her by the hand, and the fever left her, and she waited on their needs.

32 Esi fiẽ ɖo, eye ɣe ɖo to la, amewo kplɔ dɔnɔwo kple ame siwo me gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo le la va egbɔ; 33 eye du bliboa va ƒo ƒu ɖe ʋɔtrua nu tututu. 34 Eda dɔ na ame geɖe siwo ŋu dɔléle vovovowo le, eye wònya gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃ geɖewo do goe, ke meɖea mɔ na gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃awo be woaƒo nu o, elabena wonya be eyae nye Kristo.

32 And when evening was come, and the sun was set, they brought to him all who were ill and all the demoniacs; 33 and the whole city was gathered at the door; 34 and he cured many who were ill with various diseases, and expelled many demons, and would not let the demons speak, because they knew him.
35 Le ŋdi kanya, esi xexea me mekpɔ kɔ nyuie haɖe o la, efɔ do go yi afi si ame aɖeke mele o, eye wòde asi gbedodoɖa me le afi ma.
35 And in the morning, while it was still deep in the night, he rose and went out, and went away to a lonely place and prayed there.

36 Ke Simon kple ame siwo kpe ɖe eŋu la dii, 37 eye esi wokpɔe la, wogblɔ nɛ be: "Ame sia ame le diwòm. " 38 Ke egblɔ na wo be: "Mina míayi teƒe bubu le du siwo gogo afi sia me, ne maɖe gbeƒã le afi mawo hã, elabena esia tae meva ɖo. " 39 Ale wòyi ɖale gbeƒã ɖem le woƒe ƒuƒoƒewo le Galilea blibo la, eye wòle gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo nyam do goe.

36 And Simon and those who were with him followed him up 37 and found him, and said to him "Everybody is looking for you. " 38 And he said to them "Let us go elsewhere, to the adjoining towns, that I may make my proclamation there too; for it was for this that I came out. " 39 And he came to all Galilee making the proclamation in their synagogues and expelling the demons.

40 Anyidɔléla aɖe hã va egbɔ, eye wòdze klo hele kuku ɖem nɛ vevie be: "Ne èlɔ̃ ko la, àte ŋu ana ŋutinye nakɔ. " 41 Ale eƒe nu wɔ nublanui nɛ, eye wòdo asi ɖa ka asi eŋu gblɔ nɛ be: "Melɔ̃! Ŋutiwò nekɔ. " 42 Enumake anyidɔ la vɔ nɛ, eye eŋuti kɔ.

40 And there came to him a leper, appealing to him and kneeling down and saying to him "If you will, you can cleanse me. " 41 And he, moved with pity, reached out his hand and touched him and said to him "I will; be cleansed "; 42 and at once the leprosy went away from him and he was cleansed.

43 Ede se nɛ vevie, eye wòdo mɔe enumake 44 hegblɔ nɛ be: "Mègagblɔ nya aɖeke na ame aɖeke o, ke boŋ yi nàtsɔ ɖokuiwò afia nunɔla, eye nàna nu siwo Mose ƒe se la bia be wòanye kpeɖodzi na wo. " 45 Ke esi ŋutsua dzo la, ede asi gbeƒãɖeɖe tso nya la ŋu me, eye wòkakae ale gbegbe be Yesu megatea ŋu gena ɖe du aɖeke me gaglãa o, ke boŋ duawo godo koe wònɔna le afi si amewo mele o. Gake amewo gatsoa goawo katã me vaa egbɔ kokoko.

43 And at once he spoke sternly to him and put him out, 44 and said to him "See that you do not say anything to anybody, but go show yourself to the priest and make the offerings that Moses directed on account of your cleansing, for an attestation to them; " 45 But he went out and began to proclaim it a great deal, and to spread the word so that Jesus could no longer come openly into a city; but he was outside in lonely places, and they came to him from every quarter.
Marko
Mark

2 Le ŋkeke aɖewo megbe la, Yesu gayi Kapernaum, eye amewo se be ele aƒe me. 2 Eye ame geɖewo va ƒo ƒu ale gbegbe be teƒe aɖeke megali o, mɔ mele ʋɔtrua nu teti hã o, eye wòde asi nya nyui la gbɔgblɔ me na wo.
2 And upon his coming into Capernaum again after some days it was heard that he was in the house, 2 and great numbers gathered, so that there was no longer room for them even around the door.
3 Eye ŋutsu ene kɔ lãmetututɔ aɖe gbɔna egbɔ.
And he was speaking the word to them, 3 and there came people bringing to him a paralyzed man borne by four.
4 Ke womete ŋu kɔe va ɖo Yesu gbɔ o le ameha la ta, eya ta wofo xɔ si me Yesu le la tame, eye esi woŋɔe vɔ la, woɖiɖi aba si dzi lãmetututɔa mlɔ la ɖe anyi.
4 And, not being able to bring the man to him because of the crowd, they took off the roofing where he was, and, by breaking a hole, let down the pallet on which the paralyzed man was lying.

Ele busunya gblɔm. Ame kae ate ŋu atsɔ nu vɔ̃wo ake, ne menye Mawu ɖeka ko oa? " 8 Ke Yesu dze sii enumake be wole susum le wo ɖokuiwo me alea, eya ta ebia wo be: "Nu ka tae miele nu siawo susum le miaƒe dzi me? 9 Kae bɔbɔ wu, be woagblɔ na lãmetututɔ la be, ‘Wotsɔ wò nu vɔ̃wo ke’ loo, alo be woagblɔ be, ‘Tso nàtsɔ wò aba, eye nàzɔ’? 10 Ke be miadze sii be ŋusẽ le Amegbetɔvi la si be wòatsɔ nu vɔ̃wo ake le anyigba dzi la, . . . " egblɔ na lãmetututɔa be: 11 "Mele egblɔm na wò be: Tso nàtsɔ wò aba eye nàyi aƒewò me. " 12 Ale wòtso, eye wòtsɔ eƒe aba enumake hezɔ do go le wo katã ŋkume. Ale wo katã ƒe nu ku, eye wokafu Mawu gblɔ be: "Míekpɔ nu sia tɔgbi kpɔ o. "

5 And Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralyzed man "My child, your sins are forgiven. " 6 But there were some of the scribes sitting there and inwardly questioning 7 "Why does this man speak so? he is blaspheming; who can forgive sins but one, God? " 8 And at once Jesus, recognizing in his spirit that they were thus questioning in their minds, said to them "Why are you inwardly questioning like that? 9 Which is easier, to say to a paralyzed man your ‘sins are forgiven’ or to say rise, and take up your pallet and walk’? 10 But, that you may know that the Son of Man has authority to forgive sins on earth " said he to the paralyzed man, 11 "I say to you, Rise, take up your pallet and go home. " 12 And he rose and at once took up the pallet and went out before them all, so that all of them were surprised and glorified God, saying "We never saw anything like this. "
13 Egado go yi ƒuta, eye ameha la katã va egbɔ, eye wòte nufiafia wo.
13 And he went out by the seaside again; and all the masses came to him, and he taught them.
14 Esi wòva yina la, ekpɔ Lewi, Alfeo vi, wòbɔbɔ nɔ adzɔxɔƒe, eye wògblɔ nɛ be: "Dze yonyeme. " Eye wòtso dze eyome.
14 And in passing he saw Levi the son of Alpheus sitting in a customhouse office, and said to him "Follow me "; and he rose and followed him.

15 Emegbe esime Yesu kple eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo le nuɖukplɔ̃ ŋu le Lewi ƒe me la, adzɔxɔlawo kple nu vɔ̃ wɔla gbogbo aɖewo va nɔ kplɔ̃a ŋu kpli wo, elabena wo dometɔ geɖe dze eyome. 16 Ke esi Farisitɔwo dometɔ siwo nye agbalẽfialawo kpɔ be ele nu ɖum kple nu vɔ̃ wɔlawo kpakple adzɔxɔlawo la, wobia eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo be: "Adzɔxɔlawo kple nu vɔ̃ wɔlawo hãe wòɖua nu kplia? " 17 Esi Yesu see la, egblɔ na wo be: "Ame siwo le lãmesẽ me la mehiã gbedala o, negbe ame siwo le dɔ lém ko. Menye ame dzɔdzɔewo yɔ gee meva o, ke boŋ nu vɔ̃ wɔlawoe. "

15 And it so befell that he was eating a meal in his house, and there were many customhouse officers and people of bad character at the table with Jesus and his disciples (for there were many of them, and they accompanied him), 16 and the scribes of the Pharisees, seeing that he was eating with the people of bad character and the customhouse officers, said to his disciples "Why does he eat with the customhouse officers and people of bad character? " 17 And Jesus, hearing it, said to them "Not the able-bodied, but the ill, need a physician; I have not come to call saints, but sinners. "

18 Yohanes ƒe nusrɔ̃lawo kple Farisitɔwo tsia nu dɔna. Eya ta wova biae be: "Nu ka tae Yohanes ƒe nusrɔ̃lawo kple Farisitɔwo ƒe nusrɔ̃lawo tsia nu dɔna, evɔ wò nusrɔ̃lawo ya metsia nu dɔna o? " 19 Yesu ɖo eŋu na wo be: "Ðe ŋugbetɔsrɔ̃ la xɔlɔ̃wo atsi nu adɔ esime ŋugbetɔsrɔ̃ la le wo gbɔa? Zi ale si ŋugbetɔsrɔ̃ la le wo gbɔ la, mehiã be woatsi nu adɔ o.

18 And John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting; and they came and said to him "Why is it that John’s disciples and the Pharisees’ disciples fast, but your disciples do not? " 19 and Jesus said to them "Can the wedding guests fast while the bridegroom is with them? so long as they have the bridegroom with them they cannot fast.
20 Ke ŋkekewo li gbɔna, esime woakplɔ ŋugbetɔsrɔ̃ la adzoe le wo gbɔ, ekema woatsi nu adɔ le ŋkeke ma dzi.
20 But there will come days, when the bridegroom is taken from them, and then, in that day, they will fast.
21 Ame aɖeke metsɔa avɔ yeye ƒe nuɖeɖi kaa awudziwui xoxo o. Ne ewɔe nenema la, avɔ yeyea aho ɖa le xoxoa ŋu, eye vuvua alolo wu tsãtɔ.
21 Nobody sews a piece of unfulled cloth upon an old cloak; if one does, the filler takes some away from it, the new from the old, and a worse hole is made.
22 Eye ame aɖeke mekɔa wain yeye ɖe lãgbalẽgolo xoxowo me o. Ne ewɔe nenema la, ekema wain la awó lãgbalẽgoloawo, eye wain la kple lãgbalẽgoloawo siaa dome agblẽ.
22 And nobody puts new wine in old skins; if one does, the wine will burst the skins, and the wine is lost, and so are the skins; but new wine goes in fresh skins. "

Ke boŋ wokɔa wain yeye ɖe lãgbalẽgolo yeyewo me. " 23 Le Sabat aɖe dzi la, Yesu zɔ to lugblewo me va yina, eye esi wole yiyim la, eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo de asi luawo ŋeŋe me. 24 Eya ta Farisitɔwo biae be: "Kpɔ ɖa, nu ka tae wole nu si mele se nu o la wɔm le Sabat dzi? " 25 Ke eɖo eŋu na wo be: "Ðe miexlẽ nu si David wɔ esime nuɖuɖu hiãe, eye dɔ wu eya kple eŋutimewo la kpɔ oa? 26 Ale si David ge ɖe Mawu ƒe aƒe la me eye wòɖu ŋkumeɖobolo siwo ŋu se meɖe mɔ ɖo na ame aɖeke be wòaɖu o, negbe nunɔlawo ko, eye wòna ɖe eŋutimewo hã abe ale si woŋlɔe ɖe nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔ Abiatar ŋuti nuŋlɔɖia me ene oa? " 27 Eye wògagblɔ na wo be: "Amegbetɔ tae woɖo Sabat la anyi ɖo, ke menye Sabat tae wowɔ amegbetɔ ɖo o. 28 Eya ta Amegbetɔvi la nye Sabat la gɔ̃ hã ƒe Aƒetɔ. "

23 And it befell that on the Sabbath he was on his way across the grainfields, and his disciples began to make a way picking the ears; 24 and the Pharisees said to him "There, why are they doing on the sabbath what is not lawful? " 25 and he said to them "Did you never read what David did when he, and those who were with him, were in need and hungry? 26 how he went into the house of God in the high-priesthood of Abiathar and ate the showbread, which it is not lawful that any but the priests should eat, and gave it to those who were with him too? " 27 And he said to them "The sabbath was made for man and not man for the sabbath; 28 so that the Son of Man is master even of the sabbath. "
Marko
Mark
3 Yesu gayi ƒuƒoƒe aɖe, eye ame aɖe si titi lé asi na la le afi ma. 2 Eye Farisitɔwo le ŋku lém ɖe eŋu tututu be yewoakpɔe ɖa be ada gbe le amea ŋu le Sabat dzi hã, ne yewoatsɔ nya ɖe eŋu.
3 And he went into a synagogue again, and there was a man there with his hand shriveled; 2 and they were watching him to see if he would cure him on the sabbath, that they might arraign him.
3 Egblɔ na ame si titi lé asi na la be: "Tso nàva titina. " 4 Ebia wo be: "Ðe se ɖe mɔ be woawɔ nu nyui alo awɔ nu vɔ̃ɖi le Sabat dzia? Be woaɖe agbe loo alo awu amea? "

3 And he said to the man with the shriveled hand "Stand forward "; 4 and he said to them "Is it lawful on the sabbath to do a good act or to do harm, to save a life or to kill? " but they were silent.
Ke wozi kpi. 5 Esi wòtsa ŋku le wo dzi godoo kple dziku hexa nu vevie le woƒe dzimesesẽ la ŋuti vɔ la, egblɔ na amea be: "Mlo asi. " Eye wòmloe, eye eƒe asi la ɖɔ ɖo.
5 And he looked around at them in anger, grieving over their lumpish-heartedness, and said to the man "Stretch out your hand "; and he stretched it out, and his hand was restored.
6 Ale Farisitɔwo do go, eye enumake wo kple Herodes habɔbɔ me nɔlawo wode adaŋu ɖe eŋu, ne woawui.
6 And the Pharisees went out and at once entered into a plot with the Herodians against him to make away with him.

7 Ke Yesu kple eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo dzo le afi ma yi ƒuta, eye ameha gã aɖe tso Galilea kple Yudea kplɔ wo ɖo. 8 Eye ame gbogbo siwo hã se nu geɖe siwo wɔm wòle la tso Yerusalem, Idumea kple Yordan godo kpakple Tiro kple Sidon nutowo me va egbɔ.

7 And Jesus, with his disciples, retired to the seaside; and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, 8 and from Judea and from Jerusalem and from Idumea and the other side of the Jordan and around Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, hearing how much he was doing, came to him.

9 Eye wògblɔ na eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo be woadi tɔdziʋu sue aɖe ada ɖi na ye, ale be ameha la nagamimi ye ɖo o. 10 Esi wòda dɔ na ame geɖewo ta la, ame siwo katã ŋu dɔléle sesẽwo le la ƒo zi ɖe eŋu be yewoaka asi eŋu.

9 And he told his disciples to have a boat attend on him because of the mass of people, that they might not crowd him: 10 for he had cured many, so that any who had complaints were throwing themselves against him in order to touch him.
11 Eye ɣesiaɣi si gbɔgbɔ makɔmakɔwo gɔ̃ hã kpɔe la, wotsyɔa mo anyi ɖe eŋkume, eye wodoa ɣli gblɔna be: "Wòe nye Mawu ƒe Vi la. " 12 Ke zi geɖe la, edea se na wo vevie be woagana woadze si ye o.
11 And the unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down before him and screamed "You are the Son of God. " 12 And he told them peremptorily over and over not to make him known.
13 Eyi to aɖe dzi, eye wòyɔ ame siwo wòdi la wova egbɔ.
13 And he went up on the mountainside and summoned whom he pleased, and they went to him.
14 Eye wòɖo ƒuƒoƒo aɖe si me ame wuieve le, ena ŋkɔ wo be apostolowo, ame siwo anɔ eŋu, siwo wòadɔ woaɖaɖe gbeƒã, 15 eye ŋusẽ nanɔ wo si ne woanya gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo ado goe.

14 And he appointed twelve to be with him, and for him to send out to make the proclamation 15 and to have authority to expel demons: 16 he appointed the twelve, and gave Simon the other name Peter; 17 and James the son of Zebedee and James’s brother John, and he gave them the other name Boanerges, that is, Sons of Thunder ; 18 and Andrew and Philip and Bartholomew and Matthew and Thomas and James the son of Alpheus and Thaddeus and Simon the Kananee 19 and Judas Iscarioth, the same who was the agent in his arrest.

16 Ame wuieve siwo le ƒuƒoƒo si wòɖo la me woe nye Simon, si wòna ŋkɔe be Petro, 17 Yakobo, Zebedeo vi la, kple Yohanes, Yakobo nɔvi la (ena ŋkɔ ame siawo hã be Boanerges, si gɔmee nye "Dziɖegbeviwo "), 18 Andrea, Filipo, Bartolomeo, Mateo, Toma, Yakobo, Alfeo vi la, Tadeo, Simon Veviedola la, 19 kple Yuda Iskariot, ame si va dee asi emegbe.

And he came back to the house; 20 and the crowd came together again so that they could not even eat a meal; 21 and his family, hearing of it, went out to seize him, for they said he was out of his senses.
Azɔ Yesu yi aƒe aɖe me, 20 eye ameha aɖe gaƒo ƒu ake, ale be eya kple eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo mete ŋu ɖu nu gɔ̃ hã o.
22 And the scribes that had come down from Jerusalem said that he had Beelzebul, and that it was by the head of the demons that he expelled the demons.

21 Ke esi eƒe ƒometɔwo see la, woyi be yewoaɖalée, elabena wole gbɔgblɔm be: "Eƒe tagbɔ le gbegblẽm. " 22 Agbalẽfiala siwo tso Yerusalem va hã le gbɔgblɔm be: "Beelzebul le eme, eye gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo ƒe fia dzie wòtona nyaa gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo. " 23 Eye esi wòyɔ wo va eɖokui gbɔ la, eƒo nu na wo le lododowo me be: "Aleke Satana ate ŋu anya Satana ado goe? 24 Ne fiaɖuƒe aɖe ma ɖe eɖokui ŋu la, fiaɖuƒe ma mate ŋu ali ke o, 25 eye ne aƒe aɖe ma ɖe eɖokui ŋu la, aƒe ma mate ŋu ali ke o. 26 Nenema kee ne Satana tsi tsitre ɖe eɖokui ŋuti, eye wòma la, mate ŋu anɔ te o, ke boŋ eƒe nuwuwue nye ema ɖo.

23 And he called them to him and said to them with parables "How can Satan expel Satan? 24 And if a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot be kept up; 25 and if a family is divided against itself, that family will not be able to stand; 26 and if Satan has stood up against himself and is divided, he cannot stand, but is at an end.
27 Le nyateƒe me la, ame aɖeke mate ŋu age ɖe ŋusẽtɔ aɖe ƒe aƒe me afi eƒe nuwo o, negbe ɖeko wòabla ŋusẽtɔ la gbã hafi ate ŋu aha eƒe aƒe la.
27 But nobody can enter a strong man’s house and plunder it of his goods unless he first binds the strong man, and then he shall plunder his house.

28 Vavãe, mele egblɔm na mi be, Mawu atsɔ nu sia nu ake amegbetɔviwo, eɖanye nu vɔ̃ ka kee wowɔ alo busunya ka kee wogblɔ o. 29 Gake ame si gblɔa busunya ɖe gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔea ŋu la, womatsɔe akee gbeɖegbeɖe o, ke boŋ eɖi nu vɔ̃ mavɔmavɔ ƒe fɔ. " 30 Yesu gblɔ esia, elabena wole gbɔgblɔm be: "Gbɔgbɔ makɔmakɔ le eme. "

28 I tell you verily that the sons of men will be forgiven all their sins, 29 and whatever blasphemies they indulge in, but one who shall blaspheme against the Holy Spirit has no pardon forever, but is guilty of an eternal sin " 30 because they said "He has an unclean spirit. "

32 Ɣemaɣi la, ameha aɖe nɔ anyi ƒo xlãe, eye wogblɔ nɛ be: "Kpɔ ɖa! Dawò kple nɔviwòwo le xexe le diwòm. " 33 Ke eɖo eŋu na wo be: "Ame kawoe nye danye kple nɔvinyewo? " 34 Ekpɔ ame siwo nɔ anyi ƒo xlãe la godoo va kpe, eye wògblɔ be: "Mikpɔ ɖa, danye kple nɔvinyewoe nye esi! 35 Ame sia ame si wɔa Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu la, eyae nye nɔvinyeŋutsu kple nɔvinyenyɔnu kpakple danye. "

31 And his mother and his brothers came and stood outside and sent to him to call him; 32 and there was a crowd sitting around him, and they told him "Here are your mother and your brothers outside looking for you. " 33 And he answered them "Who is my mother, and my brothers? " 34 and, looking around at those who were sitting round about him, he said "Here are my mother and my brothers! 35 for whoever does the will of God, he is my brother and sister and mother. "
Marko
Mark

4 Esi wòle nukua wum la, nuku aɖewo ge ɖe mɔ to, eye xeviwo va fɔ wo mi. 5 Bubuwo ge ɖe kpenyigba dzi, afi si womekpɔ anyi sɔgbɔ le o, eye womie enumake, elabena anyia mede to o. 6 Esi ŋdɔ ʋu la, ŋdɔkutsu ɖu wo, eye woyrɔ, elabena woƒe ke meyi to o.

4 And again he began to teach by the seaside; and a very great crowd gathered to him, so that he got into a boat and sat in it on the sea, and all the crowd were close to the sea on the land; 2 and he taught them much in parables, and said to them in his teaching 3 "Listen: once upon a time a sower went out to sow.

7 Nuku bubuwo ge ɖe ŋùwo me, eye ŋùawo vu tsyɔ wo dzi, eye wometse ku aɖeke o. 8 Ke bubuwo ge ɖe anyigba nyui dzi, eye esi womie la, wotsi, eye wode asi tsetse me, ɖewo teƒe blaetɔ̃, ɖewo teƒe blaade, eye ɖewo teƒe alafa ɖeka. " 9 Eye wògblɔ kpee be: "Ame si to senu li na la, nesee. "

4 And in the sowing one seed fell on the roadside, and the birds came and ate it up; 5 and another fell on the rocky ground where it had not much soil, and came up at once because of not having any depth of soil, 6 and was scorched when the sun rose, and dried up because of not having roots; 7 and another fell in among the thorns, and the thorns grew up and stifled it, and it yielded no crop; 8 and others fell into the good soil and yielded a crop, shooting up and growing, and bore at the rate of thirty and sixty and a hundred. " 9 And he said "Let him who has ears to hear, hear! "

10 Ke esi eya ɖeka li la, ame siwo le eŋu kple Ame Wuieveawo bia nu si lododoawo fia lae. 11 Egblɔ na wo be: "Miawo la, wona miese Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la ƒe nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe la gɔme, ke ame siwo le egodo ya la, nuwo katã le lododowo me na wo, 12 ale be togbɔ be wole nu kpɔm hã la, womakpɔ nu adze sii o, eye togbɔ be wole nu sem hã la, womase egɔme o; eye womatrɔ gbeɖe ne woatsɔe ake wo o. " 13 Egagblɔ na wo hã be: "Miese lododo sia gɔme oa? Ekema aleke miawɔ ase lododo bubuawo katã gɔme? 14 "Nukuwulaa le nya la wum. 15 Ke esiwo le mɔ to afi si wowu nya la ɖo lae nye ame siwo ne wonya se nyaa ko la, Satana vana, eye wòɖea nya si wowu ɖe wo me la dzonɛ.

10 And when he was in private his companions, with the Twelve, asked him about the parables; 11 and he said to them "To you is given the secret of the Reign of God, but for those outsiders everything is in parables, 12 that when they see they may see without perceiving, and when they hear they may hear without understanding, for fear they should turn back and be forgiven. " 13 And he said to them "You do not know this parable? and how are you to make out all parables? 14 The sower is sowing the word; 15 and these are the ones by the road, where the word is sowed, and when they hear, at once Satan comes and takes away the word that was sowed in them.

16 Eye esiwo wowu ɖe kpenyigba dzi lae nye ame siwo ne wose nya la ko la, woxɔnɛ enumake kple dzidzɔ. 17 Gake womelia ke le wo ɖokuiwo me o, ke boŋ wonɔa anyi ɣeyiɣi aɖe ko; eye ne xaxa alo yometiti nya va le nya la ta ko la, wogbea nu le xɔse la gbɔ.

16 And in the same way these are the ones that are sowed on the rocky ground: they who, when they hear the word, at once receive it with joy, 17 and do not have any roots in them but are temporary, and then, when there comes distress or persecution because of the word, are staggered at once.

18 Eye wowu bubuwo hã ɖe ŋùwo me. Woawoe nye ame siwo se nya la, 19 gake nuɖoanyi sia me dzimaɖitsitsiwo kple kesinɔnuwo ƒe amebleŋusẽ kpakple nu bubuawo katã ƒe amedzodzro gena ɖe wo me hevuna tsyɔa nya la dzi, eye metsea ku o.

18 And others are the ones that are sowed in among the thorns; these are they who hear the word, 19 and temporal anxieties and the deceits of wealth, and desires as to other things, step in and stifle the word and it becomes unfruitful.
20 Mlɔeba esiwo wowu ɖe anyigba nyui dzi la woe nye ame siwo sea nya la, eye woxɔnɛ nyuie, eye wotsea ku, ɖewo teƒe blaetɔ̃, ɖewo teƒe blaade, eye ɖewo teƒe alafa ɖeka. "
20 And those are the ones that are sowed on the good soil who hear the word and accept it, and bear their crop at the rate of thirty and sixty and a hundred. "

21 Eye wògagblɔ na wo be: "Ðe wosia akaɖi dana ɖe kusi alo abati tea? Menye akaɖiti dzi boŋ ye wosinɛ dana ɖo oa? 22 Elabena womeɣla naneke, si womava ɖe ɖe go o; eye wometsyɔ nu naneke dzi nyuie, si dzi womava klo nu le o.

21 And he said to them "Does the lamp come that it may be put under the peck measure or under the couch? does it not go on the stand? 22 For there is nothing that is secret except with a view to its being disclosed, nor has anything been concealed except with a view to its being brought to light.
23 Ame si to senu li na la, nesee. "
23 Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear! "
24 Egagblɔ na wo be: "Milé to ɖe nya si sem miele la ŋu nyuie.
24 And he said to them "Look out what you hear.
Dzidzenu si mietsɔ le nu dzidzem na amewo la, eya kee woatsɔ adzidze nu na miawo hã, ɛ̃, woagade edzi na mi akpee.
The measure that you give shall be given to you, and you shall have more added to it.
25 Elabena ame si si nu le la, woatsɔ geɖe akpee nɛ, ke ame si si nu mele o la, woaxɔ nu si le esi la gɔ̃ hã le esi. "
25 For to him who has, more shall be given; and from him who has not, even what he has shall be taken away. "

26 Eye wògagblɔ be: "Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la le abe ale si ame wua nuku ɖe anyigba ene. 27 Eye wòdɔa alɔ̃ le zã me, eye wòfɔna le ŋkeke me, eye nukuawo miena hetsina gake menyana ale si tututu wòdzɔna ya o. 28 Anyigba la ŋutɔ nana nuku wɔna le eɖokui si vivivi: gbã la, aŋgba dona, emegbe eƒoa se, eye mlɔeba etsea ku.

26 And he said "This is the way the Reign of God is: as a man scatters the seed on the ground 27 and sleeps and wakes night and day, and the seed sprouts and stretches up, he does not know how; 28 the ground bears its crops of itself, first blades, then ears, then full grain in the ears.
29 Ke ne kutsetsea tsi ko la, edoa hɛ gobɛ ɖa, elabena nuŋeɣi ɖo. "
29 But when the crop permits he sends in the sickle at once, because the harvest is here. "

30 Eye wògagblɔ be: "Nu kae míatsɔ Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la asɔ kplii, alo lo kae míado atsɔ aɖe eme? 31 Esɔ kple sinapi-ku, si nye anyigbadzinuku suetɔ le eƒãɣi. 32 Ke ne woƒãe la, etsina, eye wòva lolona wu abɔmenu miemiewo katã, eye wòɖea alɔ gãwo, ale be dziƒoxewo tea ŋu nɔa eƒe vɔvɔli te. "

30 And he said "How shall we illustrate the Reign of God, or by what parable shall we set it forth? 31 Like a grain of mustard, which, though when it is sowed in the ground it is the smallest of all the seeds in the ground, 32 yet, when it is sowed, grows up and becomes the largest of all the plants and makes great branches, so that the birds of the air can perch under its shadow. "

33 Aleae wògblɔa nya nyui la na wo to lododo sia ƒomevi geɖewo me, zi ale si woate ŋu ase wo gɔme ko. 34 Le nyateƒe me la, meƒoa nu na wo ne menye le lododo me o, ke ne eya kple eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo ɖeɖe woli la, eɖea nuwo katã gɔme na wo.

33 And with many such parables he spoke the word to them, in a way that they could take in, 34 and did not speak to them without parable; but to his disciples, when they were by themselves, he explained everything.
35 Eye gbe ma gbe, esi fiẽsi ɖo la, egblɔ na wo be: "Mina míayi go kemɛ dzi. " 36 Eya ta esi woɖe asi le ameha la ŋu vɔ la, ekpɔtɔ nɔ ʋua me, eye wokui yii; tɔdziʋu bubuwo hã kpe ɖe eŋu.
35 And he said to them that day when evening came "Let us go over to the other side "; 36 and they left the crowd and took him with them in the boat as he was. And there were other boats with him.
37 Azɔ ya sesẽ aɖe de asi ƒoƒo me, eye ƒutsotsoewo le ŋeŋem ɖe tɔdziʋua me ale gbegbe be esusɔ vie ʋua nanyrɔ. 38 Ke eya ŋutɔ le tɔdziʋua ƒe megbe lɔƒo, ziɔ suɖui, nɔ alɔ̃ dɔm.
37 And there came a great squall of wind, and the waves were breaking over the side of the boat, so that the boat was getting full; 38 and he was in the stern asleep on the cushion.
Eya ta wonyɔe hebiae be: "Nufiala, mètsɔ ɖeke le eme be míeku vɔ oa? " 39 Esi wòfɔ la, eblu ɖe ya la ta, eye wògblɔ na ƒu la be: "Zi ɖoɖoe! Dze akɔ anyi! " Ale yaƒoƒo la tɔ, eye ɖoɖoe zi toŋtoŋtoŋ.

And they waked him and said to him "Teacher, do you not care that we are perishing? " 39 And when he woke up he rebuked the wind and said to the sea "Hush! break off! " and the wind lulled, and there came a great calm.
40 Ebia wo be: "Nu ka tae vɔvɔ̃ ɖo mi nenema gbegbe? Ðe xɔse mele mia si haɖe oa? " 41 Ke vɔvɔ̃ ɖo wo ŋutɔ, eye wobia wo nɔewo be: "Ame ka gɔ̃e nye esia? Yaƒoƒo kple atsiaƒu gɔ̃ hã ɖoa toe. "
40 And he said to them "Why are you so timorous? do you not yet have faith? " 41 And they were greatly frightened, and said to each other "Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him? "
Marko
Mark
5 Eye wova ɖo ƒua ƒe go kemɛ le Gerasatɔwo ƒe anyigba dzi.
5 And they came to the other side of the sea, to the country of the Gerasenes.

2 Esi Yesu ɖi le tɔdziʋua me teti ko la, ŋutsu aɖe si dzi gbɔgbɔ makɔmakɔ aɖe kpɔ ŋusẽ ɖo la do tso yɔdowo dome va do goe. 3 Yɔdoawo domee nye enɔƒe, eye va se ɖe ɣemaɣi la, ame aɖeke mete ŋu blae ɖi alo de kɔsɔkɔsɔ gɔ̃ hãe o. 4 Elabena enuenu wodea kunyowu kple kɔsɔkɔsɔe, gake etsoa kɔsɔkɔsɔawo, eye wòŋea kunyowuawo; eye ame aɖeke metea ŋu kpea edzi o.

2 And when he came out of the boat, at once there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit, 3 who had his residence in the tombs, and whom no one could bind any longer, even with a chain; 4 because he had often been bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been wrenched apart by him and the fetters shattered, and nobody was able to subdue him.
5 Eye ɖaa zã kple keli wònɔa yɔdowo me kple towo dzi henɔa ɣli dom, eye wòtsɔa kpewo nɔa eɖokui sim.
5 And he was all the time, night and day, screaming and hacking himself with stones in the tombs and on the mountainsides.
6 Ke esi wòkpɔ Yesu le adzɔge ɖaa la, eƒu du va dze klo ɖe eŋkume. 7 Eye wòdo ɣli kple gbe sesẽ gblɔ be: "Nya kae le nye kpli wò dome, Yesu, Mawu Dziƒoʋĩtɔ la ƒe Vi?
6 And, seeing Jesus from a distance, he ran and did him reverence 7 and said with a loud scream "What have you to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God?

Tà Mawu nam be màwɔ fum o. " 8 Elabena Yesu gblɔ nɛ be: "Wò, gbɔgbɔ makɔmakɔ, do go le amea me. " 9 Ke Yesu biae be: "Ŋkɔwò ɖe? " Eye wòɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Ŋkɔnyee nye Aʋakɔ, elabena míesɔ gbɔ. " 10 Eye ŋutsua ɖe kuku na Yesu vevie be wòaganya gbɔgbɔawo dzoe le nutoa me o.

I adjure you by God, do not torture me " 8 for he was saying to him "Come out of the man, unclean spirit. " 9 And he put the question to him "What is your name? " and he said to him "My name is Brigade because there are many of us. " 10 And he appealed to him over and over not to send them off out of the country.

11 Ke hawo ƒe hatsotso gã aɖe le afi ma le nu ɖum le toa dzi. 12 Eye gbɔgbɔawo ɖe kuku nɛ be: "Nya mí ɖo ɖe haawo me be míage ɖe wo me. " 13 Eye wòɖe mɔ na wo. Gbɔgbɔ makɔmakɔawo do go yi ɖe haawo me, eye haawo ƒu du kplikplikpli to to la dzi ge dze ƒu la me doo, woanɔ abe akpe eve ene, eye wono tsi ku ɖe ƒu la me. 14 Ke hakplɔviawo sí eye wova gblɔ nya la le dua me kple kɔƒewo me, eye amewo yi ɖakpɔ nu si dzɔ la.

11 Now there was there at the foot of the mountain a large herd of hogs feeding; 12 and they appealed to him with the request "Send us among the hogs, so that we may go into them. " 13 And he gave them permission, and the unclean spirits came out and went into the hogs, and the herd bolted down the steep bank into the sea, about two thousand of them, and were drowned in the sea; 14 and the men who were tending them ran away, and reported it in the city and in the fields, and they came to see what it was that had happened.

15 Wova Yesu gbɔ eye wokpɔ ŋutsu si me gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo ƒe aʋakɔa nɔ la, edo awu henɔ anyi, eye eƒe mo kɔ, ale vɔvɔ̃ ɖo wo. 16 Eye ame siwo kpɔ nu si dzɔ ɖe ŋutsu si me gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃awo nɔ tsã kple haawo dzi la, ka eta na vavalawo. 17 Eya ta woɖe kuku na Yesu vevie be wòadzo le yewoƒe nutoa me.

15 And they came to Jesus and saw the demoniac sitting down, clothed and sane, the one that had had the brigade, and they were afraid; 16 and those who had seen it told them the story of what had happened to the demoniac, and about the hogs; 17 and they began to appeal to him to go away from their territory.

18 Ke esi wòle gegem ɖe tɔdziʋua me la, ŋutsu si me gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo nɔ la ɖe kuku nɛ vevie be yeayi kplii. 19 Gake mena mɔe o, ke boŋ egblɔ nɛ be: "Yi aƒe me le ƒowòmetɔwo gbɔ, eye nàgblɔ nu siwo katã Yehowa wɔ na wò kple ale si wòkpɔ nublanui na wòe la na wo. " 20 Ŋutsu sia dzo hede asi gbeƒãɖeɖe me le Dekapoli tso nu siwo katã Yesu wɔ nɛ la ŋuti, eye wòwɔ nuku na ameawo katã.

18 And as he was stepping into the boat the man who had been demon-ridden appealed to him to let him be with him; 19 and he would not let him, but said to him "Go home to your people and report to them how much the Lord has done for you and what mercy he has shown you "; 20 and he went away and began to proclaim in the Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him, and they all wondered at it.
21 Esi Yesu ɖo tɔdziʋua gatso ƒua va go kemɛ dzi la, ameha gã aɖe ƒo ƒu ɖe eŋu, esime wònɔ ƒua nu.
21 And when Jesus had crossed over to the other side again in the boat, a great crowd gathered about him while he was by the seaside.

22 Ke ƒuƒoƒea dzi kpɔlawo dometɔ ɖeka si ŋkɔe nye Yairo la va, eye esi wòkpɔe la, edze klo ɖe eƒe afɔnu. 23 Eye wòɖe kuku nɛ vevie ŋutɔ be: "Vinyenyɔnuvi dze dɔ vevie. Meɖe kuku, va da asi ɖe edzi bena eƒe lãme nasẽ ne wòatsi agbe. " 24 Eye wòyi kplii, ke ameha gã aɖe dze eyome, eye womimii ɖo. 25 Azɔ nyɔnu aɖe si nɔ ʋusisidɔ lém ƒe wuieve sɔŋ la hã le afi ma.

22 And there came one of the directors of the synagogue, Jair by name; and at seeing him he threw himself down at his feet 23 and appealed to him over and over, saying "My little daughter is at the point of death; come and lay your hands on her to make her get well and live "; 24 and he went off with him, and a great crowd followed him and were pressing against him.

26 Nyɔnu sia kpe fu le atikewɔla geɖewo si me, eye wògblẽ eƒe nunɔamesiwo katã, gake dɔa meka ɖe eme nɛ o, ke boŋ ɖeko wòganyra ɖe edzi. 27 Esi wòse Yesu ŋkɔ la, eto ameha la dome va Yesu megbe, eye wòka asi eƒe awudziwui ŋu, 28 elabena egblɔna le eɖokui me be: "Ne meka asi eƒe awudziwui teti ŋu la, mahaya. " 29 Eye enumake ʋusisi la nu tso, eye wòse le lãme be dɔléle vɔ̃ɖi la vɔ na ye.

25 And a woman who had been having a flow of blood twelve years, 26 and had had a great many things done to her by many physicians and spent everything in her house and got no good from it but rather grown worse, 27 having heard about Jesus, came in the crowd behind and touched his cloak 28 for she said "If I touch even his clothes I shall be made well " ; 29 and at once the trickling of her blood dried up, and she felt that she was healed of her complaint.

30 Enumake Yesu de dzesii be ŋusẽ do go le ye me, ale wòtrɔ le ameha la dome hebia be: "Ame kae ka asi nye awudziwuiwo ŋu? " 31 Ke eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo gblɔ nɛ be: "Èkpɔe be ameha la mimi wò ɖo tso hafi nèle biabiam be, ‘Ame kae ka asi ŋunye?’ " 32 Ke etsa ŋku godoo va kpe be yeakpɔ ame si wɔ nu sia.

30 And at once Jesus, recognizing that the power from him had gone out, turned back in the crowd and said "Who touched my clothes? " 31 And his disciples said to him "You see the crowd pressing against you, and do you say ‘Who touched me’? " 32 And he looked around to see the one that had done that.

33 Vɔvɔ̃ ɖo nyɔnu la, eye wòle dzodzom nyanyanya, elabe enya nu si dzɔ ɖe edzi, eye wòva dze klo ɖe Yesu ŋkume hegblɔ nyateƒea katã nɛ. 34 Yesu gblɔ nɛ be: "Vinyenyɔnu, wò xɔse na nèhaya. Heyi le ŋutifafa me, eye nàhaya tso wò dɔléle vɔ̃ɖi la si me. "

33 And the woman, frightened and trembling, knowing what she had had done to her, came and threw herself down before him and told him all the truth; 34 and he said to her "Daughter, your faith has made you well; go, and good betide you; be well of your complaint. "

35 Esi wògale nuƒoƒo dzi la, ame aɖewo tso ƒuƒoƒedzikpɔla Yairo ƒe aƒe me va gblɔ be: "Viwònyɔnuvi la ku! Nu ka ƒe fue nàgaɖe na Nufiala la? " 36 Ke Yesu se nya si gblɔm wole la, eye wògblɔ na ƒuƒoƒedzikpɔla la be: "Mègavɔ̃ o, wò ya xɔ se ko. " 37 Ke meɖe mɔ na ame aɖeke be wòakplɔ ye ɖo o, negbe Petro, Yakobo kple Yohanes, si nye Yakobo nɔvi la ko.

35 While he was still speaking, people came from the director’s house saying "Your daughter has died; why put the teacher out anymore? " 36 But Jesus, overhearing the words spoken, said to the director "Do not be afraid, only believe. " 37 And he would not let anyone go along with him except Peter and James and James’s brother John.

38 Ale wova ƒuƒoƒedzikpɔla la ƒe aƒe me, eye wòkpɔ be teƒea tɔ zi eye amewo le avi fam hele ɣli dom bobobo. 39 Esi wòge ɖe aƒea me la, ebia wo be: "Nu ka tae miele avi fam ale hena aƒea me tɔ zi? Ðevia meku o, ke boŋ alɔ̃ dɔm wòle. " 40 Ale wode asi ekoko me.

38 And they came to the director’s house; and he saw a commotion, and people weeping and yelling at a great rate, 39 and he went in and said to them "Why are you raising a commotion and weeping? the child is not dead but asleep "; 40 and they laughed at him.

Ke esi wòna wo katã do go la, ekplɔ ɖevia fofo kple dadaa kpakple ame siwo kpe ɖe eŋu la ɖe asi, eye wòyi afi si ɖevia le. 41 Esi wòlé ɖevia ƒe alɔnu la, egblɔ nɛ be: "Talita kumi, " si gɔmee nye: "Nyɔnuvi, mele egblɔm na wò be, ‘tsi tsitre!’ " 42 Enumake nyɔnuvia tsi tsitre eye wòzɔ azɔli. (Nyɔnuvi la xɔ ƒe wuieve.) Eye gbɔgblɔ bu ɖe edzilawo eye wogli kple dzidzɔ.

But he, putting them all out of the house, took the child’s father and mother and those who were with him and went in where the child was, 41 and grasped the child’s hand and said to her "Talitha, kum, " which means "Girl, stand up "; 42 and at once the girl rose and walked (for she was twelve years old), and they were at once seized with great surprise.
43 Ke ede se na wo vevie be womegana ame aɖeke nase nya sia o, eye wògblɔ na wo be woadi nane nɛ wòaɖu.
43 And he charged them over and over that nobody should know of this, and directed that she be given something to eat.
