10 Eye Yesu dzo le afi ma va Yudea ƒe liƒowo dzi le Yordan godo, eye amehawo gava ƒo ƒu ɖe eŋu. Eye abe ale si wòwɔna ɖaa ene la, egade asi nufiafia wo me.
10 And he went away from there and came into the territory of Judea and the other side of the Jordan; and crowds collected around him again, and he taught them again as was his custom.
2 Eye Farisitɔwo ɖoe be yewoadoe kpɔ, eya ta wote ɖe eŋu biae ne se ɖe mɔ na ŋutsu be wòagbe srɔ̃a.
And 2 Pharisees approached him and put the question to him, to test him, whether it is lawful for a husband to divorce a wife.
3 Ebia wo be: "Se kae Mose de na mi? " 4 Woɖo eŋu be: "Mose ɖe mɔ be woaŋlɔ srɔ̃gbegbalẽ eye woagbee. " 5 Ke Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Miaƒe dzimesesẽ tae wòŋlɔ se sia ɖi na mi ɖo.

3 But he answered them "What commands did Moses give you? " 4 And they said "Moses permitted writing a certificate of separation and divorcing her; " 5 But Jesus said to them "It was in view of your obduracy that he wrote you this commandment.
6 Gake tso nuwɔwɔwo ƒe gɔmedzedze la, ‘ŋutsu kple nyɔnu Mawu wɔ woe. 7 Esia ta ŋutsu agblẽ fofoa kple dadaa ɖi, 8 eye wo ame evea woanye ŋutilã ɖeka,’ ale be womeganye eve o, ke boŋ ŋutilã ɖeka.

6 But from the first of the creation he ‘made them male and female’; 7 ‘for this a man shall leave his father and mother, 8 and the two shall become one flesh’; so that they are no longer two but one flesh.

9 Eya ŋuti nu si Mawu bla ɖekae la, ame aɖeke negama eme o. " 10 Esi wogava aƒe aɖe me la, nusrɔ̃lawo bia nyae tso nya sia ŋu. 11 Egblɔ na wo be: "Ame sia ame si gbe srɔ̃a, eye wòɖe bubu la, ewɔ ahasi ɖe nyɔnua ŋu, 12 eye ne nyɔnu aɖe gbe srɔ̃a, eye wòɖe ŋutsu bubu la, ewɔ ahasi. "

9 So let not a man part what God has joined. " 10 And when they got into the house the disciples questioned him again about this; 11 and he said to them "Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery against her; 12 and if she divorces her husband and marries another she commits adultery. "
13 Azɔ amewo kplɔ wo vi suewo va egbɔ be wòaka asi wo ŋu, ke nusrɔ̃lawo blu ɖe wo ta.
13 And they brought children to him to have him touch them; but the disciples rebuked them.
14 Esi Yesu kpɔ esia la, dɔme vee, eye wògblɔ na wo be: "Mina ɖeviawo nava gbɔnye; migaxe mɔ na wo o, elabena ame siawo ƒomevi tɔe nye Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la.
14 But Jesus was offended at seeing it, and said to them "Let the children come to me, do not interfere with them; for to such belongs the Reign of God.
15 Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, ame sia ame si mexɔa Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la abe ale si ɖeviwo xɔa nui ene o la, mate ŋu ayi ɖe eme gbeɖe o. " 16 Exɔ ɖeviawo ɖe eƒe akɔnu, eye wòda asi ɖe wo dzi heyra wo.
15 I tell you verily, anyone who does not receive the Reign of God like a child shall not get into it. " 16 And he took them in his arms and covered them with blessings, putting his hands on them.

17 Esi Yesu do go yina la, ame aɖe ƒu du va dze klo ɖe eŋkume hebiae be: "Nufiala Nyui, nu kae mawɔ be manyi agbe mavɔ la dome? " 18 Yesu gblɔ nɛ be: "Nu ka tae nèle yɔyem be ame nyui? Ame aɖeke menye ame nyui o, negbe ame ɖeka ko, eyae nye Mawu.

17 And as he was going out on the road, one ran up and knelt before him and put the question to him "Good teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life? " 18 But Jesus said to him "Why do you call me good? nobody is good except one, God.

19 Ènya sededeawo ɖe: ‘Mègawu ame o, mègawɔ ahasi o, mègafi fi o, mègaɖi aʋatsoɖase o, mègatafa ame o, bu fofowò kple dawò.’ " 20 Ŋutsua gblɔ nɛ be: "Nufiala, mewɔa nu siawo katã tso nye ɖevime ke. " 21 Yesu kpɔe dũu, eye wòlɔ̃e, eye wògblɔ nɛ be, "Nu ɖeka susɔ na wò: Heyi nàdzra nu siwo le asiwò la, nàtsɔ ga la ana ame dahewo, eye kesinɔnu anɔ asiwò le dziƒo; eye nàva dze yonyeme. " 22 Ke esi wòse nya sia la, elé blanui, eye wòdzo kple nuxaxa, elabena nu geɖe le esi.

19 You know the commandments, ‘Do not commit murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not testify falsely, do not keep back payments, honor your father and mother.’ " 20 But he said to him "Teacher, I have kept from all these ever since my youth. " 21 And Jesus looked at him and loved him, and said to him "You have one shortcoming: go sell everything you have and give the money to the poor, and you will have a fund laid by in heaven; and come and follow me. " 22 But he was dismayed at the words, and went away grieving; for he owned great possessions.

23 Eye Yesu tsa ŋku godoo eye wògblɔ na eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo be: "Aleke gbegbe wòasesẽ na ame siwo si ga le be woage ɖe Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la mee nye esi! " 24 Eƒe nyawo wɔ nuku na nusrɔ̃lawo. Ke Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Vinyewo, aleke gbegbe wòasesẽ be woage ɖe Mawu Fiaɖuƒea mee nye esi! 25 Ele bɔbɔe na kposɔ be wòato abui ƒe vo me wu be kesinɔtɔ nayi ɖe Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la me. " 26 Egawɔ nuku na wo ɖe edzi, eye wobiae be: "Ekema ame ka gɔ̃e ate ŋu akpɔ ɖeɖe? " 27 Yesu kpɔ wo dũu, eye wògblɔ be: "Le amegbetɔwo gbɔ la, manya wɔ o, ke mele nenema le Mawu gbɔ o, elabe Mawu ya tea ŋu wɔa nu sia nu. " 28 Petro gblɔ nɛ be: "Kpɔ ɖa!

23 And Jesus looked around and said to his disciples "What hard work the wealthy will have to get into the Reign of God! " 24 and the disciples were amazed at his words; but Jesus answered them again "Children, how hard it is to get into the Reign of God! 25 it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to get into the Reign of God. " 26 And they were extremely astonished, saying to each other "And who can be saved? " 27 Jesus looked at them and said "With men it is impossible, but not with God, for everything is possible with God. "

Míegblẽ nuwo katã ɖi hedze yowòme. " 29 Yesu gblɔ be: "Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, ame sia ame si gblẽ aƒe alo nɔviŋutsuwo alo nɔvinyɔnuwo alo dada alo fofo alo viwo alo agblewo ɖi le nye kple nya nyuia ta la, 30 akpɔ aƒewo, nɔviŋutsuwo, nɔvinyɔnuwo, dadawo, viwo kple agblewo teƒe alafa ɖeka fifia le ɣeyiɣi sia me hekpe ɖe yometitiwo ŋu, eye le nuɖoanyi si gbɔna me la, akpɔ agbe mavɔ.

28 Peter began to say to him "We here did leave everything and followed you. " 29 Said Jesus, "I tell you verily, there is nobody who has left house or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or lands on my account and the gospel’s 30 but shall receive a hundredfold now in this time, houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and lands, with persecutions, and in the coming age eternal life.
31 Ke ame geɖe siwo nye gbãtɔwo la azu mlɔetɔwo, eye mlɔetɔwo azu gbãtɔwo. "
31 But many of the first will be last, and the last first. "
32 Azɔ wodze mɔ yina Yerusalem, eye Yesu le wo ŋgɔ, eye wòwɔ moyaa na wo; ke ame siwo dze wo yome la le vɔvɔ̃m.
32 And they were on the road, going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus going ahead of them, and they were amazed; and those who followed were afraid.

Egayɔ Ame Wuieveawo ɖe kpɔe, eye wòde asi nu siwo gbɔna dzɔdzɔ ge ɖe edzi la, gbɔgblɔ me na wo be: 33 "Kpɔ ɖa! Míeyina Yerusalem, eye woade Amegbetɔvi la asi na nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple agbalẽfialawo. Woatso kufia nɛ, eye woadee asi na dukɔwo me tɔwo, 34 eye woaɖu fewu le eŋu, woaɖe ta ɖe eŋu, woaƒoe kple atam, eye woawui, gake afɔ ɖe tsitre le ŋkeke etɔ̃ megbe. "

And he took the Twelve with him again and began to tell them the things that were to befall him: 33 "here we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be put into the hands of the chief priests and the scribes, and they will condemn him to death and hand him over to the foreigners, 34 and they will outrage him and spit on him and flog him and kill him, and after three days he will rise. "

35 Eye Yakobo kple Yohanes, siwo nye Zebedeo viwo, te ɖe eŋu gblɔ nɛ be: "Nufiala, míedi be nàwɔ nu sia nu si míabia wò la na mí. " 36 Ebia wo be: "Nu ka dim miele be mawɔ na mi? " 37 Woɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Na be mía dometɔ ɖeka nanɔ anyi ɖe wò ɖusime, eye ɖeka ɖe wò miame le wò ŋutikɔkɔe la me. " 38 Ke Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Mienya nu si biam miele o.

35 And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, went to him and said to him "Teacher, we want you to do for us what we shall ask you. " 36 And he said to them "What do you want me to do for you? " 37 And they said to him "Grant us that we shall sit one on your right hand and one on your left in your glory. " 38 But Jesus said to them "You do not know what you are asking for.
Miate ŋu ano kplu si no ge mala alo axɔ nyɔnyrɔ si xɔ ge malaa? " 39 Woɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Míate ŋui. "
Can you drink the cup that I am drinking, or go under the water that I am going under? " 39 And they said to him "We can. "

40 Gake anyinɔnɔ ɖe nye ɖusime alo miame ya la, menye tɔnye be mana o, ke boŋ ame siwo Mawu dzrae ɖo ɖi na la tɔe. " 41 Esi ame ewo susɔeawo see la, dzi ku wo ɖe Yakobo kple Yohanes ŋu. 42 Ke Yesu yɔ wo va eɖokui gbɔ gblɔ na wo be: "Mienyae be ame siwo wobuna dukɔwo dzi ɖulawo la ɖua aƒetɔ ɖe wo dzi, eye woƒe amegãwo kpɔa ŋusẽ ɖe wo dzi.

And Jesus said to them "The cup that I am drinking you shall drink, and shall go under the water that I am going under; 40 but the sitting on my right or on my left is not mine to give, but belongs to those for whom it has been prepared. " 41 And at hearing of it the ten began to be offended with James and John; 42 and Jesus called them to him and said to them "You know that those who are thought to head the nations lord it over them and their great men domineer over them.

43 Meganɔ alea le mia dome o; ke boŋ ame sia ame si di be yeanye gã le mia dome la nanye miaƒe subɔla, 44 eye ame sia ame si di be yeanye gbãtɔ le mia dome la nanye mi katã miaƒe kluvi. 45 Elabena Amegbetɔvi la gɔ̃ hã meva be woasubɔ ye o, ke boŋ be yeasubɔ, eye yeatsɔ yeƒe agbe ana wòanye tafe na ame geɖewo. " 46 Eye wova ɖo Yeriko.

43 But it is not so among you, but anyone who wishes to be great among you shall be your serving-man, 44 and anyone who wishes to be first among you shall be everybody’s slave; 45 for so did the Son of Man come not to be waited on but to wait on the needs of others, and to give his life as a ransom for many. "

Ke esi eya kple eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo kpakple ameha gã aɖe le go dom le Yeriko dua me la, Bartimeo, (Timeo vi,) si nye nubiala ŋkuagbãtɔ la nɔ anyi ɖe mɔ to. 47 Esi wòse be Yesu Nazaretetɔ lae la, ede asi ɣlidodo me be: "Yesu, David Vi, kpɔ nublanui nam! " 48 Eye ame geɖewo blu ɖe eta be wòazi ɖoɖoe, ke egado ɣli sesĩe wu be: "David Vi lee, kpɔ nublanui nam dzro! " 49 Eya ta Yesu tɔ hegblɔ be: "Miyɔe vɛ nam. " Eya ta woyɔ ŋkuagbãtɔ la gblɔ nɛ be: "Wò dzi nedze eme!

46 And they came to Jericho; and as he was going out of Jericho, and his disciples and a considerable crowd, Bartimeus the son of Timeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the roadside; and, 47 hearing that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out "Jesus, son of David, take pity on me! " 48 And many rebuked him, telling him to be still; but he cried out more and more "Son of David, take pity on me! " 49 And Jesus stopped and said "Call him "; and they called the blind man, saying to him "All right, rise, he is calling for you "; 50 and he, throwing off his cloak, sprang up and came to Jesus.

Tso; ele yɔwòm. " 50 Eɖe eƒe awudziwui ƒu gbe hetso kpla yi Yesu gbɔ. 51 Eye Yesu biae be: "Nu kae nèdi be mawɔ na wò? " Ŋkuagbãtɔ la gblɔ nɛ be: "Raboni, na magakpɔ nu. " 52 Eye Yesu gblɔ nɛ be: "Heyi. Wò xɔse na nèhaya. " Enumake ŋkuagbãtɔ la kpɔ nu, eye wòdze Yesu yome le mɔa dzi.

51 And Jesus answered him "What do you want me to do for you? " and the blind man said to him "Rabbuni, that I may have my eyesight back. " 52 And Jesus said to him "Go; your faith has made you well, " and at once he recovered his sight and followed him along the road.
Marko
Mark

11 Ke esi wogogo Yerusalem, eye wote ɖe Betfage kple Betania ŋu le Amitoa dzi la, edɔ eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo dometɔ eve 2 gblɔ na wo be: "Miyi kɔƒe si kpɔm miele le mia ŋgɔ la me, eye ne miege ɖe eme teti la, miakpɔ tedzivi aɖe le ka me, si dzi ame aɖeke menɔ kpɔ o. Miɖe kae, eye mikplɔe vɛ.

11 And when they were drawing near to Jerusalem, to Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples 2 and said to them "Go to the village opposite you, and at once as you are entering it you will find a colt hitched, on which no man ever yet sat; unhitch it and bring it.

3 Eye ne ame aɖe bia mi be, ‘Nu ka tae miele ka ɖemee?’ hã la, migblɔ be, ‘Aƒetɔ la le ehiãm, eye agatrɔe ɖo ɖa kpuie.’ " 4 Ale woyi, eye wokpɔ tedzivi la le ka me le aƒe aɖe ƒe agbo nu le mɔ to, eye woɖe kae. 5 Ke ame siwo le tsitre ɖe afi ma dometɔ aɖewo bia wo be: "Nu ka tae miele ka ɖem tedzivi la? " 6 Woɖo eŋu na wo abe ale si tututu Yesu gblɔ ene, eye woɖe mɔ na wo wodzo.

3 And if anybody says to you ‘Why are you doing that?’ say ‘The Lord needs it; and he will send it back here at once.’ " 4 And they went, and found a colt hitched at a door, out in the roadway, and went to unhitching it; 5 and some of those who were standing there said to them "What are you doing untying the colt? " 6 but they told them what Jesus told them to, and they let them alone.
7 Wokplɔ tedzivi la vɛ na Yesu, eye wotsɔ woƒe awudziwuiwo ɖo ɖe edzi, eye wòbɔbɔ nɔ edzi.
7 And they brought the colt to Jesus and laid their cloaks on it, and he took his seat on it.

8 Ame geɖewo hã ɖo woƒe awudziwuiwo ɖe mɔa dzi, ke ame bubuwo ŋe atilɔwo tso gbe me ɖo ɖe mɔa dzi. 9 Eye ame siwo le eŋgɔ kple ame siwo le eyome la le ɣli dom be: "Míeɖe kuku, xɔ nɛ! Woayra ame si gbɔna le Yehowa ƒe ŋkɔ me! 10 Woayra mía fofo David ƒe Fiaɖuƒe si gbɔna la!

8 And many spread their cloaks in the road, and others green things that they cut from the fields; 9 and those who went ahead and who followed were crying "Hosanna! 10 blessed is he who is coming in the name of the Lord; blessed is the reign that is coming, our father David’s; hosanna on high! "
Míeɖe kuku, xɔ nɛ, wò ame si le dziƒo ʋĩi! " 11 Eva ɖo Yerusalem heyi ɖe gbedoxɔa me, eye wòtsa ŋku godoo helé ŋku ɖe nu sia nu ŋu, esi fiẽsi ɖo vɔ ta la, eya kple Ame Wuieveawo dzo yi Betania.
11 And he came into Jerusalem and into the temple-precinct; and he looked around at everything, and, the hour being already late, went out to Bethany with the Twelve.
12 Esi ŋu ke, eye wotrɔ tso Betania gbɔna la, dɔ wui. 13 Ekpɔ gboti aɖe si dzi aŋgbawo le la le adzɔge ɖaa, eye wòyi be yeakpɔ ɖa be tsetse aɖe le edzi hã.
12 And when they came out from Bethany on the following day, he felt hungry, 13 and, seeing at a distance a fig-tree with leaves, went to see if he might find anything on it.
Gake esi wòte ɖe eŋu la, mekpɔ naneke le edzi o negbe aŋgbawo ko, elabena gbotseɣi meɖo haɖe o.
And when he came to it he found nothing but leaves; for it was not time for figs.
14 Eya ta egblɔ nɛ be: "Ame aɖeke magaɖu wò tsetse azɔ gbeɖegbeɖe o. " Eye eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo see.
14 And he answered by saying to it "Never again let anyone eat fruit from you "; and his disciples heard him.

15 Eye wova Yerusalem. Le afi ma la, ege ɖe gbedoxɔa me, eye wòde asi nudzrala kple nuƒlela siwo le gbedoxɔa me la nyanya me do goe, emu gaɖɔlilawo ƒe kplɔ̃wo kple ahɔnɛdzralawo ƒe zikpuiwo ƒu anyi, 16 eye meɖe mɔ na ame aɖeke be wòatsɔ naneke ato gbedoxɔa me ayi o. 17 Efia nu wo be: "Menye ɖe woŋlɔe ɖi be, ‘Woayɔ nye aƒe la be dukɔwo katã ƒe gbedoɖaƒe’ oa? Ke miawo mietsɔe wɔ adzodalawo ƒe doe. " 18 Esi nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple agbalẽfialawo se nu si dzɔ la, wodi mɔnu be yewoawui; elabena wonɔ evɔ̃m, le esi eƒe nufiafia nana ameha blibo la ƒe nu kuna la ta.

15 And they came to Jerusalem; and he went into the temple-precinct and began to turn out those who were selling and buying in the precinct, and threw down the money-changers’ tables and the pigeon-sellers’ seats, 16 and would not let anybody carry an article through the precinct; 17 and he taught and said to them "Is it not written ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer for all nations’? but you have made it a robbers’ cave "; 18 and the chief priests and the scribes heard it, and tried to find a way to destroy him; for they were afraid of him, for all the crowd was astonished over his teaching.
19 Esi fiẽsi ɖo la, wodo go le dua me.
19 And when it grew late they went out outside the city.

20 Ke esi wova yina ŋdi kanya la, wokpɔ be gboti la yrɔ xoxo tso eƒe kè me ke. 21 Esi Petro ɖo ŋku nu si dzɔ va yi dzi ta la, egblɔ nɛ be: "Rabi, kpɔ ɖa, gboti si nèƒo fi de la yrɔ! " 22 Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Mixɔ Mawu dzi se. 23 Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be ame sia ame si agblɔ na to sia be, ‘Ho nàyi aɖadze atsiaƒu me,’ eye meke ɖi le eƒe dzi me o, ke boŋ wòxɔe se be nya si yegblɔ la ava eme la, ava eme nɛ nenema.

20 And as they were going past in the morning they saw the fig-tree withered to the root; 21 and Peter recollected about it and said to him "Rabbi, there is the fig-tree that you cursed withered up. " 22 And Jesus answered by saying to them "Have faith in God; 23 I tell you verily that anyone who says to this mountain ‘Be taken up and be thrown into the sea,’ and does not inwardly doubt but believes that what he utters will be done, shall have it so.
24 Esia tae mele egblɔm na mi be, nu siwo katã miedoa gbe ɖa biana la, mixɔe se be miexɔ wo xoxo, ekema woasu mia si.
24 Accordingly I tell you, everything that you pray and ask for, believe that you have got it and you shall have it.
25 Eye ne miele tsitre le gbe dom ɖa la, mitsɔ nya sia nya si le mia si ɖe ame aɖe ŋu la kee, ne mia Fofo si le dziƒowo hã natsɔ miaƒe vodadawo ake mi. " 26
25 And when you stand praying, forgive whatever you have against anybody, that your Father in heaven may also forgive you your offenses. "

27 Eye wogava Yerusalem. Esi Yesu le tsatsam le gbedoxɔa me la, nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple agbalẽfialawo kpakple dumegãwo va egbɔ, 28 eye wobiae be: "Ŋusẽ kae nètsɔ wɔa nu siawo? Alo ame kae na ŋusẽ sia wò nètsɔ wɔa nu siawoe? " 29 Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Mabia nya ɖeka mi. Miɖo eŋu nam, ekema magblɔ ŋusẽ si metsɔ wɔa nu siawoe la na mi.

26 27 And they came into Jerusalem again; and as he was walking in the temple-precinct the chief priests and the scribes and the elders came to him 28 and said to him "By what authority are you doing these things? or who gave you this authority to do these things? " 29 But Jesus said to them "I will put one question to you; answer me and I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.

30 Dziƒoe Yohanes ƒe amenyɔnyrɔ ɖe tsi me la tso loo alo amegbetɔwo gbɔe wòtso? Miɖo eŋu nam. " 31 Ale wolé nyaa kpɔ le wo nɔewo dome eye wogblɔ be: "Ne míegblɔ be, ‘Dziƒoe wòtso’ la, abia be, ‘Ekema nu ka tae miexɔ edzi se o?’ 32 Evɔ atse meble mí míagblɔ be, ‘Amegbetɔwo gbɔe wòtso’ o. "

30 Was John’s baptizing from heaven or from men? answer me. " 31 And they went over the question to themselves, thinking "If we say ‘From heaven’ he will say ‘Then why did you not believe him?’ 32 but shall we say ‘From men’? " they were afraid of the populace, for one and all looked on John as having been a real prophet.
33 Eya ta woɖo eŋu na Yesu be: "Míenya o. "
33 And they answered Jesus "We do not know. "
Ale Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Nye hã nyemagblɔ ŋusẽ si metsɔ wɔa nu siawoe la na mi o. "
And Jesus said to them "And neither do I tell you by what authority I am doing these things. "
Marko
Mark
12 Ede asi nuƒoƒo me na wo le lododowo me be: "Ame aɖe de waingble, eye wòtɔ kpɔ ƒo xlãe, ewɔ wainfiãƒe ɖe eme, eye wòtu agbledzɔxɔ ɖe eme, etsɔe de asi na agbledelawo, eye wòzɔ mɔ yi duta.
12 And he began to speak to them in parables: "A man set out a vineyard, and put a fence round it and dug out a receiver for the wine and built a tower, and rented it to farmers and went abroad.
2 Ke esi nuŋeɣi ɖo la, edɔ eƒe kluvi ɖeka ɖe agbledelawo gbɔ be wòaxɔ waingblea me kutsetse aɖewo tso wo gbɔ avɛ. 3 Ke wolée heƒoe, eye wogbugbɔe ɖo ɖa asi ƒuƒlui.
2 And at the proper date he sent a servant to receive from the farmers some of the produce of the vineyard; 3 and they took him and gave him a beating and sent him off empty-handed.
4 Egadɔ kluvi bubu ɖe wo gbɔ, ke woxlã nu ɖe ta nɛ hedo vloe.
4 And again he sent another servant to them; and they broke that one’s head and insulted him.
5 Eye wògadɔ bubu ɖa, ke wowu eya hã, egadɔ bubu geɖewo ɖa, ke woƒo ɖewo, eye wowu ɖewo hã.
5 And he sent another, and him they killed; and many others, beating some and killing some.

6 Azɔ viŋutsuvi ɖeka le esi, si gbɔ melɔ̃a nu le o. Edɔ eya hã ɖe wo gbɔ gblɔ be, ‘Woasi vinye ŋkume ɖa.’ 7 Ke agbledela mawo gblɔ le wo nɔewo dome be, ‘Ame siae nye domenyila la. Miva míawui, ne domenyinua nazu mía tɔ.’ 8 Ale wolée hewui, eye wokɔe ƒu gbe ɖe waingble la godo.

6 He had one left, a dear son; he sent him to them last, thinking ‘They will have some respect for my son,’ 7 But those farmers said to each other ‘This is the heir: come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours’; 8 and they took him and killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.
9 Nu kae waingbletɔa awɔ? Ava eye wòawu agbledelawo, eye wòatsɔ waingblea ade asi na ame bubuwo.
9 What will the owner of the vineyard do? he will come and kill off the farmers, and give the vineyard to others.

10 Ðe miexlẽ ŋɔŋlɔ sia kpɔ be, ‘Kpe si xɔtulawo gbe la, eyae va zu dzogoedzikpe vevitɔ, 11 Yehowa gbɔe esia tso, eye wònye nu wɔnuku le mía ŋkume’ oa? " 12 Ale wodi be yewoalée, elabena wokpɔe dze sii be yewo ŋue wòdo loa ɖo, gake wovɔ̃ ameha la. Eya ta wogblẽe ɖi dzo.

10 Have you not even read this text, ‘The stone that the builders condemned, that stone has come to be the top of the corner: 11 this was from the Lord, and is wonderful in our eyes’? " 12 And they tried to seize him; and they were afraid of the crowd for they perceived that he had aimed the parable at them and let him go and went away.

13 Emegbe wodɔ Farisitɔwo kple Herodes habɔbɔ me nɔla aɖewo ɖe egbɔ be woalée le eƒe nuƒoƒo me. 14 Esi wova la, wogblɔ nɛ be: "Nufiala, míenyae be ètoa nyateƒe, eye mèdea ame dzi o, elabena mèwɔa nu ɖe ale si ame dzena le gotae la nu o, ke boŋ èfiaa Mawu ƒe mɔ la le nyateƒe me. Ðe se ɖe mɔ be woaxe adzɔ na Kaisaro loo, alo se meɖe mɔ o? 15 Míaxee loo alo mígaxee o? " Esi wòkpɔ woƒe alakpanuwɔwɔa dze sii la, ebia wo be: "Nu ka tae miele mɔ̃ trem nam?

13 And they sent to him some of the Pharisees and the Herodians, to fish for him with talk; 14 and they came and said to him "Teacher, we know that you are truthful and care for nobody, for you do not look at men’s faces but teach the way of God in good faith: is paying taxes to Caesar lawful or unlawful? 15 shall we pay or shall we not? "
Mitsɔ denario ɖeka vɛ makpɔ. " 16 Wotsɔ ɖeka vɛ, eye wòbia wo be: "Ame ka ƒe nɔnɔmetata kple nuŋɔŋlɔe nye esia? "
But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them "Why are you trying tricks on me? bring me a denarius so that I can see it. " 16 And they brought one.
Woɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Kaisaro tɔe. " 17 Eya ta Yesu gblɔ be: "Mitsɔ nu siwo nye Kaisaro tɔ la na Kaisaro, ke nu siwo nye Mawu tɔ la, na Mawu. "
And he said to them "Whose is this portrait and this inscription? " and they said to him "Caesar’s. " 17 And Jesus said to them "Pay what is Caesar’s to Caesar and what is God’s to God. "
Eye eƒe nu wɔ nuku na wo.
And they admired him.

18 Eyome Zadukitɔ siwo gblɔna be tsitretsitsi aɖeke meli o la va egbɔ hebiae be: 19 "Nufiala, Mose ŋlɔ ɖi na mí be ne ame aɖe nɔviŋutsu ku hegblẽ srɔ̃a ɖi eye medzi vi aɖeke o la, nɔvia naxɔ nyɔnua aɖe, ne wòado ƒome ɖi nɛ. 20 Nɔviŋutsu adre nɔ anyi kpɔ.

18 And Sadducees, who say there is no such thing as a resurrection, came to him and put the question to him 19 "Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if one’s brother dies and leaves a widow behind, and leaves no child, his brother should take his widow and set up a posterity for his brother.
Gbãtɔa ɖe srɔ̃, gake medzi vi aɖeke hafi ku o. 21 Eye evelia hã ɖe nyɔnua, gake eya hã ku evɔ medzi vi aɖeke o, eye etɔ̃lia hã nenema ke. 22 Eye wo ame adreawo katã medzi vi aɖeke o.

20 There were seven brothers, and the first took a wife and left no issue at his death, 21 and the second took her and died without leaving any issue behind, and the third in the same way, 22 and the seven left no issue.
Mlɔeba nyɔnua hã ku.
Last of all, the woman died too.

23 Le tsitretsitsia me ɖe, wo dometɔ ka srɔ̃ wòanye? Elabena wo ame adreawo katã ɖee kpɔ. " 24 Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Ðe menye esia tae mieda ƒu le esi mienya Ŋɔŋlɔawo loo alo Mawu ƒe ŋusẽ la oa? 25 Elabena ne wofɔ tso ame kukuwo dome la, ŋutsuwo maɖe srɔ̃ o, eye womatsɔ nyɔnuwo ana be woaɖe o, ke boŋ woanɔ abe mawudɔla siwo le dziƒo ene.

23 At the resurrection, when they rise, which of them will she be the wife of? for the seven had her as wife. " 24 Said Jesus to them, "Is not this why you go wrong, not knowing the Scriptures nor the power of God? 25 for when they rise from the dead they do not marry but are like angels in heaven.

26 Ke le ame kukuwo ƒe tsitretsitsi ŋuti la, ɖe miexlẽ ŋuve ŋuti nuŋlɔɖi si le Mose ƒe agbalẽa me, ale si Mawu gblɔ nɛ be: ‘Nyee nye Abraham ƒe Mawu kple Isak ƒe Mawu kpakple Yakob ƒe Mawu’ la oa? 27 Menye ame kukuwo ƒe Mawue wònye o, ke boŋ agbagbeawo tɔe.

26 But as to the dead, that they are raised, have you not read in the book of Moses, in the part about the bush, how God told him ‘I am the God of Abraham and of Isaac and of Jacob’? 27 He is not the God of dead men but of living men.
Mieda ƒu ŋutɔ. "
You are very far wrong. "

28 Esi agbalẽfialawo dometɔ ɖeka si va afi ma hese woƒe nyaʋiʋlia kpɔe be Yesu ɖo nya ŋu na wo nyuie la, ebiae be: "Se kae nye gbãtɔ le wo katã dome? " 29 Yesu ɖo eŋu be: "Gbãtɔe nye, ‘Oo Israel, see, Yehowa mía Mawu la, Yehowa ɖeka koe, 30 eye nàlɔ̃ Yehowa wò Mawu kple wò dzi blibo, wò luʋɔ blibo, wò tamesusu blibo kple wò ŋusẽ blibo.’ 31 Eveliae nye esi, ‘Lɔ̃ hawòvi abe wò ŋutɔ ɖokuiwò ene.’

28 And one of the scribes, having heard them discussing, approached, knowing that he had answered them well, and put the question to him "Which commandment is the first of all? " 29 Jesus answered "The first is ‘Hear, Israel: our God is the Lord; the Lord is one; 30 and you shall love the Lord your God out of all your heart and out of all your soul and out of all your mind and out of all your strength.’ 31 Second is this: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’

Se bubu aɖeke megali si lolo wu esiawo o. " 32 Agbalẽfiala la gblɔ nɛ be: "Nufiala, ègblɔe nyuie le nyateƒe la nu be, ‘Ðeka koe wònye, eye bubu aɖeke megali o, negbe eya ko,’ 33 eye be woalɔ̃e kple dzi blibo kple gɔmesese blibo kpakple ŋusẽ blibo, eye woalɔ̃ ame havi abe ame ɖokui ene la xɔ asi sãsãsã wu numevɔsa blibowo kple vɔsawo katã. " 34 Esi Yesu kpɔ be eɖo nyaa ŋu nunyatɔe la, egblɔ nɛ be: "Mèle adzɔge tso Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la gbɔ o. "

Another commandment greater than these there is not. " 32 And the scribe said to him "Good, teacher: you say rightly; that he is one and there is no other but he, 33 and to love him out of all one’s heart and out of all one’s intellect and out of all one’s strength, and to love one’s neighbor as one’s self, is more of a thing than all burnt-offerings and sacrifices. " 34 And Jesus, seeing that he answered thoughtfully, said to him "You are not far from the Reign of God. "
Ke ame aɖeke megado dzi bia nya aɖekee o.
And no one dared put any further questions to him.

35 Ke esi Yesu le nu fiam le gbedoxɔa me la, ebia be: "Aleke wɔ agbalẽfialawo gblɔna be David vie Kristo la nye? 36 Evɔ gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe la na David ŋutɔ gblɔ be, ‘Yehowa gblɔ na nye Aƒetɔ be: "Bɔbɔ nɔ nye ɖusime va se ɖe esime matsɔ wò futɔwo ade wò afɔ te. "’ 37 Ne David ŋutɔ yɔe be ‘Aƒetɔ’ ɖe, ke aleke wɔ wònye via? "

35 And Jesus answered, as he was teaching in the temple-precinct, "How is it that the scribes say the Messiah is to be a son of David? 36 David himself says in the Holy Spirit ‘The Lord said to my lord "Sit at my right hand till I put your enemies under your feet "’; 37 David himself calls him lord, and how comes he to be his son? "
Eye ameha gã la ɖo toe dzidzɔtɔe.
And the great crowd listened to him gladly.

38 Eyi eƒe nufiafia dzi gblɔ be: "Mikpɔ mia ɖokui dzi nyuie le agbalẽfiala siwo nɔa awu ʋlayawo me nɔa tsatsam, eye wodina be amewo nado gbe na yewo le ablɔwo me, 39 eye wolɔ̃a ŋgɔgbezikpuiwo dzi nɔnɔ le ƒuƒoƒewo kple bubunɔƒewo nɔnɔ le fiẽnuɖuƒewo la ŋu. 40 Woawoe daa adzo ahosiwo ƒe aƒewo, eye wodoa gbe legbewo ɖa be amewo nakpɔ yewo. Ame siawo ƒe ʋɔnudɔdrɔ̃ asesẽ wu. "

38 And in his teaching he said "Look out for the scribes, who are bound to go in robes and to have greetings in the marketplaces 39 and the first seats in synagogues and the first places at dinners: 40 those who eat up widows’ houses and make a pretense of long prayers these shall receive more of a sentence. "
41 Yesu bɔbɔ nɔ anyi dze ŋgɔ nudzɔɖakawo hele ŋku lém ɖe ale si amewo le ga dem nudzɔɖakawo mee ŋu, eye kesinɔtɔ geɖewo tsɔa gaku geɖe dea wo me.
41 And he sat down opposite the treasury and looked at the way in which the crowd dropped coins into the treasury; and many rich men dropped in a great deal.
42 Eye ahosi dahe aɖe tsɔ gaku sue eve siwo ƒe home le sue ŋutɔ la va de eme.
42 And one poor widow came and dropped in two mites, that is, a farthing.

43 Eya ta eyɔ eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo va eɖokui gbɔ gblɔ na wo be: "Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, ahosi dahe sia tsɔ geɖe de eme wu ame bubu siwo katã va de nu nudzɔɖakaawo me. 44 Elabena wo katã wotsɔ woƒe nu gbogboawo ƒe ɖe ko va de eme, ke eya tso eƒe ahedada me tsɔ nu siwo katã le esi, si nu wòanɔ agbe ɖo la, de eme. "

43 And he called his disciples to him and said to them "I tell you verily that this poor widow dropped in more than any of those who have been dropping into the treasury; 44 for they all of them dropped in part of what they had to spare, but she out of her destitution dropped in everything she had, her whole living. "
Marko
Mark

Womele kpe aɖeke gblẽ ge ɖe kpe dzi le afi sia, si womamu aƒu anyi o. " 3 Esi wòbɔbɔ nɔ Amitoa dzi dze ŋgɔ gbedoxɔa la, Petro, Yakobo, Yohanes kple Andrea ɖeɖe va biae be: 4 "Gblɔe na mí, ɣekaɣie nu siawo adzɔ, eye nu kae anye nu siawo katã ƒe nuwuɣi ƒe dzesi? " 5 Eye Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Mikpɔ nyuie be ame aɖeke nagaflu mi o. 6 Ame geɖewo ava yɔ nye ŋkɔ ɖe wo ɖokuiwo ŋu agblɔ be: ‘Nyee,’ eye woaflu ame geɖewo.

13 And as he was on his way out of the temple-precinct, one of his disciples said to him "Teacher, look what stones and what architecture! " 2 And Jesus said to him "You see this great architecture? there shall not be one stone left on another that shall not be torn down. " 3 And when he was sitting on the side of the Mount of Olives opposite the temple-precinct Peter and James and John and Andrew put the question to him as they were by themselves, 4 "Tell us when this will be, and what will be the sign when all this is to come to its end? " 5 And Jesus began to say to them "Look out that no one deludes you; 6 many will come under my name, saying that it is I, and delude many.
7 Eye ne miese aʋawɔwɔwo kple aʋawɔwɔwo ŋu nyawo la, dzika megatso mia ƒo o; ele be nu siawo nava eme, gake nuwuwu la meɖo haɖe o.
7 And when you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be disquieted; they have to come, but it is not yet the end.
8 "Elabena dukɔ atso ɖe dukɔ ŋu, eye fiaɖuƒe ɖe fiaɖuƒe ŋu; anyigba aʋuʋu le teƒeteƒewo; nuɖuɖu hã ave.
8 For nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom, there will be earthquakes in one place and another, there will be famines; this is the beginning of the birth-pangs.

Nu siawo nye fuɖuame ƒe gɔmedzedze. 9 "Ke miawo la, mikpɔ mia ɖokui dzi nyuie. Amewo akplɔ mi ayi ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒewo, eye woaƒo mi le ƒuƒoƒewo, eye woana miatsi tsitre ɖe nutodziɖulawo kple dufiawo ŋkume le tanye, ne wòanye ɖaseɖiɖi na wo.

9 But look out for your own selves; for they will have you arrested and taken into court, and you will be whipped in synagogues and set before governors and kings on my account, for an attestation to them.
10 Eye ele be woaɖe gbeƒã nya nyui la le dukɔwo katã me gbã.
10 And the gospel must be proclaimed first among all the nations.
11 Ke ne wokplɔ mi yina ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe la, migatsi dzimaɖi le nya si miagblɔ ŋu o; ke boŋ nya sia nya si woana mi le gaƒoƒo ma me la, migblɔe, elabena menye miawoe le nu ƒom o, ke boŋ gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe lae.

11 And when they arrest you and carry you off, do not fret beforehand over what you are to speak, but whatever is given you at the moment, that speak; for it is not you that are speaking but the Holy Spirit.

12 Gawu la, nɔvi ade nɔvi asi be woawu, eye fofo ade vi asi, eye ɖeviwo atso ɖe wo dzilawo ŋu ahana woawu wo. 13 Eye amewo katã alé fu mi le nye ŋkɔ la ta. Ke ame si do dzi va se ɖe nuwuwu la, eyae akpɔ ɖeɖe.

12 And a brother will have a brother arrested and put to death, and a father a child; and children will stand up against parents and have them put to death; 13 and you will be hated by all because of my name; but he who holds out to the end, he will come safe through.

14 "Ke ne miekpɔ ŋunyɔnu si ahe aƒedozuzu vɛ la wòle afi si mele be wòanɔ o la, (nuxlẽla newɔ gɔmesese ŋu dɔ) ekema ame siwo le Yudea nasi ayi towo dzi. 15 Ame si le xɔ ta la megaɖi alo ayi eme be yeatsɔ nane tso yeƒe xɔ me o, 16 eye ame si le agble la nagatrɔ agbɔ be yeatsɔ yeƒe awudziwui o. 17 Baba na funɔwo kple ame siwo le no nam vi le ŋkeke mawo me! 18 Minɔ gbedodoɖa dzi be miaƒe sisiɣi nagadze vuvɔŋɔli me o; 19 elabena ŋkeke mawo anye xaxa si tɔgbi meva kpɔ tso esime Mawu wɔ xexea va se ɖe fifi o, eye etɔgbi megale vava ge ake o.

14 "But when you see the desolating abomination standing where it ought not (let the reader note), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains; 15 let him who is on the roof not go down or in to take away anything from his house, 16 and let him who is in the field not go back to pick up his cloak; 17 and woe to women who are pregnant and nursing in those days! 18 But pray that it may not come in winter; 19 for those days will be a distress such as there has not been from the beginning of God’s creation till now, nor shall be.
20 Le nyateƒe me la, ne ɖe Yehowa metso ŋkeke mawo dzi o la, ŋutilã aɖeke makpɔ ɖeɖe o. Ke le ame tiatiawo ta la, etso ŋkeke mawo dzi.
20 And if the Lord had not cut the days short, no flesh would have come safe through; but because of the chosen whom he had singled out he did cut the days short.

21 "Eye ne ame aɖe gblɔ na mi be, ‘Kpɔ ɖa, Kristo la le afii!’ alo ‘Kpɔ ɖa, eyae nye ema ɖaa!’ la, migaxɔe se o. 22 Elabena aʋatsokristowo kple aʋatsonyagblɔɖilawo ado, eye woawɔ dzesiwo kple nukunuwo bena, ne woate ŋui la, woaflu ame tiatiawo.

21 And then if anybody says to you ‘here is the Messiah in this place,’ ‘here he is in that,’ do not believe it; 22 for there will arise pretended Messiahs and pretended prophets, and they will exhibit tokens and wonders to lead the chosen astray if possible.
23 Eya ta minɔ ŋudzɔ. Mena toklã mi tso nya sia nya ŋu.
23 But you are to look out: I have told you everything beforehand.

24 "Ke le ŋkeke mawo me le xaxa ma megbe la, ɣe ado viviti, eye ɣleti magaɖi o, 25 ɣletiviwo anɔ gegem tso dziƒo, eye woaʋuʋu dziƒowo ƒe ŋusẽwo. 26 Ɣemaɣi la, woakpɔ Amegbetɔvi la le alilikpowo me gbɔna kple ŋusẽ gã kpakple ŋutikɔkɔe. 27 Eye wòadɔ mawudɔlawo ɖa wòaƒo eƒe ame tiatiawo nu ƒu tso anyigba ƒe dzogoe eneawo dzi, tso anyigba ƒe seƒe va se ɖe dziƒo ƒe seƒe ke.

24 "But in those days, after that distress, the sun will turn dark and the moon will not give its radiance, 25 and the stars will be falling from the sky, and the powers in the heavens will be shaken; 26 and then will they see the Son of Man coming among clouds with great power and glory; 27 and then will he send out the angels and gather his chosen from the four winds, from the extremity of the earth to the extremity of the heavens.
28 "Ke misrɔ̃ nu sia tso gboti ŋu: Ne eɖe alɔ fẽwo, eye wònya to aŋgbawo ko la, mienyana be dzomeŋɔli gogo. 29 Nenema kee ne miekpɔ nu siawo le dzɔdzɔm la, minyae be Amegbetɔvi la gogo ʋɔtruawo nu.

28 "But learn from the fig-tree this parable: when its twigs come to turn tender and put out their leaves you know that the summer is near; 29 so you too, when you see these things taking place, are to know that he is near, at the doors.
30 Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, dzidzime sia nu mele yiyi ge akpɔ o, va se ɖe esime nu siawo katã va eme.
30 I tell you verily that this generation shall not pass away until all this takes place.
31 Dziƒo kple anyigba nu ava yi, ke nye nyawo ya nu mava yi akpɔ o.
31 The heavens and the earth will pass away, but my words will not.
32 "Le ŋkeke ma alo gaƒoƒo la ŋuti la, ame aɖeke menyae o, mawudɔla siwo le dziƒo la menyae o, eye Vi la hã menyae o, negbe Fofo la ko.
32 But as to that day or that hour nobody knows, neither the angels in heaven nor the Son, but the Father.
33 Mikpɔ nyuie, minɔ ŋudzɔ, elabena mienya ɣeyiɣi ɖoɖi la o.
33 Look to it, keep on the alert; for you do not know when the time is.

Ena ŋusẽ eƒe kluviwo, ede dɔ asi na wo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe, eye wòde se na agbonudzɔla la be wòanɔ ŋudzɔ. 35 Eya ta minɔ ŋudzɔ, elabena mienya ɣekaɣi aƒetɔ la le vava ge o, eɖanye fiẽ alo zãtiƒe alo do ŋgɔ na fɔŋli alo ŋdi kanya o; 36 ale be ne eva ɖo le vo me la, wòagakpɔ mi le alɔ̃ me o.

34 As a man going abroad, leaving his house and giving commissions to his servants, to each one his work, gave the doorman too a command, to keep awake 35 keep awake then, for you do not know when the master of the house is coming, whether at evening or at midnight or at cockcrow or at morning; 36 lest he should come all of a sudden and find you asleep.
37 Ke nya si gblɔm mele na mi la, amewo katãe mele egblɔm na be: Minɔ ŋudzɔ. "
37 And what I am saying to you I am saying to everybody: keep awake! "
Marko
Mark

14 Azɔ esusɔ ŋkeke eve ne Ŋutitoto kple Amɔwɔ Maʋamaʋã Bolo Ŋkekenyuia naɖo. Eye nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple agbalẽfialawo le mɔnu dim be yewoato ayemɔ aɖe dzi alé Yesu awu; 2 elabena wogblɔ be: "Menye le ŋkekenyuia ɖuɣi o; ɖewohĩ zi ava tɔ le dukɔ la me. " 3 Esi wòle nuɖuƒe le Simon anyidɔléla ƒe me le Betania la, nyɔnu aɖe va do kple alabastrogoe si me ami ʋeʋĩ aɖe, si nye nardomi akuakua, si xɔ asi ŋutɔ la le.

14 And after two days it would be passover and matzoth-time; and the chief priests and scribes were trying to find a way to seize him by trickery and kill him; 2 for they said "Not during the feast, for fear there should be a disturbance among the people. " 3 And while he was in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper, while he was at the table a woman came with an alabaster vial of expensive perfume, nard in pistachio oil.
Eŋe alabastrogoe la ƒe kɔme eye wòtrɔ ami la kɔ ɖe Yesu ƒe tame.
She crushed the vial and poured it over his head.

4 Eye ameawo dometɔ aɖewo do dɔmedzoe gblɔ le wo nɔewo dome be: "Nu ka tae wogblẽ ami ʋeʋĩ sia dome ale? 5 Elabena woate ŋu adzra ami ʋeʋĩ sia wòawu denario alafa etɔ̃ eye woatsɔ ga la ana ame dahewo ɖe! "

4 But there were some who took offense and said to each other "To what purpose has this waste of the perfume been made? 5 for this perfume might have been sold for above three hundred denarii and given to the poor "; and they spoke sternly to her.
Wodo dɔmedzoe ɖe nyɔnua ŋu vevie. 6 Ke Yesu gblɔ be: "Miɖe asi le eŋu.
6 But Jesus said "Let her be; why are you worrying her? she has done a good deed by me.
Dɔ nyui aɖee wòwɔ nam. 7 Elabena ame dahewo le mia gbɔ ɖaa, eye miate ŋu anyo dɔme na wo ɣesiaɣi si mielɔ̃, ke nye ya nyemanɔ mia gbɔ ɖaa o.
7 For you always have the poor with you, and can do good to them when you choose, but me you do not always have.

8 Ewɔ nu si wòate ŋui; edo ŋgɔ si ami ʋeʋĩ na nye ŋutilã hena ɖiɖi. 9 Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, afi sia afi si woaɖe gbeƒã nya nyui la le le xexe bliboa me la, woagblɔ nu si nyɔnu sia wɔ la hã atsɔ aɖo ŋku edzii. " 10 Eye Yuda Iskariot, si nye Ame Wuieveawo dometɔ ɖeka, yi nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo gbɔ be yeade Yesu asi na wo. 11 Esi wose nyaa la, dzi dzɔ wo ŋutɔ, eye wodo ŋugbe be yewoana klosalogae. Eya ta enɔ mɔnu dim be yeadee asi.

8 She did what she had the power to; she scented my body beforehand for burial; 9 and I tell you verily, wherever the gospel is proclaimed in the whole world, what she did will also be spoken of for a memorial of her. " 10 And Judas Iscarioth, the Judas Iscarioth who was one of the Twelve, went off to the chief priests to put him into their hands; 11 and they were glad to hear his proposition, and promised to give him money, and he went to looking for a way to deliver him to them under favorable circumstances.

12 Ke le Amɔwɔ Maʋamaʋã Bolo Ŋkekenyui la ƒe ŋkeke gbãtɔ, si dzi wotsɔa ŋutitotolãa saa vɔe le dzi la, eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo biae be: "Afi kae nèdi be míadzra ɖo na wò be nàɖu ŋutitotoa le? " 13 Ale wòdɔ eƒe nusrɔ̃la eve gblɔ na wo be: "Miyi ɖe dua me, eye ŋutsu aɖe si tsɔ tsize la ado go mi. Midze eyome, 14 eye aƒe si me wòage ɖo la, migblɔ na aƒea tɔ be, ‘Nufiala be: "Afi kae amedzroxɔ si me nye kple nye nusrɔ̃lawo míaɖu ŋutitotoa le la le? "’ 15 Afia xɔ gã aɖe si le dziƒoxɔ dzi, si me woɖo nuwo ɖo xoxo la mi. Midzra afi ma ɖo na nua ɖuɖu. " 16 Eya ta nusrɔ̃laawo do go yi dua me, eye wokpɔe abe ale si tututu wògblɔe na wo ene; eye wodzra ɖo ɖe Ŋutitotoŋkekenyui la ŋu.

12 And on the first day of matzoth-time, when they killed the sheep for the passover, his disciples said to him "Where will you have us go and make the preparations for you to eat the passover? " 13 And he sent two of his disciples and said to them "Go into the city, and you will meet with a man carrying a pitcher of water; follow him, 14 and where he goes in say to the man of the house ‘The teacher says "Where is my room where I am to eat the passover with my disciples? "’ 15 and he will show you a large upper room, ready spread; make our preparations there. " 16 And the disciples went out and came into the city and found what he told them they would, and got ready the passover; 17 and when evening came he came with the Twelve.

17 Esi fiẽsi ɖo la, eya kple Ame Wuieveawo va afi ma. 18 Eye esi wole nu ɖum le kplɔ̃ ŋu la, Yesu gblɔ be: "Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, mi ame siwo le nu ɖum kplim la dometɔ ɖeka adem asi. " 19 Wode asi nuxaxa me hele ebiam ɖekaɖeka be: "Menye nyee o ɖe? " 20 Egblɔ na wo be: "Mi Ame Wuieveawo dometɔ ɖeka si le asi dem agba ɖeka me kplim ye. 21 Elabena Amegbetɔvi la le kuku ge abe ale si woŋlɔe ɖi le eŋuti ene, gake baba na ame ma, si ade Amegbetɔvi la asi!

18 And while they were at the table eating, Jesus said "I tell you verily that one of you will have me arrested, he who is eating with me. " 19 They began to be pained and to say to him one by one "Am I the one? " 20 and he said to them "One of the Twelve, one who dips into the dish with me 21 because the Son of Man goes as is written of him, but woe to that man through whom the Son of Man is put under arrest; it would have been well for that man if he had not been born. "

Ne ɖe womegaxa ame ma dzi o la, anye ne enyo nɛ wu. " 22 Eye esi wole nua ɖum la, etsɔ abolo, yra ɖe edzi, ŋe eme, eye wòtsɔe na wo hegblɔ be: "Mixɔe; esia le tsitre ɖi na nye ŋutilã. " 23 Eye esi wòtsɔ kplu ɖe asi la, eda akpe ɖe eta, eye wòtsɔe na wo, eye wo katã wonoe le enu.

22 And while they were eating he took a cake of bread, and pronounced the blessing and broke it and gave it to them, and said "Take this: this is my body. " 23 And he took a cup, and gave thanks over it and gave it to them, and they all drank from it; 24 and he said to them "This is my covenant blood poured out for many.
24 Eye wògblɔ na wo be: "Esia le tsitre ɖi na nye ʋu, si nye ‘nubabla ƒe ʋu,’ si woakɔ ɖe anyi le ame geɖewo ta.
25 I tell you verily I will drink of this produce of the vine no more till that day when I drink it new in the Reign of God. "
25 Vavã mele egblɔm na mi be, nyemegale wain no ge akpɔ o va se ɖe ŋkeke ma dzi, esime mano wain yeye le Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la me. " 26 Mlɔeba esi wodzi kafukafuhawo vɔ la, wodo go yi Amito la dzi.
26 And they sang the hymns and went out to the Mount of Olives.

27 Eye Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Mi katã miagblẽm ɖi, elabena woŋlɔe ɖi be: ‘Mada nu alẽkplɔla la, eye alẽawo aka hlẽ.’ 28 Ke ne wofɔm ɖe tsitre la, madze mia ŋgɔ ayi Galilea. " 29 Ke Petro gblɔ nɛ be: "Ne ame susɔeawo katã gblẽ wò ɖi hã la, nye ya nyemagblẽ wò ɖi o. " 30 Eya ta Yesu gblɔ nɛ be: "Vavã mele egblɔm na wò be: Le zã sia tututu me la, hafi koklo naku atɔ zi eve la, àgbe nu le gbɔnye zi gbɔ zi etɔ̃. " 31 Ke Petro gate gbe ɖe edzi vevie wu be: "Ne ahiã be maku kpli wò hã la, nyemagbe nu le gbɔwò akpɔ o. "

27 And Jesus said to them "You will all be staggered, because it is written ‘I will strike down the shepherd, and the sheep will scatter’; 28 but after my rising I will go ahead of you to Galilee. " 29 But Peter said to him "Even if everybody will be staggered, yet I will not. " 30 And Jesus said to him "I tell you verily that you today, this night before a cock has crowed twice, will disown me three times. " 31 But he talked and talked, "If I have to die with you I will not disown you "; and so said all of them.

Ame susɔeawo hã gblɔ nenema ke. 32 Azɔ wova ɖo teƒe si woyɔna be Getsemane, eye wògblɔ na eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo be: "Minɔ anyi ɖe afi sia ne mayi aɖado gbe ɖa. " 33 Ekplɔ Petro, Yakobo kple Yohanes ɖe ŋuti, ede asi nuxaxa me vevie eye wòtsi dzi ŋutɔ. 34 Egblɔ na wo be: "Mele nu xam ale gbegbe be ɖeko wòle abe ɖe mele kukum ene. Minɔ afi sia, eye minɔ ŋudzɔ. " 35 Esi wòzɔ yi ŋgɔ vie la, edze klo tsyɔ mo anyi hede asi gbedodoɖa me be, ne anya wɔ la, gaƒoƒo la nato ye ŋu ayi.

32 And they came to an enclosure of which the name was Gethsemane, and he said to his disciples "Sit here while I pray. " 33 And he took with him Peter and James and John, and began to be dismayed and uneasy, 34 and said to them "My soul is sad, deathly sad; stay here, and keep awake. " 35 And he went a little further, and threw himself down on the earth, and prayed that if it was possible the moment might pass away from him, 36 and said "Abba, Father, everything is possible to you: pass by me with this cup.

36 Eye wògblɔ be: "Abba, Fofo, ètea ŋu wɔa nuwo katã; na kplu sia nato ŋunye. Gake menye nu si medi o, ke boŋ nu si nèdi. " 37 Etrɔ va kpɔ wo wole alɔ̃ dɔm, eye wògblɔ na Petro be: "Simon, alɔ̃ dɔm nèlea? Màte ŋu anɔ ŋudzɔ gaƒoƒo ɖeka oa? 38 Minɔ ŋudzɔ, eye minɔ gbedodoɖa dzi be miagadze tetekpɔ me o. Nyateƒee, gbɔgbɔ la le lɔlɔ̃m, gake ŋutilãa ya gbɔdzɔ. " 39 Eye wògadzo yi ɖado gbe ɖa hegblɔ nya mawo ke.

But not what I will, but what you. " 37 And he came and found them asleep, and said to Peter "Simon, are you asleep? were you not able to keep awake one moment? 38 Keep awake and pray, that you may not fall under temptation: the spirit is enthusiastic but the flesh is weak. " 39 And he went away again and prayed, saying the same thing; 40 and again he came and found them asleep, for their eyes were weighed down; and they did not know what answer to make to him.

40 Egatrɔ va, eye wòkpɔ wo wole alɔ̃ dɔm, elabena alɔ̃ bla ŋku na wo, eya ta womenya nya si woagblɔ atsɔ aɖo eŋu nɛ o. 41 Egava zi etɔ̃lia eye wògblɔ na wo be: "Ɣeyiɣi sia mee mianɔ alɔ̃ dɔm ahanɔ ɖiɖim ɖe emea? Esɔ gbɔ! Gaƒoƒo la de! Kpɔ ɖa! Wotsɔ Amegbetɔvi la de asi na nu vɔ̃ wɔlawo. 42 Mitso, mina míadzo. Kpɔ ɖa! Ame si dem asi la gogo. "

41 And he came the third time and said to them "Well, then, sleep and rest; that will do; the moment has come; lo, the Son of Man is given up into the hands of the sinners 42 rise, let us be going; here is the one who gives me up to them, coming right on. "
43 Esi wògale nuƒoƒo dzi la, kasia Yuda, si nye Ame Wuieveawo dometɔ ɖeka la va do, eye ameha aɖe si lé yiwo kple kpowo ɖe asi la tso nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo, agbalẽfialawo kple dumegãwo gbɔ kplɔe ɖo.
43 And at once, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, arrived, and with him a crowd with swords and sticks from the chief priests and the elders and the scribes.

44 Ke ame si dee asi la ɖo dzesi ɖi na wo be: "Ame si magbugbɔ nu na la, eyae; milée, mikplɔe yii eye miaƒe ŋku nanɔ eŋu. " 45 Eye Yuda zɔ tẽe te ɖe eŋu hegblɔ be: "Rabi! " eye wògbugbɔ nu nɛ. 46 Ameawo dze edzi eye wolée.

44 And the one who was giving him up had given them a cue, telling them "Whichever I kiss is he; take him and get him safely away. " 45 And when he came, at once he went up to him and said "Rabbi, " and went to kissing him; 46 and they put their hands on him and took him.
47 Ke ame siwo le tsitre ɖe afi ma la dometɔ ɖeka ɖe eƒe yi heda nunɔlagã ƒe kluvi eye wòkpa to nɛ.
47 But someone of those who were present drew his sword and struck the high priest’s servant and took off his ear.
48 Ke Yesu gblɔ na wo be: "Yiwo kple kpowoe mietsɔ va be yewoalém abe adzodala enea? 49 Menɔa mia gbɔ le gbedoxɔa me gbe sia gbe nɔa nu fiam, gake mielém kpɔ o.

48 And Jesus answered them "You come out as if it were against a robber, with swords and sticks, to arrest me; 49 I had been among you in the temple-precinct day by day teaching, and you did not take me.
Ke edzɔ alea be Ŋɔŋlɔawo nava eme. " 50 Eye eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo katã gblẽe ɖi hesi dzo.
But it is in order that the scriptures may be fulfilled. " 50 And everybody left him and ran.
51 Gake ɖekakpui aɖe si do aklalawu ko la kplɔe ɖo, eye ameawo di be yewoalée, 52 ke egblẽ eƒe aklalawua ɖi hesi amamae.
51 And a young man went along with him, who had a linen wrapper on his naked body; 52 and they seized him, but he ran away naked, leaving the wrapper.
53 Azɔ wokplɔ Yesu yi nunɔlagã la gbɔ, eye nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple dumegãwo kpakple agbalẽfialawo katã va ɖi anyi.
53 And they took Jesus to the high priest’s house; and all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes came together.
54 Ke Petro le eyome le adzɔge ʋĩi heva keke nunɔlagã la ƒe aƒea me ke; eye wònɔ anyi ɖe subɔviawo gbɔ le dzo ƒum.
54 And Peter had followed him at a distance clear into the high priest’s courtyard, and was sitting with the officers and warming himself in the light.

55 Ɣemaɣi la, nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple Sanhedrin blibo la le ame siwo aɖi ɖase si woatsɔ atso Yesu nu la dim, ne woawui, gake womekpɔ ɖeke o. 56 Le nyateƒe me la, ame geɖewo le aʋatsoɖase ɖim le eŋuti, gake wo dometɔ aɖeke ƒe ɖaseɖiɖi mesɔ kple nɔvia tɔ o.

55 And the chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for testimony against Jesus for putting him to death, and did not find any; 56 for a great many were testifying against him falsely, and the testimonies did not tally.

57 Ame bubu aɖewo hã tsi tsitre hele aʋatsoɖase ɖim le eŋu be: 58 "Míesee wògblɔ be, ‘Magbã gbedoxɔ sia si wotsɔ asi wɔe la, eye le ŋkeke etɔ̃ me la, matu bubu si wometsɔ asi wɔe o.’ " 59 Gake le nya sia gɔ̃ hã me la, woƒe ɖaseɖiɖiwo mesɔ kple wo nɔewo tɔ o.

57 And some stood up and testified falsely against him 58 "We heard him say ‘I will tear down this temple made by hands and in three days build another not made by hands’ "; 59 and even so their testimony did not tally.
60 Mlɔeba nunɔlagã la tso ɖe tsitrenu le wo dome hebia Yesu be: "Mèle nya aɖeke gblɔ ge atsɔ aɖo eŋu oa? Nya kawoe nye esi ame siawo tsɔ le nuwo tsomee? " 61 Ke ezi kpi, eye meɖo nya aɖeke ŋu o.
60 And the high priest stood forward and put the question to Jesus "Do you not make any answer? what is it that these are testifying against you? " 61 but he was silent and did not make any answer.

Eye nunɔlagã la gabiae be: "Wòe nye Yayratɔ la ƒe Vi Kristo laa? " 62 Yesu ɖo eŋu be: "Nyee; eye miakpɔ Amegbetɔvi la wòabɔbɔ nɔ Ŋusẽtɔ la ƒe ɖusime eye wòanɔ dziƒolilikpowo dzi gbɔna. " 63 Ale nunɔlagã la dze eƒe awuwo hegblɔ be: "Ðe ɖasefo bubuwo gahiã mía? 64 Miese busunya la.

Again the high priest put to him the question "Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed? " 62 And Jesus said "I am, and you shall see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power and coming with the clouds of the heavens. " 63 And the high priest, tearing his tunics, said "What further need have we of witnesses? 64 you heard the blasphemy, what is your opinion? "
Nya kae le mia si? " Wo katã wobu fɔe be edze ku.
And they all found him guilty and punishable with death.
65 Eye ame aɖewo de asi taɖeɖe me ɖe eŋu, ɖewo hã tsyɔ nu mo nɛ eye wotu kɔe gblɔ nɛ be: "Ne nyagblɔɖilae nènye la, ekema gblɔ ame si ƒo wò la na mí! "
65 And some began to spit on him and to cover up his face and strike him with their fists and say to him "Prophesy! " and the officers received him with slaps.
Marko
Mark

15 Le ŋufɔke ƒe fɔŋli la, nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple dumegãwo kpakple agbalẽfialawo, ɛ̃, Sanhedrin blibo la, de adaŋu, eye wobla Yesu hekplɔe yi na Pilato. 2 Eye Pilato biae be: "Wòe nye Yudatɔwo ƒe fia la? "
15 And at once in the morning the chief priests, with the elders and scribes and the whole Sanhedrin, got their scheme ready and bound Jesus and brought him to Pilate and handed him over to him.

Eɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Eya tututue nye ema nègblɔ. " 3 Ke nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo tsɔ nya geɖewo ɖe eŋu. 4 Azɔ Pilato gabiae be: "Mèle nya aɖeke ŋu ɖo ge oa? Kpɔ nya gbogbo siwo tsɔm wole ɖe ŋuwò ɖa. " 5 Ke Yesu megaɖo nya aɖeke ŋu o, eye wòwɔ nuku na Pilato ale gbegbe.

2 And Pilate put the question to him, "Are you the ‘king of the Jews’? " and he answered him "As you say. " 3 And the chief priests accused him vehemently; 4 and Pilate questioned him again, "Do you not make any answer? see at what a rate they are accusing you "; 5 but Jesus no longer made any answer, so that Pilate wondered.
6 Ke le ŋutitotoŋkekenyui ɖe sia ɖe dzi la, eɖea asi le gamenɔla ɖeka si wobia la ŋu na wo.
6 And every feast-time he used to release to them one prisoner whom they begged off.
7 Ɣemaɣi la, ŋutsu aɖe si woyɔna be Baraba la le gaxɔ me hekpe ɖe aglãdzela bubuwo ŋu, ame siawo wu ame le woƒe aglãdzedze ɖe dziɖuɖua ŋu me.
7 And the man known as Bar-Abbas was in custody with the rioters, who had committed murder in the riot.

8 Eya ta ameha la va do hede asi Pilato biabia me be wòawɔ nu si wòwɔna na yewo ɖaa la. 9 Pilato bia wo be: "Miedi be maɖe asi le Yudatɔwo ƒe Fia la ŋu na mia? " 10 Elabena Pilato nya be ŋuʋaʋã tae nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo de Yesu asi ɖo.

8 And the crowd went up and began to ask for what he used to do for them; 9 and Pilate answered them "Will you have me release for you the King of the Jews? " 10 for he was aware that it was out of jealousy that the chief priests had had him arrested.
11 Ke nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo ƒlɔ dzo ɖe ameha la te be woabia be wòaɖe asi le Baraba boŋ ŋuti na yewo.
11 But the chief priests hounded the crowd on to have him release Bar-Abbas for them instead.

12 Eye Pilato gabia wo be: "Ekema nu kae mawɔ ame si mieyɔna be Yudatɔwo ƒe Fia la? " 13 Wogado ɣli be: "Hee ɖe ati ŋu! " 14 Ke Pilato gabia wo be: "Nu ka tae? Nu vɔ̃ɖi kae wòwɔ? " Ðeko wogado ɣli sesĩe wu be: "Hee ɖe ati ŋu! " 15 Eye esi Pilato di be yeadze ameha la ŋu ta la, eɖe asi le Baraba ŋu na wo; eye esi wòna woƒo Yesu kple atam vɔ la, eɖe asi le eŋu be woahee ɖe ati ŋu.

12 And Pilate answered them again "Then what shall I do with the one that you call the King of the Jews? " 13 but they screamed again "Crucify him. " 14 And Pilate said to them "Why, what harm has he done? " but they screamed more and more "Crucify him. " 15 And Pilate, wishing to satisfy the crowd, released Bar-Abbas for them, but scourged Jesus and gave him in charge to be crucified.

16 Azɔ asrafoawo kplɔe yi nutodziɖula la ƒe fiasãa ƒe xɔxɔnu, eye woyɔ asrafoha blibo la ƒo ƒu. 17 Wodo awu hɛ̃ aɖe nɛ, eye wotsɔ ŋù lɔ̃ fiakuku ɖɔ nɛ; 18 eye wole ɣli dom le gbɔgblɔm nɛ be: "Míedo gbe na wò, Yudatɔwo ƒe Fia! " 19 Eye wotsɔ aɖa nɔ tame ƒom nɛ, woɖe ta ɖe eŋu, eye wodze klo hebɔbɔ nɛ.

16 And the soldiers took him inside the courtyard, that is, the praetorium; and they called together the whole cohort, 17 and dressed him in purple, and braided a wreath of thorns and put it around his head, 18 and began to salute him with "Hail, King of the Jews! " 19 and they beat his head with a reed and spat on him, and got down on their knees and did reverence to him.
20 Mlɔeba esi woɖu fewu le eŋu vɔ la, woɖe awu hɛ̃ la le eŋu, eye wogatsɔ eƒe awudziwuiwo do nɛ.
20 And when they had had their fun with him, they took off the purple from him and put his own clothes on him.
Eye wokplɔe do goe be woahee ɖe ati ŋu. 21 Eye wozi Simon, Kirenetɔ, si tso eme va yina, ame si tso agbleta gbɔna, eye wònye Aleksandro kple Rufo fofo la dzi be wòatsɔ Yesu ƒe fuwɔameti la.
And they led him out to be crucified; 21 and they requisitioned a passerby coming from the country, Simon, a Cyrenian, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to take up his cross.

22 Eye wokplɔe va teƒe si woyɔna be Golgata, si gɔmee nye "Ametakoliƒe. " 23 Wotsɔ wain si wotsaka kple mire la nɛ le afi ma, gake menoe o. 24 Eye wohee ɖe ati ŋu, wodzidze nu ɖe eƒe awuwo dzi be woakpɔ esi ame sia ame axɔ, eye woma wo.

22 And they brought him to the place Golgotha, which means "the Skull place "; 23 and they offered him wine with myrrh in it, but he did not take it; 24 and they crucified him and divided up his clothes, throwing lots over them, who should take what.
25 Gaƒoƒo etɔ̃lia mee wohee ɖe ati ŋu.
25 And it was at nine o’clock they crucified him.
26 Eye woŋlɔ nya si wotsɔ tso enu la be: "Yudatɔwo ƒe Fia La. " 27 Wohe adzodala eve hã ɖe ati ŋu kpe ɖe eŋu le eƒe axawo dzi, ɖeka le eƒe ɖusime, eye evelia le eƒe miame.
26 And the inscription of his offense was written up, "The King of the Jews. " 27 And with him they crucified two robbers, one on his right and one on his left.

28 29 Eye ame siwo to teƒea va yina la dzui, heʋuʋu ta gblɔ be: "Hoo na wò! Wò ame si gblɔ be yeamu gbedoxɔa aƒu anyi ahagbugbɔe atu le ŋkeke etɔ̃ me, 30 ɖe ɖokuiwò ne nàɖi tso fuwɔametia ŋu. " 31 Nenema kee nunɔlawo ƒe tatɔwo kple agbalẽfialawo hã le fewu ɖum le eŋu le gbɔgblɔm na wo nɔewo be: "Exɔ na ame bubuwo; mate ŋu axɔ na eɖokui o! 32 Kristo, Israel ƒe Fia, neɖi tso fuwɔametia ŋu míakpɔ azɔ, ne míaxɔ edzi ase. " Ame siwo wohe ɖe ati ŋu le exa hã do vloe.

28 29 And those who went past taunted him, shaking their heads and saying "Wow! you that were tearing down the temple and building it up in three days, 30 save yourself by getting down off the cross! " 31 In the same way the chief priests too, making fun of him to each other with the scribes, said "He saved others; he cannot save himself! 32 Let the Messiah, the King of Israel, get down off the cross now, that we may see it and believe; " And those who were crucified with him twitted him.
33 Esi gaƒoƒo adelia ɖo la, viviti do ɖe anyigba ma katã dzi va se ɖe gaƒoƒo asiekelia dzi.
33 And when twelve o’clock came there came a darkness all over the land till three.

34 Eye le gaƒoƒo asiekelia dzi la, Yesu do ɣli sesĩe be: "Eli, Eli, lama sabaktani? " si gɔmee nye: "Nye Mawu, nye Mawu, nu ka ŋuti nègblẽm ɖi? " 35 Esi ame siwo le tsitre ɖe egbɔ dometɔ aɖewo see la, wogblɔ be: "Kpɔ ɖa!

34 And at three o’clock Jesus shrieked loudly "Elohí, Elohí, lamá shabaktáni? " which means "My God, my God, wherefore hast thou abandoned me? " 35 And some of those who were present said when they heard it "Hark, he is calling Eliah " [for that was the way Elijah’s name was then pronounced].

Ele Eliya yɔm. " 36 Ke ame aɖe ƒu du tsɔ ƒumekutsa de wain tsitsi me, etsɔe ɖo aɖa nu, eye wòtsɔe nɛ be wòano hegblɔ be: "Miɖe asi le eŋu! Mina míakpɔe ɖa be Eliya ava ɖee le atia ŋu hã. " 37 Ke Yesu do ɣli sesĩe, eye wòku. 38 Eye gbedoxɔmetsovɔ la dze ɖe eve tso etame va se ɖe egɔme.

36 And somebody ran and filled a sponge with vinegar and stuck it on a reed, and offered him the drink, saying "Just let us see if Elijah is coming to take him down. " 37 And Jesus uttered a loud cry and expired; 38 and the curtain of the temple split in two from top to bottom.
39 Ke esi asrafomegã si le tsitre dze ŋgɔe la kpɔ nu siwo dzɔ hafi wòku la, egblɔ be: "Mawu ƒe Vie ame sia nye vavã. "
39 And at seeing that he expired like that, the centurion who was there standing across the way from him said "This man positively was the son of God. "

40 Nyɔnu aɖewo hã le adzɔge le nu kpɔm, wo dometɔ aɖewoe nye Maria Magdalatɔ kple Maria, si nye Yakobo Suetɔ kple Yose dada, kpakple Salome; 41 ame siawoe kplɔnɛ ɖo hesubɔnɛ esime wònɔ Galilea, eye nyɔnu bubu geɖe siwo kplɔe ɖo va Yerusalem hã kpe ɖe wo ŋu.

40 And there were also women looking on from a distance; among them Mary the Magdalene, and Mary the mother of little James and of Jose, and Salome, 41 those who when he was in Galilee followed him and supplied his needs, and many others who had come up to Jerusalem with him.

42 Ke le fiẽ me, esi wònye Dzadzraɖoŋkeke si nye ŋkeke si doa ŋgɔ na Sabat la ta la, 43 Yosef si tso Arimatia, ame si nye Adaŋudeha la me tɔ xɔŋkɔ aɖe la va, ame si ŋutɔ hã le Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la lalam. Edo dzi yi Pilato gbɔ ɖabia Yesu ƒe kukua.

42 And when evening had now come, since it was Friday, the day before the sabbath, 43 Joseph of Arimathea, a member of the Sanhedrin and a man of high standing in the community, who was himself watching for the Reign of God, plucked up courage to go into Pilate’s presence and ask for Jesus’s body.
44 Ke Pilato di be yeanya ne eku xoxo, eya ta eyɔ asrafomegãa hebiae se be ɖe Yesu ku xoxo mahã. 45 Eye esi asrafomegã la ɖo kpe edzi nɛ la, eɖe mɔ na Yosef be wòaxɔ ame kukua.

44 And Pilate wondered that he should be already dead, and called in the centurion and questioned him as to whether he had been dead long; 45 and, having found this out from the centurion, he presented Joseph with the corpse.
46 Eya ta eƒle aklala biɖibiɖi, eye wòɖe Yesu le atia ŋu, exatsa aklala biɖibiɖi la ɖe eŋu, eye wòtsɔe mlɔ yɔdo si woɖe ɖe agakpe me la me; eye wòmli kpe xe yɔdoa nu.
46 And he bought a linen wrapper and took him down and did him up in the wrapper and placed him in a tomb that had been cut out of a rock, and rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
47 Ke Maria Magdalatɔ kple Maria, Yose dada, kpɔtɔ nɔ afi si wotsɔe mlɔ kpɔm.
47 And Mary the Magdalene and Jose’s Mary saw where he was laid.

Mark

16 Eya ta esi Sabat la va yi vɔ la, Maria Magdalatɔ kple Maria si nye Yakobo dada kpakple Salome woƒle atike ʋeʋĩwo be yewoayi aɖasi na Yesu ƒe kukua. 2 Eye le kwasiɖaa ƒe ŋkeke gbãtɔ ƒe ŋdi kanya esi agu dze la, wova yɔdo la to.

16 And when the sabbath was over, Mary the Magdalene and James’s Mary and Salome bought spices to come and anoint him; 2 and extremely early on the first day of the week they came to the tomb when the sun was up.
3 Eye wonɔ wo nɔewo biam be: "Ame kae amli kpea ɖa le yɔdoa nu na mí? " 4 Ke esi wofɔ kɔ dzi la, wokpɔe be womli kpea ɖa xoxo, togbɔ be elolo ŋutɔ hã.
3 And they were saying to each other "Who will roll away the stone for us from the door of the tomb? " 4 and they looked up and saw that the stone was rolled back. For it was very large.
5 Esi woge ɖe yɔdoa me la, wokpɔ ɖekakpui aɖe wòbɔbɔ nɔ ɖusime le awu ʋlaya ɣi me, eye dzidzi ƒo wo.
5 And they entered the tomb and saw a young man sitting on the right, clad in a white robe; and they were dismayed.
6 Egblɔ na wo be: "Dzidzi megaƒo mi o.
6 But he said to them "Do not be dismayed; you are looking for Jesus the Nazarene, the one who was crucified; he has risen, he is not here; there is the place where they laid him.
Menya be Yesu Nazaretetɔ si wohe ɖe ati ŋu la dim miele.
And they said nothing to anybody, for they were afraid.
Wofɔe ɖe tsitre. Mele afi sia o.
A WRITING SAID TO BE BY ELDER ARISTON; THE VERSES ARE NUMBERED AS PART OF THE SIXTEENTH CHAPTER OF MARK
Mikpɔ afi si wotsɔe mlɔ la ɖa! 7 Ke miheyi ɖagblɔ na eƒe nusrɔ̃lawo kple Petro be, ‘Edze mia ŋgɔ yina Galilea.
9 And, having risen on the first day of the week early in the morning, he appeared first to Mary the Magdalene, from whom he had expelled seven demons.
Afi mae miakpɔe le, abe ale si wògblɔe na mi ene.’ " 8 Eye esi wodo go la, wode afɔ du me tso yɔdo la gbɔ, henɔ dzodzom nyanyanya kple vɔvɔ̃ gã aɖe.
10 She, going to those who had been with him, reported it to them as they were mourning and weeping; 11 and they, hearing that he was alive and had been seen by her, disbelieved.
Eye womegblɔ nya aɖeke na ame aɖeke o, elabena vɔvɔ̃ lé wo.
15 And he said to them "Go into the entire world and proclaim the gospel to all the creation.
Luka
Luke

1 Mekpɔe be ame geɖewo dze agbagba ŋlɔ nu tso nudzɔdzɔ ŋutɔŋutɔ siwo dzi míexɔ se bliboe la ŋu, 2 abe ale si ko ame siwo kpɔ nu siawo teƒe kple ŋku le gɔmedzedzea me eye wozu nya la ƒe dɔlawo la gblɔe na mí ene. 3 Eya ta meku nuwo katã me tsitotsito tso gɔmedzedzea me, eye nye hã meɖoe be maŋlɔ wo ɖe ɖoɖo nu aɖo ɖe wò, bubutɔ Teofilo, 4 ale be nàkpɔ kpeɖodzi be nyateƒee nu siwo wofia wò la nye.

1 Theophilus, inasmuch as many have undertaken to recite the things that have been consummated among us 2 as those who from the first had been eyewitnesses and agents of the word delivered them to us, 3 I also, having followed up everything accurately from the beginning, have resolved to write it for your excellency consecutively, 4 that you might be acquainted with the certainties about the matters in which you were instructed.
5 Nunɔla aɖe nɔ anyi le Yudea-fia Herodes ŋɔli, eŋkɔe nye Zakariya eye wòtso Abiya ƒe hatsotso la me. Eɖe Aron vinyɔnuwo dometɔ ɖeka, si ŋkɔe nye Elizabet.
5 There was in the days of Herod king of Palestine a certain priest, by name Zachariah, of the course of Abijah; and he had a wife from among the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elisabeth.
6 Wo ame evea siaa nye ame dzɔdzɔewo le Mawu ŋkume, eye wowɔna ɖe Yehowa ƒe sewo kple ɖoɖowo katã dzi mokakamanɔŋui.
6 And both of them were upright before God, going by all the Lord’s commandments and prescriptions irreproachably.
7 Ke vi mele wo si o, elabena Elizabet tsi ko, eye wo kple evea wotsi xɔ ƒe geɖe.
7 And they had no child, as Elisabeth was barren and both were advanced in years.

8 Ke esi wòɖo woƒe hatsotsoa dzi, eye Zakariya le nunɔladɔ wɔm le Mawu ŋkume 9 abe ale si wòle le nunɔlawo ƒe ɖoɖoa nu ene la, eɖo Zakariya dzi be wòage ɖe Yehowa ƒe gbedoxɔa me ado dzudzɔ ʋeʋĩ. 10 Ameha blibo la le gbe dom ɖa le xexe le gaƒoƒo si me wòle dzudzɔa dom. 11 Eye Yehowa ƒe dɔla ɖe eɖokui fiae hele tsitre ɖe dzudzɔdomlekpuia ƒe ɖusime.

8 And when he was performing his priestly functions before God 9 in the order of his course, in the customary drawing of lots for the priestly service it fell to him to go into the temple of the Lord and burn incense; 10 and the whole body of the people were praying outside at the hour of the incense-burning; 11 and there appeared to him an angel of the Lord standing on the right of the altar of incense.
12 Esi Zakariya kpɔe la, eɖi vo, eye vɔvɔ̃ ɖoe.
12 And Zachariah was alarmed at the sight, and fear fell upon him.

17 Azɔ hã adze Mawu ŋgɔ ava le Eliya ƒe gbɔgbɔ kple ŋusẽ me, be wòatrɔ fofowo ƒe dzi ɖe viwo ŋu, eye wòatrɔ ame maɖotowo ɖe ame dzɔdzɔewo ƒe nunya vavãtɔ ŋu, be wòadzra dukɔ la ɖo ɖi wòasu te na Yehowa. "

13 But the angel said to him "Do not be afraid, Zachariah, because your petition has been listened to, and your wife Elisabeth shall bear you a son, and you shall name him John; 14 and you shall have joy and gladness, and many shall be glad at his birth.

18 Eye Zakariya bia mawudɔla la be: "Aleke mawɔ aka ɖe nu sia dzi? Elabena meku amegã, eye srɔ̃nye hã tsi xɔ ƒe geɖe. " 19 Mawudɔla la ɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Nyee nye Gabriel, ame si nɔa tsitre ɖe Mawu ŋkume, edɔm be mava ƒo nu kpli wò, eye magblɔ nya nyui la na wò. 20 Ke kpɔ ɖa, wò aɖe atu, eye màgate ŋu aƒo nu o, va se ɖe gbe si gbe nu siawo va eme, elabena mèxɔ nye nya siwo le eme va ge le woƒe ɣeyiɣi ɖoɖi dzi la dzi se o. " 21 Le ɣeyiɣi ma katã me la, dukɔ la le Zakariya lalam, eye wòwɔ nuku na wo be etsi gbedoxɔa me nenema gbegbe. 22 Esi wòdo go la, mete ŋu ƒo nu na wo o, eye wodze sii be ekpɔ nu wɔnuku aɖe le gbedoxɔa me.

15 For he shall be a great man before the Lord, and shall not drink wine or beer, and shall be filled with Holy Spirit from his very birth; 16 and many of the sons of Israel shall he bring back to the Lord their God; 17 he shall go before him with Elijah’s power and spirit, to bring the hearts of fathers back to their children and disobedient men into the mind of the upright, to get ready for the Lord a prepared people. " 18 And Zachariah said to the angel "By what shall I know this? for I am an old man, and my wife advanced in years. " 19 And the angel answered him "I am Gabriel who attend on God, and I was sent to speak to you and bring you this word; 20 and lo, you shall be silent and not able to speak till the day that this comes to pass, for your not believing my words, which shall be fulfilled in their time. " 21 And the people were expecting Zachariah to come out, and wondering at his staying late in the temple; 22 but when he came out he could not speak to them, and they recognized that he had seen a manifestation in the temple.
Eye wòle dzesi wɔm na wo, ke mete ŋu le nu ƒom o.
And he communicated with them by signs, and remained dumb.
23 Esi eƒe subɔsubɔdɔ kɔkɔea ƒe ŋkekeawo wu enu la, edzo yi aƒe me.
23 And when his days of service were full, he went home.

24 Le ŋkeke aɖewo megbe la, srɔ̃a Elizabet fɔ fu, eye wòɣla eɖokui ɣleti atɔ̃ sɔŋ hegblɔ be: 25 "Aleae Yehowa wɔ nu ɖe ŋunye le ŋkeke siawo me. Etrɔ susu ɖe ŋunye be yeaɖe nye ŋukpe ɖa le amewo dome. "

24 And after these days his wife Elisabeth conceived, and secluded herself five months, saying 25 "Thus has the Lord done to me in the days in which he turned his eye to remove my disgrace among men. "

26 Le eƒe fufɔfɔ ƒe ɣleti adelia me la, Mawu dɔ eƒe dɔla Gabriel ɖe Galilea du si woyɔna be Nazaret me, 27 ɖe ɖetugbui leaƒe aɖe si ŋugbe wodo na ŋutsu aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Yosef, tso David ƒe me la gbɔ, eye ɖetugbui leaƒe la ŋkɔe nye Maria.

26 And in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city in Galilee whose name was Nazareth, 27 to a maiden engaged to a man whose name was Joseph, of the family of David; and the maiden’s name was Mary.
28 Esi mawudɔla la va egbɔ la, egblɔ be: "Medo gbe na wò, wò, ame si nu wove ŋutɔ, Yehowa li kpli wò. " 29 Ke eɖi vo ŋutɔ le nya la ŋuti, eye wòbu tame le nu si gbedoname sia fia la ŋu.
28 And he came in where she was and said "Hail, maiden highly favored, the Lord be with you "; 29 and she was disconcerted at the words, and wondered what sort of salutation that was.
30 Eye mawudɔla la gblɔ nɛ be: "Mègavɔ̃ o, Maria, elabena Mawu ve nuwò. 31 Kpɔ ɖa, èle fu fɔ ge adzi ŋutsuvi, eye nàna ŋkɔe be Yesu.
30 And the angel said to her "Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God; 31 and lo, you will conceive and bear a son, and you will name him Jesus.

32 Eya anye gã, eye woayɔe be Dziƒoʋĩtɔ la ƒe Vi, eye Yehowa Mawu atsɔ fofoa David ƒe fiazikpui la anɛ, 33 aɖu fia ɖe Yakob ƒe aƒe la dzi tegbee, eye nuwuwu manɔe na eƒe Fiaɖuƒe la o. " 34 Ke Maria bia mawudɔla la be: "Aleke nu sia ate ŋu ava eme esi nyemenya ŋutsu o? " 35 Mawudɔla la ɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe ava dziwò, eye Dziƒoʋĩtɔ la ƒe ŋusẽ ado vɔvɔli ɖe dziwò. Eya ta woayɔ vi si dzi ge nàla la be kɔkɔetɔ, Mawu ƒe Vi.

32 He will be great, and will be called the son of the Most High, and the Lord God will give him the throne of his father David; 33 and he will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and there will be no end to his reign. " 34 And Mary said to the angel "How is this to be, since I do not know man? " 35 and the angel answered her "The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you; wherefore what is born will be called holy too, the Son of God.

36 Eye kpɔ ɖa, wò ƒometɔ Elizabet si ku nyagã la hã fɔ fu le ŋutsuvi dzi ge, eye esiae nye ɣleti adelia na eya ame si woyɔna be konɔ la; 37 elabena Mawu ƒe nya aɖeke mado kpo emevava o. " 38 Eye Maria gblɔ be: "Kpɔ ɖa, Yehowa ƒe dɔlanyɔnue menye!

36 And lo, your kinswoman Elisabeth has herself conceived a son also in her old age, and this is her sixth month, she who was called barren; 37 for from God nothing will be impossible. " 38 And Mary said "Here I am, the Lord’s property; be it with me according to your word. "
Neva eme nam le wò nya la nu. "
And the angel left her.
Ale mawudɔla la dzo le egbɔ. 39 Ale le ŋkeke mawo me la, Maria tso eye wòɖe abla yi tonuto la me le Yuda du aɖe me, 40 eye wòge ɖe Zakariya ƒe me hedo gbe na Elizabet.
39 And during those days Mary started out and took her way in haste to the highlands, to a city in Judah, 40 and came into Zachariah’s house and greeted Elisabeth.

41 Ke esi Elizabet se Maria ƒe gbedonamea la, vidzĩ la ti kpo le eƒe dɔ me, eye gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe yɔ Elizabet fũu 42 eye wòdo ɣli gblɔ be: "Woayra wò le nyɔnuwo dome, eye woayra wò dɔmevi la! 43 Aleke wòdzɔe be mɔnukpɔkpɔ sia su asinye be nye Aƒetɔ dada va gbɔnye? 44 Kpɔ ɖa, esi mese wò gbedoname ko la, vidzĩ la ti kpo le nye dɔ me kple dzidzɔ.

41 And when Elisabeth heard Mary’s greeting the child leaped in her body, and Elisabeth was filled with Holy Spirit 42 and gave a great shout and said "Blessed are you among women, and blessed the fruit of your body! 43 And to what do I owe this, that the mother of my Lord should come to me? 44 for here the child leaped in my body for glee when the sound of your greeting came into my ears.
45 Eye dzidzɔtɔe nye nyɔnu si xɔe se, elabena nya siwo wogblɔ nɛ tso Yehowa gbɔ la, ava eme bliboe. "
45 And happy is she who believed that there would be an accomplishment of what she had been told from the Lord. " 46 And Mary said
46 Eye Maria gblɔ be: "Nye luʋɔ le Yehowa dom ɖe dzi, 47 eye nye gbɔgbɔ mate ŋu adzudzɔ aseyetsotso ɖe Mawu, nye Xɔla la ŋu o, 48 elabe ekpɔ eƒe dɔlanyɔnu ƒe ame gblɔe nyenye ɖa.
"My soul is magnifying the Lord, 47 And my spirit exults in God my Savior, 48 Because he has taken notice of his servant’s obscurity.
Elabena kpɔ ɖa, tso fifia la, dzidzimewo katã ayɔm be dzidzɔtɔ, 49 elabena Ŋusẽtɔ la wɔ nu dzɔtsuwo nam, eye eƒe ŋkɔ le kɔkɔe, 50 eƒe nublanuikpɔkpɔ le ame siwo vɔ̃nɛ la dzi tso dzidzime yi dzidzime.
For lo, henceforth all generations shall celebrate my happy lot, 49 Because the Mighty One has done great things for me, The Mighty One, and holy is his name,
51 Etsɔ eƒe alɔ wɔ nu dzɔtsuwo, eka ame siwo doa wo ɖokuiwo ɖe dzi le woƒe dzimesusuwo me la hlẽ.
50 And his mercy is to generations and generations for those who fear him. 51 He has done mightily with his arm,
52 Eɖe ŋusẽtɔwo ɖa le zi dzi, eye wòdo ame tsɛwo ɖe dzi; 53 etsɔ nu nyuiwo ɖi ƒo na dɔwuitɔwo taŋ, ke edo mɔ kesinɔtɔwo ya asi ƒuƒlui.
He has scattered men proud in inward thought, 52 Brought potentates down from their thrones and set lowly men on high, 53 Filled hungry men with good things and sent rich men away empty.

54 Ekpe ɖe eƒe subɔla Israel ŋu, eye wòɖo ŋku eƒe nublanuikpɔkpɔ nɛ 55 tegbee la dzi, abe ale si wògblɔe na mía tɔgbuiwo, na Abraham kple eƒe dzidzimevi la ene la dzi. " 56 Maria nɔ egbɔ anɔ abe ɣleti etɔ̃ ene, eye wòtrɔ yi aƒe.
55 as he told our fathers, To Abraham and his issue forever. " 56 And Mary stayed with her about three months, and returned to her home.
57 Ke Elizabet ƒe vidziɣi ɖo, eye wòdzi ŋutsuvi.
57 And Elisabeth came to her full time for bearing, and had a son.
58 Eƒe aƒelikawo kple ƒometɔwo se be Yehowa kpɔ nublanui nɛ geɖe ŋutɔ, eye wokpɔ dzidzɔ kplii.
58 And her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown great mercy to her, and they rejoiced with her.

59 Le ŋkeke enyia gbe la, wova be woatso aʋa na ɖevi la, eye wodi be yewoatsɔ fofoa Zakariya ŋkɔ nɛ. 60 Gake dadaa gblɔ be: "Gbeɖe, ke boŋ woayɔe be Yohanes. " 61 Eye wogblɔ nɛ be: "Wò ƒometɔ aɖeke metsɔ ŋkɔ sia kpɔ o ɖe! " 62 Eye wowɔ dzesi na fofoa biae be ŋkɔ kae wòdi be woatsɔ na ɖevi la hã.

59 And on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and were naming him Zachariah after his father; 60 and his mother answered "No, he is to be named John. " 61 And they said to her "There is no one in your family who bears that name "; 62 and they made signs to his father to know what name he would wish to have given him.
63 Eya ta ebia be woatsɔ nuŋlɔkpe na ye, eye wòŋlɔ ɖe edzi be: "Eŋkɔe nye Yohanes. "
63 And he asked for a tablet and wrote "His name is John "; and they all wondered.
Esia wɔ moyaa na wo katã. 64 Enumake eƒe nu ʋu, eye eƒe aɖeka ɖɔ ɖo, eye wòde asi nuƒoƒo me hele Mawu kafum.
64 And immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue liberated, and he spoke, blessing God.

65 Ale vɔvɔ̃ ɖo woƒe aƒelikawo katã, eye amewo ƒo nu le nu siawo ŋu le Yudea tonuto blibo la katã me. 66 Eye ame siwo katã see la lé nya siawo ɖe woƒe dzi me le gbɔgblɔm be: "Nu ka gɔ̃e ɖevi sia ava zu? " Elabena Yehowa ƒe asi le ɖevi la dzi vavã.

65 And fear came upon all who lived in the neighborhood; and in all the highland of Judea all these matters were talked of, 66 and all who heard them laid them up in their hearts, saying "What, then, will this child be? " for the Lord’s hand was with him.

67 Eye gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe yɔ fofoa Zakariya fũu wògblɔ nya ɖi be: 68 "Woakafu Yehowa, Israel ƒe Mawu la, elabena etrɔ susu ɖe eƒe amewo ŋu, eye wòɖe wo. 69 Ena xɔxɔ ƒe dzo do na mí le eƒe subɔla David ƒe me, 70 abe ale si ko wògblɔ to eƒe blemanyagblɔɖila kɔkɔewo dzi 71 be yeaɖe mí tso míaƒe ketɔwo kple ame siwo katã lé fu mí la si me; 72 yeakpɔ nublanui le mía tɔgbuiwo ta, eye yeaɖo ŋku yeƒe nubabla kɔkɔe la dzi ene. 73 Esiae nye atam si wòka na mía tɔgbui Abraham, 74 be ne yeɖe mí tso míaƒe futɔwo si me vɔ la, yeana mɔnukpɔkpɔ mí míawɔ subɔsubɔdɔ kɔkɔe na ye vɔvɔ̃manɔmee 75 le ye ŋkume, le nuteƒewɔwɔ kple dzɔdzɔenyenye me le míaƒe agbemeŋkekewo katã me.

67 And his father Zachariah was filled with Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying 68 "Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, because he has visited and redeemed his people 69 and raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David 70 as he spoke by the mouths of his old-time holy prophets 71 salvation from our enemies and from the hands of all who hate us, 72 to show mercy to our fathers and remember his holy covenant, 73 the oath that he swore to Abraham our father 74 to grant to us that without fear, delivered from enemies’ hands, we should worship him in his presence 75 in godliness and honesty all our days.

76 Ke wò, vinye, woayɔ wò be Dziƒoʋĩtɔ la ƒe nyagblɔɖila, elabena àdze Yehowa ŋgɔ adzra eƒe mɔwo dzi ɖo, 77 àna eƒe amewo nadze si xɔname, si ava to woƒe nu vɔ̃wo tsɔtsɔ ke me, 78 le mía Mawu ƒe dɔmetɔtrɔ gã la ta. Dɔmetɔtrɔ sia ana agudzedze natso dziƒo ava kpɔ mí ɖa, 79 be wòana kekeli ame siwo bɔbɔ nɔ viviti kple ku ƒe vɔvɔli me, eye wòafia mɔ míaƒe afɔwo le ŋutifafa ƒe mɔ dzi. "

76 And you too, child, you shall be called the prophet of the Most High; for you shall go in advance of the Lord to get ready his roads, 77 to give his people knowledge of salvation in the pardoning of their sins 78 because of our God’s heart of pity, whereby a sunrise from on high 79 shall visit us to shine on those who are sitting in darkness and the shadow of death, that it may guide our feet into the way of peace. "
80 Eye ɖevi la tsi hekpɔ ŋusẽ le gbɔgbɔ la me, eye wònɔ gbedzi va se ɖe gbe si gbe wòɖe eɖokui fia Israel le dutoƒo.
80 And the child grew, and strengthened in spirit, and was in the wildernesses till the day of his commission to Israel.
Luka
Luke
2 Ke le ŋkeke mawo me la, Kaisaro Augusto de se be woaŋlɔ anyigbadzinɔlawo katã ŋkɔ.
2 And in those days a decree was issued by Caesar Augustus that all the world of men should be registered.

2 (Ŋkɔŋɔŋlɔ gbãtɔ sia va eme esime Kirenio nye nutodziɖula le Siria.) 3 Eye amewo katã yi wo de be woaŋlɔ yewoƒe ŋkɔ. 4 Yosef hã tso le Nazaret dua me le Galilea yi David ƒe du si woyɔna be Betlehem la me le Yudea, elabena David ƒe aƒe kple ƒomea me tɔ wònye. 5 Eya kple Maria, ame si wotsɔ nɛ wòɖe abe ale si wodo eƒe ŋugbe nɛ ene eye fu tsi ɖe eƒo azɔ lae yi be woaŋlɔ yewoƒe ŋkɔ.

2 (This was the first registration while Quirinius was governor of Syria.) 3 And everybody went to be registered at his own city; 4 and Joseph, among the rest, went up from the city of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to David’s city, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of David’s house and clan, 5 to have himself registered with Mary his wife, she being with child.
6 Esime wole afi ma la, eƒe vidziɣi ɖo. 7 Eye wòdzi ŋutsuvi, si nye eƒe ŋgɔgbevi, eye wòxatsa avɔ ɖe eŋu hetsɔe mlɔ lãnuɖunu me, elabena womekpɔ teƒe le amedzrodzeƒe o.
