5 There is talk of such a thing as unchastity among you, and such unchastity as there is not even among the heathen, so that one has his father’s wife; 2 and you are puffed up, and did not rather go to mourning, so that the one who had done that thing would be got out from your midst? 3 For I, absent in body but present in spirit, have already, as present, come to the decision you and my spirit, 4 together with the power of our Lord Jesus, being assembled in the Lord Jesus Christ’s name 5 to hand over to Satan the man with such a record, the one that did that in that fashion, for destruction of the flesh in order that the spirit may be saved on the day of the Lord.
6 Nu si ŋu miele adegbe ƒom le la menyo o.
6 Your boast is not a good one.

Elabena le nyateƒe me la, wotsɔ Kristo, míaƒe Ŋutitotolẽvi la sa vɔe. 8 Eya ta mina míanɔ ŋkekenyui la ɖum, menye kple amɔwɔ ʋaʋã xoxo o, eye menye kple vɔ̃ɖinyenye alo nu vɔ̃ ƒe amɔwɔ ʋaʋã hã o, ke boŋ kple amɔwɔ maʋamaʋã bolo si nye nu dzɔdzɔe wɔwɔ kple nyateƒetoto.

Do you not know that a little yeast makes the whole batch of dough yeasty? 7 Clean out the old yeast in order that you may be a new batch as you are unyeasty men for our passover is sacrificed, Christ, 8 so let us keep the feast not with old yeast nor with yeast of viciousness and villainy but with yeastless bread of candor and truth.

9 Meŋlɔe na mi le nye agbalẽ la me be miadzudzɔ hadede kple ame siwo ƒoa wo ɖokui ɖe gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu me; 10 nyemele gbɔgblɔm be miadzudzɔ hadede kura kple ame siwo le xexe sia me siwo ƒoa wo ɖokui ɖe gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu me alo nye ŋuklẽlawo alo adzodalawo alo trɔ̃subɔlawo o. Ne nenemae la, ke ɖeko miadzo le xexea me.

9 I wrote to you in my letter not to be mixed up with libertines; 10 not in general, this world’s libertines, or overreaching and grasping people or idolaters, since you would be obliged to go out of the world; 11 but I did tell you not to be mixed up if anyone who goes by the name of brother is a libertine or overreaching or an idolater or abusive or drunken or grasping, not even to eat with the one who is like that.
12 Elabena nya kae le mía kple ame siwo le egodo la dome be madrɔ̃ ʋɔnu wo? Ðe menye ame siwo le eme lae miedrɔ̃a ʋɔnui, 13 eye Mawu drɔ̃a ʋɔnu ame siwo le egodo la oa?
12 For what business is it of mine to judge the outsiders? do not you do the judging of the insiders, 13 but God the judging of the outsiders?
"Miɖe ame vɔ̃ɖi la ɖa le miawo ŋutɔwo mia dome. "
Get the vicious man out of your company.
1 Korintotɔwo
1 Corinthians

6 Ne nya ɖo mia dometɔ aɖe kple nɔvia dome la, ɖe wòdoa dzi tsɔnɛ yia ʋɔnu le ame madzɔmadzɔwo gbɔ, ke menye le ame kɔkɔewo gbɔ oa? 2 Alo ɖe mienyae be ame kɔkɔewoe adrɔ̃ ʋɔnu xexea oa? Eye ne miawoe adrɔ̃ ʋɔnu xexea ɖe, ekema ɖe miedze adrɔ̃ nya suesuewo ya oa? 3 Ðe mienyae be míadrɔ̃ ʋɔnu mawudɔlawo oa?

6 Does anyone of you, when he has a difficulty with another, dare to bring the case before the lawless and not before the holy? 2 Or do you not know that the holy will judge the world? and if the world gets judged by you, are you unfit for petty trials? 3 Do you not know we shall judge angels? not to say secular matters.
Ekema nu ka tae míadrɔ̃ agbe sia me nyawo ya o? 4 Ke ne agbe sia me nyawo li miadrɔ̃ la, ame siwo ŋu hamea medea bubui o lae mieɖoa ʋɔnudrɔ̃lawoea? 5 Mele egblɔm ale be ŋu nakpe mi.
4 Then if you do have secular cases to try, it is just those who do not amount to anything in the church that you set on the bench! 5 I say it to your shame.

Ðe nunyala ɖeka hɔ̃ hã mele mia dome, si ate ŋu adrɔ̃ nɔviawo dome nya oa? 6 Ke boŋ nɔvi kplɔa nɔvi yia ʋɔnu le dzimaxɔsetɔwo gbɔ! 7 Le nyateƒe me la, ne miekplɔa mia nɔewo yia ʋɔnu la, ekema miedo kpo nu xoxo. Nu ka ta miena wowɔ vɔ̃ ɖe mia ŋu boŋ o? Nu ka ta miena wotafa mi boŋ o? 8 Ke boŋ miewɔa vɔ̃, mietafaa ame, eye miele esia wɔm ɖe mia nɔviwo kekeake ŋu! 9 Ðe mienyae be ame madzɔmadzɔwo manyi Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la dome oa? Migana woaflu mi o.

Are you so totally without any wise man among you who can decide between his brothers, 6 but brother goes to law with brother, and that before unbelievers? 7 It is a blot on you anyhow, to begin with, that you do have lawsuits with each other; why not sooner have injustice done you? why not sooner have your rightful dues held back? 8 But you yourselves do injustice and hold back rightful dues, and to brothers at that; 9 or do you not know that unjust men will not inherit God’s Reign?

Ame siwo ƒoa wo ɖokuiwo ɖe gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu me, trɔ̃subɔlawo, ahasiwɔlawo, ŋutsu siwo gbɔ ŋutsuwo dɔna, alo ŋutsu siwo dɔna kple ŋutsuwo, 10 kple fiafitɔwo, ŋuklẽlawo, ahamulawo, amedzulawo kple adzodalawo la, womanyi Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la dome o.

Make no mistake: neither libertines nor idolaters nor adulterers nor any who practice sodomy or submit to it 10 nor thieves nor overreaching or drunken or abusive or grasping people will inherit the Reign of God.
11 Gake nenemae mia dometɔ aɖewo nɔ tsã. Ke wole tsi na mi; ke wona mia ŋuti kɔ; ke wobu mi ame dzɔdzɔewo le mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe ŋkɔ la kple mía Mawu ƒe gbɔgbɔ la me.
11 And that is what you, some of you, were; but you were washed clean! you were sanctified! but you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and in the Spirit of our God!
12 Woɖe nuwo katã ƒe mɔ nam, ke menye nuwo katãe dea ame dzi o.
12 Everything is free to me, but not everything is advantageous.
Woɖe nuwo katã ƒe mɔ nam, ke nyemaɖe mɔ be nu sia nu nakpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe dzinye o.
Everything is free to me, but I for my part am not going to be brought into subjection by anything.
13 Nuɖuɖu li na ƒodo, eye ƒodo hã li na nuɖuɖu, ke Mawu ana esia kple ekemɛa siaa nazu nu gbɔlo.
13 Foods for the stomach, and the stomach for foods but God will supersede both that and those.
Ke ŋutilã meli na gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu o, ke boŋ na Aƒetɔ la, eye Aƒetɔ la hã li na ŋutilã la. 14 Ke Mawu fɔ Aƒetɔ la ɖe tsitre, eye wòafɔ míawo hã ɖe tsitre tso ame kukuwo dome to eƒe ŋusẽ me.
But the body is not for unchastity but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body; 14 and God both raised the Lord and will raise us up by his power.
15 Ðe mienyae be miaƒe ŋutilãwo nye Kristo ƒe ŋutinuwo oa?
15 Do you not know that your bodies are organs of Christ?
Ekema ɖe maɖe Kristo la ƒe ŋutinuwo ɖa ahatsɔ wo awɔ ɖeka kple gbolo ƒe ŋutinuwoea? Gbeɖe! 16 Ðe mienyae be ame si tsɔ eɖokui lé ɖe gbolo ŋu la, eya kplii wozu ŋutilã ɖeka oa?

So am I to take away the Christ’s organs and make them organs of a loose woman? away with the thought! 16 Or do you not know that he who has a connection with a loose woman is one body? for "the two shall become one flesh, " it says.
Elabena egblɔ be: "Wo ame evea woazu ŋutilã ɖeka. " 17 Ke ame si tsɔ eɖokui lé ɖe Aƒetɔ la ŋu la, eya kplii wozu gbɔgbɔ ɖeka.
17 But he who has a connection with the Lord is one spirit.
18 Misi le gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu nu!
18 Keep clear of unchastity!
Nu vɔ̃ bubu ɖe sia ɖe si ame awɔ la, mele eƒe ŋutilã me o, ke ame si ƒoa eɖokui ɖe gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu me la le nu vɔ̃ wɔm ɖe eya ŋutɔ ƒe ŋutilã ŋu.
Any sin that a man commits is outside the body; but he who has unchaste relations sins against his own body.
19 Ðe mienyae be miaƒe ŋutilã nye gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe si le mia me, si miexɔ tso Mawu gbɔ la, ƒe gbedoxɔ oa? Eye mienye mia ɖokuiwo tɔ hã o, 20 elabena ho gã aɖee wotsɔ ƒle mi.
19 Or do you not know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit that you have in you, which comes to you from God, and you do not belong to yourselves? 20 For you were bought and paid for.
Eya ta midze agbagba ɖe sia ɖe miakafu Mawu le miaƒe ŋutilã me.
Glorify God in your body.
1 Korintotɔwo
1 Corinthians

7 Ke le nya siwo miebia le agbalẽ si mieŋlɔ ɖo ɖem me ŋu la, enyo na ŋutsu be wòagade asi nyɔnu ŋu o; 2 ke le gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu ƒe bɔbɔ ta la, srɔ̃ nenɔ ŋutsu sia ŋutsu si, eye srɔ̃ nenɔ nyɔnu sia nyɔnu si.
7 But as to what you wrote about: It is a good thing for a man not to touch a woman. 2 But for fear of unchastities let each have his own wife and each woman her own husband.
3 Srɔ̃ŋutsu netsɔ nu si srɔ̃a dze na la nɛ, eye srɔ̃nyɔnu hã newɔ nenema ke na srɔ̃a.
3 Let the husband pay to the wife what he owes her, and likewise the wife too to the husband.
4 Srɔ̃nyɔnu mekpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe eya ŋutɔ ƒe ŋutilã dzi o, ke srɔ̃a ya kpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe edzi; nenema kee srɔ̃ŋutsu hã mekpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe eya ŋutɔ ƒe ŋutilã dzi o, ke srɔ̃a ya kpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe edzi.
4 The wife is not entitled to control her own body, but the husband; and likewise the husband too is not entitled to control his own body, but the wife.

5 Migate mia ɖokui mia nɔewo o, negbe ɖe mi ame evea mielɔ̃ ɖe edzi va se ɖe ɣeyiɣi aɖe ko, ne miakpɔ ɣeyiɣi ɖe gbedodoɖa ŋu, eye miagava wɔ ɖeka ake, ale be le ɖokuidzimaɖumaɖu ta, Satana naganɔ mia tem kpɔ o.

5 Do not hold back each other’s rightful dues, unless it may be temporarily by agreement in order that you may have a while for prayer and again be together, so that Satan may not tempt you because of your incontinence.

6 Gake mele esia gblɔm na mi abe mɔnana ene, ke menye abe sedede ene o. 7 Ke ɖe madi be amewo katã nanɔ abe ale si mele ene hafi. Gake ame sia ame kple nunana si wòxɔ tso Mawu gbɔ, ame aɖe xɔe le mɔ si nu, ame bubu hã xɔe le mɔ kemɛ nu.
6 But this I say in the way of tolerance, not as an order; 7 but I wish all men to be the same as I myself am but each has a gift of his own from God, one in this way and one in that.

8 Ke mele egblɔm na ame siwo meɖe srɔ̃ o kple ahosiwo be, enyo na wo be woanɔ abe ale si ko nye hã mele ene. 9 Gake ne womate ŋu aɖu wo ɖokuiwo dzi o la, ekema woaɖe srɔ̃, elabena enyo be woaɖe srɔ̃ wu be fieŋufieŋu nanɔ fu ɖem na ame.

8 But I say to the unmarried and the widows, it is a good thing for them if they remain the same as I am; 9 but if they are not masters of themselves let them marry, for it is better to marry than to be burned.

10 Mele mɔfiame sia nam srɔ̃tɔwo, gake menye nyee o, ke boŋ Aƒetɔ lae, be srɔ̃nyɔnu nagaklã ɖa tso srɔ̃a gbɔ o. 11 Ke ne eklã ɖa tso egbɔ la, nenɔ anyi srɔ̃maɖemaɖee, alo negawɔ ɖeka kple srɔ̃a; eye srɔ̃ŋutsu hã nagagblẽ srɔ̃a ɖi o.

10 But married couples I enjoin, not I but the Lord, that wife must not separate from husband 11 or if she does, let her remain unmarried or make up with her husband and that husband must not divorce wife.

12 Ke mele egblɔm na ame mamlɛawo, ɛ̃, nyee le egblɔm, menye Aƒetɔ lae o be: Ne nɔvi aɖe srɔ̃nyɔnu nye dzimaxɔsetɔ, eye nyɔnua lɔ̃ be yewoanɔ anyi ɖekae la, ŋutsua megadzo le egbɔ o; 13 eye ne nyɔnu aɖe srɔ̃ nye dzimaxɔsetɔ, eye ŋutsua lɔ̃ be yewoanɔ anyi ɖekae la, nyɔnua megadzo le srɔ̃a gbɔ o.

12 But to the rest I, not the Lord, say, if any brother has an unbelieving wife and she is satisfied to live with him, let him not divorce her, 13 and whatever woman has an unbelieving husband and he is satisfied to live with her, let her not divorce her husband.
14 Elabena srɔ̃ŋutsu dzimaxɔsetɔ la ŋuti kɔ le srɔ̃a ta, eye srɔ̃nyɔnu dzimaxɔsetɔ la hã ŋuti kɔ le nɔviŋutsua ta; ne menye nenemae o la, anye ne mia viwo nye ame makɔmakɔwo, ke azɔ wole kɔkɔe.
14 For the unbelieving husband is consecrated in the wife and the unbelieving wife is consecrated in the husband; else your children would be unclean; but in fact they are holy.
15 Ke ne dzimaxɔsetɔ la tiae be yeadzo la, nedzo faa; se mebla nɔviŋutsu alo nɔvinyɔnu le nya siawo me o, ke boŋ Mawu yɔ mi be mianɔ ŋutifafa me.
15 But if the unbeliever separates, let him; the brother or sister is not fettered in such cases. But it is in peace that God has called us.
16 Ke srɔ̃nyɔnu, aleke nàwɔ anya ne wòe axɔ srɔ̃wò ɖe agbe? Alo srɔ̃ŋutsu, aleke nàwɔ anya ne wòe axɔ srɔ̃wò ɖe agbe?
16 For how do you know, wife, whether you will save your husband? or how do you know, husband, whether you will save your wife?
17 Ke hã, le gome si Yehowa na ame sia ame nu la, ame sia ame nezɔ nenema abe ale si Mawu yɔe ene.
17 Only, as the Lord has allotted each his share, as God has called each one, so let him walk.
Eye mɔfiame siae mena le hameawo katã me.
And so I direct in all the churches.
18 Ðe ame aɖe nye aʋatsotsotɔ esi woyɔea? Megatrɔ eɖokui aʋamatsomatsotɔe o. Ðe ame aɖe nye aʋamatsomatsotɔ esi woyɔea? Megatso aʋa o.
18 One was called in circumcised condition let him not obliterate the mark; one was called in uncircumcised condition let him not get himself circumcised.
19 Aʋatsotso mefia naneke o, eye aʋamatsomatso hã mefia naneke o; nu si le vevie nye Mawu ƒe sewo dzi wɔwɔ boŋ.
19 Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing; but the keeping of God’s commandments.
20 Nɔnɔme ka mee woɖayɔ ame aɖe le o, nenɔ eme nenema.
20 In the call that came to each, in that let him remain.
21 Ðe nènye kluvi esime woyɔ wòa? Megaɖe fu na wò o; gake ne àte ŋu axɔ ablɔɖe la, wɔ mɔnukpɔkpɔ ma ŋu dɔ.
21 You were called as a slave do not be concerned about it, but if you do have the chance to become free, prefer to carry on.

22 Elabena ame sia ame si le Aƒetɔ la me, si nye kluvi esime woyɔe la zu Aƒetɔ la ƒe ablɔɖeme; nenema kee ame si nye ablɔɖeme esime woyɔe la zu Kristo ƒe kluvi. 23 Ho gã aɖee wotsɔ ƒle mi; midzudzɔ amewo ƒe kluviwo zuzu.
22 For the slave who has been called in the Lord is the Lord’s freedman; likewise the freeman when he is called is Christ’s slave; 23 you were bought and paid for do not become slaves of men.
24 Nɔviwo, nɔnɔme ka mee woɖayɔ ame aɖe le o, nenɔ nɔnɔme ma me le Mawu ŋkume.
24 Let each one, brothers, as a member of God’s household remain in what he was called in.
25 Ke le ɖekakpui kple ɖetugbui siwo meɖe srɔ̃ o gome la, nyemexɔ sedede aɖeke tso Aƒetɔ la gbɔ na wo o, gake mele nye susu dom ɖa, abe ame si Aƒetɔ la kpɔ nublanui na be manye nuteƒewɔla ene.
25 But as to maidens I do not have any order given by the Lord, but give my judgment as one to whom the Lord has granted the mercy of being trusted.
26 Eya ta mesusu be, anyo be ame nanɔ anyi abe ale si wòle ene le ale si nɔnɔmeawo le fifia ta.
26 I think this is best, then, in view of the straits we are in: it is best for a man to be so.
27 Ðe wobla wò ɖe nyɔnu ŋua? Dzudzɔ mɔnudidi be yeaɖe ta le eme. Ðe wotu wò le nyɔnu ŋua?
27 You are bound to a wife do not try for release; you are free from a wife do not try for a wife.
Dzudzɔ srɔ̃didi. 28 Ke ne èɖe srɔ̃ hã la, mèwɔ nu vɔ̃ o. Eye ne ɖekakpui si menya nyɔnu o alo ɖetugbui leaƒe ɖe srɔ̃ la, mewɔ nu vɔ̃ o.
28 But if you do marry you have not sinned, and if the maiden marries she has not sinned; but such will have distress for the flesh, and I am having consideration for you.

29 Azɔ hã, nɔviwo, mele esia gblɔm be, ɣeyiɣi vi aɖe koe susɔ. Tso fifia dzi yina la, ame siwo si srɔ̃ le la nanɔ abe ɖe ɖeke mele wo si o ene, 30 eye ame siwo le avi fam nanɔ abe ame siwo mele avi fam o ene, eye ame siwo le dzidzɔ kpɔm la nanɔ abe ame siwo mele dzidzɔ kpɔm o ene, eye ame siwo le nu ƒlem la nanɔ abe ame siwo si nu mele o ene, 31 eye ame siwo wɔa xexea ŋuti dɔ la nanɔ abe ame siwo mele eŋuti dɔ wɔm bliboe o ene; elabena xexe sia ƒe nɔnɔme le tɔtrɔm.

29 But this I do say, brothers, the times are under pressure, so that hereafter those who have wives should be as if they did not have them, 30 and those who weep as if they were not weeping, and those who rejoice as if they were not rejoicing, and those who buy as not having obtained title, 31 and those who deal with the world as not having the use of it; for this world’s shows are transient.
32 Ɛ̃, medi be miavo tso dzimaɖitsitsi me.
32 But I want you free from anxieties.
Ŋutsu si meɖe srɔ̃ o la tsia dzi ɖe Aƒetɔ la ƒe nuwo ŋu, ale si wòawɔ adze Aƒetɔ la ŋu. 33 Ke ŋutsu si ɖe srɔ̃ la tsia dzi ɖe xexea me nuwo ŋu, ale si wòawɔ adze srɔ̃a ŋu, 34 eye wòle evedomesi.

The unmarried man is anxious over what belongs to the Lord, how to please the Lord; 33 but the man who has married is anxious over what belongs to the world, how to please his wife, 34 and is divided.

Eye nyɔnu si meɖe srɔ̃ o alo ɖetugbui leaƒe tsia dzi ɖe Aƒetɔ la ƒe nuwo ŋu, ale be wòanɔ kɔkɔe le eƒe ŋutilã kple eƒe gbɔgbɔ me. Ke nyɔnu si ɖe srɔ̃ la tsia dzi ɖe xexea me nuwo ŋu, ale si wòawɔ adze srɔ̃a ŋu.

And the unmarried woman and the maiden is anxious over what belongs to the Lord in order that she may be holy both in body and in spirit; but the woman who has married is anxious over what belongs to the world, how to please her husband.
35 Ke miawo ŋutɔwo miaƒe nyonyo tae mele esia gblɔm ɖo, menye be mana miaxaxa o, ke boŋ be mana miawɔ nu si dze, eye miatsɔ mia ɖokui ana ahasubɔ Aƒetɔ la ɣesiaɣi susuhenuwo manɔmee.
35 But I am saying this in your own interest, not in order to put a halter on you but with a view to what will be respectable and favorable to undistracted listening to the Lord.
36 Ke ne ame aɖe susu be yemele nu wɔm ɖe yeƒe ɖekakpuinyenye alo ɖetugbuinyenye ŋu nyuie o, eye wòto sɔhɛnyenye me do la, ekema nu si wòawɔe nye esi: newɔ nu si dim wòle; mewɔ nu vɔ̃ o.
36 But if anybody feels that he will be acting discreditably toward his maiden if she is overage, and that is the way it has to be, let him do what he will, he is not sinning; let them marry.

Neɖe srɔ̃ faa. 37 Ke ne ame aɖe ɖoe kplikpaa le eƒe dzi me, eye naneke mezi edzi o, ke boŋ wòkpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe eya ŋutɔ ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu dzi, eye wòɖoe le eya ŋutɔ ƒe dzi me be yeanɔ anyi srɔ̃maɖemaɖee la, awɔe nyuie.
37 But he who stands fast in his heart, not being under a compulsion but having freedom to go by his own will, and has come to this decision in his own heart, to keep his maiden, will be doing well.
38 Eye ame si ɖe srɔ̃ hã wɔe nyuie, ke ame si meɖe srɔ̃ o la awɔe nyuie wu.
38 So that equally he who marries his maiden is doing well, and he who does not will be doing better.
39 Ŋkeke ale si srɔ̃ŋutsu le agbe ko la, se bla srɔ̃nyɔnua. Ke ne ŋutsua dɔ alɔ̃ le ku me la, ekema nyɔnua vo aɖe ame si wòlɔ̃, negbe le Aƒetɔ la me ko.

39 A wife is bound for such time as her husband is alive; but if her husband goes to his rest she is free to marry whom she will, only in the Lord; 40 but she is happier if she remains so, in my opinion.
40 Ke le nye susu nu la, ne enɔ anyi nenema la, akpɔ dzidzɔ wu; eye meka ɖe edzi be Mawu ƒe gbɔgbɔ le nye hã dzinye.
And I think I too have God’s spirit.
1 Korintotɔwo
1 Corinthians
8 Ke le nuɖuɖu si wotsɔ sa vɔ na trɔ̃wo ŋuti la, mí katã míenya nu tso eŋu.
8 And as to meat from idol-sacrifices: we are aware that we all have knowledge.
Sidzedze nana ame doa eɖokui ɖe dzi, ke lɔlɔ̃ tua ame ɖo.
Knowledge puffs up, but love builds up.
2 Ne ame aɖe susu be yenya nane gɔ̃ hã la, menyae wòde edeƒe haɖe o.
2 If anybody thinks he knows anything, he has not known yet as one needs to know.
3 Ke ne ame aɖe lɔ̃ Mawu la, ekema Mawu nya eya amea.
3 But if anybody loves God, that man is known by him.

4 Ke le nu si wotsɔ sa vɔ na trɔ̃wo ɖuɖu ŋu la, míenyae be trɔ̃ menye naneke le xexea me o, eye be Mawu ɖeka hɔ̃ koe li. 5 Togbɔ be nu siwo woyɔna be mawuwo li, eɖanye le dziƒo alo le anyigba dzi o, abe ale si "mawu " geɖewo kple "aƒetɔ " geɖewo li ene hã la, 6 le nyateƒe me la, Mawu ɖeka si nye Fofo la, ame si me nuwo katã dzɔ tso, eye míele agbe nɛ la, koe li na mí; eye Aƒetɔ ɖeka koe li, eyae nye Yesu Kristo, ame si dzi nuwo katã to va dzɔ, eye míawo hã míele agbe to eya dzi.

4 Well, then, as to the eating of meat from idol-sacrifices, we are aware that there is no such thing in the world as an idol-god and that there is no God but one 5 for, though it be a fact that there are so-called gods whether in heaven or on earth (as there are many "gods " and many "lords "), 6 yet for us there is one God, the Father, out of whom comes everything and into whom come we; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom comes everything, and through him we.

7 Gake menye amewo katã sie sidzedze sia le o. Ke boŋ esi ame aɖewo kpɔ gome le trɔ̃subɔsubɔ me tsã ta la, wobua nu siwo woɖuna la abe trɔ̃wo ƒe vɔsanu ene, eye esia ƒoa ɖi woƒe dzitsinya si gbɔdzɔ la.
7 But not everybody has the knowledge in him; and some, by habituation to the idol-god heretofore, eat as from an idol-sacrifice, and their conscience, being weak, is defiled.
8 Ke menye nuɖuɖue ate mí ɖe Mawu ŋu o; ne míeɖu nane o la, megblẽ naneke le mía ŋu o, eye ne míeɖu nane la, medoa mí ɖe ŋgɔ le go aɖeke me o.
8 And a food will not be a recommendation to God for us: we are neither in inferior standing if we do not eat nor in especially good standing if we do.
9 Ke mikpɔ nyuie be miaƒe tiatiawɔblɔɖe la nagazu nuɖiaɖia na ame siwo gbɔdzɔ la le mɔ aɖeke nu o.
9 But look out that this right of yours does not possibly become a snag for the feet of the weak.

10 Elabena ne ame aɖe kpɔ wò, ame si si sidzedze le, nèle kplɔ̃ ŋu le nu ɖum le trɔ̃xɔ me la, ɖe ema mana dzi naɖo ame si ƒe dzitsinya gbɔdzɔ la ƒo, be eya hã naɖu nu siwo wotsɔ sa vɔ na trɔ̃wo oa? 11 Eya ta wò sidzedze la agblẽ nu le nɔviwò si gbɔdzɔ, ame si ta Kristo ku ɖo, la ŋu. 12 Ne miewɔ nu vɔ̃ ɖe mia nɔviwo ŋu alea, eye miede abi woƒe dzitsinya si gbɔdzɔ ŋu la, ekema miele nu vɔ̃ wɔm ɖe Kristo ŋu.

10 For if one sees you, the one who has the knowledge, taking a meal in an idol-temple, will not his conscience, weak as he is, be built up into eating meat from idol-sacrifices? 11 why, by your knowledge the weak one is perishing, the brother on whose account Christ died! 12 And so, sinning against the brothers and battering their conscience when it is weak, you sin against Christ.
13 Eya ta ne nuɖuɖu aɖia nɔvinye nu la, ekema nyemagaɖu lã akpɔ gbeɖe o, ale be nyemaɖia nɔvinye nu o.
13 Wherefore if a food is tripping my brother up I will go without meat forever in order not to trip my brother up.
1 Korintotɔwo
1 Corinthians

Ðe nyemekpɔ Yesu, mía Aƒetɔ la oa? Menye miawoe nye dɔ si mewɔ le Aƒetɔ la me la me tsonuwo oa? 2 Ne nyemenye apostolo na ame bubuwo o hã la, menyee na miawo ya! Elabena miawoe nye nutrenu si le kpe ɖom edzi be Aƒetɔ la ƒe apostoloe menye.

9 Am I not a free man? am I not an apostle? have I not seen our Lord Jesus? are not you in the Lord my work? 2 If for others I am not an apostle, for you anyhow I am; for you in the Lord are the seal of my apostleship.

3 Nya siwo matsɔ aɖe ɖokuinye nu na ame siwo drɔ̃a ʋɔnum lae nye esi: 4 Ðe míekpɔ mɔ aɖu nu alo ano nu oa? 5 Ðe míekpɔ mɔ aɖe nyɔnu haxɔsetɔ akplɔ ɖe ŋuti, abe ale si apostolo susɔeawo kple Aƒetɔ la nɔviwo kpakple Kefas hã wɔna ene oa? 6 Alo nye kple Barnaba koe mekpɔ mɔ adzudzɔ dɔwɔwɔ be míatsɔ akpɔ mía ɖokuiwo dzi oa? 7 Asrafo kae wɔa asrafodɔ evɔ eya ŋutɔe kpɔa eɖokui dzi? Ame kae dea waingble evɔ meɖua eme kutsetse o? Alo ame kae kplɔa lãha evɔ menoa lãha la ƒe notsi ƒe ɖe o? 8 Amegbetɔ ƒe susu nue mele nya siawo gblɔm lea? Alo ɖe Se la hã megblɔ nya siawo oa? 9 Elabena woŋlɔ ɖe Mose ƒe Se la me be: "Mègabla nu na nyitsu ne ele nuku tugum o. "

3 My defense to my examiners is this: 4 Do we not have the right to eat and drink? 5 do we not have the right to take around a wife who is one of the sisters, the same as the rest of the apostles do, and the Lord’s brothers, and Cephas? 6 or do Barnabas and I alone have no right not to work? 7 Whoever serves in the army and pays his own expenses? who plants a vineyard and does not eat the fruit of it, or who tends a flock and does not eat any of the milk of the flock? 8 Am I talking like this from a human point of view, or does not the law too say this? 9 For in the law of Moses it says "You shall not muzzle a threshing beast. "
Nyitsuwo ŋue Mawu tsi dzi ɖoa? 10 Alo míawo koŋ tae wògblɔe ɖo?
Does God care for the beasts, 10 or is it distinctly on our account that he says it?
Le nyateƒe me la, míawo tae woŋlɔe ɖi ɖo, elabena ele be ame si le agble ŋlɔm kple ame si le nuku tugum la nawɔe kple mɔkpɔkpɔ be yewoava kpɔ gome le eme.
Why, it was put in on our account, because the plower ought to plow in hope, and the thresher in hope of coming in for a share.
11 Ne míeƒã gbɔgbɔmenuwo ɖe mia me ɖe, ekema nu gãe wònye ne míeŋe ŋutilãmenuhiahiãwo tso mia domea? 12 Ne ame bubuwo kpɔ mɔ abia nu siawo tso mia si ɖe, ekema ɖe míawo míekpɔ mɔ geɖe wu oa?
11 If we sowed the spiritual things for you, is it anything great if we are to harvest the material things from you? 12 If others come in for a share of rights over you, do not we all the more?
Gake míewɔ ŋusẽ sia ŋu dɔ o, ke boŋ míedoa dzi le nuwo katã me, ale be míagaxe mɔ na Kristo la ŋuti nya nyui la le mɔ aɖeke nu o.
But we did not use those rights, but are putting up with everything in order that we may not cause any obstruction to the gospel of the Christ.

13 Ðe mienyae be ame siwo wɔa dɔ kɔkɔewo la ɖua gbedoxɔa me nuwo, eye ame siwo subɔna le vɔsamlekpuia ŋu ɣesiaɣi la, vɔsamlekpuia ƒe nuwo mee wokpɔa wo tɔ gome tsonɛ oa? 14 Nenema kee Aƒetɔ la ɖo na ame siwo ɖea gbeƒã nya nyui la be, nya nyui la nakpɔ nu si ŋu woanɔ agbe ɖo la gbɔ na wo.

13 Do you not know that those who do the sacred work eat the sanctuary’s supplies, those who attend the altar participate with the altar? 14 in the same way the Lord prescribed to those who were announcing the gospel that they should live by the gospel.
15 Ke nyemewɔ mɔnukpɔkpɔ siawo dometɔ ɖeka teti hã ŋu dɔ o.
15 But I have not availed myself of any of this.

Le nyateƒe me la, menye ɖe mele nu siawo ŋlɔm ale be miawɔ nenema nam o, elabena enyo nam be maku wu esi mana ame aɖe naɖe nu si metsɔ ƒoa adegbe la ɖa! 16 Ke ne mele nya nyui la gblɔm hã la, esia menye susu si ta maƒo adegbe ɖo o, elabena agba wònye le dzinye.

And I did not write this in order that it should come so in my case, for I had better die sooner than nobody shall make my boast an empty one. 16 For if I preach the gospel it is no boast for me, for I am under compulsion; for there is a woe for me if I do not.
Ɛ̃, ne nyemegblɔ nya nyui la o la, baba nam! 17 Ne mewɔ esia tso dzi me faa la, fetu li nam; ke ne nyemewɔe tso dzi me o hã la, wotsɔ aƒedzikpɔkpɔdɔ de asi nam.
17 For if I do this voluntarily I get pay, but if involuntarily I have a stewardship entrusted to me.
18 Ekema nu kae nye nye fetua? Eyae nye be, ne mele nya nyui la gblɔm la, magblɔ nya nyui la naneke maxɔmaxɔe, ale be magazã ŋusẽ si le asinye le nya nyuia me la ɖe mɔ madzemadze nu o.
18 What is my pay then? that in my preaching I shall render the gospel free of expense, so as to make no use of my rights as preacher.

19 Togbɔ be mevo tso amewo katã si me hã la, mewɔ ɖokuinye amewo katã ƒe kluvii, be asinye nasu ame geɖe ale si mate ŋui dzi. 20 Ale mezu abe Yudatɔ ene na Yudatɔwo, ale be asinye nasu Yudatɔwo dzi; mezu abe ame si le se te ene na ame siwo le se te, evɔ nye ŋutɔ nyemele se te hafi o, ale be asinye nasu ame siwo le se te la dzi. 21 Mezu abe semanɔsitɔ ene na semanɔsitɔwo, evɔ le Mawu gbɔ la, nyemenye semanɔsitɔ hafi o, ke boŋ mele Kristo ƒe se te, ale be asinye nasu semanɔsitɔwo dzi. 22 Mezu gbɔdzɔgbɔdzɔtɔ na gbɔdzɔgbɔdzɔtɔwo, ale be asinye nasu gbɔdzɔgbɔdzɔtɔwo dzi. Mezu nuwo katã na ame ƒomeviwo katã, ale be mate ŋu aɖe wo dometɔ aɖewo kokoko.

19 For when I was free from everybody I enslaved myself to everybody in order to get the greatest number; 20 and I behaved to the Jews like a Jew in order to get Jews, to those under the law like one under the law when I was not myself under the law, in order to get those under the law, 21 to the lawless like a lawless man when I was not lawless for God but law-abiding for Christ, in order to get the lawless; 22 I became anything to anybody in order anyhow to save some.
23 Ke nya nyui la tae mewɔa nuwo katã ɖo, ale be nye hã mate ŋu agblɔe na amewo.
23 And I do everything on account of the gospel, in order to become a fellow-participant in it.
24 Ðe mienyae be duƒula siwo le ho ʋlim la katãe ƒua dua, gake ame ɖeka koe xɔa dziɖuɖufetu la oa?
24 Do you not know that those who run in the races all run, but one gets the prize?
Miƒu du le mɔ si ana miaxɔ fetu la nu.
Run in such a way that you may arrive.
25 Azɔ hã, ame sia ame si le gome kpɔm le hoʋiʋli me la ɖua eɖokui dzi le nuwo katã me. Woawo la, wowɔnɛ be woaxɔ dziɖuɖukuku si gblẽna, ke míawo ya hena esi megblẽna o.
25 And everybody who goes into the contests masters himself in every respect; they, indeed, aiming to win a perishable wreath, but we an imperishable.

26 Eya ta ale si mele dua ƒum la, nyemele eƒum ɖewoɖewoe o; ale si mele nye kɔwo dam la, menye be mada dadagbo o; 27 ke boŋ meƒoa nye ŋutilã vevie hewɔnɛ kluvii, ale be esi meɖe gbeƒã na ame bubuwo vɔ la, nye ŋutɔ nyemagazu ame madzemadze le mɔ aɖeke nu o.

26 Well, then, I run not in aimless fashion; I spar not in the way of shadowboxing, 27 but bang my body about and make a slave of it, for fear that after I had been herald to others I should myself fail to make good.
1 Korintotɔwo
1 Corinthians

10 Ke nɔviwo, medi be mianyae be, mía tɔgbuiwo katã nɔ alilikpo la te, eye wo katã woto ƒu la me, 2 eye wonyrɔ wo katã ɖe Mose me esi wonɔ alilikpo la te heto ƒu la me, 3 eye wo katã woɖu gbɔgbɔmenuɖuɖu ma ke, 4 eye wo katã wono gbɔgbɔmenunono ma ke. Elabena wono tsi tso gbɔgbɔ me agakpe si dze wo yome la me, eye agakpe ma le tsitre ɖi na Kristo la. 5 Gake Mawu mekpɔ ŋudzedze ɖe wo dometɔ akpa gãtɔ ŋu o, elabena ena woku le gbea dzi.

10 For we do not want you to lack the knowledge, brothers, that our fathers were all of them under the cloud and all went through the sea 2 and all had themselves baptized to Moses in the cloud and in the sea, 3 and all ate the same spiritual food 4 and all drank the same spiritual drink (for they drank out of a spiritual rock that went along with them; and the rock was the Christ), 5 but God was not pleased with most of them; for they fell along the desert road.
6 Ke nu siawo zu kpɔɖeŋu na mí, ale be míaganye nu vɔ̃ɖi dzrolawo, abe ale si wòdzro wo ene o.
6 And in these respects they were types of us, so that we may not take to desiring bad things as some of them did.

Eye wotso hedo dzidzɔ na wo ɖokuiwo. " 8 Migana míaƒo mía ɖokui ɖe gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu me, abe ale si wo dometɔ aɖewo ƒo wo ɖokuiwo ɖe gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu me, ale be wodze anyi, ame akpe blaeve vɔ etɔ̃ sɔŋ le ŋkeke ɖeka dzi la ene o.

7 And do not become idolaters, as did some of them, as it is written "The people sat down to eat and drink and stood up to play. " 8 And let us not go into sexual debauchery, as some of them did, and twenty-three thousand fell in one day.
9 Eye migate Yehowa kpɔ, abe ale si wo dometɔ aɖewo tee kpɔ, eye dawo tsrɔ̃ wo la ene o.
9 And let us not put the Lord to a test, as some of them tested him and perished by the snakes.
10 Migazu liʋiliʋĩlĩlawo, abe ale si wo dometɔ aɖewo lĩ liʋiliʋĩ, eye nutsrɔ̃la tsrɔ̃ wo la ene o.
10 And do not grumble, as some of them grumbled and perished by the destroyer.
11 Ke nu siawo dzɔ ɖe wo dzi abe kpɔɖeŋu ene, eye woŋlɔ wo ɖi be wòanye nuxlɔ̃ame na mí ame siwo dzi nuɖoanyi siawo ƒe nuwuwuwo va ɖo la.
11 And these things befell them by way of types, and were recorded for admonition to us, in whom the ages have reached their goal.
12 Eya ta ame si susu be yele tsitre la nakpɔ nyuie be wòagadze anyi o.
12 Consequently, let him who thinks he is standing look out that he does not fall.
13 Tetekpɔ aɖeke mevaa mia dzi o, negbe esi tɔgbi vaa amegbetɔwo dzi la ko.
13 There has not any temptation caught you but such as is the lot of man.
Ke nuteƒewɔlae Mawu nye, eye maɖe mɔ woate mi akpɔ wu esi nu miate ŋu anɔ te ɖo o, gake ne tetekpɔa va la, ana mɔ si dzi miato ado le eme la hã, ale be miate ŋu ado dzi atsɔe.
And God is faithful, who will not let you be tempted beyond your power, but with the temptation will also make the way out so that you may be able to stand it.
14 Eya ta nye lɔlɔ̃tɔwo, misi le trɔ̃subɔsubɔ nu.
14 Wherefore, my dear friends, flee from idolatry.
15 Mele nu ƒom na mi ame siwo si gɔmesese le; miawo ŋutɔwo mida nya si gblɔm mele la kpɔ.
15 I speak as one does to sensible men; judge of what I say yourselves.

16 Yayrakplu si míeyrana la, ɖe menye gomekpɔkpɔ le Kristo la ƒe ʋu mee wònye oa? Abolo si míeŋena la, ɖe menye gomekpɔkpɔ le Kristo la ƒe ŋutilã mee wònye oa? 17 Elabena abolo ɖeka koe, togbɔ be míawo míesɔ gbɔ hã la, ŋutilã ɖekae míenye, elabena mí katã míeɖua abolo ɖeka ma ke ƒe ɖe.

16 The blessing-cup that we bless, is it not participation in the blood of the Christ? the loaf of bread that we break, is it not participation in the body of the Christ? 17 because we, many as we are, are one loaf, one body; for we all share in the one loaf.
18 Mikpɔ ŋutilã me Israel la ɖa: Ðe ame siwo ɖua vɔsanuawo la mekpɔa gome le wo me kple vɔsamlekpui la oa? 19 Ekema nya ka gblɔm mele?
18 Look at Israel, Israel in the fleshly sense: are not those who eat the sacrifices participants with the altar?

Be nu si wotsɔ sa vɔ na trɔ̃ la nye nanea, alo be trɔ̃ nye nanea? 20 Ao; ke boŋ mele gbɔgblɔm be, nu si dukɔwo tsɔ saa vɔe la, gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃woe wotsɔa wo saa vɔe na, ke menye na Mawu o; eye nyemedi be miade ha kple gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo o.

19 What am I saying then? that an idol-sacrifice is anything, or that there is any such thing as an idol-god? 20 no, but that what they sacrifice they sacrifice to demons and not to God. And I do not want you to become participants with demons.
21 Miate ŋu anɔ nu nom le Yehowa ƒe kplu nu aganɔ nu nom le gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo ƒe kplu nu o; miate ŋu anɔ nu ɖum le "Yehowa ƒe kplɔ̃ " ŋu aganɔ nu ɖum le gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo ƒe kplɔ̃ ŋu o.
21 You cannot drink the Lord’s cup and demons’ cup! you cannot share the Lord’s table and demons’ table! 22 Or are we teasing the Lord into jealousy? are we stronger than he?
23 Woɖe nuwo katã ƒe mɔ na ame, ke menye nuwo katãe dea ame dzi o.
23 Everything is permissible, but not everything is advantageous.
Woɖe nuwo katã ƒe mɔ na ame, ke menye nuwo katãe tua ame ɖo o.
Everything is permissible, but not everything is constructive.
24 Ame aɖeke meganɔ eya ŋutɔ ƒe nyonyo ko dim o, ke nedi ame bubu tɔ hã.
24 Let nobody look after what is for himself, but what is for the other man.

25 Nu sia nu si wodzrana le lãsi me la, miate ŋu aɖui, eye miganɔ nya gɔme biam o le miaƒe dzitsinya ta, 26 elabena "Yehowa tɔe nye anyigba kple edzinuwo katã. " 27 Ne dzimaxɔsetɔ aɖe kpe mi, eye mielɔ̃ be yewoayi la, miɖu nu sia nu si wotsɔ ɖo mia kɔme, eye miganɔ nya gɔme biam o le miaƒe dzitsinya ta.

25 Eat anything that is offered for sale at a market, without making any inquiries for reasons of conscience; 26 for "the earth and all that fills it belong to the Lord. " 27 If one of the unbelievers invites you and you choose to go, eat anything that is brought to the table without making any inquiries for reasons of conscience.

28 Ke ne ame aɖe gblɔ na mi be, "Wotsɔ nu sia sa vɔe " la, ekema migaɖui o, le ame si gblɔe ta kple dzitsinya ta. 29 Menye miaƒe dzitsinya ye mewɔnɛ o, ke boŋ ame kemɛa tɔ. Elabena nu ka tae ame bubu ƒe dzitsinya nadrɔ̃ ʋɔnu nye ablɔɖe? 30 Ne meda akpe hafi le nua ɖum ɖe, nu ka tae woaƒo nu gbegblẽ le ŋunye le nu si ta meda akpe ɖo la ŋu?

28 But if somebody tells you "this is sacrifice meat, " do not eat, because of him, the one that informed you, and for reasons of conscience 29 and I do not mean one’s own conscience but the other man’s; for to what purpose is my liberty judged by another conscience? 30 If I partake with gratitude, why am I vilified over what I give thanks for?
31 Eya ta ne miele nu ɖum alo le nu nom alo le nu bubu aɖe wɔm la, miwɔ nuwo katã hena Mawu ƒe kafukafu.
31 So, whether you are eating or drinking or doing anything, do everything to God’s glory.

32 Migazu nuɖiaɖia na Yudatɔwo kple Helatɔwo kpakple Mawu ƒe hame la o, 33 abe ale si nye hã mele amewo katã ŋu dzem le nuwo katã me, eye nyemele nye ŋutɔ nye nyonyo dim o, ke boŋ ame geɖewo tɔ, be woakpɔ ɖeɖe la ene.

32 Have nothing about you that either Jew or Greek or the church of God could stub their toes on, 33 in the same way as I am pleasing everybody about everything, not looking out for my own interests but for those of the many, that they may be saved.
1 Korintotɔwo
1 Corinthians
11 Mizu srɔ̃nyelawo, abe ale si nye hã menye Kristo srɔ̃la ene.
11 Be imitators of me in the same way as I am of Christ.
2 Mele mia kafum, elabena mieɖoa ŋku dzinye le nuwo katã me, eye mielé ɖoɖoawo me ɖe asi goŋgoŋ abe ale si metsɔ wo de mia sii ene.
2 And I praise you that you thoroughly remember me and stick to the correct line as I passed it on to you.
3 Ke medi be mianyae be ŋutsu sia ŋutsu ƒe tae nye Kristo; nyɔnu hã ƒe tae nye ŋutsu; eye Kristo hã ƒe tae nye Mawu.
3 But I want you to know that every man’s head is the Christ, and a woman’s head the man, and the Christ’s head God.

4 Ŋutsu sia ŋutsu si tsyɔa nu ta hafi doa gbe ɖa alo gblɔa nya ɖi la, doa ŋukpe eƒe ta; 5 ke nyɔnu sia nyɔnu si metsyɔa nu ta hafi doa gbe ɖa alo gblɔa nya ɖi o la, doa ŋukpe eƒe ta, elabena ele ko abe nyɔnu si wolũ ta na ene.

4 Any man praying or prophesying with anything on his head is disgracing his head. 5 But a woman praying or prophesying with her head uncovered is disgracing her head, for it is one and the same thing as a shaved woman.
6 Elabena ne nyɔnu aɖe metsyɔa nu ta o la, ekema nekpa ɖa boŋ; ke ne enye ŋukpe na nyɔnu aɖe be wòakpa ɖa alo alũ ta la, ekema netsyɔ nu ta.
6 For if a woman is not covered, let her have her hair cut too; but if having her hair cut or shaved is disgraceful for a woman, let her be covered.

7 Ke medze be ŋutsu natsyɔ nu ta o, elabena Mawu ƒe nɔnɔme kple ŋutikɔkɔe wònye, ke nyɔnue nye ŋutsu ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe. 8 Elabena ŋutsu metso nyɔnu me o, nyɔnu boŋ ye tso ŋutsu me. 9 Eye womewɔ ŋutsu le nyɔnu ta hã o, nyɔnu boŋ ye wowɔ le ŋutsu ta.

7 For a man ought not to have his head covered, he being the image and glory of God; but woman is the glory of man, 8 for man does not have his being out of woman but woman out of man; 9 for, also, man was not created on account of the woman but a woman on account of the man.
10 Esia tae wòle be ŋusẽ ƒe dzesi nanɔ ta na nyɔnu, le mawudɔlawo ta.
10 For this reason the woman ought to have a safeguard over her head because of the angels.

11 Hekpe ɖe eŋu la, le Aƒetɔ la me la, nyɔnu meli ŋutsu manɔmee o, eye ŋutsu hã meli nyɔnu manɔmee o. 12 Elabena ale si ko nyɔnu tso ŋutsu me la, nenema kee ŋutsu hã to nyɔnu dzi va; ke nuwo katã tso Mawu me.

11 There is not in the Lord, though, woman apart from man nor man apart from woman; 12 for as the woman comes out of the man, so does the man too come through the woman; and everything comes out of God.

13 Miawo ŋutɔwo mibu eŋu kpɔ: Ðe wòsɔ be nyɔnu nado gbe ɖa na Mawu ne metsyɔ nu ta oa? 14 Ðe miekpɔe be le dzɔdzɔme nu la, ne ɖa legbe le ta na ŋutsu la, enye ŋukpe nɛ, 15 ke ne ɖa legbe le ta na nyɔnu la, enye atsyɔ̃ nɛ oa? Elabena wotsɔ ɖa nɛ ɖe tatsyɔnu teƒe.

13 Judge in your own consciences: is it proper for a woman to pray uncovered to God? 14 Does not even nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair it is a dishonor to him, 15 but if a woman has long hair it is a glory to her, because she is given her hair to serve as a wrap?
16 Gake ne ame aɖe le nya hem be ɖoɖo bubu aɖe li le nya sia ŋu la, bubu aɖeke mele mía si o, eye ɖeke mele Mawu ƒe hameawo hã si o.
16 But if anybody sees fit to be disputatious, we do not have such a custom, and neither do God’s churches.

17 Ke le mɔfiame siwo gbɔna ŋu la, nyemele mia kafum o, elabena ne miekpe ta la, nuwo menyona ɖe edzi o, ɖe wogblẽna ɖe edzi boŋ. 18 Elabena gbã la, mese be ne mieva kpe ta le hamea me la, mamawo nɔa mia dome; eye mexɔ edzi se le go aɖe me. 19 Elabena kɔmamawo anɔ mia dome godoo, ale be ame siwo ŋu wokpɔ ŋudzedze ɖo la nadze ƒãa le mia dome.

17 But this injunction I give without praise for your way of coming together not for the better but for the worse: 18 for, in the first place, when you come together in a church meeting I hear there are divisions among you; and to some extent I believe it, 19 for there do have to be factions among you in order that it may become apparent among you which ones are of the right kind.

20 Eya ta ne mieva kpe ta la, menye Aƒetɔ ƒe Fiẽnuɖuɖu lae mieɖuna o. 21 Elabena ne eɖo edzi be miaɖui la, mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe ɖua eya ŋutɔ ƒe fiẽnuɖuɖu doa ŋgɔ, ale be dɔ nɔa ame aɖewo wum, evɔ ame bubuwo ya mua aha.

20 So when you meet together there is no eating a supper of the Lord’s, 21 for each one is getting a start in the eating to take his own supper, and one goes hungry and another has had too much drink.
22 Ðe aƒewo mele mia si be miaɖu nu ahano nu le wo me oa?
22 Why, have you no houses for eating and drinking? or are you despising the church of God and shaming those who have nothing?
Alo ɖe miedoa vlo Mawu ƒe hame la, eye miedoa ŋukpe ame siwo si naneke mele o laa?
What am I to say to you? am I to praise you over this?
Makafu mia?
I do not.

Nyemele mia kafum le nu sia me o. 23 Elabena nu si mexɔ tso Aƒetɔ la gbɔ lae metsɔ de asi na mi, be le zã si me woade Aƒetɔ Yesu asi la, etsɔ abolo, 24 eye esi wòda akpe ɖe eta vɔ la, eŋe eme gblɔ be: "Esia le tsitre ɖi na nye ŋutilã si wotsɔ na ɖe mia ta. Minɔ esia wɔm hena ŋkuɖoɖo dzinye. " 25 Nenema kee wòtsɔ kplu la hã le fiẽnuɖuɖu la megbe gblɔ be: "Kplu sia le tsitre ɖi na nubabla yeye si wowɔ to nye ʋu dzi la. Minɔ esia wɔm, ɣesiaɣi si mianoe, hena ŋkuɖoɖo dzinye. " 26 Elabena ɣesiaɣi si mieɖua abolo sia henoa nu le kplu sia nu la, miele gbeƒã ɖem Aƒetɔ la ƒe ku va se ɖe esime wòava.

23 For I received from the Lord that same thing that I handed on to you, that the Lord Jesus, on the night when he was to be arrested, took bread 24 and gave thanks and broke it and said "This is my body that goes for you; do this in remembrance of me "; 25 in the same way the cup too, after eating the supper, saying "This cup is the new covenant in my blood; do this, as often as you drink, in remembrance of me. " 26 For as often as you eat this bread and drink the cup, you are announcing the death of the Lord, until he come.
27 Eya ta ame sia ame si ɖua abolo la, alo noa nu le Aƒetɔ la ƒe kplu la nu madzemadzee la, aɖi fɔ le Aƒetɔ la ƒe ŋutilã kple eƒe ʋu ŋu.
27 Consequently one who eats the Lord’s bread or drinks his cup in unworthy fashion will be liable for the body and blood of the Lord.

28 Ele be ame nadzro eɖokui me kpɔ nyuie gbã be yedze hã, ema ko hafi wòaɖu abolo la ƒe ɖe ahano nu le kplu la nu. 29 Elabena ame si medzro nu si ŋutilã la fia me kpɔ nyuie hafi ɖunɛ alo nonɛ o la, eɖua ʋɔnudɔdrɔ̃ henoa ʋɔnudɔdrɔ̃ na eɖokui.

28 But let a man see how he is to be rated, and in such fashion eat from the loaf and drink from the cup; 29 for he who eats and drinks is eating and drinking a judgment upon himself when he does not distinguish the body.
30 Esia tae mia dometɔ geɖewo gbɔdzɔ, eye wodze dɔ, eye geɖewo hã le alɔ̃ dɔm le ku me.
30 That is why there are among you many weakly and sick, and a number have gone to their rest.
31 Ke ne míedzro mía ɖokui me kpɔ nyuie la, womadrɔ̃ ʋɔnu mí o. 32 Gake ne wodrɔ̃ ʋɔnu mí la, Yehowae le mía ɖɔm ɖo, ale be woagabu fɔ mí kpe ɖe xexea ŋu o.
31 But if we saw how we stood, we should not be judged; 32 but in being judged we are being disciplined by the Lord, in order that we may not be condemned with the world.
33 Eya ta nɔvinyewo, ne mieva kpe ta be yewoaɖui la, milala mia nɔewo.
33 Consequently, my brothers, when you come together to eat wait for each other.
34 Ne dɔ le ame aɖe wum la, neɖu nu le aƒe me, ale be ne mieva kpe ta la, woagadrɔ̃ ʋɔnu mi o.
34 If anybody is hungry let him eat at home, in order that your coming together may not run you into judgment.
Ke ne meva ɖo mia gbɔ hã la, makpɔ nya susɔeawo gbɔ.
And as to the rest I will give directions when I shall come.
1 Korintotɔwo
1 Corinthians
12 Ke le gbɔgbɔmenunanawo ŋu la, nɔviwo, nyemedi be wòanɔ manyamanya na mi o.
12 And about the workings of the Spirit, brothers, I do not wish you to be ignorant.
2 Mienyae be esime mienye dukɔwo me tɔwo la, woflu mi kplɔ mi trae yi legba maƒonuwo gbɔ, eye mienɔa wo yome yia afi sia afi.
2 You know when you were heathen you were carried away to the voiceless idols, however it was done.
3 Eya ta medi be mianyae be, ame aɖeke meƒoa nu to Mawu ƒe gbɔgbɔ dzi gblɔna be, "Yesu nye fiƒodeme! " o, eye ame aɖeke mate ŋu agblɔ be, "Yesu nye Aƒetɔ! " o, negbe to gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe dzi ko.
3 For this reason I make it known to you that nobody speaking in the Spirit of God says "Jesus is accursed, " and nobody can say "Jesus is Lord " except in Holy Spirit.
4 Ke nunana vovovowoe li, gake gbɔgbɔ ɖeka ma ke koe; 5 eye subɔsubɔdɔ vovovowoe li, gake Aƒetɔ ɖeka ma ke koe; 6 eye dɔ vovovowoe li, gake Mawu ɖeka ma kee wɔa dɔawo katã to amewo katã dzi.

4 But there are different lines of gifts, but the same Spirit; 5 and there are different lines of service and the same Lord; 6 and there are different lines of divine workings and the same God, he who works everything in everybody.
7 Ke gbɔgbɔ la dzena wokpɔna le ame sia ame me hena taɖodzinu si ŋu viɖe le.
7 But each one is given such a manifestation of the Spirit as will be advantageous.

8 Elabena woto gbɔgbɔ la dzi na ale si woaƒo nu nunyatɔe la ame aɖe, eye woto gbɔgbɔ ma ke dzi na nuƒoƒo ŋuti sidzedze ame bubu, 9 woto gbɔgbɔ ma ke dzi na xɔse ame bubu, eye woto gbɔgbɔ ɖeka ma ke dzi na dɔdada ƒe nunana ame bubu, 10 eye wona ŋusẽdɔwo wɔwɔ ame bubu hã, wona nyagbɔgblɔɖi ame bubu, wona nya siwo tso gbɔgbɔ me la gɔme sese ame bubu, wona gbe bubuwo dodo ame bubu, eye wona gbewo gɔme ɖeɖe ame bubu.

8 For one through the Spirit is given words of wisdom, and another words of knowledge after the same Spirit, 9 somebody else faith, in the same Spirit, and another gifts of healing, in the one Spirit, 10 and another miracle-workings, another prophecy, another discrimination between spirits, somebody else different kinds of languages, and another the translating of languages.
11 Ke gbɔgbɔ ɖeka ma kee wɔa dɔ siawo katã, eye wòmaa wo na ame sia ame ale si wòlɔ̃.
11 But in all these one and the same Spirit is at work, distributing to each individually as it wishes.

12 Ale si ko ametia nye nu ɖeka gake ŋutinu geɖewo le eŋu, eye ameti ma ƒe ŋutinuwo sɔ gbɔ gake woƒo ƒu wɔ ameti ɖeka la, nenema kee Kristo la hã le. 13 Elabena gbɔgbɔ ɖeka me woto nyrɔ mí katã ɖe ŋutilã ɖeka me, míeɖanye Yudatɔwo alo Helatɔwo o, míeɖanye kluviwo alo ablɔɖemewo o, eye wona mí katã míeno gbɔgbɔ ɖeka.

12 For just as the body is one and has many organs, but all the organs of the body, many as they are, are one body, so it is with the Christ; 13 for we too were all baptized in one Spirit into one body, be we Jews or Greeks, be we slaves or freemen, and were all given one Spirit to drink in.
14 Le nyateƒe me la, ametia menye ŋutinu ɖeka o, ke boŋ ŋutinu geɖewoe.
14 For neither is the body one organ, but many.

15 Ne afɔ agblɔ be, "Esi nyemenye asi o ta la, nyemenye ametia ƒe akpa aɖeke o " la, ema mewɔe be meganye ametia ƒe akpa aɖeke o. 16 Eye ne to agblɔ be, "Esi nyemenye ŋku o ta la, nyemenye ametia ƒe akpa aɖeke o " la, ema mewɔe be meganye ametia ƒe akpa aɖeke o.

15 If the foot says "Because I am not a hand I am no part of the body " it is not on that account no part of the body, 16 and if the ear says "Because I am not an eye I am no part of the body " it is not on that account no part of the body.

Ne wo katã nye nusese ɖe, ekema afi kae nuʋeʋẽse anɔ? 18 Ke Mawu ɖo ŋutinuawo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe wo teƒe le ametia ŋu abe ale si wòdi ene. 19 Ne wo katã nye ŋutinu ɖeka ɖe, ekema afi kae ametia anɔ? 20 Ke azɔ wonye ŋutinu geɖewo, gake ameti ɖeka.

17 If the body were wholly eye, where would be the hearing? if wholly ear, where the smelling? 18 But now God did put the organs each one of them in the body as he chose; 19 and if all were one organ, where would be the body? 20 but now there are many organs but one body.

21 Ŋku mate ŋu agblɔ na asi be, "Nyemehiã wò o "; eye ta hã mate ŋu agblɔ na afɔwo be, "Nyemehiã mi o. " 22 Ke boŋ ametia ƒe ŋutinu siwo dze abe ɖe wogbɔdzɔ wu ene la hiã vevie, 23 eye ametia ƒe akpa siwo míesusuna be bubu boo aɖeke mele wo ŋu o la, woawo ŋue míedea bubui wu, ale ŋutinu siwo menya kpɔ o la ŋue míetrɔa asi le nyuie wu, 24 evɔ ŋutinu siwo nya kpɔ la mehiã naneke o.

21 And the eye cannot say to the hand "I have no need of you, " or again the head to the feet "I have no need of you, " 22 but, much rather, what seem to be weak organs of the body are necessary, 23 and it is just what we think are less honorable parts of the body that we invest with special honor, and the indecorous parts of us have special decorum, 24 but the decorous parts of us stand in no need.

Gake Mawu fɔ ametia ƒe ŋutinuwo kpe, eye wòna bubu geɖe akpa siwo hiã bubu la, 25 ale be mama aɖeke naganɔ ametia me o, ke boŋ ŋutinuawo nalé be na wo nɔewo sɔsɔe. 26 Eye ne ŋutinu ɖeka le fu kpem la, ŋutinu bubuawo katã kpea fu kplii; alo ne wodo ŋutinu ɖeka ɖe dzi la, ŋutinu bubuawo katã kpɔa dzidzɔ kplii.

But God commingled the body, giving special honor to what came short, 25 in order that there might not be division in the body, but the organs might feel the same solicitude for each other; 26 and be it that one organ suffers, all the organs suffer with it; be it that one organ is decorated, all the organs rejoice with it.

27 Ke miawoe nye Kristo ƒe ŋutilã, eye mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe nye ŋutinuawo dometɔ aɖe. 28 Eye Mawu de dɔ asi na ame vovovowo le hamea me: gbã la, apostolowo; evelia nyagblɔɖilawo; etɔ̃lia nufialawo; emegbe ŋusẽdɔwɔwɔwo; dɔdada ƒe nunana; kpekpeɖeŋunadɔwo; mɔfiafiaŋutetewo; gbe bubuwo dodo. 29 Amewo katãe nye apostolowoa? Amewo katãe nye nyagblɔɖilawoa?

27 And you are Christ’s body, and, individually, organs; 28 and in the church God has put some, first, as apostles; secondly, as prophets; thirdly, as teachers; then miracles, then gifts of healing, assistance, management, different kinds of languages.
Amewo katãe nye nufialawoa? Amewo katãe wɔa ŋusẽdɔwoa? 30 Amewo katã sie dɔdada ƒe nunanawo lea? Amewo katãe ƒoa nu le gbegbɔgblɔ bubuwo mea?
29 Are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? do all work miracles? 30 do all have gifts of healing? do all speak languages? do all translate?
Amewo katãe nye nyagɔmeɖelawoa? 31 Ke miyi edzi mianɔ nunana siwo lolo wu la dim vevie.
31 But aspire to the greater gifts.
Ke azɔ mafia mɔ aɖe si de ŋgɔ wu la mi.
And let me point out to you an even preeminent course.
1 Korintotɔwo
1 Corinthians

2 Ne nyagblɔɖi ƒe nunana le asinye, eye menya nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔewo katã kple sidzedzewo katã, eye xɔse le asinye ale gbegbe be mate ŋu aho towo, gake lɔlɔ̃ mele asinye o la, nyemenye naneke o. 3 Eye ne metsɔ nye nunɔamesiwo katã na be woatsɔ anyi ame bubuwo, eye metsɔ nye ametia na, ale be maƒo adegbe, gake lɔlɔ̃ mele asinye o la, meɖe vi aɖeke kura nam o. 4 Lɔlɔ̃ gbɔa dzi blewu, eye wònyoa dɔme. Lɔlɔ̃ meʋãa ŋu o. Meƒoa adegbe o, medoa eɖokui ɖe dzi glodzoo o, 5 mewɔa nu si medze o, media eya ŋutɔ tɔ o, mebia dzi o.

13 If I speak the languages of men and angels but do not have love, I turn into a gong sounding or a cymbal clashing; 2 and if I have prophecy and know all secrets and all knowledge, and if I have all faith so as to move mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing; 3 and if I give all my possessions in charity, and if I give up my body in order to boast, but do not have love, I am none the better.

Meléa vɔ̃ siwo wowɔ ɖe eŋu la ɖi o. 6 Mekpɔa dzidzɔ ɖe nu madzɔmadzɔ ŋu o, ke ekpɔa dzidzɔ ɖe nyateƒe boŋ ŋu. 7 Enɔa te ɖe nuwo katã nu, exɔa nuwo katã dzi sena, ekpɔa mɔ na nuwo katã, edoa dzi le nuwo katã me. 8 Lɔlɔ̃ nu metsina gbeɖe o.

4 Love is patient, kind; love is not jealous; love does not show off, does not get inflated, 5 does not shock people, does not look out for its own interests, does not get provoked, does not count its injuries, 6 is not glad at a wrong deed but glad to have the truth made glad, 7 stands everything, believes everything, hopes everything, holds out through everything.

Ke ne nyagbɔgblɔɖi ƒe nunanawo li la, woava ɖe wo ɖa; ne gbegbɔgblɔ bubuwo gbɔgblɔ li la, woadzudzɔ; ne sidzedze li la, woava ɖee ɖa. 9 Elabena sidzedze afãafã ye le mía si, eye míegblɔa nya ɖi afãafã, 10 ke ne nu si le blibo la va ɖo la, woaɖe nu afãafã la ɖa.

8 Love never drops away; but as for prophecies they will be superseded, as for languages they will come to a stop, as for knowledge it will be superseded; 9 for it is in part that we know and in part that we prophesy, 10 but when the complete comes the partial will be superseded.
11 Esime menye ɖevi la, meƒoa nu abe ɖevi ene, mebua tame abe ɖevi ene, mebua nuwo ŋu abe ɖevi ene; ke azɔ esi metsi la, meɖe asi le ɖevimenuwo ŋu.
11 When I was a child I used a child’s language, took a child’s views, made a child’s calculations; since I have become a man I have superseded the child’s ways.
12 Elabena fifia la, míekpɔa nu flukpee to gahuhɔ̃e aɖe me, ke ɣemaɣi la, anye ŋkume kple ŋkume. Fifia la, menya nu afãafã, ke ɣemaɣi la, manya nu sia nu nyuie abe ale si wonyam nyuie ene.
12 For we see now by a mirror, as a puzzle to be guessed at, but then face to face; now I know in part, but then I shall be aware in the same way as he was aware of me.
13 Ke azɔ la, nu etɔ̃ siawoe kpɔtɔ li: xɔse, mɔkpɔkpɔ, lɔlɔ̃; ke esi ƒo wo tae nye lɔlɔ̃.
13 And now there remain faith, hope, love these three. And greatest of these is love.
1 Korintotɔwo
1 Corinthians
14 Miti lɔlɔ̃ yome, ke minɔ gbɔgbɔmenunanawo dim vevie, gake vevietɔ la, be miagblɔ nya ɖi.
14 Aim at love; but aspire to the manifestations of the Spirit, but preferably that you should prophesy.

2 Elabena ame si tsɔa gbegbɔgblɔ bubu ƒoa nu la, menye amewoe wòƒoa nu na o, ke boŋ Mawue, elabena ame aɖeke mesenɛ o, ke boŋ egblɔa nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔewo to gbɔgbɔ la dzi. 3 Ke ame si gblɔa nya ɖi la tua ame ɖo, eye wòdea dzi ƒo na ame hefaa akɔ na amewo to eƒe nuƒoƒo dzi.

2 For he who speaks a language is speaking not to men but to God, for nobody understands, but in spirit he is speaking secrets; 3 but he who prophesies is speaking upbuilding and exhortation and comfort for men.
4 Ame si tsɔa gbegbɔgblɔ bubu ƒoa nu la tua eya ŋutɔ ɖokui ɖo, ke ame si gblɔa nya ɖi la tua hame la ɖo.
4 He who speaks a language is building himself up; but he who prophesies is building up the church.

5 Ðe madi be mi katã miado gbegbɔgblɔ bubuwo hafi, ke medi be miagblɔ nya ɖi boŋ. Le nyateƒe me la, ame si gblɔa nya ɖi la de ŋgɔ wu ame si tsɔa gbegbɔgblɔ bubuwo ƒoa nui, negbe ɖe wòɖe egɔme, ale be wòatu hamea ɖo.

5 And I want to have you all speak languages, but preferably to have you prophesy; and he who prophesies is superior to him who speaks languages, except in case he translates so that the church may get an upbuilding.

Ke ne metsɔ nyaɖeɖefia alo sidzedze alo nyagbɔgblɔɖi alo nufiafia boŋ ƒo nu na mi la, ɖe maɖe vi wu oa? 7 Nenemae wòle le nu siwo me agbe mele o la ƒe ɖiɖime gome, eɖanye dze alo saŋku o. Ne woƒe ɖiɖi meto vovo o ɖe, aleke woawɔ anya nu si kum dze la le alo nu si ƒom saŋku la le? 8 Elabena ne kpẽ ƒe ɖiɖime mekɔ nyuie o ɖe, ame kae adzra ɖo ɖe aʋa ŋu? 9 Nenema kee miawo hã, ne mietsɔa aɖe gblɔa nya siwo gɔme anya se bɔbɔe o ɖe, aleke ame awɔ anya nya si gblɔm miele?

6 And now, brothers, if I come to you speaking languages what good shall I do you unless I speak to you either in revelation or in knowledge or in prophecy or teaching? 7 It is the same with lifeless sound-producers: be it flute or be it harp, if it does not make a distinction in the notes how will the tune that is being played be known? 8 For, again, if a trumpet makes an unclear sound, who will get ready for war? 9 So with you too: if by your tongues you do not produce plain speech, how will the meaning that is being spoken be known? for you will be talking into the air.

Le nyateƒe me la, anye nuƒoƒo ɖe yame. 10 Anye be gbegbɔgblɔ vovovowo le xexea me, gake wo dometɔ aɖeke meli, si ŋu gɔmesese mele o. 11 Elabena ne nyemese nya si wogblɔ la gɔme o la, ekema mezu dutagbedola na ame si le nu ƒom, eye ame si le nu ƒom hã zu dutagbedola nam.
10 There are so many kinds, say, of sounds in the world, and none unvocal; if, then, 11 I do not know the force of the sound, I shall be senseless to the speaker and the speaker senseless to me.
12 Eya ta miawo hã, esi miele gbɔgbɔ la ƒe nunanawo dim vevie ta la, midze agbagba miagba go le nunana siwo atu hamea ɖo la me.
12 In the same way you: since you are aspirants to spirit-gifts, try to excel for the upbuilding of the church.
13 Eya ta ame si tsɔa gbegbɔgblɔ bubu ƒoa nu la nedo gbe ɖa be yeate ŋu aɖe egɔme.
13 Wherefore, let him who speaks a language pray that he may translate.
14 Elabena ne metsɔa gbegbɔgblɔ bubu doa gbe ɖae la, gbɔgbɔ ƒe nunana si le asinye lae le gbea dom ɖa, ke nye susu ya meɖe vi aɖeke o.
14 For if I pray in a language, my spirit is praying but my mind is not fruiting.
15 Ekema nu kae mawɔ?
15 So what is the thing to do?
Matsɔ gbɔgbɔ ƒe nunana la ado gbe ɖa, eye magatsɔ nye susu hã ado gbe ɖa. Matsɔ gbɔgbɔ ƒe nunana la adzi kafukafuha, eye magatsɔ nye susu hã adzi kafukafuha.
I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the mind too; I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the mind too.

16 Ne menye nenema o la, ne ètsɔa gbɔgbɔ ƒe nunana la gblɔa kafukafunyawo ɖe, aleke ame tsɛ si le mia dome la ate ŋu agblɔ "Amen " ɖe wò akpedada dzi, esi menya nya si gblɔm nèle o? 17 Nyateƒee, èdaa akpe le mɔ nyui nu, gake metua ame kemɛa ɖo o.

16 Since if you bless in spirit, how is he who occupies the commoner’s place to say the Amen to your thanks, since he does not know what you are saying? 17 you are giving thanks well, but the other man is not being built up.

18 Medaa akpe na Mawu be metsɔa gbegbɔgblɔ bubuwo ƒoa nui wu mi katã. 19 Gake madi be matsɔ nye susu agblɔ nya atɔ̃ le hamea me, ale be mafia nu ame bubuwo hã, wu be magblɔ nya akpe ewo le gbegbɔgblɔ bubu me.

18 I thank God, I speak languages more freely than any of you; 19 but in meeting I had rather speak five sentences with my mind, in order to enlighten others too, than ten thousand sentences in a language.
20 Nɔviwo, miganye ɖevi suewo le nugɔmesese me o, ke boŋ minye ɖevi suewo le nu vɔ̃ɖi wɔwɔ me; ke mizu ame siwo tsi bliboe le nugɔmesese me.
20 Brothers, do not be children in intelligence; as to viciousness do be childlike, but in intelligence be adult.

21 Woŋlɔ ɖe Se la me be: "‘Dutagbedolawo ƒe aɖe kple du bubu me tɔwo ƒe nuyiwo matsɔ aƒo nu na dukɔ sia, ke hã, woagbe toɖoɖom,’ Yehowa ye gblɔe. " 22 Eya ta gbegbɔgblɔ bubuwo dodo menye dzesi na xɔsetɔwo o, ke boŋ na dzimaxɔsetɔwo, eye nyagbɔgblɔɖi meli na dzimaxɔsetɔwo o, ke boŋ na xɔsetɔwo.

21 In the law it stands written "By men of alien language and by alien lips I will speak to this people, and not even so will they listen to me, says the Lord. " 22 Consequently languages are for a token not to believers but to unbelievers, but prophecy not to unbelievers but to believers.

23 Eya ta ne hame blibo la katã va kpe ta ɖe afi ɖeka, eye wo katã wotsɔ gbegbɔgblɔ bubuwo le nu ƒom, eye ame tsɛwo alo dzimaxɔsetɔwo va la, ɖe womagblɔ be miaƒe tagbɔe le gbegblẽm oa? 24 Ke ne mi katã miele nya gblɔm ɖi, eye dzimaxɔsetɔ aɖe alo ame tsɛ aɖe va la, ekema miaƒe nyawo katã azu mokaka nɛ, eye wòatsɔ wo adzro eɖokui me. 25 Eƒe dzimenya ɣaɣlawo adze ƒãa, ale be wòatsyɔ mo anyi ade ta agu na Mawu agblɔ be: "Mawu le mia dome vavã. "

23 If then the whole church meets together and all are speaking languages, and commoners or unbelievers come in, will they not say you are crazy? 24 But if all are prophesying, and some unbeliever or commoner comes in, he is reproved by all, he is put through an examination by all, 25 the things hidden in his heart come out; and thus he will throw himself down on his face and do reverence to God, declaring that God really is among you.
26 Ekema nɔviwo, nu kae miawɔ?
26 So what is the thing to do, brothers?

Miwɔ nuwo katã hena tutuɖo. 27 Eye ne ame aɖe tsɔa gbegbɔgblɔ bubu ƒoa nu la, ke woanye ame eve alo ne ede ƒãa la, ame etɔ̃, eye woaƒo nu ɖekaɖeka, eye ame aɖe naɖe egɔme. 28 Ke ne gbegɔmeɖela aɖeke meli o la, nezi ɖoɖoe le hame la me, eye wòaƒo nu na eɖokui kple Mawu.

When you come together, each has a psalm, has a teaching, has a revelation, has a language, has a translation let everything be so done as to build up: 27 suppose somebody is speaking a language, let it be done by twos or at most threes, and one after another, and one translate; 28 but if there is no translator, let him keep silence in meeting, and speak to himself and to God.
29 Nyagblɔɖila eve alo etɔ̃ ko naƒo nu, eye ame bubuwo nadi egɔmesese. 30 Ke ne woɖe nane fia ame bubu aɖe si nɔ anyi ɖe afi ma la, ke ame gbãtɔ si le nu ƒom la nazi ɖoɖoe.
29 And of prophets let two or three speak and the others assess; 30 but if a revelation comes to another who is in the seats, let the first keep silence.

31 Elabena mi katã miate ŋu agblɔ nya ɖi ɖekaɖeka, ale be ame sia ame nasrɔ̃ nane, eye wòade dzi ƒo nɛ. 32 Eye nyagblɔɖilawo nakpɔ egbɔ be wozã gbɔgbɔ ƒe nunana la le ɖoɖo nu. 33 Elabena Mawu menye nyamanyamawɔwɔ ƒe Mawu o, ke ŋutifafa ƒe Mawu boŋ.

31 For you can all prophesy one at a time, in order that all may learn and all receive exhortation; 32 and prophets’ spirits subordinate themselves to prophets, 33 for God is not a God of disorder but of peace.
Abe ale si wòle le ame kɔkɔewo ƒe hamewo katã me ene la, 34 nyɔnuwo nazi ɖoɖoe le hameawo me, elabena womeɖe mɔ na wo be woaƒo nu o. Ke boŋ woabɔbɔ wo ɖokuiwo, abe ale si Se la hã gblɔe ene.
As in all meetings of God’s people, 34 let the women keep silence in the meetings; for it is not permissible for them to speak, but let them subordinate themselves, as the law too says.
35 Ke ne wodi be yewoasrɔ̃ nane la, woabia wo srɔ̃wo le aƒe me, elabena enye ŋukpe be nyɔnu naƒo nu le hamea me.
35 But if they wish to find out something, let them put questions to their husbands at home; for it is disgraceful for a woman to speak in meeting.

36 Mia gbɔe Mawu ƒe nya la dzɔ tsoa, alo miawo ɖeɖe gbɔ koe wòɖoa? 37 Ne ame aɖe susu be yenye nyagblɔɖila alo be wona gbɔgbɔ ƒe nunana ye la, ekema nelɔ̃ ɖe edzi be nya siwo ŋlɔm mele na mi la nye Aƒetɔ la ƒe sedede. 38 Ke ne ame aɖe metsɔ ɖe le eme o la, ekema womatsɔ ɖe le eya hã me o.

36 Or was it from you that the word of God started, or did it arrive at you alone? 37 If anybody is supposed to be a prophet or gifted with the Spirit, let him recognize what I am writing to you as being a commandment of the Lord; 38 but if somebody discredits it, discredit that.
39 Eya ta nɔvinyewo, miyi edzi mianɔ nyagbɔgblɔɖi ƒe nunana la dim vevie, gake migade se ɖe gbegbɔgblɔ bubuwo dodo nu o. 40 Ke mina nuwo katã nayi edzi nyuie ɖe ɖoɖo nu.
39 Consequently, brothers, aspire to prophesying, and do not bar speaking languages; 40 but let everything be done in a respectable and orderly way.
1 Korintotɔwo
1 Corinthians

15 Ke nɔviwo, mele ŋku ɖom nya nyui si megblɔ na mi, si hã miexɔ helé eme ɖe asi sesĩe la dzi na mi. 2 Miakpɔ ɖeɖe hã ne mielé nya nyui si megblɔ na mi la me ɖe asi sesĩe ko, negbe ɖe mieva zu xɔsetɔwo dzodzro. 3 Elabena nu gbãtɔ siwo metsɔ de asi na mi lae nye nu siwo nye hã mexɔ, be Kristo ku ɖe míaƒe nu vɔ̃wo ta le Ŋɔŋlɔawo nu; 4 eye woɖii, ɛ̃, wofɔe ɖe tsitre le ŋkeke etɔ̃a gbe le Ŋɔŋlɔawo nu; 5 eye eɖe eɖokui fia Kefas, emegbe la, Ame Wuieveawo. 6 Le ema megbe la, eɖe eɖokui fia nɔvi siwo wu alafa atɔ̃ zi ɖeka, ame siwo dometɔ akpa gãtɔ kpɔtɔ le mía dome, ke wo dometɔ aɖewo hã dɔ alɔ̃ le ku me. 7 Emegbe eɖe eɖokui fia Yakobo, eyome eɖe ɖokui fia apostoloawo katã.

15 But, brothers, let me make you acquainted with the gospel I preached to you, the same that you received, the same that you stand on, 2 the same that you are saved by, in what terms I preached it to you, if you are holding to it except in case you believed for nothing! 3 For I handed on to you as a foremost thing the same thing I received, that Christ died for our sins in accordance with scripture, 4 and that he was buried, and that he rose the third day in accordance with scripture, 5 and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the Twelve; 6 then he appeared to above five hundred brothers at a time, of whom the majority are with us until now, but some have gone to their rest; 7 then he appeared to James, then to all the apostles; 8 and last of all, as it were to the runt born by abortion, he appeared to me too.

8 Ke mlɔeba eɖe eɖokui fia nye hã, abe ame si ƒe ŋkeke mede hafi wodzii o ene. 9 Nyee nye suetɔ le apostoloawo dome, eye nyemedze woayɔ be apostolo o, elabena meti Mawu ƒe hame la yome. 10 Ke le Mawu ƒe amenuveve me la, mezu nu si menye egbea.

9 For I am the most insignificant of the apostles, not fit to be called an apostle, because I persecuted God’s church; 10 but by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace to me was not a failure, but I out-toiled all of them yet not I, but God’s grace with me.
11 Gake eɖanye nyee o, eɖanye woawoe o, nu siae míeɖea gbeƒãe, eye nu siae na mieva xɔe se.
11 So, be it I or they, we preach that way and you believed that way.

12 Ke ne wole gbeƒã ɖem be wofɔ Kristo ɖe tsitre tso ame kukuwo dome la, aleke wɔ mia dometɔ aɖewo le gbɔgblɔm be ame kukuwo ƒe tsitretsitsi aɖeke meli o? 13 Ne vavãe ame kukuwo ƒe tsitretsitsi aɖeke meli o la, ekema womefɔ Kristo ɖe tsitre o. 14 Ke ne womefɔ Kristo ɖe tsitre o la, ekema míaƒe gbeƒãɖeɖe la nye dzodzro nyateƒe, eye miaƒe xɔse hã nye dzodzro. 15 Azɔ hã, woakpɔ mí be míenye aʋatsoɖasefowo ɖe Mawu ŋu elabena míeɖia ɖase tsia tsitre ɖe Mawu ŋuti be efɔ Kristo la ɖe tsitre, evɔ ne vavãe womefɔa ame kukuwo ɖe tsitre o la, ekema mefɔe ɖe tsitre hafi o. 16 Elabena ne womafɔ ame kukuwo ɖe tsitre o la, ekema womefɔ Kristo hã ɖe tsitre o.

12 But if Christ is preached to have risen from the dead, how do some among you say there is no such thing as resurrection of the dead? 13 But if there is no such thing as resurrection of the dead, not even Christ has risen; 14 and if Christ has not risen, then our preaching has nothing in it, your faith has nothing in it either, 15 and into the bargain we are found to be false witnesses against God, because we testified as to God that he raised the Christ, whom he did not raise if we are to take it that the dead do not rise.
17 Eye ne womefɔ Kristo ɖe tsitre o la, ekema viɖe aɖeke mele miaƒe xɔse la ŋu o; miegakpɔtɔ le miaƒe nu vɔ̃wo me.
16 For if the dead do not rise, not even Christ has risen; 17 and if Christ has not risen, your faith is futile, you are still in your sins.
18 Ekema ame siwo dɔ alɔ̃ le ku me le Kristo me hã tsrɔ̃.
18 Then those who have gone to their rest in Christ perished too.
19 Ne agbe sia ɖeɖe ko mee míekpɔ mɔ na Kristo le la, ekema míaƒe nue wɔ nublanui wu.
19 If we are hoping in Christ in this life only, we are most pitiable of all men.
20 Gake azɔ wofɔ Kristo ɖe tsitre tso ame kukuwo dome, eye wònye ame siwo dɔ alɔ̃ le ku me la ƒe kutsetse gbãtɔ.
20 But now Christ has risen from the dead, first to come in of those who have gone to their rest.
21 Elabena esi wònye ame dzie ku to va ta la, ame kukuwo ƒe tsitretsitsi la hã to ame dzi va.
21 For since death came through a man, resurrection of the dead came through a man too.

22 Elabena ale si ko amewo katã kuna le Adam me la, nenema kee woagbɔ agbe wo katã hã le Kristo me. 23 Ke ame sia ame le eƒe ɖoɖo nu: Kristoe nye kutsetse gbãtɔ, emegbe la, ame siwo nye Kristo la tɔ le eƒe anyinɔɣi la. 24 Azɔ nuwuwu la ava, esime wòatsɔ Fiaɖuƒe la ade asi na eƒe Mawu, si nye Fofoa, ne eɖe dziɖuɖu katã kple amegãnyenye katã kpakple ŋusẽ katã ɖa vɔ. 25 Elabena ele be wòaɖu fia va se ɖe esime Mawu natsɔ futɔwo katã ade eƒe afɔ te.

22 For as by Adam all are dying, so too by the Christ all are going to be brought to life, 23 but each when his turn comes: Christ the first to come in; then those who belong to Christ, at his coming; 24 then the end, when he hands the empire over to God the Father, when he has superseded every government and every authority and power, 25 for he has to reign "until he has put all enemies under his feet. " 26 Last of the enemies death is superseded.
26 Futɔ mamlɛtɔ si woaɖe ɖa lae nye ku. 27 Elabena Mawu "tsɔ nuwo katã de eƒe afɔ te. " Ke esi wògblɔ be ‘wotsɔ nuwo katã de ete’ la, edze ƒãa be Ame si tsɔ nuwo katã de ete ya mele eme o.
27 For "he has subjected everything under his feet "; but, when it says "everything " is subjected, evidently exclusive of him who subjected everything to him.
28 Ke ne wotsɔ nuwo katã de ete vɔ la, ekema Vi la ŋutɔ hã atsɔ eɖokui ade Ame si tsɔ nuwo katã de ete la te, ale be Mawu nanye nuwo katã na ame sia ame.
28 But when everything has been subjected to him, then the Son himself too will be subjected to him who subjected everything to him, in order that God may be everything in everything.

29 Ne menye nenema o la, nu kae ame siwo nyrɔm wole yi ɖe ku me la awɔ? Ne womafɔ ame kukuwo ɖe tsitre kura o ɖe, ekema nu ka tae wole wo nyrɔm kple taɖodzinu ma? 30 Nu ka tae míawo hã míeɖoa afɔku me ɣesiaɣi ɖo? 31 Medzea ŋgɔ ku gbe sia gbe.

29 Because what will those who get baptized for the dead do? if dead men do not rise anyhow, why go the length of getting baptized for them? 30 Why, too, do we ourselves run risks every moment? 31 I am dying day after day, I swear it by the boast of you, brothers, which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord.

Nɔviwo, aseye si metsona le mia ta le mía Aƒetɔ Kristo Yesu me lae metsɔ le kpe ɖom nya sia dzi. 32 Ne mewɔ avu kple lã wɔadãwo le Efeso abe ame bubuwo ene ɖe, viɖe kae wònye nam? Ne womafɔ ame kukuwo ɖe tsitre o la, ekema "mina míaɖu nu, eye míano nu, elabena etsɔ míele kuku ge. " 33 Migana woaflu mi o. Hadede vɔ̃wo gblẽa nɔnɔme nyuiwo.

32 If as far as men were concerned I fought the beasts in Ephesus, what good does it do me? if dead men do not rise, "let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die. " 33 Make no mistake; "keeping bad company spoils good characters "; 34 sober up honestly and do not sin; for some folks are sheer materialists I speak to stir your sense of shame.

Nu si nèƒãna la megbɔa agbe o, negbe ɖe wòku gbã. 37 Eye nu si nèƒãna la, menye ati si amie tso eme lae nèƒãna o, ke boŋ nuku gbɔlo ko, ate ŋu anye lu alo nuku bubu ɖe sia ɖe; 38 ke Mawu naa nɔnɔmee ale si wòlɔ̃, eye wònaa nukuawo ŋutɔ ƒe nɔnɔme wo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe.

35 But somebody will say "How do the dead rise? and with what sort of body do they come? " 36 Silly man, what you yourself sow does not come to life unless it dies; 37 and of what you sow you sow not the body that is to come but a naked grain, of wheat say or some one of the rest; 38 and God gives it a body as he has willed, and to each of the seeds a body of its own.
39 Menye ŋutilãwo katãe nye ŋutilã ɖeka ƒomevi o, ke boŋ amegbetɔwo tɔ li, lãfɔnewo ƒe ŋutilã li, xewo ƒe ŋutilã li eye tɔmelãwo tɔ hã li.
39 Flesh is not all of it the same flesh, but there is one of men, and another flesh of cattle, and another flesh of fowl, and another of fishes.
40 Dziƒoŋutilãwo li, eye anyigbadziŋutilãwo hã li; ke dziƒoŋutilãwo ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe le vovo, eye anyigbadziŋutilãwo hã tɔ le vovo.

40 And there are heavenly bodies and earthly bodies, but the glory of the heavenly is of one type and that of the earthly is other: 41 one glory of the sun and another glory of the moon and another glory of the stars, for star differs from star in glory.
41 Ɣe ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe le vovo, ɣleti ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe le vovo, eye ɣletiviwo ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe hã le vovo; le nyateƒe me la, ɣletivi ɖe sia ɖe ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe to vovo na nɔvia tɔ.

42 So too the resurrection of the dead: it is sowed in dissolution, it rises in imperishability; 43 it is sowed in ignominy, it rises in glory; it is sowed in weakness, it rises in power; 44 it is sowed an animal body, it rises a spiritual body.
42 Nenema kee ame kukuwo ƒe tsitretsitsi hã le.
If there is an animal body there is a spiritual too.
Ne ŋutilã si míekpɔna li la, ekema gbɔgbɔŋutilã hã li. 45 Woŋlɔ ɖi be: "Ame gbãtɔ Adam zu ame gbagbe. "
45 It is written so too, the first man Adam "became a living soul "; the last Adam, a life-giving spirit.
Adam mamlɛtɔ zu gbɔgbɔ si naa agbe. 46 Gake menye gbɔgbɔmetɔe gbãtɔ nye o.
46 But there is not first the spiritual, but the animal, then the spiritual.
47 Ame gbãtɔ la tso anyigba me, eye anyi wotsɔ mèe; ame evelia ya tso dziƒo.
47 The first man was out of the earth, a figure of clay; the second man, out of heaven.

48 Ame siwo wowɔ kple anyi la le ko abe ame si wotsɔ anyi mè la ene; eye ame siwo le dziƒo la le ko abe ame si tso dziƒo va la ene. 49 Eye ale si ko ame si wotsɔ anyi mè la ƒe nɔnɔme le mía si la, nenema kee ame si tso dziƒo va la ƒe nɔnɔme hã anɔ mía si.

48 Such as the figure of clay, such also are those who are of clay, and such as the heavenly one, such also are those who are heavenly; 49 and as we have worn the likeness of the figure of clay, let us wear the likeness of the heavenly one also.
50 Ke nɔviwo, esia gblɔm mele be, ŋutilã kple ʋu mate ŋu anyi Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la dome o, eye gbegblẽ mate ŋu anyi magblemagblẽ dome o.
50 But this I do say, brothers, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the Reign of God, nor does dissolution inherit imperishability.

51 Kpɔ ɖa! Mele nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe aɖe gblɔm na mi: Menye mí katãe adɔ alɔ̃ le ku me o, ke boŋ woatrɔ mí katã míaƒe nɔnɔme 52 enumake, le aɖabaƒoƒo ɖeka me, le kpẽkuku mamlɛa me. Elabena kpẽ la aɖi, eye woafɔ ame kukuwo ɖe tsitre magblemagblẽe, eye woatrɔ míaƒe nɔnɔme.

51 Here I tell you a secret: we shall not all go to our rest, but we shall all be changed in an instant, 52 in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet; for the trumpet will sound, and the dead will rise imperishable, and we shall be changed.
53 Elabena ele be nu sia, si gblẽna la, nadó magblemagblẽ, eye nu sia, si kuna la, nadó makumaku.
53 For this that is perishable has to dress itself in imperishability, and this that is mortal to dress itself in immortality.
54 Ke ne nu sia si gblẽna la dó magblemagblẽ, eye nu sia si kuna la dó makumaku la, ekema nya si woŋlɔ ɖi la ava eme be: "Womi ku tegbee. " 55 "Ku, wò dziɖuɖu ɖe?
54 But when this that is mortal does dress itself in immortality, then the words that are written will come true, 55 "Death has been swallowed up in victory. "
Ku, afi kae wò ti si nètsɔ le ame tém la le? " 56 Ti si hea ku vanɛ lae nye nu vɔ̃, eye nu vɔ̃ ƒe ŋusẽe nye Se la.
Where is your victory, death? where is your sting, death? 56 But the sting of death is sin. And the power of sin is the law.
57 Ke woada akpe na Mawu be ena dziɖuɖu mí to mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo dzi!
57 And thanks be to God who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
58 Eya ta nɔvinye lɔlɔ̃tɔwo, minɔ te sesĩe, maʋamaʋã, eye miwɔ geɖe le Aƒetɔ la ƒe dɔ la me ɣesiaɣi, elabena mienyae be miaƒe agbagbadzedze le Aƒetɔ la me menye dzodzro o.
58 Consequently, dear brothers, be firm in your footing, not easy to knock about, always abundant in work for the Lord, knowing that your labor does not come to nothing in the Lord.
1 Korintotɔwo
1 Corinthians

16 Ke le nudzɔdzɔ si woaɖo ɖe ame kɔkɔeawo ŋuti la, miwɔ ɖe mɔfiame siwo mena hame siwo le Galatia la dzi. 2 Le kwasiɖa ɖe sia ɖe ƒe ŋkeke gbãtɔ dzi la, mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe nadzra nane ɖo le eƒe ŋutete nu, ale be mahiã be mava ɖo hafi miadzɔ nu o.

16 And as to the collection for the members of the church, do the same as I directed the churches of Macedonia: 2 the first day of every week let each of you lay by to accumulate whatever he is prospered to, in order that when I come there may not be taking up of collections then.
3 Ke ne meva ɖo la, madɔ ŋutsu siwo dzi mieda asi ɖo le miaƒe agbalẽawo me la be woatsɔ miaƒe dɔmenyonunana la ayi Yerusalem. 4 Gake ne esɔ be nye hã mayi la, ekema woayi kplim.
3 And when I arrive, whomever you approve I will send with letters to take your kindness to Jerusalem; 4 and if it is worth while for me to go too, they shall go with me.
5 Ke ne metso Makedonia la, mava mia gbɔ, elabena Makedonia to ge mele; 6 eye ɖewohĩ manɔ mia gbɔ vie, alo matsi mia gbɔ le vuvɔŋɔli la gɔ̃ hã, ale be miaɖom ɖa vie ne mayi afi si wòle be magayi.

5 But I will come to you when I have been through Macedonia; for I am going through Macedonia, 6 but with you I shall maybe stay a while or over the winter, in order that you may give me a send-off wherever I may be going.
7 Nyemedi be makpɔ mi fifia ne metso eme va yina o, elabena mele mɔ kpɔm be ne Yehowa ɖe mɔ la, mava nɔ mia gbɔ vie.
7 For I do not want to pay you a passing visit now; for I hope to stay with you some time, if the Lord permits.
8 Ke manɔ Efeso va se ɖe Pentekoste Ŋkekenyui la dzi, 9 elabena woʋu dɔwɔwɔ ƒe ʋɔtru gã aɖe nam, gake tsitretsiɖeŋula geɖewo li.
8 But I shall stay in Ephesus till Pentecost; 9 for a great door for effective work has been opened to me, and there are many opponents.
10 Ne Timoteo va ɖo la, mikpɔ egbɔ be vɔvɔ̃ nagaɖoe le mia dome o, elabena Yehowa ƒe dɔ wɔmee wòle abe nye ke ene. 11 Eya ta ame aɖeke megado vloe o.

10 But if Timothy comes, see to it that he is free from fear among you; for he is working at the Lord’s work the same as I am, 11 so let nobody scorn him, but start him on his way in peace to come to me, for I am expecting him with the brothers.
Mikplɔe ɖo ɖa le ŋutifafa me, ne wòava gbɔnye afi sia, elabena mele eya kple nɔviawo lalam. 12 Ke le mía nɔvi Apolo ŋuti la, meɖe kuku nɛ vevie be eya kple nɔviawo nava mia gbɔ.
12 But as to Brother Apollos, I strongly urged him to come to you with the brothers, and it positively was not willed that he should come now, but he will when he gets a chance.
13 Minɔ ŋudzɔ, minɔ tsitre sesĩe le xɔse la me, miwɔ ŋutsu, misẽ ŋu.
13 Keep awake, stand firm in the faith, be manly, take on strength.
14 Miwɔ miaƒe nuwo katã le lɔlɔ̃ me.
14 Let everything you are concerned in be done in love.

15 Ke mele nu xlɔ̃m mi, nɔviwo: Mienyae be Stefana ƒe aƒe lae nye kutsetse gbãtɔ le Akaya, eye wotsɔ wo ɖokuiwo ɖo anyi hena ame kɔkɔewo subɔsubɔ. 16 Miawo hã miyi edzi miabɔbɔ mia ɖokui na ame siawo tɔgbi kple ame siwo katã le asi kpem ɖe dɔa ŋu aduadu hele kutri kum.

15 But I urge you, brothers, you know Stephanas’s family, how it was the first to come in in Achaea and they charged themselves with service to God’s people, 16 that you too put yourselves at the disposal of folks like that and of everybody who cooperates and does the hard work.
17 Ke mekpɔ dzidzɔ le Stefana, Fortunato kple Akaiko ƒe anyinɔnɔ ŋuti, elabena esi miele afi sia o la, woxɔ ɖe mia teƒe. 18 Elabena wofa akɔ na nye gbɔgbɔ kple miawo hã mia tɔ.
17 And I am glad of the arrival of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus because these filled out the shortage of you; 18 for they set my spirit at rest, and yours too.
Eya ta mikpɔ ŋudzedze ɖe ame siawo tɔgbi ŋu.
So recognize folks like that.
19 Hame siwo le Asia la do gbe na mi.
19 The churches of Asia send you greetings.
Akwila kple Priskila kpakple hame si le woƒe aƒe me la do gbe na mi vevie le Aƒetɔ la me.
Aquila and Prisca, with the meeting at their home, send you many greetings in the Lord.
20 Nɔviawo katã do gbe na mi.
20 All the brothers send you greetings.
Mitsɔ nugbugbɔ kɔkɔe do gbe na mia nɔewo.
Give my greetings to each other with a holy kiss.
21 Nye Paulo ƒe gbedoname, si metsɔ nye ŋutɔ nye asi ŋlɔ lae nye esi.
21 Greeting with my own hand from me, Paul.
22 Ne ame aɖe melɔ̃ Aƒetɔ la o la, neɖi eŋu kpékpekpe.
22 If anyone does not love the Lord, let him be for God’s destruction.
Oo, mía Aƒetɔ, va! 23 Mía Aƒetɔ Yesu ƒe amenuveve nanɔ kpli mi.
Maran atha. 23 The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you.
24 Nye lɔlɔ̃ nanɔ kpli mi katã le Kristo Yesu me.
24 My love is with you all in Christ Jesus.
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians

1 Paulo, Kristo Yesu ƒe apostolo to Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu me, kple mía nɔvi Timoteo, le esia ŋlɔm na Mawu ƒe hame si le Korinto kple ame kɔkɔe siwo le Akaya nutoa katã me: 2 Amenuveve kple ŋutifafa si tso Mawu mía Fofo kple Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo gbɔ la woana mi.

1 Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through God’s will, and Brother Timothy, to God’s church at Corinth with all the people of God in all Achaea; 2 grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

3 Woakafu mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe Mawu, si nye Fofoa, ame si nye dɔmetɔtrɔ Fofo kple akɔfafawo katã ƒe Mawu, 4 ame si faa akɔ na mí le míaƒe tetekpɔwo katã me, ale be míato akɔfafa si míekpɔ tso Mawu gbɔ la dzi afa akɔ na ame siwo le tetekpɔ ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi me tom la. 5 Elabena ale si ko míaƒe fukpekpewo le Kristo la ta sɔ gbɔe la, nenema kee akɔfafa si míekpɔna la hã sɔ gbɔ to Kristo dzi.
