3 Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of compassion and God of all encouragement, 4 who encourages us upon all our distress so that we may be able to encourage those who are in any distress with the encouragement that is given to us ourselves by God, 5 because as the Christ’s sufferings are coming plentifully to us, so through the Christ our encouragement too comes in plentiful measure.

6 Ne míele tetekpɔwo me tom la, esi míedi be miakpɔ akɔfafa kple ɖeɖe tae; eye ne wofa akɔ na mí la, ale si miawo hã miakpɔ akɔfafa, be miate ŋu ado dzi le fu siwo ke míawo hã míekpena me la tae. 7 Ale mɔkpɔkpɔ si le mía si le mia ŋuti la li ke sesĩe, esi míenyae be, ale si ko miawo hã mietoa fukpekpewo me la, nenema kee woafa akɔ na miawo hã. 8 Elabena nɔviwo, míedi be xaxa si me míeto le Asia nutoa me la nanɔ manyamanya na mi o. Womimi mí ɖo wòwu tsɔtsɔ na mí ale gbegbe be míegaka ɖe edzi be míatsi agbe gɔ̃ hã o.

6 And be it that we are distressed, this is for your encouragement and salvation; or be it that we are encouraged, this is for your encouragement, which takes effect in the steadfast endurance of the same sufferings that we too undergo, 7 and our hope is firm for you, knowing as we do that as you are included in the sufferings, so too you are included in the encouragement.

9 Le nyateƒe me la, míesusu be wotso kufia na mí. Eva eme alea, ale be míagaɖo dzi ɖe mía ɖokuiwo ŋu o, ke boŋ ɖe Mawu, ame si fɔa ame kukuwo ɖe tsitre la ŋu. 10 Eɖe mí tso ku ƒe ŋɔdzi gã aɖe me, eye agaɖe mí, eye míele mɔ kpɔm be agayi edzi aɖe mí.

8 For we do not want you to go without the knowledge, brothers, as to our distress in Asia, that we had an extraordinarily hard time, too hard for our powers, so that we had no prospect of even living, 9 but have had in our own selves the answer of death, in order that we may not be confident in ourselves but in God who raises the dead, 10 who delivered us out of that awful death and will do so; on whom we have set our hope.
11 Miawo hã miate ŋu akpe ɖe mía ŋu aƒo koko ɖe mía ta, ale be ame geɖewo nada akpe ɖe mía ta, le ale si wove mía nui heɖo ame geɖewo ƒe gbedodoɖa ɖe mía ta ŋu la ŋuti.
And he will deliver us still, 11 while you cooperate helpfully on our behalf by petition, in order that from many faces thanks for the favor bestowed on us may be given through many on our behalf.

12 Elabena nu si ŋu míeƒoa adegbe lee nye esi, be míaƒe dzitsinya ɖia ɖase be míenɔ agbe le xexea me, vevietɔ le mia dome, le kɔkɔenyenye kple anukwareɖiɖi si dzea Mawu ŋu la nu, menye ɖe ŋutilã ƒe nunya nu o, ke boŋ ɖe Mawu ƒe amenuveve nu.

12 For this is our boast, the testimony of our conscience that it was in God’s holiness and candor, not in fleshly wisdom but in the grace of God, that we lived the life we did in the world; and very specially in relation to you.

13 Elabena míele nya bubu aɖeke ŋlɔm ɖo ɖe mi o, negbe nu siwo miate ŋu axlẽ ase wo gɔme la ko; eye mele mɔ kpɔm be miayi edzi anɔ nu siawo gɔme sem bliboe, 14 abe ale si ko miese egɔme xoxo va se ɖe afi aɖe ene, be miatsɔ mí aƒo adegbee, abe ale si ko míawo hã míatsɔ mi aƒo adegbee le mía Aƒetɔ Yesu ƒe ŋkeke la dzi ene.

13 For we do not write anything else to you but what you read or even recognize, and we hope will recognize to the full, 14 as you did in part recognize us to be your boast, the same as you are ours on the day of our Lord Jesus.

15 Eya ta esi kakaɖedzi sia su asinye ta la, meɖoe gbã be mava mia gbɔ ale be dzi nagadzɔ mi zi evelia; 16 elabena meɖoe be mava kpɔ mi ɖa ne meyina Makedonia, eye magatrɔ tso Makedonia ava mia gbɔ, eye miaɖom ɖa mayi Yudea.

15 And in this assurance I wanted to come first to you, in order that you might have a second glad time, 16 and to go through to Macedonia by way of you and come from Macedonia to you again and have you see me off for Judea.

Alo ɖe meɖoa tame le ŋutilã ƒe didi nu, ale be nye nyawo nyea "Ɛ̃, ɛ̃, " eye wògatrɔna zua "Ao, ao " mahã? 18 Ke esi miate ŋu aka ɖe Mawu dzi godoo ta la, nya si míegblɔ na mi la menye "ɛ̃ " ganye "ao " o.

17 Wanting to do this, then, did I act capriciously? or is it in the way of flesh that I plan what I plan, so that with me there should be "O yes " and "O no "? 18 But, as God is faithful, our words to you are not yes-and-no.
19 Elabena Mawu ƒe Vi, Yesu Kristo, ame si woɖe gbeƒãe le mia dome to nye ŋutɔ kple Silvano kpakple Timoteo dzi la, menye "ɛ̃, " ganye "ao " o, ke boŋ "ɛ̃ " nye "ɛ̃ " le eya gome.
19 For God’s Son Jesus Christ, who was proclaimed among you through us, Silvanus and Timothy and me, has not shown himself a yes-and-no, but in him there has been a Yes.
20 Elabena aleke gbegbee Mawu ƒe ŋugbedodowo ɖasɔ gbɔe o, wo katã nye "ɛ̃ " to eya amea dzi. Eya ta to eya amea dzi kee míegblɔa "Amen " na Mawu bena míahe ŋutikɔkɔe avɛ na Mawu.
20 For in him is the Yes to as many promises of God as there are; for which reason through him also comes the Amen for glory to God through us.

21 Ke ame si ɖo kpe edzi be míawo kple miawo míenye Kristo tɔ, eye wòsi ami na mí lae nye Mawu. 22 Eɖo eƒe nutrenu mía ŋu hã, eye wòna nu si ava va la ƒe kpeɖodzi sue aɖe mí, si nye gbɔgbɔ la, le míaƒe dziwo me.
21 And the one who brings us with you into a settled position in Christ and has anointed us is God, 22 the same who sealed us and gave us the Spirit in our hearts as earnest-money.
23 Meyɔ Mawu be wòanye ɖasefo nam be, fafam mele na mi be miagaxa nu akpa o tae nyemeva Korinto haɖe o.
23 But I call God as witness against my own self that it was out of consideration for you I broke off coming to Corinth.
24 Menye be míeɖua aƒetɔ ɖe miaƒe xɔse dzi o, ke boŋ míenye hadɔwɔlawo hena miaƒe dzidzɔ, elabena miaƒe xɔsee na miele tsitre.
24 Not that we have any control over your faith, but we are cooperators in your joy; for it is by faith you stand.
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians
2 Ke meɖoe be nyemagatsɔ nuxaxa ava mia gbɔ azɔ o.
2 But I made this resolution, not to come to you with an annoyance again.

2 Elabena ne mena miexa nu la, ekema ame kae gali ado dzidzɔ nam, ne menye ame si medo nuxaxa na lae oa? 3 Meŋlɔ nya mawo ɖo ɖe mi, ale be ne meva la, nyemagaxa nu le ame siwo ta wòle be makpɔ dzidzɔ ɖo hafi la ŋuti o, elabena kakaɖedzi le asinye be nu si hea dzidzɔ vanɛ nam la hea dzidzɔ vanɛ na mi katã hã.

2 For if I annoy you, then who is it that gladdens me but the one who is annoyed by me? 3 And I wrote that very thing in order that I might not, when I come, have annoyance from those over whom I ought to be rejoicing, being confident of you all that my joy is that of all of you.
4 Elabena xaxa kple dzi kpekpe ye na metsɔ aɖatsi geɖe ŋlɔ nu ɖo ɖe mi, menye be mana miaxa nu o, ke boŋ ne mianya lɔlɔ̃ si gbegbe le asinye na mi.
4 For in much distress and heartache I wrote to you with many tears, not in order that you might be annoyed but in order that you might know the love I specially feel toward you.
5 Ke ne ame aɖe he nuxaxa vɛ la, menye nyee wòdo nuxaxa na o, ke boŋ le mɔ aɖe nu la, mi katãe.
5 And if anyone has caused an annoyance he has caused it not to me but in part, not to come down too hard, to all of you.
Ke nyemedi be nye nyawo nu nasẽ akpa o. 6 Tohehe sia si mia dometɔ akpa gãtɔ miena ŋutsu sia la sɔ gbɔ nɛ; 7 azɔ la, mitsɔe kee faa, eye mifa akɔ nɛ, ale be nuxaxa akpa nagamii o.
6 For such a one this rebuke by the majority is sufficient; 7 so that on the contrary you should rather be condoning and encouraging, for fear such a one should be crushed with excessive grief.
8 Eya ta mele nu xlɔ̃m mi be, miɖee fiae be mielɔ̃e. 9 Esia ta meŋlɔ agbalẽ ɖo ɖe mi, ne manya ne miele klalo aɖo to le nuwo katã me.
8 For which reason I urge you to take the line of love toward him; 9 for this was what I wrote for, in order to ascertain your quality, whether you are obedient on all points.

10 Ne mietsɔ ame aɖe ƒe nu si wòwɔ kee la, nye hã metsɔe kee. Le nyateƒe me la, nu sia nu si metsɔ ke (ne metsɔ nane ke) la, miaƒe viɖe tae metsɔe ke ɖo le Kristo ŋkume, 11 ale be Satana ƒe asi nagasu mía dzi o, elabena eƒe ayemɔwo mele ɣaɣla ɖe mí o.

10 But to him to whom you condone anything, so do I for what I have condoned, if anything I have, has been on your account before Christ’s face, 11 in order that we may not be overreached by Satan; for we are not unacquainted with his contrivances.

12 Ke esi meva ɖo Troa be magblɔ Kristo la ŋu nya nyuia, eye woʋu ʋɔtru nam le Aƒetɔ la me la, 13 nye gbɔgbɔ tsi dzodzodzoe le menye, elabena nyemekpɔ nɔvinye Tito o. Eya ta meklã nusrɔ̃la siwo le afi ma hedze Makedonia mɔ.

12 But when I came to Troas to preach Christ’s gospel, and had a door opened for me in the Lord, 13 I did not have any relief for my spirit owing to my not finding my brother Titus, but bade them farewell and went out to Macedonia.

14 Ke woada akpe na Mawu, ame si nɔa ŋgɔ na mí ɣesiaɣi le aʋadziɖuɖu ƒe gbɔlɔlɔ gã aɖe me ɖekae kple Kristo, eye wòtoa mía dzi kakaa eŋuti sidzedze ƒe ʋeʋẽ lilili le afi sia afi! 15 Elabena míenye Kristo ƒe ʋeʋẽ lilili na Mawu le ame siwo xɔm wole ɖe agbe kple ame siwo le tsɔtsrɔ̃m la dome; 16 míenye ku ƒe ʋeʋẽ si kplɔa ame yia ku me na ame siwo le tsɔtsrɔ̃m, eye míenye agbe ƒe ʋeʋẽ lilili si kplɔa ame yia agbe me na ame siwo xɔm wole ɖe agbe la.

14 But thanks be to God who is always leading us about in his triumph and through us diffusing in every place the odor of the knowledge of him, 15 because we are Christ’s genial scent to God among those who are being saved and among those who are being lost 16 to these an odor from death, to death, but to those an odor from life, to life.

Eye ame kae dze nyuie na nu siawo wɔwɔ? 17 Míawoe, elabena míetsɔa Mawu ƒe nya la tsaa asi abe ale si ame geɖewo wɔnɛ ene o, ke boŋ míeƒoa nu le anukwareɖiɖi me abe ame siwo Mawu dɔ ene; ɛ̃, le Mawu ŋkume, le ɖekawɔwɔ me kple Kristo.
And for this who is adequate? 17 For we are not like so many, peddling God’s word for a living; it is as in honor bound, it is as from God, in God’s presence, in Christ, that we speak.
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians

3 Elabena mieɖee fia be miawoe nye Kristo ƒe agbalẽ si mí subɔlawo míeŋlɔ, menye kple agbalẽŋlɔtsi o, ke boŋ kple Mawu gbagbe la ƒe gbɔgbɔ, menye ɖe kpe ŋutɔŋutɔwo dzi o, ke boŋ ɖe esiwo nye ŋutilã dzi, ɖe dziwo dzi. 4 Kakaɖedzi sia le mía si le Mawu me to Kristo dzi.

3 Are we beginning to recommend ourselves again? or do we want, as some folks do, letters of commendation to you or from you? 2 You are our letter, inscribed on our hearts, known and read by all men, 3 manifested to be a letter of Christ’s delivered by us, inscribed not in ink but in Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on heart-tablets of flesh.

5 Menye be míawo ŋutɔwo míedze nyuie asusu be míawo gbɔe nane tso o, ke boŋ míaƒe dzedze nyuie la tsoa Mawu gbɔ, 6 ame si na míedze nyuie be míanye nubabla yeye aɖe ƒe subɔlawo, menye se siwo woŋlɔ ɖi la tɔwo o, ke boŋ gbɔgbɔ la tɔwo; elabena se siwo woŋlɔ ɖi la tsoa kufia na ame, ke gbɔgbɔ la gbɔa agbe ame.

4 But we have such assurance through the Christ toward God, 5 not that we are adequate of ourselves to count anything as from ourselves, but our adequacy is from God, 6 the same who made us adequate as servitors of a new covenant not of letter but of spirit; for the letter kills but the spirit brings to life.

7 Azɔ ne Se si hea kufiatsotso vanɛ, si wotsɔ ŋɔŋlɔdzesiwo ŋlɔ ɖe kpewo dzi la, va le ŋutikɔkɔe ma gbegbe me be Israel-viwo mete ŋu kpɔ Mose ƒe mo o le ŋutikɔkɔe si dze le eƒe mo ta, evɔ wònye ŋutikɔkɔe si woava ɖe ɖa la, 8 ekema ɖe gbɔgbɔ la ƒe subɔsubɔdɔ manɔ ŋutikɔkɔe geɖe wu me oa? 9 Elabena ne ŋutikɔkɔe nɔ Se si hea fɔbubu vanɛ ŋu la, ekema ŋutikɔkɔe ka gbegbee nye esi anɔ subɔsubɔdɔ si hea dzɔdzɔenyenye vanɛ la ŋu! 10 Le nyateƒe me la, woɖe ŋutikɔkɔe ɖa le nu si wodo ŋutikɔkɔe na tsã la gɔ̃ hã ŋu, le ŋutikɔkɔe si ƒo eta sãa la ta.

7 And if the service of death, in letters, imprinted in stones, came in glory so that the sons of Israel could not fix their eyes on Moses’s face because of that glory of his face which was being superseded, 8 how shall the service of the Spirit not be more greatly in glory? 9 For if the service of condemnation is glory, much more surpassing in glory is the service of righteousness; 10 for the glorified is even gloryless in this aspect, on account of the glory that outdoes it.
11 Elabena ne nu si woava ɖe ɖa la va le ŋutikɔkɔe me la, ekema aleke gbegbe nu si anɔ anyi ya ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe alolo wue nye esi!
11 For if what is superseded comes in glory, much more does what remains stand in glory.

12 Esi mɔkpɔkpɔ sia le mía si ta la, míevo aƒo nu faa, 13 eye míawo ya míewɔa nu si Mose wɔ esi wòtsɔa motsyɔnu tsyɔa mo be Israel-viwo nagakpɔ nu si woava ɖe ɖa la ƒe nuwuwu o. 14 Ke woƒe susu wɔ dɔ̃ɔ. Elabena va se ɖe egbegbe la, ne wole nubabla xoxoa xlẽm la, motsyɔnu ma gali kokoko, elabena Kristo dzi ko wotona ɖenɛ ɖa. 15 Le nyateƒe me la, va se ɖe egbegbe la, ɣesiaɣi si woxlẽ Mose ƒe nuŋlɔɖiwo la, motsyɔnu tsyɔa woƒe dziwo dzi.

12 So, having such a hope, we practice great frankness, 13 and do not do as Moses did when he put a veil over his face so that the sons of Israel should not set eyes on the end of what was being superseded; 14 but their senses became callous, for to this very day the same veil remains over the reading of the old covenant, not thrown back because it is superseded in Christ, 15 but to this day when Moses is read a veil lies over their heart.
16 Ke ne wotrɔ ɖe Yehowa ŋu la, ekema woɖea motsyɔnu la ɖa.
16 But when he returns to the Lord the veil is taken off.
17 Azɔ la, Yehowa nye Gbɔgbɔ; eye afi si Yehowa ƒe gbɔgbɔ le la, afi mae ablɔɖe le.
17 And the Lord is the Spirit; and where the Lord’s Spirit is, freedom is.

18 Eye esi mí katã míetsɔa mo siwo wometsyɔ nui o ɖea Yehowa ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe fiana abe ahuhɔ̃ewo ene ta la, wotrɔa míaƒe nɔnɔme ɖe nɔnɔme ma ke me tso ŋutikɔkɔe me yi ŋutikɔkɔe si de ŋgɔ wu me, abe ale si tututu Yehowa, Gbɔgbɔ la, wɔe ene.

18 But we all of us, viewing the reflection of the Lord’s glory with face freed from its veil, are transfigured into the same likeness, from glory into glory, as should be the case from the Lord’s Spirit.
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians

4 Eya ta esi wokpɔ nublanui na mí hetsɔ subɔsubɔdɔ sia de asi na mí ta la, míenaa ta o. 2 Ke boŋ míegbea nu le ŋukpenanu ɣaɣlawo gbɔ, míewɔa ayemenu o, eye míetɔa tsi Mawu ƒe nya la hã o; ke boŋ le Mawu ŋkume la, míehea nyateƒea ɖe go eye míekpɔa ŋusẽ nyui ɖe amewo katã ƒe dzitsinya dzi.

4 For this reason, having this service to perform as mercy was granted to us, we do not give up trying, 2 but have renounced the concealments of shame, not walking in trickery nor adulterating God’s word, but by giving publicity to the truth commending ourselves to every human conscience before God.

3 Ke ne wotsyɔ nu nya nyui si gblɔm míele la dzi vavã la, ame siwo le tsɔtsrɔ̃m lae wotsyɔ nu edzi na, 4 ale nuɖoanyi sia ƒe mawu gbã ŋku na dzimaxɔsetɔ siawo ƒe tamesusu, ale be Kristo, si nye Mawu ƒe nɔnɔme la, ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe nya nyui la ƒe kekeli nagaklẽ na wo o.

3 And if our gospel be veiled, it is veiled in the case of those who are being lost, 4 in whose case the god of this world has blinded unbelievers’ senses so that they should not eye the refulgence of the gospel of the glory of the Christ, who is image of God.

5 Elabena míele gbeƒã ɖem mía ɖokui o, ke boŋ Yesu Kristo, be eyae nye Aƒetɔ la, eye míawo míenye miaƒe kluviwo le Yesu ta. 6 Elabena Mawu ame si gblɔ be, "Kekeli neklẽ tso viviti me " lae klẽ ɖe míaƒe dziwo me be wòana Mawu ŋuti sidzedze wɔnuku la naklẽ ɖe wo me to Kristo ƒe mo dzi.

5 For we are not preaching ourselves, but Jesus Christ as Lord and ourselves servants to you on Jesus’s account, 6 because it was God, he who said "Light shall shine out of darkness, " that shone in our hearts to produce the refulgence of the knowledge of God’s glory in the face of Christ.

7 Gake nu xɔasi sia le mía si le anyigoewo me, ale be ŋusẽ si gbɔ dzɔdzɔmetɔ ŋu la nanye Mawu tɔ, eye menye mía gbɔ wòatso o. 8 Womimi mí ɖo le go sia go me, ke menye ale gbegbe be míedo kpo ʋaʋã o; míetɔtɔ, ke menye be míenya nu si míawɔ kura o; 9 wotia mía yome, ke womegblẽ mí ɖi o; woxlã mí ɖe anyi, ke wometsrɔ̃ mí o.

7 But we have this treasure in earthen jars, in order that the surpassing power may be God’s and not out of us: 8 every way hard pressed but not cornered, perplexed but not baffled, 9 persecuted but not deserted, felled but not ended, 10 always carrying about in our body Jesus’s deadness in order that Jesus’s life too may be made visible in our body.
11 Elabena mí, ame siwo le agbe la, míedzea ŋgɔ ku ɣesiaɣi le Yesu ta, ale be Yesu ƒe agbe nadze hã le míaƒe ŋutilã si kuna la ŋu. 12 Ale ku le dɔ wɔm le mía me, gake agbe le dɔ wɔm le miawo me.

11 For we who are alive are all the time being sent to death on Jesus’s account, in order that Jesus’s life too may be made visible in our mortal flesh, 12 so that death is at work in us but life in you.

13 Ke esi xɔse ma ke si ŋu woŋlɔ le be, "Mexɔe se, eya tae meƒo nu ɖo "; ƒe gbɔgbɔ le mía me ta la, míawo hã míexɔe se, eya tae míeƒoa nu ɖo, 14 elabena míenyae be Ame si fɔ Yesu ɖe tsitre la afɔ míawo hã ɖe tsitre kpe ɖe Yesu ŋu, eye wòaɖe míawo kple miawo siaa afia.

13 And, having the same spirit of faith, in accordance with the written words "I believed, for that reason I spoke, " we too believe and it is for that reason we speak, 14 knowing that he who raised Jesus will raise us too with Jesus and present us together with you.
15 Elabena wowɔ nu siawo katã le mia ta, ale be amenuveve si dzi ɖe edzi la, nasɔ gbɔ ɖe edzi le ame geɖe wu ƒe akpedada ta, hena Mawu ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe.
15 For everything is on your account, in order that the grace, growing vaster by the greater number, may make thanksgiving the more abundant to the glory of God.

16 Eya ta míenaa ta o, ke ne ame si míenye le gota gome le gbegblẽm hã la, kakaɖedzi li be ame si míenye le ememe ya le yeye zum gbe sia gbe. 17 Elabena togbɔ be ɣeyiɣi vi aɖe ƒe xaxa si nu mesẽ o koe wònye hã la, ehea ŋutikɔkɔe gã mavɔ si ƒoa nu sia nu ta sãsãsã la vanɛ na mí; 18 esi míenana míaƒe ŋkuwo nɔa nu siwo wokpɔna la ŋu o, ke boŋ nu siwo womekpɔna o la ŋu.

16 Wherefore we do not give up trying, but though our outer man be perishing our inner is renewed day by day, 17 for the light pressure of our present distress is producing for us in unparalleled richness an unequaled weight of eternal glory; 18 while we look not to the seen but to the unseen, for what is seen is temporary but what is unseen is eternal.
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians
5 Elabena míenyae be ne wogbã míaƒe anyigbadzixɔ, si nye agbadɔ sia, gɔ̃ hã la, xɔ si tso Mawu gbɔ la anɔ mía si, xɔ si wometsɔ asi tu o, si li tegbee le dziƒo.
5 For we know that if our earthly housing in the tent is pulled down we have a building that comes from God, an eternal unmanufactured house, in the heavens.

2 Le nyateƒe me la, míeŋena le xɔ sia si me míele la me, eye míele didim vevie be míado xɔ si nye mía tɔ, si tso dziƒo la, 3 ale be ne míeva doe la, míagatsi amama o. 4 Le nyateƒe me la, mí ame siwo le agbadɔ sia me la míeŋena, eye nu tea mía ŋu, elabena míedi be míaɖe esia ada ɖi o, ke boŋ be míado ekemɛa, ale be agbe nami nu si kuna la.

2 For this is what we groan about, longing to be clothed with the overgarment of our habitation from heaven, 3 if we are to have put it on and not be found naked 4 for we who are in the tent are weighed down and groan over our wish not to be stripped but to be clothed with an overgarment in order that mortality may be engulfed by life.
5 Ke ame si dzra mí ɖo na nu sia lae nye Mawu, ame si na gbɔgbɔ si nye nu si ava va la ƒe kpeɖodzi mí.
5 And the one that framed us to this very end was God, he who gave us the Spirit as earnest-money.

6 Eya ta dzideƒo geɖe le mía si ɣesiaɣi, eye míenya be zi ale si míaƒe aƒe kpɔtɔ le ŋutilã me la, míele Aƒetɔ la gbɔ o, 7 elabena míezɔna le xɔse me, ke menye le nukpɔkpɔ me o. 8 Ke dzideƒo geɖe le mía si, eye míedi be míakpɔtɔ anɔ ŋutilã la me o, ke boŋ míayi aɖanɔ Aƒetɔ la gbɔ. 9 Eya ta míele egbɔ loo alo míeɖale egbɔ o, míeɖoe kplikpaa be míaƒe nu nadze eŋu.

6 So, being always ready for anything, and knowing that while at home in the body we are abroad from the Lord 7 for we are walking by faith, not by a sight, 8 but we are ready for anything and willing, more willing, to be abroad from the body and at home with the Lord; 9 for this reason we make it our ambition too, whether at home or abroad, to be pleasing to him.
10 Elabena ele na mí katã be míado ɖe Kristo ƒe ʋɔnudrɔ̃zikpui la ŋgɔ, ale be ame sia ame naxɔ nu si wòdze na ɖe nu siwo wòwɔ le ŋutilã me la nu, eɖanye nyui alo vɔ̃ o.
10 For we all have to come out to the bar of the Christ, each to get the payment for what he has done with his body, be it a good thing or a bad thing.
11 Eya ta esi míenya ale si woavɔ̃ Aƒetɔ lae ta la, míeyia edzi fiaa nu amewo be woatrɔ susu, ke Mawu nya ame siwo míenye la nyuie.
11 So, knowing the fear of the Lord, we are persuading men but are displayed in our true colors to God, and, I hope, in your consciences too.

12 Menye ɖe míegale mía ɖokuiwo kafum na mi ake o, ke boŋ míele nu si ana miatsɔ mí aƒo adegbee la nam mi, ale be miate ŋu aɖo nya ŋu na ame siwo ƒoa adegbe le gota gome ko ŋuti, ke menye le nu si le dzi me la ŋuti o.

12 We are not recommending ourselves to you again, but giving you material for boasting about us, in order that you may have something to say to those who boast of what they have to show and not of what is in them.
13 Ne míaƒe tame da la, Mawu tae; ne míaƒe susu le te la, miawo tae.
13 For if we are out of our senses it looks toward God, and if we are of sound mind it looks toward you.

14 Elabena Kristo ƒe lɔlɔ̃ la ƒonɛ ɖe mía nu, elabena nu si dzi míelɔ̃ ɖoe nye esi, be ame ɖeka ku ɖe wo katã ta; eye ale wo katã ku. 15 Eye wòku ɖe wo katã ta, ale be ame siwo le agbe la naganɔ agbe na wo ɖokuiwo azɔ o, ke woanɔ agbe na ame si ku ɖe wo ta, eye wofɔe ɖe tsitre la boŋ. 16 Eya ta tso esia dzi la, míenya ame aɖeke le ŋutilã nu o.

14 For Christ’s love puts a pressure on us, our conclusion being that one died for all, hence all died, 15 and he died for all in order that those who are alive may no longer be alive looking toward themselves but toward the one who died and rose for them, 16 so that we, from now on, do not know anybody in the way of flesh.
Ne míenya Kristo le ŋutilã nu tsã hã la, míeganyae nenema kura azɔ o.
Even though we have known Christ in the way of flesh, yet now we no longer do.
17 Eya ta ne ame aɖe wɔ ɖeka kple Kristo la, ezu nuwɔwɔ yeye; nu xoxowo nu va yi; kpɔ ɖa, nu yeyewo va li.
17 So that if one is in Christ it is a new creation, what originally existed is bygone, here have new things come into existence.

18 Ke nuwo katã tso Mawu gbɔ, eya, ame si dzra mía kplii dome ɖo to Kristo dzi, eye wòtsɔ subɔsubɔdɔ si dzraa amewo kple Mawu dome ɖo la de asi na mí, 19 si nye be Mawu to Kristo dzi nɔ eya kple xexea dome dzram ɖo, ale be megabu woƒe vodadawo na wo o, eye wòtsɔ nya si dzraa eya kple amewo dome ɖo la de asi na mí.

18 But everything is from God, who reconciled us to himself through Christ and gave us the errand of communicating the reconciliation, 19 how God was in Christ reconciling the world to himself, not counting their offenses against them, and consigning to us the word of the reconciliation.
20 Eya ta míenye amedɔdɔwo le Kristo teƒe, abe ɖe Mawu to mía dzi le kuku ɖem ene.
20 So we come as ambassadors for Christ, as if it were God appealing to you by us; speaking for Christ we beg you, be reconciled to God.
Abe Kristo teƒenɔlawo ene la, míeɖea kuku be: "Mina woadzra mia kple Mawu dome ɖo. " 21 Ena ame si ŋu nu vɔ̃ mele o la zu nuvɔ̃vɔsa ɖe mía ta, be to eya dzi la, míazu ame dzɔdzɔewo le Mawu ŋkume.
21 Him who had not known sin he made into sin for us in order that we may become righteousness of God’s in him.
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians

6 Esi míenye Mawu ƒe hadɔwɔlawo ta la, míele nu xlɔ̃m mi hã be miagaxɔ Mawu ƒe amenuveve la evɔ ada taɖodzinu si le eŋu ya ƒu o. 2 Elabena egblɔ be: "Meɖo to wò le amenuveɣi, eye mekpe ɖe ŋuwò le xɔxɔgbe. "

6 And in cooperation too we appeal to you not to give God’s grace such a reception as will make it amount to nothing; 2 for he says "At a time of acceptance I listened to you and on a day of salvation I helped you. "
Kpɔ ɖa! Fifia koŋ ye nye amenuveɣi la. Kpɔ ɖa!
Here is the time of acceptance now, here is the day of salvation now.

Fifiae nye xɔxɔgbe la. 3 Míewɔa naneke si azu nuɖiaɖia le mɔ aɖeke nu o, ale be woagakpɔ vodada aɖeke le míaƒe subɔsubɔdɔ la ŋu o; 4 ke boŋ míeɖea mía ɖokui fiana le mɔ sia mɔ nu be míenye Mawu ƒe subɔlawo, le dzidodo geɖe me, le xaxawo me, le hiãkamewo me, le fukpekpewo me, 5 le ƒoƒowo me, le gamenɔnɔwo me, le zitɔtɔwo me, le dɔ sesẽ wɔwɔ me, le zãdomadɔlɔ̃e me, le dɔmeɣeɣiwo me; 6 to dzadzɛnyenye me, to sidzedze me, to dzigbɔgbɔ blewu me, to dɔmenyonyo me, to gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe me, to lɔlɔ̃ si me alakpa mele o me, 7 to nyateƒetoto me, to Mawu ƒe ŋusẽ me; to dzɔdzɔenyenye ƒe aʋawɔnu siwo le ɖusi kple mia me la me, 8 to bubudeameŋu kple bubumadeameŋu me, to nya vɔ̃ kple nya nyui gbɔgblɔ tso mía ŋu me. Wobua mí ameblelawoe, evɔ nyateƒetɔwoe míenye, 9 wobua mí abe ame siwo womedze sii o ene, evɔ wodze si mí hafi, wobua mí abe ame siwo le kukum ene, gake kpɔ ɖa, míele agbe, wohe to na mí, gake wometsɔ mí de asi na ku o, 10 wobua mí abe ame siwo le nu xam ene, gake míekpɔa dzidzɔ ɣesiaɣi, abe ame dahewo ene, gake míenaa ame geɖewo zua kesinɔtɔwo, abe ame siwo si naneke mele o ene, evɔ nuwo katã le mía si hafi.

3 And we do not give anything for people to object to in any case, in order that the business we are on may not be found fault with, 4 but in every case are commending ourselves as agents of God, in holding out through many hard things, in distresses, in necessities, in tight pinches, 5 in beatings, in imprisonments, in mobbings, in hard work, in sleepless nights, in foodless days, 6 in integrity, in knowledge, in patience, in kindness, in Holy Spirit, in unfeigned love, 7 in words of truth, in God’s power, by the right-hand and left-hand armament of righteousness; 8 through glory and dishonor, through denunciation and commendation; as deceivers and truthful, 9 as unknown and noted, as dying and here we are alive, as punished for discipline and not put to death, 10 as grieving but always glad, as poor but enriching many, as not having anything but in possession of everything.
11 Míeke nu gblɔ nya sia nya na mi, Korintotɔwo, eye míeʋu míaƒe dziwo na mi gbadzaa.
11 Our mouth is open to you, Corinthians, our heart is expanded.
12 Míexaxa le míaƒe lɔlɔ̃ na mi me o, ke boŋ miawoe xaxa le miaƒe lɔlɔ̃ na mí me.
12 You are not narrowed down in us but narrowed down in your own sympathies.
13 Eya ta mele nu ƒom na mi abe vinyewo ene be, nu si miawɔ atsɔ aɖo eteƒee nye be, miawo hã miʋu miaƒe dziwo me gbadzaa na mí.
13 But in due requital, I say as speaking to children of mine, be expanded yourselves.

Alo ɖekawɔwɔ kae le kekeli kple viviti dome? 15 Azɔ hã, ɖekawɔwɔ kae le Kristo kple Belial dome? Alo kadodo kae le xɔsetɔ kple dzimaxɔsetɔ dome? 16 Eye ɖekawɔwɔ kae le Mawu ƒe gbedoxɔ kple trɔ̃wo dome? Elabena Mawu gbagbe la ƒe gbedoxɔ míenye; abe ale si Mawu gblɔe ene be: "Manɔ wo dome, eye mazɔ wo dome, manye woƒe Mawu, eye woanye nye dukɔ. " 17 "‘Eya ta mido go le wo dome, eye miɖe mia ɖokui ɖa,’ Yehowa ye gblɔe, ‘eye midzudzɔ asikaka nu makɔmakɔ la ŋu’ "; "‘eye maxɔ mi.’ " 18 "‘Eye manye mia fofo, eye mianye vinyeŋutsuwo kple vinyenyɔnuwo,’ Yehowa Ŋusẽkatãtɔ lae gblɔe. "

14 Do not be in incongruous yoking with unbelievers; for what have righteousness and wickedness in common? or what solidarity has light with darkness? 15 and what agreement between Christ and Belial is there? or what does a believer share with an unbeliever? 16 and what unity is there between a temple of God and idols? for we are a temple of the living God, as God said "I will live among them and walk among them, and will be their God and they shall be my people; 17 wherefore come out from their midst and separate yourselves, says the Lord, and do not touch an unclean thing, 18 and I will take you in and be father to you, and you shall be sons and daughters to me, says the Lord Almighty. "
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians
7 Esi ŋugbedodo siawo le mía si ta la, lɔlɔ̃tɔwo, mina míakɔ mía ɖokui ŋu tso ŋutilã kple gbɔgbɔ ƒe ɖiƒoƒo sia ɖiƒoƒo me, eye míanɔ kɔkɔe geɖe wu le mawuvɔvɔ̃ me.
7 So, dear friends, having these promises, let us cleanse ourselves from every defilement of flesh and spirit, working out holiness in the fear of God.
2 Mikɔ dzi me ɖe mía ŋu.
2 Find room for us; we did not wrong anybody, wreck anybody, overreach anybody.
Míeda vo ɖe ame aɖeke ŋu o, míegblẽ nu le ame aɖeke ŋu o, míeba ame aɖeke o. 3 Nyemele esia gblɔm be mabu fɔ mi o.
3 I am not saying it by way of condemnation; for I have said before that you are in our hearts to live and die with us.

5 Le nyateƒe me la, esi míeva ɖo Makedonia la, míaƒe ŋutilã mekpɔ gbɔdzɔe aɖeke o, ke boŋ woyi edzi wɔ fu mí le mɔ sia mɔ nu ʋiʋliwo nɔ egodo, vɔvɔ̃ nɔ ememe. 6 Ke Mawu, ame si faa akɔ na ame siwo ƒo dzi ɖe le la, na Tito ƒe vava fa akɔ na mí. 7 Eye menye eƒe vava la ɖeɖe koe o, ke ale si miena eƒe dzi dze eme hãe, elabena eva gblɔ ale si miedi vevie be yewoakpɔm, ale si miele nu xam ɖe tanye, kple ale si mietsɔ ɖe le eme nam vevie la nam; eye esia na megakpɔ dzidzɔ geɖe wu. 8 Elabena ne nye agbalẽa na miexa nu hã la mevem o. Ne evem gbã hã la, (mekpɔe be agbalẽ ma do nuxaxa na mi, gake ɣeyiɣi vi aɖe koe), 9 azɔ mele dzidzɔ kpɔm, menye esi wòdo nuxaxa na mi ta o, ke esi wòna miexa nu hena dzimetɔtrɔ ta boŋ.

4 I have great confidence in speaking to you, great boasts on your account; I am filled full of encouragement, I have superabundant gladness with all our distress 5 for when we came to Macedonia our human nature had no relief; but in distress at every point outwardly fights, inwardly fears 6 but he who encourages those that are brought low, God, encouraged us with Titus’s arrival, 7 and not only his arrival but also the encouragement he had over you as he reported to us your longing, your lamenting, your jealousy for me, so that I had more of gladness; 8 because if I did grieve you in my letter, I do not regret it; if I did regret it (I see that that letter did, if only momentarily, grieve you) 9 I am glad now, not that you were grieved but that you were grieved into repentance.
Elabena ena miexa nu le Mawu me, ale be míegblẽ naneke le mia ŋu o. 10 Elabena mawumenuxaxa nana wotrɔa dzi me hena ɖeɖekpɔkpɔ, eye esia mevea ame o; ke xexe sia ƒe nuxaxa hea ku vanɛ.

For you were grieved in God’s way, in order that you might not be in any respect the worse off by us; 10 for grief that is felt in God’s way causes repentance into salvation, which there is no regretting, but the world’s grief produces death.

11 Mikpɔ nu si gbegbe do tso miaƒe mawumenuxaxa me la ɖa, ɛ̃, ena miekɔ mia ɖokui ŋu, ɛ̃, ena mielé fu nu manyomanyo, ɛ̃, ena vɔvɔ̃ ɖo mi, ɛ̃, ena didi vevie nɔ mia me, ɛ̃, ena mietsɔ dzo ɖe nu ŋu, ɛ̃ ena mieɖɔ nu si gblẽ la ɖo!
11 For look what earnestness, nay, words of self-defense, nay, indignation, nay, fear, nay, longing, nay, jealousy, nay, castigation! every way you kept your skirts clean in the matter.

Mieɖee fia le go sia go me be yewole dzadzɛ le nya sia me. 12 Togbɔ be meŋlɔ agbalẽ na mi hã la, menye ame si da vo alo ame si ŋu woda vo ɖo tae meŋlɔe ɖo o, ke boŋ be miaƒe veviedodo le mía ŋuti la nadze ƒãa le mia dome le Mawu ŋkume.

12 So then if I did write to you it was not on account of the one who did the wrong nor of the one who was wronged, but for the sake of having your earnestness on our behalf made apparent to yourselves before God.

13 Esia tae wofa akɔ na mí ɖo. Ke hekpe ɖe míaƒe akɔfafa sia ŋu la, míegakpɔ dzidzɔ geɖe wu le dzidzɔ si Tito kpɔ la ta, elabena mi katã miena eƒe gbɔgbɔ kpɔ dzidzeme. 14 Ne meƒo adegbe le mia ŋu le eŋkume la, mezu ŋukpe nam o; ke boŋ ale si nya siwo katã míegblɔ na mi nye nyateƒe la, nenema kee ale si metsɔ mi ƒo adegbee na Tito la hã nye nyateƒe.

13 For this reason we have felt encouraged; and along with our encouragement we were all the gladder at Titus’s gladness because his spirit has been set at rest by all of you, 14 because if I have made any boast to him about you I was not put to shame, but as we told you everything truthfully, so too our boasting before Titus proved true.
15 Eye miaƒe nu léa dzi nɛ geɖe wu ne eɖo ŋku mi katã miaƒe toɖoɖo kple ale si mietsɔ vɔvɔ̃ kple dzodzo nyanyanya xɔe la dzi.
15 And his sympathies are most pronounced toward you as he remembers the obedience of all of you, how you received him with fear and trembling.
16 Dzi le dzɔyem be le mɔ sia mɔ nu la, dzi ate ŋu aɖo ƒonye le mia ta.
16 I am glad to say that on every score I am in good spirits as regards you.
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians

8 Ke nɔviwo, míedi be míana mianya ale si Mawu ve hame siwo le Makedonia la nui. 2 Esi wonɔ dodokpɔ gã si me wokpe fu le vevie me tom la, wotsɔ dzidzɔ manyagblɔ na nu faa togbɔ be woda ahe ŋutɔ hã, si wɔe be woƒe dɔmenyonyo la ɖe dzesi. 3 Elabena wowɔ esia le woƒe ŋutete nu, ɛ̃, mele ɖase ɖim be, wowɔe wògbɔ woƒe ŋutete ŋu gɔ̃ hã, 4 esi wotso le wo ɖokui si ɖe kuku na mí vevie be míana mɔnukpɔkpɔ yewo yewoana nu dɔmenyotɔe, eye yewoakpɔ gome le kpekpeɖeŋunana ƒe subɔsubɔdɔ si wɔm wole na ame kɔkɔewo la me. 5 Eye menye ale si míekpɔ mɔ nɛ la ɖeɖe ko o, ke boŋ wotsɔ wo ɖokuiwo na Aƒetɔ la gbã, kple míawo hã to Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu me. 6 Esia ta míede dzi ƒo na Tito be, esi wònye eyae dze dɔ sia gɔme le mia dome ta la, eya ke nawu miaƒe dɔmenyonunana la nu ƒoƒo ƒu nu.

8 But let us make you acquainted, brothers, with God’s grace that has been given among the churches of Macedonia, 2 that under a great test of distress the plentifulness of their joy and their deep poverty became a plentiful source for the wealth of their liberality, 3 because to the extent of their power, I can testify, and beyond it, 4 they gave voluntarily, imploring us with strong appeals for the favor and the participation in the service to God’s people 5 and not as we had hoped, but giving themselves first to the Lord, and to us by God’s will, 6 so that we invited Titus, as he had made the first start, so too to bring to completion in you this grace too.
7 Ke ale si miegba go le nuwo katã me, le xɔse kple nya kple sidzedze kple veviedodo katã kpakple lɔlɔ̃ si míeɖe fia mi me la, migba go hã le dɔmenyonunana sia me.
7 But as you are plentiful in everything, faith and the gift of speech and knowledge and all earnestness and love on our part toward you, try to be also plentiful in this grace.

8 Nyemele egblɔm abe se demee mele na mi ene o, ke boŋ be mianya ale si ame bubuwo le vevie dom nu, eye be mado miaƒe lɔlɔ̃ ƒe vavãnyenye akpɔ. 9 Elabena mienya mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe amenuveve la be, togbɔ be kesinɔtɔ wònye hã la, eva zu ame dahe le mia ta, ale be miato eƒe ahedada me azu kesinɔtɔwo. 10 Eye mele susu aɖe dom ɖa le esia ŋu: Esia aɖe vi na mi, elabena ƒe ɖekae nye esia la, menye ɖe miedze dɔ sia wɔwɔ gɔme ko o, ke didia nɔ mia me hã ɖe ewɔwɔ ŋu.

8 I do not say it in the way of an order, but to get proof, through the earnestness of others, of the genuineness of your love too 9 for you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, how on your account he became poor when he was rich, in order that you might become rich by his poverty 10 and as this is what I am doing I offer an opinion; for this will be good for you, who made the first start last year not only in doing but also in wanting to.

11 Ke azɔ la, miwu nu si gɔme miedze la nu, ale be ale si ko ewɔwɔ ƒe didia le mia me vevie la, miawu enu hã le nu siwo le mia si la nu. 12 Elabena ne didia nya li ko la, wokpɔa ŋudzedze ɖe eŋu le nu si le ame si la nu, menye le nu si mele ame si o la nu o.

11 But now bring to completion the doing too, so that to the heartiness of wanting to there may correspond the completion that comes from having the wherewithal; 12 for if the hearty readiness is there it is acceptable on the basis of what one has, not of what he does not have.

13 Nyemedi be wòanɔ bɔbɔe na ame bubuwo, gake wòasesẽ na miawo ya o; 14 ke boŋ be nuwo nasɔ pɛ, eye miaƒe nu siwo gbɔ edzi fifia la, nakpɔ woƒe hiahiã gbɔ na wo, ale be woawo hã ƒe nu siwo gbɔ edzi la, nakpɔ nu siwo hiã mi la gbɔ, ne nuwo nada asɔ. 15 Abe ale si woŋlɔe ɖi ene be: "Ame si si geɖe le la mekpɔe wògbɔ edzi o, eye ame si si nu ʋɛ le la tɔ mele ʋɛ akpa o. "

13 For the idea is not that others are to get an easy time, you a hard one, 14 but to have it on an equality, your surplus coming in just now for their shortage in order that their surplus may also come in for your shortage, so that there may be equality, 15 as it is written "The one who had taken more had no surplus and the one who had taken less had no shortage. "

16 Ke woada akpe na Mawu be wòdee Tito hã ƒe dzi me be wòado vevie nu nenema ke ɖe mia ta; 17 elabena le nyateƒe me la, ewɔ nu abe ale si míede dzi ƒo nɛ ene, ke esi wònye eƒe didi vevie xoxo ta la, etso le eɖokui si dze mɔ gbɔna mia gbɔ.

16 But thanks be to God who is putting into Titus’s heart the same earnestness on your behalf, 17 because he has accepted the invitation and, so earnest he was, has gone off to you on his own initiative.

18 Ke míele nɔviŋutsu aɖe, si wokafuna le hameawo katã me le nya nyuia ta la, dɔm ɖa kpe ɖe eŋu. 19 Menye ema ɖeɖe koe o, ke boŋ hameawo tiae hã be wòanye míaƒe mɔzɔhati esi míele dɔmenyonunana ƒe dɔ sia ŋu nyawo gbɔ kpɔm hena Aƒetɔ la ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe, ne wòaɖee afia be míele klalo be míana kpekpeɖeŋu. 20 Ale be ame aɖeke nagakpɔ vodada le mía ŋu le lɔlɔ̃nu faa nunana gbogbo sia ŋuti dɔwɔwɔ me o. 21 Elabena ‘míekpɔa nuwo katã gbɔ le anukwareɖiɖi me, menye le Yehowa ŋkume ɖeɖe ko o, ke le amegbetɔwo ŋkume hã.’

18 And we sent with him the brother whose praise in the preaching of the gospel runs through all the churches, 19 and, besides, who has with a view to the glory of the Lord himself and our hearty preference been elected by the churches as our fellow-traveler in the matter of this grace that is being administered by us, 20 to avoid having anybody find fault with us in the matter of this bounty that is being administered by us; 21 for we are keeping in mind what is going to look well not only before the Lord but also before men.
22 Azɔ hã, míele mía nɔvi si míedo kpɔ enuenu, eye míekpɔe be edoa vevie nu le nu geɖewo me la dɔm kpe ɖe wo ŋu, eye azɔ egale vevie dom nu wu le ale si gbegbe wòka ɖe mia dzii la ta.
22 And we sent with them our brother whom we have many times found by many evidences to be energetic, but now much more energetic by the confidence he has in you.
23 Ke ne ame aɖe bia nya tso Tito ŋu la, nye zɔhɛ kple hadɔwɔlae wònye le miaƒe nyonyo ta; alo ne ame aɖe bia nya tso mía nɔviŋutsuawo ŋu la, hameawo ƒe apostolowo kple Kristo ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe wonye.
23 As to Titus, he is our comrade and co-worker for you; our brothers, they are church delegates, glory of Christ.
24 Eya ta miɖe miaƒe lɔlɔ̃ fia wo eye miana hameawo nakpɔ nu si ta míetsɔa mi ƒoa adegbee ɖo.
24 So when you give the demonstration of your love and of our boast about you to them, it is in presence of the churches.
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians

9 Ke mekpɔe be mehiã be maŋlɔ nu ɖo ɖe mi tso subɔsubɔdɔ si woawɔ na ame kɔkɔewo la ŋu hafi o, 2 elabena menya be didia le mia me be miawɔe, eye metsɔ esia le adegbe ƒom le mia ŋuti na Makedoniatɔwo, be ƒe ɖekae nye esia si nɔvi siwo le Akaya la le klalo xoxo, eye miaƒe veviedodo nu de dzo wo dometɔ akpa gãtɔ me.

9 For about the service to God’s people it is superfluous for me to write to you, 2 for I know your heartiness, as to which I am boasting of you to the Macedonians that Achaea has been prepared ever since last year, and rivalry with you has stirred up the greater part of them.

3 Ke mele nɔviawo dɔm ɖa, ale be adegbe si míeƒona le mia ŋu la nagazu dzodzro le nya sia me o, eye be mianɔ klalo ŋutɔŋutɔ abe ale si megblɔe ene. 4 Ne menye nenema o la, ne mía kple Makedoniatɔwo míava ɖo, evɔ woakpɔe be miele klalo o la, ŋu akpe mí le ale si gbegbe míeka ɖe mia dzii la ta; nyemedi be maƒo nu tso ŋu si akpe miawo ya ŋu o. 5 Eya ta mekpɔe be ehiã be made dzi ƒo na nɔviawo be woado ŋgɔ ava mia gbɔ, ne woaƒo nunana gbogbo siwo ŋugbe miedo xoxo la nu ƒu ɖi, ale be wòanye nu siwo miena tso dzi me faa, ke menye ɖe wozi mia dzi hafi o.

3 But I send the brothers in order that our boast of you may not be made an empty one in this respect; in order that you may, as I said, be prepared, 4 for fear that if Macedonians should come with me and find you unprepared we (not to say you) should be shamed about this pledge; 5 so I thought it necessary to request the brothers to go to you in advance and get this already promised bounty of yours into shape in advance to be ready in that way, as a bounty and not as a grab.
6 Ke le esia gome la, ame si ƒã nu ʋɛ la, aŋe nu ʋɛ, eye ame si ƒã nu wòsɔ gbɔ la, aŋe nu wòasɔ gbɔ.
6 But there is this, he who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and he who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.

9 (Abe ale si woŋlɔe ɖi ene be: "Eʋua asi me, enaa nu ame dahewo. Eƒe dzɔdzɔenyenye li tegbee. " 10 Ke Ame si naa nuku nuƒãla kple nuɖuɖu amewo la ana nuku si mieƒãna la nasɔ gbɔ ɖe edzi na mi, eye wòana miaƒe dzɔdzɔenyenye ƒe kutsetse nasɔ gbɔ ɖe edzi.) 11 Le nuwo katã me la, wonana miezua kesinɔtɔwo be miate ŋu anyo dɔme le nu sia nu me, ale be nu siwo mienana amewo to mía dzi nawɔe be woada akpe na Mawu; 12 elabena kpekpeɖeŋunana ƒe dutoƒo subɔsubɔdɔ sia menye be wòakpɔ ame kɔkɔewo ƒe hiahiãwo gbɔ na wo nyuie ko o, ke be wòana woada akpe geɖe na Mawu hã. 13 Le kpeɖodzi si kpekpeɖeŋunana ƒe subɔsubɔdɔ sia nana ta la, wokafua Mawu elabena mienana Kristo la ŋuti nya nyui la kpɔa ŋusẽ ɖe mia dzi abe ale si mieʋua eme le dutoƒo ene, eye mienaa nu woawo kple ame bubuwo katã dɔmenyotɔe. 14 Eye wole kokoƒoƒo dzi ɖe mia ta, eye wole mia susum vevie le Mawu ƒe amenuveve geɖe si wòna mi la ta.

7 Each as he has his mind made up, not in annoyance nor under compulsion, for God "loves a cheerful giver. " 8 And God is powerful to make all grace superabound toward you, in order that you, always having in every respect all sufficiency for yourselves, may superabound to every good work 9 (as it is written "He scattered, gave to the poor, his sainthood lasts forever "; 10 and he who furnishes seed for the sower and bread for eating will furnish your sowings, and that abundantly, and make the produce of your right-doing grow), 11 enriched with everything for all liberality, which through you produces thanksgiving to God 12 because the dispensing of this service not only supplements the shortages of God’s people but also through many thanksgivings superabounds to God; glorifying God, 13 through the evidence of this ministration, with the good discipline of your professed allegiance to the gospel of the Christ, and the generousness of your solidarity to them and to everybody, 14 and their prayers for you as they yearn over you because of God’s surpassing grace upon you.
15 Woada akpe na Mawu le eƒe nunana faa si wu gbɔgblɔ la ta.
15 Thanks be to God for his indescribable gift.
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians

10 Ke nye Paulo, metsɔ tufafa kple dɔmenyo si Kristo ɖe fia la le nu xlɔ̃m mi, nye ame si dzena ame beli ne mele mia ŋkume, gake menye dzinɔameƒotɔ ne nyemele mia gbɔ o. 2 Mele kuku ɖem be ne meva mia gbɔ la, mahiã be mawɔ nu dzideƒotɔe aɖe afɔ sesẽ aɖewo abe ale si mesusui ene ɖe ame siwo bua mí be míezɔna le ŋutilã nu la ŋu o. 3 Elabena togbɔ be míenye ŋutilãwo hã la, míewɔa aʋa le ŋutilã nu o.

10 And I Paul myself urge you by the Christ’s gentleness and reasonableness, I who face to face am a nobody among you, but at a distance am stouthearted toward you 2 but I beg that I may not at close quarters be stout with that assurance with which I reckon on venturing against some people, those who reckon us as walking in the way of flesh.

4 Elabena míaƒe aʋawɔnuwo menye ŋutilã me tɔwo o, ke boŋ woƒe ŋusẽ tso Mawu gbɔ, be míatsɔ amu nu siwo li ke sesĩe la aƒu anyi. 5 Elabena míele tamebubuwo kple nu kɔkɔ sia nu kɔkɔ, si xea mɔ ɖe Mawu ŋuti sidzedze nu la mum ƒu anyi, eye míeɖea aboyo tamesusu ɖe sia ɖe be míana wòaɖo to Kristo la. 6 Eye míele dzadzraɖoɖi be, ne mienya ɖee fia be yewonye toɖolawo bliboe ko la, míahe to na ame sia ame si gbe toɖoɖo.

3 For, while we walk in flesh, we do not carry on our campaign in the way of flesh; 4 for the weapons of our campaigning are not fleshly but divinely powerful for the demolishing of fortified positions, 5 demolishing argumentations and every high structure raised against the knowledge of God and taking every idea prisoner into obedience to the Christ, 6 and all ready to deal out penalties for every noncompliance when your obedience has come to the full.
7 Mieléa ŋku ɖe nuwo ŋu le ale si wodzena le gota gomee nu.
7 Look at what you see before your faces.
Ne ame aɖe ka ɖe eɖokui dzi be yenye Kristo tɔ la, nebu nyateƒenya sia hã ŋu: Ale si ko wònye Kristo tɔ la, nenema kee míawo hã míenye etɔe.
If somebody feels confident that he belongs to Christ, let him think this over again to himself, that we belong to Christ just the same as he does.

8 Elabena ne maƒo adegbe wòagbɔ eme vie wu ale si dze le ŋusẽ si Aƒetɔ la tsɔ na mí be míatsɔ atu mi ɖo, ke menye be míatsɔ agblẽ nu le mia ŋu o ŋuti hã la, nyemaɖu ŋukpe o. 9 Elabena nyemedi be wòanɔ abe ɖe metsɔ nye agbalẽwo le vɔvɔ̃ dom na mi ene o. 10 Elabena wogblɔna be: "Eƒe agbalẽwo kpena, eye ŋusẽ le wo ŋu, ke ne eya ŋutɔ le afi sia la, edzena ame beli, eye eƒe nyawo mele ɖeke me o. " 11 Nenem me ma nanyae be, nya siwo míegblɔna le míaƒe agbalẽwo me ne míele mia gbɔ o la, nu mawo kee míawɔ ne míele mia gbɔ.

8 For if I boast more or less freely about our authority, which the Lord gave for building you up and not for demolishing you, I shall not be shamed; 9 not to speak as if I were sort of scaring you by my letters, 10 because "the letters, " he says, "are impressive and strong, but the personal presence is weak and the talk does not amount to anything. " 11 Let such a man think this over, that what we are like in talk by letters while absent is just what we are like in action when present.

12 Elabena míete kpɔ be míabu mía ɖokui ɖe ame aɖewo dome, alo atsɔ mía ɖokui asɔ kple ame siwo kafua wo ɖokui la o. Gake esi wotsɔa wo ɖokui dzidzea wo ɖokui, eye wotsɔa wo ɖokui sɔna kple wo ɖokui la, womenyaa nu o.

12 For we do not venture to put ourselves in the same class with, or compare ourselves with, some of those who are recommending themselves; but they, measuring themselves by themselves and comparing themselves with themselves, do not see what is what.
13 Ke hã, míeƒoa adegbe le dɔ si wowɔ le míaƒe liƒo godo la ŋu o, ke boŋ le liƒo si Mawu ɖo na mí la me, si de keke mia gbɔ ke.
13 But we will not boast beyond the range of measurement, but suitably to the measurement of the yardstick of the measure God gave us, to come clear through to you.

14 Nyateƒee, menye ɖe míegbɔ míaƒe liƒo ŋu esi míeva mia gbɔ tsã abe ɖe míaƒe liƒo meɖo mia gbɔ o ene o, elabena míawoe nye ame gbãtɔ siwo tsɔ Kristo la ŋuti nya nyuia va keke mia gbɔ ke. 15 Ao, menye ame bubu ƒe agbagbadzedze le míaƒe liƒo godo ye míetsɔ le adegbe ƒom o, ke boŋ míele mɔ kpɔm be, esi miaƒe xɔse le sesẽm ɖe edzi la, miava kpɔe be dɔ si míewɔ la ava dzi ɖe edzi. Ekema míagawɔ dɔ gã geɖe awu, 16 be míagblɔ nya nyui la agbɔ mia ŋu ayi dukɔ bubuwo me, ale be míagaƒo adegbe le ame bubu ƒe nuto me, afi si wowɔ dɔ le xoxo la o.

14 For we are not overstretching ourselves, as we might be if we were not coming through to you; for we did get clear through to you in preaching the Christ’s gospel; 15 not boasting out of measure on the basis of other people’s hard work, but having a hope that as your faith grows we may be greatened in you, conformably to our yardstick, to a further extension, 16 to preach the gospel in the places out beyond you, not in somebody else’s yard to brag of ready-made progress.
17 "Ke boŋ ame si ƒoa adegbe la, neƒo adegbe le Yehowa me. " 18 Elabena menye ame si kafua eɖokui la ŋue wokpɔa ŋudzedze ɖo o, ke ame si Yehowa kafuna la boŋ.
17 But "let him who boasts boast of the Lord. " 18 For it is not he who recommends himself that rates as up to the standard, but he whom the Lord recommends.
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians
11 Madi be miagbɔ dzi ɖi atsɔ nye nya siwo dze bometsinyawoe la.
11 I wish you would put up with a little bit of silliness from me; yes, do put up with me.

Le nyateƒe me la, miele dzi gbɔm ɖi hã xoxo! 2 Elabena metsɔ mawumeŋuʋaʋã le ŋu ʋãm ɖe mia nu, elabena nye ŋutɔe do mia ɖeɖe ŋugbe na ŋutsu ɖeka, be matsɔ mi ana Kristo la abe ɖetugbui leaƒe dzadzɛ ene.
2 For I am jealous over you, feeling God’s jealousy.
3 Ke mele vɔvɔ̃m be le mɔ aɖe nu la, ale si da la tsɔ eƒe ayedzedze ble Xawa la, ɖewohĩ woagblẽ miaƒe susu be miate ɖa tso anukwareɖiɖi kple dzadzɛnyenye si Kristo la dze na la gbɔ.

For I betrothed you to one husband, to present you to Christ a pure virgin; 3 and I am afraid lest, as the snake befooled Eve by his trickery, your sentiments should be seduced away from Christ-directed single-mindedness and purity.

4 Elabena ne ame aɖe va ɖe gbeƒã Yesu bubu aɖe si to vovo na esi míeɖe gbeƒãe, alo miexɔ gbɔgbɔ bubu aɖe si to vovo na esi miexɔ, alo nya nyui bubu aɖe si to vovo na esi miexɔ la, enɔa bɔbɔe na mi be miado dzi axɔ ame ma.

4 For if the one who comes preaches another Jesus whom we did not preach, or you get a different spirit that you did not get, or a different gospel that you did not receive, you are quite right in putting up with him.
5 Elabena nyemesusu be miaƒe apostolo deŋgɔawo nyo wum le nu ɖeka pɛ hã me o.
5 For I figure that I have in no respect fallen behind the superlative apostles.
6 Ke ne nyemebi le nuƒoƒo me o hã la, nyemele nenema le sidzedze ya me o; ke boŋ míena esia dze ƒãa na mi le mɔ sia mɔ nu le nuwo katã me.
6 And even if I am uneducated in talk I am not in knowledge, but in everything we have made it manifest by everything on all occasions among you.

7 Alo nu vɔ̃e wònye mewɔ be mebɔbɔ ɖokuinye, ne woado mi ɖe dzi, esi megblɔ Mawu ŋuti nya nyui la na mi dzidzɔtɔe naneke maxɔmaxɔea? 8 Magblɔ be meba hame bubuwo esi melɔ̃ xɔ woƒe nunanawo, ale be masubɔ mi. 9 Evɔ esi menɔ mia gbɔ, eye nu hiãm la, nyemezu agba na mia dometɔ aɖeke o, elabena nɔvi siwo tso Makedonia va la na nu siwo hiãm la wòsɔ gbɔ.

7 Or did I commit a sin by lowering myself to have you upraised, in that I preached God’s gospel to you gratis? 8 I looted other churches, taking pay for service to you; 9 and when I was there with you and was in want I did not squeeze anybody, for the brothers came from Macedonia and supplemented my shortage; and in everything I kept myself from being a load on you, and will do so.
10 Zi ale si Kristo ƒe nyateƒea le menye la, nyemadzudzɔ esia tsɔtsɔ aƒo adegbee le Akaya nutoawo me o.
10 It is gospel truth what I am telling you, I am not going to have this boast blocked against me in the territories of Achaea.
11 Le susu ka ta? Esi nyemelɔ̃ mi o taea?
11 Why? because I do not love you?
Mawu nyae be melɔ̃ mi.
God knows.
12 Ke nu si wɔm mele la, mayi edzi awɔe, ale be mana ame siwo le mɔnu dim be amewo nakpɔ be yewosɔ kpli mí le ɖoƒe sia la ƒe adegbeƒoƒo nu natsi.

12 But what I am doing and will do is in order to cut away the foothold of those who desire a foothold to start from, in order that in the point they boast of they may be found to be the same as we are.

13 Elabena nenem me siawo nye aʋatso apostolowo, dɔwɔla siwo blea ame, eye wowɔa wo ɖokuiwo abe Kristo ƒe apostolowo ene. 14 Eye esia mewɔ nuku o, elabena Satana ŋutɔ hã wɔa eɖokui abe kekeli ƒe dɔla ene. 15 Eya ta ne eƒe subɔlawo hã wɔa wo ɖokuiwo abe subɔla dzɔdzɔewo ene la, mewɔ nuku kura o. Ke woƒe nuwuwu anɔ ɖe woƒe dɔwɔwɔwo nu.

13 For men of that sort are false apostles, tricky workmen, reshaping themselves into apostles of Christ’s 14 and no wonder, for Satan himself reshapes himself into an angel of light, 15 so it is no great thing if his agents too reshape themselves like agents of righteousness; their end will be suitable to their deeds.
16 Megale egblɔm ake be: ame aɖeke megabum bometsilae o.
16 I say again, do not any of you think I am silly.
Gake ne nenemae miebui hã la, ekema mixɔm abe bometsila ene faa, ale be nye hã maƒo adegbe vie.
But if you do, at least give me a silly man’s hearing so that I too may do a little boasting.
17 Nya si gblɔm mele fifia la, nyemele egblɔm le kpɔɖeŋu si Aƒetɔ la ɖo la nu o, ke boŋ abe bometsila ene, abe adegbeƒola si ka ɖe eɖokui dzi ŋutɔ ene.
17 What I am saying I am not saying along the Lord’s line but, so to speak, in silliness, in this insistence on boasting.

18 Esi ame geɖewo le adegbe ƒom le ŋutilã nu ta la, nye hã maƒo adegbe. 19 Esi mienye "nugɔmeselawo " ŋutɔ ta la, miedoa dzi xɔa bometsilawo dzidzɔtɔe. 20 Le nyateƒe me la, ne ame aɖe wɔ mi kluvii, ne ame aɖe ba mi xɔ miaƒe nunɔamesi, ne ame aɖe xɔ nu si le mia si la sesẽe, ne ame aɖe do eɖokui ɖe dzi ɖe mia ŋu, eye ne ame aɖe ƒo mo gbɔ na mi la, miedoa dzi tsɔnɛ.

18 Since many are boasting along the line of flesh, so will I. 19 For you do like to put up with silly people, you being so sensible; 20 for you put up with it if one enslaves you, if one eats you out of house and home, if one takes things, if one holds his head high, if one strikes you in the face.
21 Enye ŋukpe na mí be magblɔ nya sia, elabena awɔ na mi be míewɔa nu abe ame siwo gbɔdzɔ ene.
21 I am speaking in terms of disrespect as if the point were that we had been weak.
Israel-viwoe wonyea? Eyae nye hã menye. Abraham ƒe dzidzimeviwoe wonyea?
But as to what anybody presumes on, I say in silliness, so do I presume.

Eyae nye hã menye. 23 Kristo ƒe subɔlawoe wonyea? Mele eŋu ɖom abe ame si ƒe tame da ene be, menyee wu wo: mewɔ dɔ geɖe wu, menɔ gaxɔ me zi geɖe wu, zi ale si woƒom la mele xexlẽ me o, eye meɖo kudo nu zi geɖe.

22 They are Hebrews so am I. They are Israelites so am I. They are descendants of Abraham so am I. 23 They are Christ’s messengers I am out of my senses to say it, more so I, with an uncommon amount of hard work, an uncommon number of imprisonments, a record-breaking number of beatings, a great number of deaths.

24 Zi gbɔ zi atɔ̃ sɔŋ Yudatɔwo ƒom ƒoƒo blaene, ɖeka koe do le eme, 25 zi etɔ̃ woƒom kple ati, zi ɖeka woƒu kpem, menɔ tɔdziʋu me wògbã zi etɔ̃, metsi atsiaƒu dzi zã blibo ɖeka kple ŋkeke blibo ɖeka; 26 mezɔ mɔ enuenu, meɖo ŋɔdzi me le tɔsisiwo dzi, meɖo ŋɔdzi me le adzodalawo si me, meɖo ŋɔdzi me le nye ŋutɔ nye dukɔmeviwo dome, meɖo ŋɔdzi me le dukɔwo dome, meɖo ŋɔdzi me le du me, meɖo ŋɔdzi me le gbedzi, meɖo ŋɔdzi me le atsiaƒu dzi, meɖo ŋɔdzi me le aʋatsonɔviwo dome; 27 le agbagbadzedze kple kutrikuku me, le zãdomadɔlɔ̃e zi geɖe me, le dɔwuame kple tsikɔwuame me, le numakpɔɖui zi geɖe me, le vuvɔ kple amamanɔnɔ me.

24 At Jews’ hands I five times received forty stripes lacking one; 25 three times I was beaten with Roman rods; once I was stoned; three times I was shipwrecked, I have spent a day and a night in the deep; 26 often on the move, in dangers by rivers, dangers by robbers, dangers from those of my blood, dangers from foreigners, dangers in the city, dangers in the wilderness, dangers on the sea, dangers among pretended brothers, 27 in toil and drudgery, with many a sleepless night, with hunger and thirst, many times without anything to eat, with cold and nakedness.
28 Hekpe ɖe nu siawo, siwo tso gota ŋu la, nane tena ɖe dzinye gbe sia gbe, eyae nye dzimaɖitsitsi ɖe hameawo katã ŋu.
28 Apart from the things outside me, there is what takes up my mind day after day, anxiety about all the churches.
Ame ka nue woɖia, eye meku dzi nam o? 30 Ne maƒo adegbe la, ekema maƒo adegbe le nu siwo me megbɔdzɔ le la ŋuti.
29 Who is sick and I am not sick? who trips up and my face does not burn? 30 If I have to boast I will boast of things connected with my weakness.

31 Aƒetɔ Yesu ƒe Mawu, si nye Fofoa, Ame si wòle be woakafu yi mavɔmavɔ me la, nyae be nyemele aʋatso kam o. 32 Le Damasko la, nutodziɖula si le fia Areta te la nɔ Damaskotɔwo ƒe dua ŋu dzɔm, be yealém, 33 ke wotsɔm de kusi me ɖiɖi ɖe anyi to fesre aɖe si le glia ŋu la me, eye medo le eƒe asi me.

31 The Lord Jesus Christ’s God and Father knows, he who is blessed forever, that I am not lying: 32 at Damascus King Harithath’s sheik had a force in the city of the Damascenes to arrest me, 33 and I was let down in a basket through the wall by a window and escaped his hands.
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians
12 Ele be maƒo adegbe. Togbɔ be maɖe vi aɖeke o hã, matrɔ ɖe Aƒetɔ la ƒe ŋutega wɔnukuwo kple nyaɖeɖefiawo ŋu.
12 I have to boast; it is not good for me, but I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.

2 Menya ame aɖe si nye Kristo ƒe nusrɔ̃la, ƒe wuienee nye esia si wokɔe yi dziƒo etɔ̃lia ŋutilã mee wònɔ alo menye ŋutilã mee wònɔ o, nyemenya o; Mawue nya. 3 Ɛ̃, menya ame ma ŋutilã mee wònɔ alo menye ŋutilã mee wònɔ o, nyemenya o; Mawue nya 4 wokɔe yi paradiso me, eye wòse nya siwo mele gbɔgblɔ me o, eye womeɖe mɔ na ame be wòagblɔ o.

2 I know of a man in Christ fourteen years ago, whether in body I do not know or whether outside the body I do not know, God knows, of that person’s being snatched up to the third heaven; 3 and I know that man (whether in the body or apart from the body I do not know, God knows) 4 to have been snatched up into Paradise and heard unutterable words which it is not permissible for a man to speak.
5 Maƒo adegbe le nenem me sia ŋu, ke nyemaƒo adegbe le ɖokuinye ŋu o, negbe le nye gbɔdzɔgbɔdzɔwo ŋu ko.
5 As to that person I will boast, but as to myself I will do no boasting except of my weaknesses.

6 Elabena ne medi be maƒo adegbe hã la, nyemazu bometsila o, elabena nyateƒee mato. Ke nyemeƒoa adegbe o, ale be ame aɖeke nagakafum wu ale si wòkpɔam, alo le nya siwo wòsena le nunye la nu o, 7 eye woagakafum le nyaɖeɖefia wɔnuku siwo mexɔ dzaa ko ta o.

6 For if I do choose to boast I shall not be silly, for I shall be speaking the truth; but I am holding back for fear somebody should rate me above what he sees me to be or hears from me 7 by the very extraordinariness of the revelations.
Eya ta be magado ɖokuinye ɖe dzi akpa o la, ŋù aɖe le nye ŋutilã me, abe Satana ƒe dɔla ene, si le fu wɔmem, ale be magado ɖokuinye ɖe dzi akpa o.
For which reason, in order that I may not feel too lofty, I was given a thorn for my flesh, a messenger of Satan’s to bang me about in order that I may not feel too lofty.
8 Meɖe kuku na Aƒetɔ la vevie zi etɔ̃ le esia ŋuti be wòadzo le dzinye. 9 Gake egblɔ nam be: "Nye amenuveve sɔ gbɔ na wò, elabena nye ŋusẽ zua blibo le wò gbɔdzɔgbɔdzɔ me. "
8 As to this I appealed to the Lord three times to have it leave me; 9 and he has said to me "My grace suffices you; for power comes to its completion in weakness. "
Eya ta matsɔ dzidzɔ aƒo adegbe le nye gbɔdzɔgbɔdzɔwo ŋu boŋ, ale be Kristo la ƒe ŋusẽ nanɔ dzinye abe agbadɔ ene.
Most gladly, then, will I boast rather of weaknesses, in order that the Christ’s power may settle on me.
10 Eya ta mekpɔa dzidzɔ le gbɔdzɔgbɔdzɔwo me, le dzudzuwo me, le hiãkamewo me, le yometitiwo kple xaxawo me, le Kristo ta.
10 For which reason I welcome weaknesses brutal treatment, necessities, persecutions, and tight pinches for Christ; for when I am weak, then I am powerful.
Elabena ne megbɔdzɔ la, ekema mesẽa ŋu. 11 Mezu bometsila.
11 I have become silly; you drove me to it.
Miawoe na, elabena ɖe wòle be miakafum hafi.
For I ought to be getting recommendations from you.
Elabena ne nyemenye naneke o hã la, miaƒe apostolo deŋgɔawo menyo wum le nu ɖeka pɛ hã me o.
For there is nothing in which I have fallen behind the superlative apostles, even if I do not amount to anything.
12 Le nyateƒe me la, meɖe dzesi siwo ɖo kpe edzi be apostoloe menye la fia mi le dzidodo geɖe me, tsɔ kpe ɖe nukunuwo, dzesiwo kple ŋusẽdɔwo ŋu.
12 The tokens of the apostle have been produced among you with all perseverance, by tokens and wonders and miracles.
13 Elabena nu ka mee meve hame susɔeawo nu le wu mi? Eya koe nye be, nyemezu agba na miawo ya o.
13 For what point is there in which you were left worse off than the rest of the churches, except that I did not personally squeeze you? excuse me for this unfairness.
Mitsɔ vodada sia kem faa. 14 Kpɔ ɖa!
14 This makes the third time now that I have been ready to come to you, and I will not squeeze you, for I am not after what is yours but after you.
Zi etɔ̃liae nye esia medzra ɖo be mava mia gbɔ, eye nyemava azu agba na mi o.
For the children ought not to be laying by for the parents, but the parents for the children.
15 Ke nye la, adzɔ dzi nam be mazã nye nuwo katã, eye woazãm bliboe, ɖe mia ta.
15 And I will most gladly spend and be expended for your souls.
Ne melɔ̃ mi geɖe wu la, ɖe wòle be miawo ya miaƒe lɔlɔ̃ nam dzi naɖe akpɔtɔa? 16 Ke aleke kee wòɖale o, nyemezu agba na mi o.
If I specially love you am I less loved? 16 But say I did not burden you myself, but, foxy that I am, I caught you by trickery.

Gake miegblɔna be "ayetɔe " menye eye meto "amefuflu " dzi lé mi. 17 Ðe meto ame siwo medɔ ɖo ɖe mi la dometɔ aɖe dzi di viɖe le mia ŋua? 18 Mede dzi ƒo na Tito be wòava mia gbɔ, eye medɔ nɔvi aɖe kpe ɖe eŋu. Ðe Tito va di viɖe aɖe le mia ŋua? Menye nɔnɔme ɖekae nye kplii míeɖe fia oa?

17 Of those that I have sent to you has there been anyone through whom I took an advantage of you? 18 I invited Titus to go, and I sent the brother with him; did Titus take any advantage of you? did we not walk by the same spirit? in the same steps?
Menye afɔɖoƒe ɖeka ma ke mee míezɔ le oa? 19 Ðe miele susum le ɣeyiɣi siawo katã me be mía ɖokui ta ko ʋlim míele le mia gbɔa?
19 You have been thinking all along that it was to you we were making our defense; it is before God that we have been speaking in Christ.

Ke lɔlɔ̃tɔwo, nu siwo katã míewɔna la, miaƒe tutuɖo tae. 20 Elabena mele vɔvɔ̃m be le mɔ aɖe nu ne meva la, ɖewohĩ nyemakpɔ mi abe ale si madi ene o, eye be nyemanɔ na mi abe ale si miadi ene o, ke boŋ be dzre, ŋuʋaʋã, dzikudodowo, nyahehewo, ameŋugbegblẽwo, sakplisasawo, ɖokuidodoɖedziwo, kple masɔmasɔwo anɔ anyi le mɔ aɖe nu. 21 Ðewohĩ ne megava la, nye Mawu abɔbɔm ɖe anyi le mia ŋkume, eye maxa nu le ame siwo wɔ nu vɔ̃ tsã evɔ wo dometɔ geɖe metrɔ dzi me le woƒe makɔmakɔnyenye, gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu kple ŋukpenanuwɔwɔ dzimesesẽtɔe me o la ta.

But everything, dear friends, has been for your upbuilding; 20 for I have been afraid that possibly when I come I may find you not such as I want to, and have you find me such as you do not want to; that possibly quarreling, jealousy, fits of passions, schemes of church politics, detractions, whisperings, inflated airs, disorders 21 that when I come again God is going to humble me in your presence and I am to mourn over great numbers of those who had previously sinned and have not repented over the nastiness and unchastity and indecency they have practiced.
2 Korintotɔwo
2 Corinthians

13 Zi etɔ̃liae nye esia si megbɔna mia gbɔ. "Le ɖasefo eve alo etɔ̃ ƒe ɖaseɖiɖi nu la, woaɖo kpe nya sia nya dzi. " 2 Togbɔ be nyemele mia gbɔ fifia o hã, ɖeko wòle abe mele mia gbɔ zi evelia ene, eye mele nu xlɔ̃m ame siwo wɔ nu vɔ̃ tsã, kple ame susɔewo katã hã do ŋgɔ, be ne megava ake la, nyemakpɔ nublanui na wo o, 3 elabena miele kpeɖodzi dim si afia be Kristo le nu ƒom to dzinye vavã, Kristo si megbɔdzɔ le nuwɔwɔ kpli mi me o, ke boŋ wòsẽa ŋu le mia dome. 4 Elabena nyateƒee wònye be wohee ɖe ati ŋu le gbɔdzɔgbɔdzɔ ƒe nɔnɔme si me wònɔ ta, gake ele agbe le Mawu ƒe ŋusẽ ta. Nyateƒee, míawo hã míegbɔdzɔ abe ale si eya hã nɔ nɔnɔme sia me tsã ene, gake míanɔ agbe kplii le Mawu ƒe ŋusẽ si wòɖe fia mi la ta.

13 This makes the third time I am coming to you, "Every point shall be established at the mouths of two witnesses, and of three. " 2 I have said beforehand, and am saying beforehand, the same now that I am away as when I was there the second time, that if I come again I will not spare, 3 since you are looking for evidence of the genuineness of the Christ who speaks in me 4 who is not weak toward you, but is powerful in you; for he was crucified as a result of weakness, but he is alive as a result of God’s power; for we too are weak in him but shall live with him as a result of God’s power toward you.
5 Minɔ mia ɖokui dom kpɔ be miele xɔse la me hã; minɔ mia ɖokui me dzrom kpɔ ne mianya ame siwo ƒomevi mienye.
5 Make the test of yourselves, if you are in the faith; see about your own genuineness.
Negbe ɖe womekpɔ ŋudzedze ɖe mia ŋu o. 6 Mele mɔ kpɔm vavã be miava kpɔe adze sii be, menye ame siwo ŋu womekpɔ ŋudzedze ɖo o lae míenye o.
Or do you not recognize in your own case that Jesus Christ is in you? unless you are counterfeit, 6 but I hope you will find that we are not counterfeits.
7 Ke míedoa gbe ɖa na Mawu be miagawɔ nu gbegblẽ aɖeke o, menye be míawo míadze ame siwo ŋu wokpɔ ŋudzedze ɖo o, ke boŋ be miawɔ nu si nyo, ne míawo míedze ame siwo ŋu womekpɔ ŋudzedze ɖo o hã.

7 But we pray to God that you may not do anything bad, not in order that we may show up as genuine but that you may be doing what is good and we be as if we were counterfeits; 8 for we cannot do anything against the truth, but for the truth.
8 Elabena míate ŋu awɔ naneke ɖe nyateƒe la ŋu o, negbe nu si ade nyateƒe la dzi ko. 9 Vavãe, ne míawo míegbɔdzɔ gake miawo miesẽ ŋu la, edzɔa dzi na mí.
9 For we are glad when we are weak but you are powerful; this is the very thing we are praying for, your advance to soundness.

Eye esiae míedoa gbe ɖa biana, be woaɖɔ mi ɖo. 10 Esia tae mele nya siawo ŋlɔm togbɔ be nyemele mia gbɔ o hã, ale be ne mele mia gbɔ la, nye asi nagasẽ ɖe mia dzi le ŋusẽ si Aƒetɔ la nam be matsɔ atu ame ɖo, ke menye be matsɔ agblẽ nu le ame ŋu o, la zazã me o.
10 That is why I write this while I am away, so that when I am there I may not act rigorously under the authority which the Lord gave me for building up and not for demolishing.
11 Mlɔeba la, nɔviwo, miyi edzi mianɔ dzidzɔ kpɔm, mina woanɔ mia ɖɔm ɖo, woanɔ akɔ fam na mi, miaƒe tamesusu nanɔ ɖeka, minɔ anyi le ŋutifafa me; eye lɔlɔ̃ kple ŋutifafa ƒe Mawu la anɔ anyi kpli mi.
11 For the rest, brothers, be joyous, sound, cheerful, unanimous, peaceful, and the God of love and peace will be with you.
12 Mitsɔ nugbugbɔ kɔkɔe do gbe na mia nɔewo.
12 Give my greetings to each other with a holy kiss.
13 Ame kɔkɔewo katã do gbe na mi.
13 All God’s people send you greetings.
14 Mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe amenuveve kple Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃ kpakple gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe si ɖea vi na mí katã la, nanɔ kpli mi katã.
14 The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ and the love of God and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all.
Galatiatɔwo
Galatians

1 Paulo, si nye apostolo, menye tso amegbetɔwo gbɔ alo to ame aɖeke dzi o, ke boŋ to Yesu Kristo kple Mawu Fofo la, ame si fɔe ɖe tsitre tso ame kukuwo dome la dzi, 2 kple nɔvi siwo katã le gbɔnye, le esia ŋlɔm na hame siwo le Galatia: 3 Amenuveve kple ŋutifafa si tso Mawu mía Fofo kple Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo gbɔ la woana mi. 4 Etsɔ eɖokui na ɖe míaƒe nu vɔ̃wo ta, be wòaɖe mí tso fifi nuɖoanyi vɔ̃ɖi sia me le Mawu mía Fofo ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu la nu, 5 ame si tɔ anye ŋutikɔkɔe tso mavɔ me yi mavɔ me. Amen.

1 Paul, an apostle not from men nor through a man but through Jesus Christ and God the Father who raised him from the dead, 2 and all the brothers who are with me, to the churches of Galatia: 3 Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ 4 who gave himself for our sins in order to take us out of the present vicious world in accordance with the will of our God and Father, 5 to whom be glory world without end; amen!

6 Ewɔ moyaa nam be miele tɔtrɔm ɖa kaba ŋutɔ tso Ame si tsɔ Kristo ƒe amenuveve yɔ mi la gbɔ yina nya nyui bubu ƒomevi aɖe gbɔ. 7 Evɔ nya nyui bubu aɖeke meli o; ke boŋ ɖeko ame aɖewo le fu ɖem na mi, eye wole didim be yewoabaɖa afɔ na Kristo ŋuti nya nyui la.

6 I wonder that you are so quickly shifting from the Christ who called you in grace to another gospel, 7 which is not another one, unless there are some who are disturbing you and wanting to turn the gospel of the Christ another way.
8 Ke ne míawo alo mawudɔla si tso dziƒo gɔ̃ hã agblɔ nya aɖe be enye nya nyui to vovo na nya nyui si míegblɔ na mi la, neɖi eŋu kpékpekpe.
8 But even if we, or if an angel from heaven, preaches to you a gospel inconsistent with the gospel we preached, let him be for God’s destruction.
9 Abe ale si míegblɔe do ŋgɔ ene la, megale egblɔm ake be, ame sia ame si va le nya nyui si to vovo na esi miexɔ la gblɔm na mi la, neɖi eŋu kpékpekpe.
9 As we have said before, now too I say again, if anyone preaches to you a gospel inconsistent with what you did have given to you, let him be for God’s destruction.
10 Ekema amegbetɔwo ŋue medi be madze loo alo Mawu ŋua?
10 For am I now persuading men or God? or am I aiming to please men?
Alo ɖe mele didim be nye nu nanyo amegbetɔwo ŋua?
If I were still pleasing men I should not be Christ’s property.
11 Nɔviwo, medi be mana mianyae be, nya nyui si megblɔ na mi la, metso amegbetɔwo gbɔ o; 12 eye menye amegbetɔ si me hãe mexɔe tsoe alo woawoe fiam o, ke boŋ nyaɖeɖefia wònye tso Yesu Kristo gbɔ.

11 And I give you notice, brothers, as to the gospel preached by me that it is not along human lines; 12 for I did not even take it over nor receive teaching from a man, but through a revelation of Jesus Christ.

13 Nyateƒee, miese nu tso ale si menɔ agbee tsã abe Yudatɔ ene la ŋu, be meti Mawu ƒe hame la yome vevie, eye menɔ edome gblẽm; 14 eye meyi ŋgɔ geɖe le Yudasubɔsubɔ me wu hanyeti geɖewo le nye dukɔ la me, elabena medo vevie nu le mía fofowo ƒe kɔnyinyiwo me geɖe wu.

13 For you have heard about my life back in my Jewish days, that I was extraordinarily active in persecuting and ravaging God’s church, 14 and went further in Jewishness than a good many in my race who were of my age, being a very special zealot for the traditions I had from my fathers.

15 Ke esi Mawu, ame si na danye dzim eye wòyɔm le eƒe amenuveve me la, kpɔe be enyo 16 be yeaɖe ye Vi la afia to dzinye, ale be magblɔ eŋuti nya nyui la na dukɔwo la, nyemeyi ɖalée kpɔ kple amegbetɔ aɖeke enumake o; 17 eye nyemeyi Yerusalem ɖe ame siwo nye apostolowo do ŋgɔ nam la hã gbɔ o, ke boŋ meyi Arabia, emegbe megatrɔ va Damasko.

15 But when he who had set me apart before I was born and had called me by his grace was pleased 16 to reveal his Son in me in order that I might preach his gospel among the nations, at once I did not consult flesh and blood 17 nor go up to Jerusalem to those who had been apostles before me but went off into Arabia, and came back again to Damascus.
18 Le ƒe etɔ̃ megbe la, meyi Yerusalem be maɖakpɔ Kefas ɖa, eye menɔ egbɔ ŋkeke wuiatɔ̃. 19 Ke nyemegakpɔ apostolo bubuawo dometɔ aɖeke o, negbe Yakobo, Aƒetɔ la nɔvi ko.
18 Then, after three years, I went up to Jerusalem to look up Cephas, and stayed at his house a fortnight, 19 but did not see another of the apostles, except the Lord’s brother James.
20 Ke le nu siwo ŋlɔm mele na mi ŋuti la, meka ɖe edzi na mi le Mawu ŋkume be menye aʋatso kam mele o.
20 And in what I am writing to you God knows I am not lying.
21 Emegbe meyi Siria kple Kilikia nutoawo me.
21 Then I came into the Syrian and Cilician neighborhood.
22 Ke Yudea hame siwo le Kristo me la mekpɔm kpɔ o. 23 Ðeko wosena be: "Ame si tia mía yome tsã la le xɔse si dome wòdi be yeagblẽ tsã la ŋu nya nyui gblɔm azɔ. " 24 Ale wonɔ Mawu kafum le tanye.

22 But I was unknown by face to the churches of Christ in Judea; 23 but they only heard "He who once persecuted us is now preaching the gospel of the faith he used to ravage, " 24 and glorified God over me.
Galatiatɔwo
Galatians
2 Azɔ le ƒe wuiene megbe la, megayi Yerusalem, nye kple Barnaba, eye mekplɔ Tito hã ɖe asi.
2 Then, after fourteen years, I went up to Jerusalem again with Barnabas, taking Titus along too.

2 Nyaɖeɖefia aɖe si mexɔ tae meyi ɖo, eye megblɔ nya nyui si ƒe gbeƒã ɖem mele na dukɔwo la na wo. Ke hã meɖe kpɔ ame ŋkutawo ɖeɖe hegblɔe na wo, ne wòagadzɔ be ɖe mele du ƒum alo be meƒu du dzodzro o. 3 Gake womeƒoe ɖe Tito si le ŋunye gɔ̃ hã nu be wòatso aʋa o, togbɔ be Helatɔe wònye hã.

2 And I went up in accordance with a revelation; and I laid before them the gospel I am proclaiming among the nations, but privately before those who had reputations, for fear that I should be or had been running a bootless course; 3 but there was no requirement that even Titus who was with me, being a Greek, should be circumcised.

4 Gake nya sia fɔ ɖe te esi aʋatsonɔviwo va tra ɖe eme dzaa hele mɔnu dim be yewoagblẽ ablɔɖe si le mía si le Kristo Yesu me la me, ale be woawɔ mí kluviwoe keŋkeŋ; 5 míeɖe mɔ ame siawo kpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe mía dzi o, ao, míeɖe mɔ na wo vie hã o, ale be nya nyui la ƒe nyateƒe la nanɔ mia me ɖaa.

4 But because of the intrusive false brothers who had intruded themselves to spy on our liberty that we have in Christ Jesus, in order to enslave us, 5 to whom we did not for a moment give way in submission, in order that the truth of the gospel might remain with you.

6 Ke ame siwo wobuna ame veviwoe ame kawo ƒomevi woɖanye tsã o, ema mele vevie nam o, elabena Mawu mewɔa nu ɖe ame ŋu le eƒe dzedzeme nu o ​nyemesrɔ̃ nu yeye aɖeke tso ame mawo siwo wobuna ame ŋkutawoe la gbɔ o. 7 Ke boŋ esi wokpɔ be wotsɔ nya nyui la de asi nam na ame siwo nye aʋamatsomatsotɔwo, abe ale si ko wotsɔe de asi na Petro hã hena aʋatsotsotɔwo ene, 8 elabena ame si na ŋusẽ Petro be wòanye apostolo na ame siwo tso aʋa la kee na ŋusẽ nye hã hena dukɔwo me tɔwo, 9 eye esi wova de dzesi ale si wove nunyee la, Yakobo, Kefas kple Yohanes, ame siwo wobuna sɔtiwoe la, na asi nye kple Barnaba tsɔ ɖee fia be yewowɔ ɖeka kpli mí, be míawo míayi dukɔwo gbɔ, ke yewo yewoayi aʋatsotsotɔwo gbɔ. 10 Negbe ɖeko wobia tso mía si be míanɔ ame dahewo ŋu bum, eye esia tututue medoa vevie wɔna. 11 Ke esi Kefas va Antiokia la, mehe nya ɖe eŋu ŋkume kple ŋkume, elabena edze ƒãa be etɔ medzɔ o. 12 Elabena hafi ame aɖewo natso Yakobo gbɔ ava la, eɖua nu kple dukɔwo me tɔwo; ke esi wova ɖo ko la, edzudzɔ heɖe eɖokui ɖe vovo le vɔvɔ̃ na aʋatsotsotɔwo ta.

6 But from those who had the reputation of being something (what they were makes no difference to me; God does not defer to a man’s personality) for those who had reputations propounded nothing to me, 7 but on the contrary, as they saw that I had been entrusted with the gospel message for the uncircumcised as Peter had with that for the circumcised, 8 for he who had inspired Peter to the apostleship for the circumcised had inspired me too to the nations, 9 and finding the grace that had been given to me, James and Cephas and John, those who had the reputation of being pillars, shook hands with Barnabas and me on a partnership, we to address ourselves to the nations and they to the circumcised; 10 only we were to remember the poor, which is just what I have made a point of doing.

13 Yudatɔ susɔeawo hã wɔ ɖeka kplii le alakpanuwɔwɔ sia me, ale be wohe Barnaba gɔ̃ hã kpe ɖe wo ɖokui ŋu le woƒe alakpanuwɔwɔa me. 14 Ke esi mekpɔ be womele zɔzɔm le nya nyui la ƒe nyateƒe la nu o la, megblɔ na Kefas le wo katã ŋkume be: "Ne wò, ame si nye Yudatɔ, nènɔa agbe abe dukɔwo me tɔwo ene, eye menye abe Yudatɔ ene o la, aleke nàte ŋu aƒoe ɖe dukɔwo me tɔwo nu be woanɔ agbe ɖe Yudatɔwo ƒe kɔnyinyiwo nu? " 15 Mí ame siwo nye Yudatɔwo tso dzɔdzɔme eye míenye nu vɔ̃ wɔla siwo tso dukɔwo dome o la, 16 míenyae be womebua ame be ele dzɔdzɔe to se la ƒe dɔwɔwɔwo me o, ke boŋ to Yesu Kristo dzi xɔxɔ se me ko. Eya ta míexɔ Kristo Yesu dzi se, ale be woabu mí ame dzɔdzɔewoe le Kristo dzi xɔxɔ se me, ke menye le se la ƒe dɔwɔwɔwo ta o, elabena womabu ame aɖeke be ele dzɔdzɔe to se la ƒe dɔwɔwɔ me o.

11 But when Cephas came to Antioch I opposed him face to face because he was recognizably in the wrong; 12 for before a certain person came from James he ate together with the foreigners, but when he came he flinched and separated himself, being afraid of the circumcised party, 13 and the rest of the Jews played the hypocrite together with him, so that even Barnabas was carried along with their hypocrisy; 14 but when I saw that they were not taking a straight line by the truth of the gospel, I said to Cephas before everybody "If you, when you are a Jew, are living in foreign fashion and not in Jewish, how is it you are forcing the foreigners to go Jewish? 15 We, as by natural birth Jews and not sinful foreigners, 16 but knowing that a man is not justified as the outcome of deeds in observance of the law but only through faith in Jesus Christ, even we put our faith in Jesus Christ in order that we might be justified as the outcome of faith in Christ and not of deeds under the law, because out of the deeds under the law no mortal will be justified.

17 Ke ne wokpɔ míawo ŋutɔwo hã be míenye nu vɔ̃ wɔlawo esi míele didim be woabu mí ame dzɔdzɔewoe to Kristo dzi la, ekema nu vɔ̃ dzi demee Kristo lea? Gbeɖe! 18 Ne nu siwo tututu memu ƒu anyi tsã la tumee megale la, ekema meɖee fia be menye vodala.

17 But if in seeking to be justified in Christ we ourselves have been found sinful too, then Christ is an auxiliary to sin! away with the thought! 18 For if I build up again what I did break down, I certify myself a transgressor.
19 Elabena meto se la me ku na se la, be magbɔ agbe na Mawu.
19 As for me, through the law I died to the law in order that I might be alive to God.

20 Wohem ɖe ati ŋu kpe ɖe Kristo ŋu. Meganye nyee le agbe o, ke boŋ Kristo ye le agbe le menye. Ɛ̃, agbe si mele fifia le ŋutilã me la, to Mawu ƒe Vi si lɔ̃m eye wòtsɔ eɖokui na ɖe tanye la dzi xɔxɔ se mee meli ɖo.

20 I have been crucified with Christ; and no longer I am alive, but Christ is alive in me; and insofar as I am now alive in flesh I am alive in faith on the Son of God who loved me and gave himself up for me.
21 Nyemegbe Mawu ƒe amenuveve la o, elabena ne se la dzie woato anɔ dzɔdzɔe la, ekema Kristo ku dzodzro.
21 I do not disregard God’s grace. For if there is righteousness through the law, then Christ died superfluously. "
Galatiatɔwo
Galatians

3 Oo, Galatiatɔ movitɔwo! Ame kae le ŋusẽ gbegblẽ sia kpɔm ɖe mia dzi, mi ame siwo ŋkume woɖee fia kɔtɛ le be wohe Yesu Kristo ɖe ati ŋu? 2 Nu si ko dim mele be manya tso mia gbɔ lae nye esi: Se la ƒe dɔwɔwɔ dzie mieto xɔ gbɔgbɔ la loo alo to nya si miese la dzi xɔxɔ se dzie? 3 Ðe miedzɔ movi nenema gbegbea? Esi miedze egɔme le zɔzɔm le gbɔgbɔ me la, ɖe miawu enu le ŋutilã mea? 4 Ðe mieto fukpekpe geɖe mawo gbegbe me dzodzroa? Mate ŋu anye dzodzro o. 5 Ekema ame si naa gbɔgbɔ la mi eye wòwɔa ŋusẽdɔwo le mia dome la, ɖe wòwɔnɛ le esi miewɔa se la ƒe dɔwo ta loo alo esi miexɔ nu si miese la dzi se taea? 6 Abe ale si Abraham "xɔ Yehowa dzi se, eye wobui dzɔdzɔenyenye nɛ " ene. 7 Mienyae nyuie be ame siwo si xɔse le lae nye Abraham ƒe viwo.

3 You stupid Galatians, who hypnotized you, you who had had it advertised before your eyes that Jesus Christ was crucified? 2 I want to find out this one thing from you: was it as the outcome of deeds in observance of the law that you received the Spirit or was it as the outcome of listening in faith? 3 Are you so stupid as this? when you began by Spirit are you now finishing by flesh? 4 Did you undergo so much for nothing? if for nothing it was! 5 Does he who furnishes the Spirit to you, then, and who works miracles among you, do it as the outcome of deeds in observance of the law or as the outcome of listening in faith? 6 As Abraham "believed God, and it was counted as righteousness for him. " 7 Know, then, that it is the men of faith who are sons of Abraham.

8 Ke esi ŋɔŋlɔ la kpɔe do ŋgɔ be Mawu abu dukɔwo me tɔwo ame dzɔdzɔewoe le xɔse ta la, egblɔ nya nyui la na Abraham do ŋgɔ be: "Dziwòe woato ayra dukɔwo katã. " 9 Eya ta wole ame siwo si xɔse le la yram kpe ɖe Abraham xɔsetɔ la ŋu.
