8 And the text, foreseeing that God is justifying the nations as the outcome of faith, gave Abraham the anticipatory gospel message "In you all the nations shall be blessed, " 9 so that the men of faith are blessed with believing Abraham.

10 Ame siwo katã ɖoa ŋu ɖe se ƒe dɔwɔwɔwo ŋu la, wole fiƒode te, elabena woŋlɔ ɖi be: "Aɖi ame sia ame si mezɔna ɖe nu siwo katã woŋlɔ ɖe Segbalẽa me hewɔa wo dzi o la ŋu. " 11 Eye edze ƒãa be womebua ame aɖeke ame dzɔdzɔe to se la dzi le Mawu gbɔ o, elabena "ame dzɔdzɔe la ƒe xɔsee ana wòanɔ agbe. " 12 Ke menye xɔse dzie wotu Se la ɖo o. Ke boŋ "ame si wɔa nu siawo dzi la ato wo dzi anɔ agbe. " 13 Kristo ƒle mí heɖe mí tso Se la ƒe fiƒode la me esi wòva zu fiƒodeme ɖe mía teƒe, elabena woŋlɔ ɖi be: "Ame sia ame si wohe ɖe ati ŋu la, fiƒode le edzi. " 14 Esia va eme ale be Abraham ƒe yayra la nava to Kristo Yesu dzi na dukɔwo, be míaxɔ gbɔgbɔ si ŋugbe wodo la to míaƒe xɔse me.

10 For as many as are on the basis of deeds in observance of the law are under a curse; for it says "Accursed is everyone who does not persist in everything written in the book of the law to live up to it. " 11 And that in the law nobody is justified in God’s presence is obvious, because "the righteous man shall have life by virtue of faith " 12 and the law is not by virtue of faith but "he who practices them shall have life by them. " 13 Christ bought us off from the curse of the law, becoming a curse for us (because it says "anyone hanging on wood is accursed "), 14 that in Jesus Christ Abraham’s blessing might be on the nations, that we might receive the promised gift of the Spirit through faith.
15 Nɔviwo, mele kpɔɖeŋu aɖe si ku ɖe amegbetɔwo ŋu wɔm: Ne wonya ɖo kpe nubabla aɖe dzi ko la, ne amegbetɔe wɔe hã la, ame aɖeke megatea fli ɖe eme alo tsɔa naneke kpenɛ o.
15 Brothers, I speak from a human point of view; it is the same with a human engagement: when it has been validated, nobody ignores it or adds new conditions to it.
16 Ke wodo ŋugbeawo na Abraham kple eƒe dzidzimevi. Megblɔ be: "Kple dzidzimeviwo, " abe ame geɖewoe ene o, ke boŋ ɖeka ko: "Kple wò dzidzimevi, " si nye Kristo.
16 But the promise was uttered to Abraham "and his seed " he does not say "and seeds " as referring to many, but, as referring to one, "and your seed, " who is Christ.
17 Mele gbɔgblɔm hã be: Se si wova de ƒe alafa ene kple blaetɔ̃ megbe la, mete fli ɖe Mawu ƒe nubabla si do ŋgɔ la me ne wòaɖe ŋugbedodo la ɖa o.

17 And this is what I am saying: when an engagement had been previously validated by God, the law that came into existence four hundred and thirty years later could not invalidate it so as to supersede the promise.
18 Elabena ne se la dzie wotu domenyinyi la ɖo la, ekema meganye ŋugbedodo dzie wotui ɖo o; ke boŋ ɖe Mawu to ŋugbedodo dzi tsɔe na Abraham dɔmenyotɔe.
18 For if the inheritance is on the basis of a law it is no longer on the basis of a promise; but God has granted it to Abraham by a promise.
19 Ekema nu ka tae Se la li ɖo?
19 How about the law then?
Wotsɔe kpe ɖe eŋuti, ne wòana vodadawo nadze, va se ɖe esime dzidzimevi si ŋu ŋugbedodoa ku ɖo la nava ɖo; eye woto mawudɔlawo dzi tsɔe na to domenɔla aɖe si me.
It was added with a view to transgressions, until the Seed to whom the promise was made should come, and was prescribed through angels by the hand of an intermediary.
20 Ke domenɔla menɔa anyi, ne ame ɖeka ko ŋue wòku ɖo o, evɔ Mawu ɖeka koe.
20 But an intermediary is not the intermediary of one. But God is one.
21 Ekema ɖe Se la tsi tsitre ɖe Mawu ƒe ŋugbedodowo ŋua? Gbeɖe!
21 So is the law in antagonism to God’s promises? away with the thought!

Elabena ne ɖe wona se si ate ŋu ana agbe la, anye ne dzɔdzɔenyenye ato se dzi ava. 22 Ke Ŋɔŋlɔ la tsɔ nuwo katã de nu vɔ̃ te, ale be woatsɔ ŋugbedodo, si tsoa Yesu Kristo dzi xɔxɔ se me la, ana ame siwo xɔa edzi sena.

For if there had been given a law that could bring life, righteousness would really be by the law; 22 but the text has shut up everything under sin in order that as the outcome of faith in Jesus Christ the fulfillment of the promise might be given to those who believe.

23 Ke hafi xɔse la nava ɖo la, se la nɔ mía ŋu dzɔm, eye wotsɔ mí de eƒe dzikpɔkpɔ te, eye míenɔ mɔ kpɔm na xɔse si woava ɖe afia la. 24 Ale Se la va zu míaƒe mɔfiala si kplɔa mí yia Kristo gbɔ, ale be woabu mí ame dzɔdzɔewoe le xɔse ta.

23 But before faith came we were kept in custody under the law, shut up to be ready for the faith that was going to be revealed, 24 so that the law has been our conductor to Christ in order that we might be justified on the basis of faith.
25 Ke esi xɔse la va ɖo azɔ la, míegale mɔfiala aɖeke te o.
25 But now that faith has come we are no longer under a conductor.
26 Le nyateƒe me la, mi katã mienye Mawu ƒe viwo le esi miexɔ Kristo Yesu dzi se ta.
26 For you are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus.

27 Elabena mi ame siwo katã wonyrɔ ɖe Kristo me la, miedo Kristo. 28 Yudatɔ alo Helatɔ meli o, kluvi alo ablɔɖeme meli o, ŋutsu alo nyɔnu meli o, elabena ame ɖekae mi katã mienye hewɔ ɖeka kple Kristo Yesu.

27 For all you who have been baptized to Christ have clothed yourselves with Christ; 28 there is no such thing as Jew or Greek, there is no such thing as slave or free, there is no such thing as male and female, for all of you are one in Christ Jesus.
29 Eye ne mienye Kristo tɔ la, ekema Abraham ƒe dzidzimeviwoe mienye vavã, domenyilawo mienye le ŋugbedodo nu.
29 And if you belong to Christ, then you are seed of Abraham, heirs by promise.
Galatiatɔwo
Galatians

4 Ke mele gbɔgblɔm be, zi ale si domenyila la kpɔtɔ nye ɖevi sue ko la, vovototo aɖeke kura mele eya kple kluvi dome o, togbɔ be eyae nye nuwo katã ƒe aƒetɔ hã, 2 ke boŋ ele vidzikpɔlawo kple aƒedzikpɔlawo te, va se ɖe ŋkeke si fofoa ɖo ɖi la dzi. 3 Nenema kee míawo hã, esime míenye ɖevi suewo la, xexea ƒe gɔmedzenuwo wɔa mí kluviwoe.

4 But, I am saying, for so long as the heir is an infant he is no different from a slave though he is master of everything, 2 but is under guardians and stewards until the date that the father sets; 3 in the same way we, when we were infants, were enslaved under the elementary things of the world.
4 Ke esi ɣeyiɣi la de keŋkeŋ la, Mawu dɔ Via ɖo ɖa, ame si nyɔnu aɖe dzi, eye wònɔ se te, 5 ne wòaƒle ame siwo le se la te ahaɖe wo, ale be woaxɔ mí abe viwo ene.
4 But when the full time had elapsed God sent out his Son, born of a woman, born under the law, 5 to buy off those who were under the law, so that we might receive our adoption as sons.

6 Ke esi mienye viwo ta la, Mawu ɖo Via ƒe gbɔgbɔ ɖe míaƒe dziwo me, eye gbɔgbɔ sia doa ɣli be: "Abba, Fofo! " 7 Eya ta mèganye kluvi o, ke boŋ vi nènye; eye ne vi nènye la, ekema domenyila hã nènye to Mawu dzi.
6 And because you are sons God sent out his Son’s spirit into our hearts crying "Abba, " Father. 7 So that you are no longer a slave but a son, and if a son, an heir too through God.
8 Ke ɣemaɣi, esime mienya Mawu o la, mienye kluviwo na nu siwo dze ƒãa be womenye mawuwo o la.
8 But then, not knowing God, you were in slavery to those who in nature are not gods.

9 Ke azɔ, esi mieva nya Mawu, alo esi Mawu boŋ va nya mi la, aleke wɔ miegale tɔtrɔm ɖe gɔmedzenu gbɔdzɔ maɖinuawo ŋu, eye miele didim be yewoagazu woƒe kluviwo ake? 10 Miele ŋku lém ɖe ŋkekewo, ɣletiwo, azãgbewo kple ƒewo ŋu tsitotsito.

9 But now when you do know God, or rather are known by God, how is it you are turning back again to the weak and cheap elementary things, to which you want to be in slavery over again? 10 you watch days and months and dates and years.
11 Mele vɔvɔ̃m ɖe mia nu be medze agbagba dzodzro ɖe mia ta mahĩ.
11 I am afraid of you, that I may have done my hard work on you for nothing.
12 Nɔviwo, mele kuku ɖem na mi be, minɔ abe nye ene, elabena nye hã menɔ abe miawo ene tsã.
12 Become like me, because I myself am becoming like you, brothers, I beg you.

Mieda vo aɖeke ɖe ŋunye o. 13 Ke mienyae be nye lãmegbegblẽ aɖee ʋu mɔ ɖi nam be magblɔ nya nyui la na mi zi gbãtɔ. 14 Eye togbɔ be nye lãmegbegblẽa zu tetekpɔ na mi hã la, miedo vlom alo nyɔ ŋum o; ke boŋ miexɔm abe mawudɔla ene, abe Kristo Yesu ene.

You did me no wrong; 13 but you know it was because of a physical infirmity that I preached the gospel to you in the first place; 14 and you were not provoked to scorn or disgust by the temptation to you in my bodily condition, but received me like an angel of God, like Jesus Christ.
15 Afi kae dzidzɔ ma si miekpɔ tsã la le fifia?
15 What has become of your self-congratulation, then? for I am your witness that if it had been possible you would have dug out your own eyes and given them to me.
Elabena mele ɖase ɖim le mia ŋu be, ne ɖe wòanya wɔ la, anye ne mieho miaƒe ŋkuwo le to me tsɔ nam.
16 So that I have become your enemy by telling you the truth!

16 Ke fifia ɖe mezu miaƒe futɔ le esi meto nyateƒe na mi taa? 17 Ame aɖewo le ʋiʋlim vevie be yewoana miatrɔ ɖe yewo ŋu, menye kple susu nyui o; ke boŋ be yewoaɖe mi ɖa le ŋunye, ale be miadi be yewoadze woawo boŋ yome.
17 They are jealous of you, not in a good sense, but they want to shut you out in order that you may be jealous of them.

18 Ke enyo be ame aɖe natsɔ susu nyui aʋli vevie ɣesiaɣi be miatrɔ ɖe ye ŋu, eye menye ne mele mia gbɔ ɖeɖe ko o; 19 vinyewo, mele veve sem le mia ta abe ale si fu ɖua nyɔnu ene, va se ɖe esime Kristo ƒe nɔnɔme nasu mia si.

18 But it is a good thing to have people’s jealousy in a good cause at all times and not only while I am there with you, 19 my children, with whom I am in birth-pangs again till Christ takes shape in you.
20 Ðe madi be manɔ mia gbɔ fifi laa, ne maƒo nu le mɔ bubu nu hafi, elabena metɔtɔ le mia ta.
20 But I wish I could be there with you now and change my tone, because I am at my wit’s end about you.

21 Migblɔe nam, mi ame siwo di be yewoanɔ se te, ɖe miese nu si Se la gblɔ oa? 22 Le kpɔɖeŋu me, woŋlɔe ɖi be vi eve nɔ Abraham si, ɖeka nye kosi la ƒe vi, eye evelia nye ablɔɖenyɔnu la ƒe vi; 23 ke esi kosi la dzi la, wodzii abe ale si ko wòle le dzɔdzɔme nu ene, eye ekemɛ si ablɔɖenyɔnua dzi la, nye esi ƒe ŋugbe wodo. 24 Nu siawo nye kpɔɖeŋu si wotsɔ ɖe nu tɔxɛ aɖe fia; elabena nyɔnu siawo le tsitre ɖi na nubabla eve, ɖeka tso Sinai To la dzi, si dzia vi hena kluvinyenye, eye eyae nye Hagar.

21 Tell me, you that want to be under the law, do you not hear the law? 22 For the text says Abraham had two sons, one by the slave-girl and one by the freewoman, 23 but the one by the slave-girl had been begotten in the way of flesh and the one by the freewoman through a promise: 24 which things are said allegorically; for these are two covenants, one from Mount Sinai, producing children for slavery, which is Hagar 25 (and Sinai is a mountain in Arabia); and it corresponds to the present Jerusalem, for that is in slavery with its children.

25 Ke Hagar le tsitre ɖi na Sinai, si nye to le Arabia, eye wòsɔ kple egbegbe Yerusalem, elabena eya kple viawo le kluvinyenye me. 26 Ke wona ablɔɖe Yerusalem si le dzi ya, eye eyae nye mía dada. 27 Elabena woŋlɔ ɖi be: "Wò, konɔ si medzi vi o, dzi nedzɔ wò; gli kple dzidzɔ, wò nyɔnu si melé ku kpɔ o; elabena nyɔnu si wogblẽ ɖi la ƒe viwo sɔ gbɔ wu nyɔnu si gbɔ srɔ̃a le la ƒe viwo. " 28 Ke azɔ la, nɔviwo, ŋugbedodo la ƒe viwo mienye abe Isak ene.

26 But the Jerusalem above is free, which is our mother; 27 for it says "Jubilate, barren woman who bore no children; break loose and shout, you that felt no birth-pangs; because the deserted mother’s children outnumber those of the husbanded mother. " 28 And you, brothers, like Isaac, are children of a promise; 29 but just as then the one born in the way of flesh persecuted the one born in the way of spirit, 30 so now but what does the text say?
29 Ke ale si ko ame si wodzi le dzɔdzɔme nu ti ame si wodzi le gbɔgbɔ la nu yome ɣemaɣi la, nenema kee wògale fifia hã.
"Turn out the slave-girl and her son, for the slave-girl’s son shall not inherit along with the freewoman’s! "

30 Gake nya kae ŋɔŋlɔ la gblɔ? "Nya kosi la kple via ɖa, elabena kosi la ƒe vi manyi dome kple ablɔɖenyɔnu la ƒe vi akpɔ o. " 31 Eya ta nɔviwo, menye kosi ƒe viwoe míenye o, ke boŋ ablɔɖenyɔnu la ƒe viwoe míenye.
31 Wherefore, brothers, we are not children of a slave-girl but of the freewoman.
Galatiatɔwo
Galatians
5 Ablɔɖe sia tae Kristo na ablɔɖe mí ɖo. Eya ta minɔ te sesĩe, eye migana woatsɔ kluvinyenye ƒe kɔkuti ade kɔ na mi ake o.
5 It was to freedom that Christ liberated us; so stand firm and do not be held in a yoke of slavery again.
2 Kpɔ ɖa, nye, Paulo mele egblɔm na mi be, ne miena wotso aʋa na mi la, ekema Kristo meganye viɖe aɖeke na mi o.
2 Here, it is I, Paul, that am telling you: if you get circumcised, Christ will not do you any good at all.
3 Megale ɖase ɖim na ame sia ame si ana woatso aʋa nɛ la be, agba le edzi be wòawɔ Se blibo la katã hã dzi.
3 And again I declare to every man who gets circumcised that he owes the performance of the whole of the law.

4 Mi ame siwo katã le agbagba dzem be woabu mi ame dzɔdzɔewo to sea dzi la, woklã mi ɖa le Kristo gbɔ; miedo le eƒe amenuveve la te. 5 Ke míawo la, míeto gbɔgbɔ la dzi le dzɔdzɔenyenye, si tsoa xɔse me, si míele mɔ kpɔm na la lalam vevie.
4 You are disengaged from Christ, you who are being justified by the law; you have dropped out of grace; 5 for we by the Spirit await on the basis of faith a hope of justification.
6 Elabena ame siwo le Kristo Yesu me la, asixɔxɔ aɖeke mele aʋatsotso alo aʋamatsomatso ŋu na wo o, hafi boŋ xɔse si wɔa dɔ le lɔlɔ̃ me ŋue.
6 For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision has any effect, but faith active through love.
7 Mienɔ dua ƒum nyuie. Ame kae xe mɔ na mi be miagayi edzi aɖo to nyateƒe la o? 8 Menye Ame si le mia yɔm la gbɔe nyaƒoɖeamenu sia ƒomevi tso o.
7 You were running finely; who interfered with you to keep you from obeying truth? 8 the pressure is not from the one who is calling you.
9 Amɔwɔʋãnu vi aɖe nana amɔwɔ blibo la katã ʋãna.
9 A little piece of yeast makes all the dough yeasty.
10 Meka ɖe edzi be, mi ame siwo le Aƒetɔ la me la, miegbɔna miaƒe susu trɔ ge o; ke ame si le fu ɖem na mi la, ame ka kee wòɖanye o, akpɔ eƒe ʋɔnudɔdrɔ̃ si wòdze na.
10 But I am confident of you in the Lord that you will not take any other attitude; but he who is disturbing you shall bear the sentence he gets, whoever he is.
11 Nye la, nɔviwo, ne ɖe megale gbeƒã ɖem aʋatsotso la, ke nu ka tae wogale yonyeme tim kokoko? Ekema woɖe fuwɔametia ŋuti nuɖiaɖia la ɖae.
11 But why am I, brothers, still being persecuted, if I am still preaching circumcision? then the difficulty of the cross is shelved.
12 Ðe madi be ame siwo le agbagba dzem be yewoatrɔ miaƒe susu la nana woata woawo ŋutɔwo hafi.
12 It would be a good thing if those who are unsettling you would do something more to themselves than circumcision.
13 Nɔviwo, ablɔɖe tae woyɔ mi ɖo; ɖeko migaɖe mɔ ablɔɖe sia nazu mɔnukpɔkpɔ na mi miakplɔ ŋutilã ƒe nudzodzrowo ɖo o, ke boŋ misubɔ mia nɔewo abe kluviwo ene le lɔlɔ̃ me.
13 For you, brothers, were called on terms of liberty; only do not make liberty an opening for the flesh, but be in slavery to each other through love.

14 Elabena woƒo Se blibo la katã nu ƒu ɖe sedede ɖeka sia me be: "Lɔ̃ hawòvi abe wò ŋutɔ ɖokuiwò ene. " 15 Ke ne miele mia nɔewo ɖum, eye miele mia nɔewo mim la, mikpɔ nyuie be miagatsrɔ̃ mia nɔewo o.
14 For all of the law is fulfilled in one proposition, to love one’s neighbor as one’s self. 15 But if you bite and eat each other, look out that you do not get used up by each other.
16 Ke mele egblɔm be: Miyi edzi miazɔ le gbɔgbɔ me, ekema miele ŋutilã ƒe nudzodzro aɖeke dzi wɔ ge o.
16 But I am saying, walk by the Spirit and you shall not fulfill the desire of flesh.
17 Elabena ŋutilã la ƒe nudzodzro tsia tsitre ɖe gbɔgbɔ la ŋu, eye gbɔgbɔ la ɖe ŋutilã la ŋu; nu siawo tsia tsitre ɖe wo nɔewo ŋu, ale be miagawɔ nu siwo tututu miadi be yewoawɔ hafi la o.
17 For the flesh feels desire against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh; for these two are opposed to each other in order that you may not do whatever you wish.
18 Azɔ hã, ne gbɔgbɔ lae le mia kplɔm la, ekema miele se la te o.
18 But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law.

19 Ŋutilã la ƒe dɔwɔwɔwo dze ƒãa keŋ, eye woawoe nye gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu, makɔmakɔnyenye, ŋukpenanuwɔwɔ dzimesesẽtɔe, 20 trɔ̃subɔsubɔ, gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ, kewɔwɔ, dzrewɔwɔ, ŋuʋaʋã, dɔmedzoedodowo, nyahehewo, mamawo, kɔmamawo, 21 ŋubiabiã, ahamumu, aglotutu siwo gbɔ eme kple nu siawo tɔgbi. Mele nu xlɔ̃m mi ku ɖe nu siawo ŋu do ŋgɔ, abe ale si mexlɔ̃ nu mi xoxo ene be, ame siwo wɔa nu siawo la, womanyi Mawu Fiaɖuƒe la dome o.

19 And the activities of the flesh are plain, which are unchastity, nastiness, indecency, 20 idolatry, witchcraft, hatreds, quarreling, jealousy, fits of passion, schemes of church politics, factions, dissensions, 21 envying, getting drunk, wild parties, and things similar to these; as to which I forewarn you, just as I did, that those who do such things will not inherit the Reign of God.
22 Ke gbɔgbɔ la ƒe kutsetse ye nye lɔlɔ̃, dzidzɔ, ŋutifafa, dzigbɔgbɔ blewu, dɔmenyonyo, nyuiwɔwɔ, xɔse, 23 tufafa, ɖokuidziɖuɖu.
22 But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faith, 23 meekness, self-mastery; against such things there is no law.
24 Azɔ hã, ame siwo nye Kristo Yesu tɔ la he ŋutilã kpakple eƒe dzodzrowo kple didiwo ɖe ati ŋu.
24 And those who belong to Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh with its susceptibilities and desires.
25 Ne gbɔgbɔ nue míele agbe nɔm ɖo la, ekema mina míayi edzi azɔ ɖe ɖoɖo nu le gbɔgbɔ me hã. 26 Migana míanɔ bubu dzodzro dim, anɔ ho ʋlim kple mía nɔewo, ahanɔ ŋu biãm mía nɔewo o.
25 If we are alive by the Spirit, let us guide ourselves by the Spirit; 26 let us not grow pretentious, challenging each other, envying each other.
Galatiatɔwo
Galatians
6 Nɔviwo, ne ame aɖe ɖe afɔ baɖa aɖe hafi va nya gɔ̃ hã la, mi ame siwo dze le gbɔgbɔ me la, midze agbagba miaɖɔ amea ɖo le gbɔgbɔ fatu me. Ke nɔ ɖokuiwò dzi kpɔm nyuie be woagate wò ŋutɔ hã kpɔ o.
6 Brothers, if a person does get swept into some offense, straighten him out, you spiritual ones, in the spirit of meekness, having an eye to yourself for fear you too should be tempted.
2 Miyi edzi miakpe ɖe mia nɔewo ŋu le miaƒe agba kpekpewo tsɔtsɔ me, ale miawɔ Kristo la ƒe se la dzi bliboe.
2 Carry each other’s burdens, and so you will fulfill Christ’s law.
3 Elabena ne ame aɖe susuna be yenye nane, evɔ menye naneke o la, eɖokui ko blem wòle.
3 For if one thinks he is something when he is nothing, he is deluding himself.
4 Ke ame sia ame nadzro eya ŋutɔ ƒe nuwɔnawo me kpɔ, ekema akpɔ susu si ta wòatso aseye le eya ŋutɔ ɖokui ɖeɖe ŋu, ke menye le eɖokui tsɔtsɔ sɔ kple ame bubu me o.
4 But let each test his own work, and then he will have his boast with regard to himself alone and not to the other man; 5 for each will be carrying his own pack.
5 Elabena ame sia ame atsɔ eya ŋutɔ ƒe agba. 6 Ame sia ame si wofia nya lae la, nekpɔ gome kple ame si fiae la le nu nyuiwo katã me.
6 But let him who receives instruction in the word share everything good with his instructor.

7 Migana woable mi o: Mawu menye ame si woate ŋu aflu o. Elabena nu si ame ƒãna la, esia kee wòaŋe; 8 elabena ame si le nu ƒãm na eƒe ŋutilã la, aŋe gbegblẽ tso eƒe ŋutilã me, ke ame si le nu ƒãm na gbɔgbɔ la, aŋe agbe mavɔ tso gbɔgbɔ la me.

7 Make no mistake, there is no thumbing your nose at God; for a man will reap just the same that he sows, 8 because he who sows into his own flesh will reap out of the flesh decay, but who sows into the Spirit shall reap out of the Spirit eternal life.
9 Eya ta migana míadzudzɔ nu si nyo la wɔwɔ o, elabena ne ɖeɖi mete mía ŋu o la, míaŋe nu le ɣeyiɣi si sɔ la dzi.
9 And let us not give up doing what is good, for at the right time reap we shall if we do not weaken.
10 Eya ta zi ale si mɔnukpɔkpɔa kpɔtɔ li la, mina míawɔ nyui na amewo katã, ke vevietɔ na ame siwo do ƒome kpli mí le xɔse la me.
10 So then let us, as we have opportunity, practice good deeds toward everybody, and especially toward the members of our family of faith.
11 Mikpɔ ale si nye ŋutɔ metsɔ nye asi ŋlɔ nya siawo wòloloe na mi la ɖa!
11 See in what large letters I am writing to you with my own hand.

12 Ame siwo katã dina be yewoadze amewo ŋu le ŋutilã me la, woawoe le agbagba dzem be yewoazi mia dzi miatso aʋa, ke wowɔa esia ne woagati wo yome le Kristo ƒe fuwɔameti la ta o. 13 Elabena ame siwo wole aʋa tsom na la ŋutɔ gɔ̃ hã mele Se la dzi wɔm o, ke wole didim be miatso aʋa be yewoate ŋu aƒo adegbe le miaƒe ŋutilãwo ŋuti.

12 It is such as want to make a fine appearance in flesh that are compelling you to get circumcised, only in order that for the Christ’s cross they may not be persecuted; 13 for those who get circumcised do not themselves keep the law either, but they want you to be circumcised in order that they may boast over your flesh.
14 Ke nye ya nyemedi be maƒo adegbe o, negbe le mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe fuwɔameti la ŋuti ko, ame si dzi woto he xexea ɖe ati ŋu nam, eye wohe nye hã ɖe ati ŋu na xexea.
14 But far be it from me to boast over anything but the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which I have the world crucified to me and myself to the world.

15 Elabena aʋatsotso menye naneke o, eye aʋamatsomatso hã menye naneke o, ke boŋ nuwɔwɔ yeye lae le vevie. 16 Ke ame siwo katã azɔ le agbenɔnɔ ƒe ɖoɖo sia nu la, ŋutifafa kple nublanuikpɔkpɔ nanɔ wo dzi, ɛ̃, nanɔ Mawu ƒe Israel la dzi.

15 For neither circumcision nor uncircumcision amounts to anything, but only new creation; 16 and as many as shall guide themselves by this standard, peace be upon them, and mercy, and upon God’s Israel.
17 Tso esia dzi la, ame aɖeke megaɖe fu nam azɔ o, elabena dzesidewo le nye ŋutilã ŋu abe Yesu ƒe kluvi ene.
17 Hereafter let nobody make me trouble; for I carry Jesus’s brand on my body.
18 Nɔviwo, mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe amenuveve nanɔ anyi kple gbɔgbɔ si mieɖena fiana la. Amen.
18 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirits, brothers; amen.
Efesotɔwo
Ephesians
1 Paulo, Kristo Yesu ƒe apostolo to Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu me, le esia ŋlɔm na ame kɔkɔe siwo le Efeso, siwo nye nuteƒewɔlawo le ɖekawɔwɔ me kple Kristo Yesu:
1 Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through God’s will, to God’s people at Ephesus, believers in Christ Jesus: 2 grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

2 Amenuveve kple ŋutifafa si tso Mawu, mía Fofo, kple Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo gbɔ la, woana mi. 3 Woakafu mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe Mawu, si nye Fofoa, elabena etsɔ gbɔgbɔmeyayra ɖe sia ɖe si le dziƒonutowo me yra mí le Kristo me, 4 etia mí be míawɔ ɖeka kple Kristo do ŋgɔ na xexea ƒe gɔmeɖoanyiɣi, ale be míanye ame kɔkɔe siwo ŋu mokaka aɖeke mele le eŋkume o le lɔlɔ̃ me. 5 Elabena eɖoe ɖi do ŋgɔ be yeaxɔ mí abe ye ŋutɔ ye viwo ene to Yesu Kristo dzi, le eya ŋutɔ ƒe didi kple lɔlɔ̃nu nu, 6 ne woakafu eƒe ŋutikɔkɔe ƒe amenuveve si wòlɔ̃ faa tsɔ ve mía nu to via lɔlɔ̃a dzi. 7 To via dzi la míekpɔ ablɔɖe, esi wòto eya amea ƒe ʋu dzi xe mía tafe, ɛ̃, be woatsɔ míaƒe vodadawo ake mí le eƒe amenuveve geɖe la nu. 8 Ena amenuveve sɔ gbɔ na mí le nunya kple gɔmesese ɖe sia ɖe me, 9 esi wòna míenya eƒe lɔlɔ̃nu le nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe la ŋu.

3 Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly sphere in Christ, 4 as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world that we should be holy and unblemished before him, 5 foreordaining us in love to adoption through Jesus Christ into himself according to the pleasure of his will, 6 to the praise of the glory of his grace with which he graced us in the Loved One! 7 in whom we have redemption through his blood, the pardon of offenses as befits the wealth of his grace 8 which he has made to superabound toward us, 9 making known to us in all good sense and wisdom the secret of his will as was his pleasure which he planned to realize in him 10 for the arrangement of all that fills time, to sum up everything in the Christ, what is in the heavens and what is on earth;

Nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe sia wɔ ɖeka kple tame si wòɖo ɖi le eya ŋutɔ ƒe didi nu, 10 be woakpɔ nuwo gbɔ ne ɣeyiɣi ɖoɖiawo de keŋ, ale be wòaƒo nuwo katã nu ƒu ɖekae le Kristo la me, nu siwo le dziƒowo kple nu siwo le anyigba dzi. Ɛ̃, le eya amea me; 11 eya, ame si míewɔ ɖeka kplii, eye wotia mí be míanye domenyilawo hã kpakplii, esi ame si wɔa nuwo katã ɖe eƒe tameɖoɖo nu la ɖo mía tiatia ɖi do ŋgɔ le eƒe lɔlɔ̃nu la nu, 12 ale be mí ame siwo si mɔkpɔkpɔ le le Kristo me gbã la, míasubɔ hena eƒe ŋutikɔkɔe kple kafukafu. 13 Ke esime miese nyateƒenya, si nye mia xɔxɔ ŋuti nya nyui la vɔ megbe la, mɔkpɔkpɔ su miawo hã mia si le eya amea me.

11 In him in whom we received our allotment too, foreordained to it in accordance with the purpose of him who works in everything according to the planning of his will, 12 that we should be for the praise of his glory, we who had set our anticipatory hope on the Christ; 13 in whom you too, having heard the word of the truth, the gospel of your salvation, in whom having believed too, you were sealed with the holy Spirit of the promise, 14 which is the first installment of our inheritance, for redemption for preservation, to the praise of his glory.

Mele mia ŋkɔ yɔyɔ dzi le nye gbedodoɖawo me, 17 be mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe Mawu, si nye ŋutikɔkɔe Fofo la, nana nunya ƒe gbɔgbɔ mi be miate ŋu ase eŋuti sidzedze vavãtɔ si wòɖe fia la gɔme nyuie. 18 Ena miaƒe dzi me ŋkuwo dzi kɔ, ne mianya mɔkpɔkpɔ si gbɔ wòyɔ mi vɛ, ne mianya ŋutikɔkɔe ƒe kesinɔnu siwo wòdzra ɖo ɖi be wòanye domenyinu na ame kɔkɔewo, 19 kple ale si gbegbe eƒe ŋusẽ ƒe gãnyenye ƒo nu sia nu ta sãsãsã na mí xɔsetɔwo. Gãnyenye sia dzena le ale si wòwɔa eƒe ŋusẽ triakɔ la ŋu dɔe me, 20 ewɔ esia esi wòfɔ Kristo la ɖe tsitre tso ame kukuwo dome, eye wòna wòbɔbɔ nɔ eƒe ɖusime le dziƒonutowo me, 21 wòƒo dziɖuɖuwo kple gãnyenye kple ŋusẽ kple aƒetɔnyenye katã kpakple ŋkɔ sia ŋkɔ si woyɔna la ta sãsãsã, menye le nuɖoanyi sia ɖeɖe ko me o, ke le esi ava va la hã me. 22 Etsɔ nuwo katã de eƒe afɔ te hã, eye wòɖoe tatɔ ɖe nuwo katã dzi na hame la, 23 si nye eƒe ŋutilã, eye eya amea yɔa nuwo katã bliboe le nu sia nu me.

15 Because of this I on my part, hearing of what there is among you of faith in the Lord Jesus and love toward all God’s people, 16 never cease to give thanks for you as I make mention of you in my prayers, 17 that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of Glory, may give you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in awareness of him, 18 your heart’s eyes lighted up so that you shall know what is the hope of his call, what the wealth of glory of his inheritance among his people, 19 and what the supreme greatness of his power toward us believers, the like of that exertion of the mightiness of his strength 20 which he has put forth in the case of the Christ, raising him from the dead and seating him at his right hand in the heavenly sphere, 21 up above every government and dominion and power and lordship and every name that is named not only in this world but also in the world to come; 22 and he subjected everything under his feet and gave him as head over everything to the church, 23 which is his body, the fullness of him who fills everything in everything.
Efesotɔwo
Ephesians

2 Azɔ hã, Mawu gbɔ agbe mi togbɔ be mienye ame kukuwo le miaƒe dzidadawo kple nu vɔ̃wo me tsã hã, 2 esiwo me miezɔna le tsã le xexe sia ƒe nuɖoanyi la nu, le yameŋusẽ ƒe fia, si nye gbɔgbɔ si le dɔ wɔm le vi sẽtowo me fifia la, ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu nu. 3 Ɛ̃, mí katã míenɔ agbe le wo dome tsã le míaƒe ŋutilã ƒe nudzodzrowo nu, eye míewɔa ŋutilã la kple tamesusuwo ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu, eye tsã la, míenye vi siwo dzi Mawu ƒe dziku nɔ tso dzɔdzɔme abe ame susɔeawo ke ene.

2 And you, when you were dead by offenses and by your sins 2 in which you once took your way to suit the times of this world, as suits the ruler of the dominion of air, of the spirit that is now at work in the sons of disobedience; 3 among whom we too, all of us, once lived our life in the desires of our flesh, doing the things willed by the flesh and the mind, and were by nature objects of anger the same as the rest.

4 Ke Mawu ƒe nublanuikpɔkpɔ sɔ gbɔ, eye le lɔlɔ̃ gã si le esi na mí ta la, 5 togbɔ be míeku le dzidadawo me hã la, egbɔ agbe mí kpe ɖe Kristo ŋu amenuvevee wotsɔ ɖe mi. 6 Gawu la, efɔ mí ɖe tsitre kpakplii eye wòna míebɔbɔ nɔ dziƒonutowo me kpakple Kristo Yesu, 7 ale be le nuɖoanyi siwo gbɔna me la, wòaɖe eƒe amenuveve geɖe si ƒo nu sia nu ta sãsãsã la afia le eƒe dɔmekɔkɔ ɖe mía ŋu me, mí ame siwo wɔ ɖeka kple Kristo Yesu.

4 But God, being rich in pity, because of his great love with which he loved us 5 brought us to life together with the Christ when we were dead by offenses it is by grace you are saved 6 and raised us together with him and seated us together with him in the heavenly sphere, in Christ Jesus, 7 in order that in the ages that are coming on he might show the surpassing wealth of his grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus.
8 Amenuveve sia dzie wonɔ te ɖo ɖe mi to xɔse me; eye menye miawo ŋutɔwo gbɔe wòtso o; ke boŋ Mawu ƒe nunanae. 9 Ao, menye dɔwɔwɔwo tae o, ale be ame aɖeke nagatsɔ naneke aƒo adegbe o.
8 For it is by grace you are saved through faith; and not out of yourselves either God’s is the gift; 9 not on a basis of deeds, lest somebody should boast.
10 Mawu ƒe asinudɔwɔwɔe míenye eye wòwɔ mí míewɔ ɖeka kple Kristo Yesu hena dɔ nyui siwo Mawu dzra ɖo ɖi do ŋgɔ na mí be míazɔ le wo me la wɔwɔ.
10 For we are his making, created in Christ Jesus with a view to good deeds which God made ready beforehand so that we might occupy ourselves in them.

11 Eya ta nenɔ susu me na mi be, ame siwo amewo tsɔ asi tso aʋa na, siwo woyɔna tsã be "aʋatsotsotɔwo " la, yɔa mi ame siwo nye dukɔwo me tɔwo le ŋutilã nu la be "aʋamatsomatsotɔwo. " 12 Mienya Kristo ɣemaɣi o, eye mienɔ adzɔge na Israel dukɔa, mienye ame tutɔwo na ŋugbedodo la ƒe nubablaawo; mɔkpɔkpɔ aɖeke menɔ mia si o, eye mienɔ xexea me evɔ mienya Mawu o. 13 Ke mi ame siwo nɔ adzɔge ʋĩi tsã la, mieto Kristo la ƒe ʋu la dzi te va azɔ heva wɔ ɖeka kple Kristo Yesu.

11 For which reason be mindful that once upon a time you, the foreigners in flesh, you who are called "uncircumcision " by the so-called "circumcision, " artificial, in flesh, 12 that at that time, away from Christ, you were cut off by unrelation from citizenship in Israel and were strangers to the covenants of the promise, hopeless and godless in the world; 13 but now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off have by the Christ’s blood come to be nearby.

14 Elabena eyae nye míaƒe ŋutifafa, eya ame si na ƒuƒoƒo eveawo va zu ɖeka, eye wòmu gli si ma wo dome la ɖa. 15 Eto eƒe ŋutilã dzi ɖe fuléle la, si nye Se si me sededewo kple ɖoɖowo le la ɖa, be wòana ƒuƒoƒo eveawo nazu ame yeye ɖeka, ne woawɔ ɖeka kplii ahawɔ ŋutifafa, 16 eye wòadzra dukɔ eveawo dome ɖo ahana woazu ŋutilã ɖeka na Mawu to fuwɔameti la dzi, elabena eɖe fuléle la ɖa to eƒe ku dzi. 17 Eye wòva gblɔ ŋutifafa nya nyui la na mi ame siwo le adzɔge ʋĩi, kple ŋutifafa na ame siwo le kpuiƒe hã, 18 elabena to eya dzie mí dukɔ eveawo siaa míetena ɖe Fofo la ŋu faa le gbɔgbɔ ɖeka me.

14 For he is our peace, he who made both one and broke away the fencing-off party-wall, 15 the enmity, in his flesh, superseding the law of commandments in decree form in order to create the two in himself into one new man, making peace, 16 and to reconcile both to God in one body through the cross, killing the enmity on it; 17 and he came bringing good news of peace to you who were far away and peace to those who were nearby, 18 because through him we both of us have our presentation to the Father in one Spirit.

19 Eya ta mieganye ame tutɔwo kple amedzrowo o, ke boŋ mia kple ame kɔkɔewo mienye dukɔ ɖeka me viwo kple Mawu ƒe aƒe la me tɔwo, 20 wotu mi ɖe apostoloawo kple nyagblɔɖilawo ƒe gɔmeɖoanyi dzi, eye Kristo Yesu ŋutɔe nye gɔmeɖoanyia ƒe dzogoedzikpe la. 21 Eya mee wotu xɔ blibo la kpe ɖo ɖekae le wòle dzi dem be wòazu gbedoxɔ kɔkɔe na Yehowa. 22 Le eya amea me la, wole miawo hã tum ɖekae be miazu nɔƒe si Mawu anɔ to eƒe gbɔgbɔ la dzi.

19 So then you are not strangers in an immigrant status any longer, but you are fellow-citizens of God’s people and members of God’s family, 20 built in on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, the cornerstone being Christ Jesus himself, 21 in whom all the work of the building is being so fitted that it grows into a holy temple in the Lord; 22 in whom you too are being built together in the Spirit into a home of God.
Efesotɔwo
Ephesians

4 Eya ta ne miexlẽ nya sia la, miate ŋu anya gɔmesese si su asinye le Kristo la ƒe nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe la ŋu. 5 Womena amegbetɔviwo nya nya ɣaɣla sia le dzidzime tsãtɔwo me, abe ale si woto gbɔgbɔ la dzi ɖee fia eƒe apostolo kɔkɔeawo kple nyagblɔɖilawo fifia ene o, 6 be dukɔwo me tɔwo nazu hati domenyilawo, woazu ŋutilã ɖeka ƒe ŋutinuwo, eye woazu gomekpɔlawo kpli mí le ŋugbedodo la me le ɖekawɔwɔ me kple Kristo Yesu, to nya nyui la dzi.

3 On this account I, Paul, Christ Jesus’s man in prison for you foreigners 2 if you heard of the bestowal of that grace of God’s which was given me for you: 3 it was by way of revelation that the secret was made known to me, as I wrote in brief above, 4 by which as you read you can sense my insight into the secret of the Christ, 5 which in other generations was not made known to the sons of men as it has now been spiritually revealed to his holy apostles and prophets, 6 the nations’ being co-heirs and concorporate and co-sharers of the promise in Christ Jesus through the gospel, 7 of which I became an agent in consequence of the gift of that grace of God’s which was given me in accordance with the working of his power.

7 Mezu esia ŋuti subɔla le Mawu ƒe amenuveve ƒe nunana faa si wonam le eƒe ŋusẽ ƒe dɔwɔwɔ nu la nu. 8 Nye, ame si le sue wu ame kɔkɔewo katã ƒe suetɔ la nue wove alea be magblɔ Kristo la ƒe kesinɔnu gbogbo manyaxlẽawo ŋuti nya nyui la na dukɔwo, 9 eye mana amewo nakpɔ ale si wole nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe la ŋuti dɔ wɔmee, nya si le ɣaɣla tso blemablema ɖe Mawu ame si wɔ nuwo katã la me. 10 Wowɔ esia, ale be to hame la dzi woana dziɖuɖu kple ŋusẽtɔ siwo le dziƒonutowo me la nanya Mawu ƒe nunya si dze le mɔ vovovoawo nu la. 11 Wowɔ esia le tame mavɔ, si wòɖo to mía Aƒetɔ Yesu, si nye Kristo la, dzi la nu, 12 ame si na míeƒoa nu faa alea, eye esi míexɔ edzi se ta la, dzi ɖoa mía ƒo míetena ɖe eŋu faa. 13 Le esia ta mele biabiam tso mia si be migana xaxa siwo me tom mele le mia ta la naɖe dzi le mia ƒo o, elabena esia ahe bubu vɛ na mi. 14 Le esia ta medzea klo na Fofo la, 15 ame si gbɔ ƒome sia ƒome, si le dziƒo kple anyigba dzi la kpɔ eƒe ŋkɔ tsoe.

8 I, the least fit of all God’s people, was given this grace, to bring the nations the gospel of the Christ’s unfathomable richness 9 and to bring into the light what is the system followed with the secret that has from eternity been hidden in God, who created everything, 10 in order that God’s many-sided wisdom might now through the church be made known to the governments and dominions in the heavenly sphere 11 in accordance with the eternal purpose he framed in the Christ our Lord Jesus, 12 in whom we have boldness and the privilege of entering with assurance through faith in him; 13 for which reason I ask you not to give in at my distresses for you, which are your glory.

16 Eye nye gbedodoɖae nye be wòato ŋusẽ si eƒe gbɔgbɔ nana la dzi ana miasẽ ŋu le ame si mienye le ememe la gome, le eƒe ŋutikɔkɔe geɖe la nu, 17 ne miato miaƒe xɔse dzi ana Kristo la naxɔ anyinɔ le miaƒe dziwo me le lɔlɔ̃ me. Ne miaƒo ke ɖe to ali ke sesĩe ɖe gɔmeɖoanyi la dzi, 18 ale be mia kple ame kɔkɔeawo katã miate ŋu ase nyateƒea ƒe kekeme kple didime kple kɔkɔme kpakple goglome gɔme tsitotsito, 19 eye miadze si Kristo la ƒe lɔlɔ̃ si de ŋgɔ sãsãsã wu sidzedze, ale be miagba go le blibonyenye si Mawu nana la me fũu.

14 On this account I bend my knees to the Father 15 from whom every father’s family in heaven and on earth takes its name 16 that he may grant to you, in accordance with the richness of his glory, to be strengthened in the inward man with power through his Spirit; 17 to have Christ fix his home in your hearts through faith; with your roots and foundations set fast in love, 18 that you may be enabled to perceive with all God’s people what is the breadth and length and height and depth 19 and to know the Christ’s unknowable love, that you may be filled to all God’s fullness.

20 Ke ame si ate ŋu awɔ nu siwo míebiana alo nu siwo vaa míaƒe susu me la na mí wòagbɔ eŋu sãsãsã le eƒe ŋusẽ si le dɔ wɔm le mía me nu la, 21 eya tɔ nanye ŋutikɔkɔe to hame la kple Kristo Yesu dzi na dzidzimewo katã, tso mavɔ me yi mavɔ me. Amen.

20 And to him who can do more than everything beyond the utmost limit of what we ask for or conceive of, in accordance with the power that is at work in us, 21 to him be glory in the church and in Christ Jesus to all the generations of endless time; amen.
Efesotɔwo
Ephesians

4 Eya ta nye, ame si le ga me le Aƒetɔ la ta, mele kuku ɖem na mi vevie be miazɔ ale si dze mia yɔyɔ la, 2 le ɖokuibɔbɔ kple tufafa blibo me, le dzigbɔgbɔ blewu me, eye miado dzi anɔ anyi kple mia nɔewo le lɔlɔ̃ me, 3 eye midze agbagba vevie mialé gbɔgbɔ la ƒe ɖekanyenye me ɖe asi le ŋutifafa ƒe nublanu la me.

4 So I, the prisoner in the Lord, urge you to walk in a fashion worthy of the call that was given you, 2 with all humility and meekness, patiently putting up with each other in love, 3 making a point of safeguarding the oneness of the Spirit in the tie of peace.

4 Ŋutilã ɖeka kple gbɔgbɔ ɖekae li, abe ale si ko woyɔ mi va mɔkpɔkpɔ ɖeka si ta woyɔ mi ɖo la gbɔ ene; 5 Aƒetɔ ɖeka, xɔse ɖeka, nyɔnyrɔxɔxɔ ɖeka; 6 Mawu ɖeka, si nye amewo katã Fofo, ame si le amewo katã nu, ame si wɔa dɔ to amewo katã dzi, eye wòwɔnɛ le amewo katã me.
4 One body and one Spirit, as you were called in one hope too that belongs to your call; 5 one Lord, one faith, one baptism; 6 one God and Father of all, he who is over all and among all and in all.

7 Ke wove mía dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe nu le Kristo la ƒe nunana faa si wòdzidze na mí la nu. 8 Elabena egblɔ be: "Esi wòlia yi dzi ʋĩi la, ekplɔ aboyomewo yii; ena nunana siwo nye amewo. " 9 Ke nu ka fiam nya si nye "wòlia yi dzi " la le, ne menye be eɖi va anyi me hã, si nye anyigba dzi oa? 10 Ame si tututu ɖi va la kee lia yi dzi ʋĩi wògbɔ dziƒowo ƒe dziƒo ŋu, ale be wòana nuwo katã nazu blibo. 11 Eye wòna ame aɖewo wonye apostolowo, ɖewo nye nyagblɔɖilawo, ɖewo nye nyanyuigblɔlawo, eye ɖewo nye alẽkplɔlawo kple nufialawo, 12 kple susu be woana hehe ame kɔkɔewo hena subɔsubɔdɔ wɔwɔ, na Kristo la ƒe ŋutilã tutu ɖo, 13 va se ɖe esime mí katã míaɖo xɔse ƒe ɖekanyenye gbɔ, eye míaɖo Mawu ƒe Vi la ŋuti sidzedze vavãtɔ gbɔ azu ame siwo tsi blibo ahaɖo tsitsime blibo si gbɔ Kristo ɖo la gbɔ; 14 ale be míaganye ɖeviwo ne nufiafia ƒe ya sia ya si ƒona yina gbɔna la nanɔ mía nyamam abe ƒutsotsoewo ene, to amewo ƒe beble kple amefuflu ayetɔe me o. 15 Ke boŋ mina míato nyateƒe, ale be míato lɔlɔ̃ me atsi le nuwo katã me le Kristo, si nye ta la me. 16 Eya gbɔe wòtso be wokpe ŋutilã blibo la ɖekae pɛpɛpɛ, eye wona wòle dɔ wɔm ɖekae esi eƒe kpeƒekpeƒewo katã le woƒe akpa dzi wɔm. Ne ŋutinu ɖe sia ɖe wɔa eƒe dɔ nyuie la, ewɔnɛ be ŋutilã la tsina le esi wòtua eɖokui ɖo le lɔlɔ̃ me ta.

7 But each one of us had grace given him in the measure of the Christ’s gift; 8 which is why it says "he went up on high, brought a train of captives, gave presents to men. " 9 And what does "went up " mean if not that he also came down to the lower parts, of the earth? 10 He who came down, he is the one also who went up clear above all the heavens so that he should fill everything; 11 and he gave some to be apostles and some to be prophets and some to be preachers of the gospel and some to be pastors and teachers 12 for the sound training of God’s people, for the work of service for the upbuilding of the Christ’s body, 13 until all of us attain to the oneness of the faith and of awareness of the Son of God, to a grown-up man to the measure of the adulthood of the fullness of the Christ, 14 in order that we may no longer be infants, tossed and driven about by every wind of doctrine in men’s jugglery of tricks governed by the devices of error, 15 but, telling truth in love, may every way grow up into him, him who is the head, Christ, 16 out of whom all the body, fitted together and conjoined by every joint which connects the supply, in accordance with the working of each individual part in measure, produces the growth of the body to its self-upbuilding in love.

17 Eya ta nya si gblɔm mele hele ɖase ɖim le eŋu le Aƒetɔ la ƒe ŋkɔ mee nye be, miagayi edzi anɔ zɔzɔm abe ale si dukɔwo hã zɔna le woƒe tamesusu gbɔlowo me la ene o. 18 Woƒe tamesusu do viviti, eye wole adzɔge na agbe si tso Mawu gbɔ, le esi numanyamanya xɔ aƒe ɖe wo me, eye woƒe dzi ku atri hã ta. 19 Naneke megakpea ŋu na wo o, eye woɖe asi le wo ɖokuiwo ŋu na ŋukpenanuwɔwɔ dzimesesẽtɔe, ale be woanɔ nu makɔmakɔ ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi wɔwɔ dzi kɔmaɖimaɖii.

17 So this I say and protest in the Lord, that you are no longer to go the same way as the heathen do in their fatuousness of mind, 18 darkened in their thinking as they are, cut off by unrelation from God’s life because of the ignorance they have in them because of their lumpish-heartedness men who, 19 having lost all sensitiveness, have given themselves up to indecency to work at every sort of foulness as a competitive business.

20 Ke miawo la, menye alea miesrɔ̃e be Kristo la le o, 21 ne vavãe miese eŋu nya, eye woto edzi fia nu mi, abe ale si nyateƒe la le Yesu me ene. 22 Wofia nu mi be miaɖe amenyenye xoxo si sɔ ɖe miaƒe agbenɔnɔ tsãtɔ nu, si le gbegblẽm le eƒe nudzodzro fluamewo nu, la ɖa. 23 Ke minɔ miaƒe tamesusu ƒe nɔnɔme si kpɔa ŋusẽ ɖe mia dzi wɔm yeyee, 24 eye miado amenyenye yeye si wowɔ le Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu nu le dzɔdzɔenyenye kple nuteƒewɔwɔ vavãtɔ me la.

20 But it was not in that fashion that you learned the Christ; 21 not if you heard of him and were taught in him as is truth in Jesus, 22 that as regards your former way of life you are to throw off the old man who is going bad along the line of the desires he is fooled into, 23 and be renewed in the spirit of your mind 24 and put on the new man who along God’s line has been created in the righteousness and godliness of truth.

30 Eye miganɔ nuxaxa dom na Mawu ƒe gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe, si wotsɔ tre mia nu hena ŋkeke si dzi woato tafe la dzi aɖe mi la o. 31 Miɖe ameléleɖedɔme kaɖikaɖi, dɔmedzoe, dziku, ɣlidodo, kple nya veame ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi ɖa le mia dome hekpe ɖe nu sia nu si gblẽa nu le ame ŋu la ŋuti. 32 Ke boŋ minyo dɔme na mia nɔewo, miaƒe dɔme netrɔ ɖe mia nɔewo ŋu vevie, eye mitsɔ nɔ mia nɔewo kem faa, abe ale si ko Mawu hã to Kristo dzi tsɔ ke mi faa ene.

25 For which reason, laying aside falsehood, each speak truth with his neighbor, because we are organs of each other; 26 "be angry and do not sin, " let the sun not go down on your exasperation, 27 and do not give the Devil a chance; 28 let him who has been stealing no longer steal but rather labor, putting his hands to work at what is good, in order to have something he can share with the one who is in need; 29 let no foul talk go out of your mouths, but any that is good, tending to the required upbuilding, to impart grace to the hearers, 30 and do not grieve God’s Holy Spirit in which you have had the seal set on you to be ready for the day of redemption; 31 let all crossness and passionateness and anger and loud and abusive language be cleared away from you, with all viciousness, 32 and be kind to each other, good-hearted, mutually making allowances in the same way as God in Christ showed grace to you.
Efesotɔwo
Ephesians

5 Eya ta mizu Mawu srɔ̃lawo abe via lɔlɔ̃awo ene, 2 eye miyi edzi miazɔ le lɔlɔ̃ me, abe ale si ko Kristo la hã lɔ̃ mí, eye wòtsɔ eɖokui na ɖe mía ta wònye nunana kple vɔsa si le ʋeʋẽm lilili na Mawu la ene.
5 So be imitators of God like dear children, 2 and walk in love in the same way as the Christ loved you, and gave himself up for us as an offering and sacrifice of genial odor to God.

3 Migana woayɔ gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu kple makɔmakɔnyenye aɖeke ƒomevi alo ŋukeklẽ ŋkɔ gɔ̃ hã le mia dome o, abe ale si ko wòdze ame kɔkɔewo ene; 4 kple ŋukpenanuwɔwɔ kple bometsinyagbɔgblɔ kple fefenya madzeto, siwo mesɔ o, ke akpedada boŋ.

3 But let unchastity and any sort of uncleanness or grasping greed not be even named among you, as befits people of God’s; 4 and obscenity and foolery or ribaldry, which are not proper things; but rather, proper thankfulness.
5 Elabena miawo ŋutɔwo mienya nyuie be, domenyinyi aɖeke meli na ame si ƒoa eɖokui ɖe gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu me alo ame makɔmakɔ alo ŋuklẽla si sɔ kple trɔ̃subɔla le Kristo la kple Mawu ƒe Fiaɖuƒe la me o.
5 For know this well, that any unchaste or unclean person or greedy grasper, which is the same as to say idolater, does not have an inheritance coming to him in the reign of Christ and God.
6 Migana ame aɖeke natsɔ nya ƒuƒluwo able mi o, elabena nu siawo tae Mawu ƒe dziku gbɔna vi sẽtowo dzi ɖo.
6 Let nobody deceive you with empty words; for it is on account of these things that God’s anger comes upon the sons of disobedience, 7 so do not be sharers in them.
7 Eya ta migade ha kpli wo o; 8 elabena tsã la, mienye viviti, ke azɔ miezu kekeli le Aƒetɔ la me.
8 For you were once darkness, but are now light in the Lord.

10 Midze agbagba ɖe sia ɖe be nu siwo miewɔna la nadze Aƒetɔ la ŋu; 11 eye midzudzɔ gomekpɔkpɔ le viviti me dɔ matsekuwo me; ke miʋu go wo boŋ. 12 Elabena enye ŋukpe be woaƒo nu le nu siwo wowɔna le ɣaɣlaƒe la ŋu gɔ̃ hã.

Walk as children of light 9 (for the fruit of the light is in every goodness and righteousness and truth), 10 studying what is pleasing to the Lord; 11 and do not be a party to the unfruitful doings of the darkness rather even expose their character.

13 Ke nu sia nu si dzena wokpɔna la kekelie na, elabena nu sia nu si dze ƒãa la, enye kekeli. 14 Esia tae wogblɔ be: "Oo, wò ame si le alɔ̃ dɔm, nyɔ, eye nàfɔ tso ame kukuwo dome, eye Kristo la aklẽ ɖe dziwò. "

12 For it is ugly even to mention the things that are done in hiding by them; 13 but everything when it has its character exposed comes into view by the light; for everything that comes into view is light; 14 which is why it says "Wake, you sleeper, and rise from the dead, and the Christ shall beam upon you. "
15 Eya ta mikpɔ nyuie be ale si miezɔna la naganye abe numanyalawo ene o, ke boŋ abe nunyalawo ene, 16 eye miwɔ miaƒe ɣeyiɣi ŋu dɔ le mɔ nyuitɔ nu, elabena ŋkekeawo nye vɔ̃.
15 So look to it carefully how you walk, not as unwise but as wise, 16 making the best you can of the crisis, because the days are wicked.
17 Le esia ta miganɔ nu wɔm abe bometsilawo ene o, ke boŋ miyi edzi miakpɔ nu si nye Yehowa ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu adze sii.
17 For this reason do not be silly, but understand what the Lord’s will is.

18 Eye migamu aha, si me nu baɖabaɖa wɔwɔ le la o, ke boŋ mina gbɔgbɔ la nayɔ mi fũu. 19 Mitsɔ psalmowo, Mawu kafukafu nyawo kple gbɔgbɔmehawo ƒo nu na mia nɔewo, midzi ha, eye miƒo ha le miaƒe dziwo me na Yehowa, 20 eye minɔ akpe dam na mía Mawu kple Fofo la le nuwo katã ŋuti ɣesiaɣi le mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe ŋkɔ me. 21 Mibɔbɔ mia ɖokui na mia nɔewo le Kristo vɔvɔ̃ me. 22 Srɔ̃nyɔnuwo nabɔbɔ wo ɖokuiwo na wo srɔ̃wo, abe ale si woabɔbɔ na Aƒetɔ la ene, 23 elabena ŋutsue nye ta na srɔ̃a, abe ale si Kristo la hã nye ta na hame la ene, eye eyae nye ŋutilã sia ɖela.

18 And do not get stimulated with wine, which carries dissipation with it, but be filled by the Spirit, 19 talking together in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making music in your hearts to the Lord, 20 giving thanks always for everything in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to God the Father, 21 submissive to each other in the fear of Christ; 22 wives to their husbands as they are to the Lord, 23 because a husband is the wife’s head the same as the Christ is the church’s.
24 Le nyateƒe me la, ale si hame la bɔbɔa eɖokui na Kristo la, srɔ̃nyɔnuwo hã nabɔbɔ wo ɖokuiwo na wo srɔ̃wo nenema ke le nuwo katã me.
He is the savior of the body; 24 but as the church is submissive to the Christ, so let the wives also be to their husbands, in everything.

25 Srɔ̃ŋutsuwo, miyi edzi mialɔ̃ mia srɔ̃wo abe ale si ko Kristo la hã lɔ̃ hame la, eye wòtsɔ eɖokui na ɖe eta ene, 26 ale be wòakɔ eŋuti, aklɔ eŋu wòadza to Mawu ƒe nya la me, 27 be wòatsɔ hame la aɖo eya ŋutɔ ŋkume le eƒe atsyɔ̃ɖoɖo me, eye ɖiƒoƒo alo ayiléle alo nu siawo tɔgbi aɖeke manɔ eŋu o, ke boŋ wòanɔ kɔkɔe, eye mokaka aɖeke naganɔ eŋu o.

25 Husbands, love your wives, as the Christ in his case loved the church, and gave himself up for it 26 in order to hallow it, cleansing it by the bath of water with a word, 27 so that he might himself present the church to himself a glorious creature without a spot or a wrinkle or anything of the sort, but holy and flawless; 28 so ought husbands too to love their wives as they do their own bodies.

Ŋutsu si lɔ̃a srɔ̃a la lɔ̃a eɖokui, 29 elabena ame aɖeke melé fu eya ŋutɔ ƒe ŋutilã kpɔ o, ke boŋ enyinɛ, eye wòléa be nɛ nyuie, abe ale si ko Kristo la hã wɔna na hame la ene, 30 elabena ŋutinuwo míenye na eƒe ŋutilã.
He who loves his wife is loving himself; 29 for nobody ever hated his own flesh, but one feeds it up and keeps it warm, just as the Christ does with the church 30 because we are organs of his body.
31 "Esia tae ŋutsu agblẽ fofoa kple dadaa ɖi, eye wòaku ɖe srɔ̃a ŋu, eye wo ame evea woazu ŋutilã ɖeka. " 32 Nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe sia lolo. Ke Kristo kple hame la ŋue mele nu ƒom le.
31 "Owing to this a man will leave father and mother and enter into a connection with his wife, and the two will become one flesh "; 32 this secret truth is a great one.
33 Gake srɔ̃ŋutsu ɖe sia ɖe nalɔ̃ srɔ̃a abe ale si wòlɔ̃a eɖokui ene; ke srɔ̃nyɔnu hã nade bubu deto srɔ̃a ŋu.
I am saying it with reference to Christ and the church; 33 let each of you individually too, though, love his wife just as he does himself.
Efesotɔwo
Ephesians
6 Mi ɖeviwo, miɖo to mia dzilawo le Aƒetɔ la me, elabena esia le eteƒe.
6 Children, obey your parents in the Lord; for this is right.

2 "Bu fofowò kple dawò, " esia nye sedede gbãtɔ si ŋu ŋugbedodo kpe ɖo: 3 "Ne eme nanyo na wò, eye nànɔ anyigba la dzi eteƒe nadidi. " 4 Mi fofowo, miganɔ dziku dom na mia viwo o, ke boŋ miyi edzi mianɔ wo hem le Yehowa ƒe amehehe kple nuxɔxlɔ̃ me.

2 "Honor your father and mother, " which is the first commandment with a promise, 3 "so that it may be well with you and your time may be long on the earth. " 4 And fathers, do not be provoking to your children, but bring them up with the instruction and admonition of the Lord.

5 Kluviwo, mikɔ dzi me miaɖo to amegbetɔ siwo nye miaƒe aƒetɔwo le vɔvɔ̃ kple dzodzo nyanyanya me, abe ale si miawɔ na Kristo la ene, 6 menye le ameŋkumenuwɔwɔ me be miadze ame ŋu ko o, ke boŋ abe Kristo ƒe kluvi siwo wɔa Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu tso luʋɔ blibo me ene. 7 Miwɔ miaƒe kluvidɔ la kple lɔlɔ̃nu faa abe Yehowa ye miele ewɔm na ene, ke menye na amewo o, 8 elabena mienyae be nu nyui sia nu nyui si ame wɔna la, eya kee wòaxɔ tso Yehowa gbɔ, eɖanye kluvi alo ablɔɖeme o.

5 Servants, obey those who are your masters in the way of flesh with fear and trembling in single-heartedness as you do the Christ, 6 not in the way of eye-service as man-pleasers do but as servants of Christ’s, doing God’s will whole-souledly, 7 serving in a friendly spirit as doing it for the Lord and not for men, 8 knowing that each one, if he does anything good, will have it coming to him from the Lord, be he slave or freeman.
9 Eye mi aƒetɔwo hã, miyi edzi mianɔ nu wɔm ɖe wo ŋu nenema ke, eye midzudzɔ ŋɔdzidodo na wo, elabena mienyae be mia kpli wo siaa ƒe Aƒetɔ le dziƒo, eye ameŋkumekpɔkpɔ aɖeke mele egbɔ o.
9 And masters, do the same toward them, going easy as to threatening, knowing that in the heavens is the master of them and of you, and there is no favoritism with him.

10 Mlɔeba la, miyi edzi miasẽ ŋu ɖe edzi le Aƒetɔ la kple eƒe ŋusẽ triakɔ la me. 11 Mido aʋawɔnu blibo si tso Mawu gbɔ la, be miate ŋu anɔ te sesĩe ɖe Abosam ƒe aɖaŋu vɔ̃wo nu; 12 elabena míele kame tem, menye kple ʋu kpakple ŋutilã o, ke boŋ mía kple dziɖuɖuwo, ŋusẽwo, xexe doviviti sia me dziɖulawo kple gbɔgbɔmeŋusẽ vɔ̃ɖi siwo le dziƒonutowo me lae le kame tem. 13 Le esia ta mido aʋawɔnu blibo si tso Mawu gbɔ la, ne miate ŋu anɔ te le ŋkeke vɔ̃ la dzi, eye ne miewu nuwo katã nu vɔ la, mianɔ tsitre sesĩe.

10 Henceforth be valiant in the Lord and in the mightiness of his strength; 11 put on God’s armor so that you can stand up to the Devil’s devices, 12 because our match is not with flesh and blood but with the governments, the dominions, the cosmocrats of this darkness, the spiritual essences of wickedness in the heavenly sphere; 13 for this reason take God’s armor in order to be able to defend yourselves on the wicked day, and after you have fought every bit through to stand your ground.

14 Eya ta minɔ tsitre sesĩe, eye mitsɔ nyateƒe ƒe alidziblanu la bla miaƒe aliwo dzi, eye mido dzɔdzɔenyenye ƒe akɔtakpoxɔnu la, 15 eye mitsɔ dzadzraɖo ɖe ŋutifafa nya nyuia gbɔgblɔ ŋu do ɖe miaƒe afɔwo. 16 Gawu la, milé xɔse ƒe akpoxɔnu gã, si miatsɔ atsi vɔ̃ɖitɔ la ƒe aŋutrɔ bibiawo katã nu la ɖe asi.

14 So stand your ground with your waists belted with truth and wearing the cuirass of righteousness, 15 and with your feet shod with preparation for carrying the gospel of peace; 16 withal taking the shield of faith, on which you will be able to quench all the flaming missiles of the Evil One.

Eya ŋuti minɔ ŋudzɔ ɣeawokatãɣi ne mianɔ kokoƒoƒo dzi ɖe ame kɔkɔewo katã ta. 19 Mido gbe ɖa ɖe nye hã tanye, be ne meke nu la, mate ŋu aƒo nu faa dzideƒotɔe, ale be mana woanya nya nyui la ƒe nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe la, 20 nya nyui si ƒe amedɔdɔ menye hele kɔsɔkɔsɔwo me ɖo, ne dzi naɖo ƒonye maƒo nu tso eŋu abe ale si dze ene.

17 And receive the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is God’s word; 18 praying in the Spirit at every time with every kind of prayer and petition and keeping on the alert for it with all intentness and fullness of petition regarding all God’s people, 19 and for me, that I may be given power to speak with open mouth to make known outspokenly the secret 20 for which I am an ambassador in chains, that I may speak it out as I ought.

21 Ke be miawo hã mianya ale si nɔnɔmeawo le le gbɔnye, kple ale si mele la, nɔvi lɔlɔ̃tɔ Tikiko, si nye subɔla nuteƒewɔla le Aƒetɔ la me la, ana mianya nuwo katã. 22 Mele edɔm ɖe mia gbɔ le susu sia tututu ta, be mianya ale si míele ne wòafa akɔ na mi.

21 But in order that you may know of my affairs, how I am getting on, Tychicus, the dear brother and faithful errand-runner in the Lord, will acquaint you with everything; 22 I have sent him to you for this express purpose, to let you know about us and to let him cheer your hearts.
23 Ŋutifafa kple lɔlɔ̃, si ŋu xɔse kpe ɖo la, natso Mawu Fofo la kple Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo gbɔ na nɔviawo.
23 Peace to the brothers, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
24 Amenuveve nanɔ kple ame siwo katã si lɔlɔ̃ si nu metsina o le na mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo la.
24 Grace be with all who love our Lord Jesus Christ imperishably.
Kolosetɔwo
Colossians
1 Paulo, Kristo Yesu ƒe apostolo to Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu me, kple mía nɔvi Timoteo, 2 le esia ŋlɔm na ame kɔkɔewo kple nɔvi nuteƒewɔla siwo wɔ ɖeka kple Kristo le Kolose:
1 Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through God’s will, and Brother Timothy, 2 to the holy and believing brothers in Christ at Colossae: grace to you, and peace, from God our Father.

Amenuveve kple ŋutifafa si tso Mawu mía Fofo gbɔ la, woana mi. 3 Míedaa akpe na Mawu, mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo Fofo la, ɣesiaɣi ne míele gbe dom ɖa ɖe mia ta, 4 tso esime míese be miexɔ Kristo Yesu dzi se eye mielɔ̃a ame kɔkɔeawo katã 5 le mɔkpɔkpɔ si wodzra ɖo ɖi na mi le dziƒowo la ta. Mɔkpɔkpɔ sia ŋu nyae miese tsã esime woɖe gbeƒã nya nyui la ŋuti nyateƒea na mi 6 ale be wòva ɖo mia gbɔ. Ale si nya nyui la le ku tsem hele ta kekem le xexea me katã la, nenema ko wòle ta kekem le miawo hã mia dome, tso gbe si gbe miese Mawu ƒe amenuveve la ŋuti nya hekpɔe dze sii nyuie le nyateƒe me. 7 Nu siae miesrɔ̃ tso mía hati kluvi lɔlɔ̃tɔ Epafra, si nye Kristo la ƒe subɔla wɔnuteƒe le mía teƒe la gbɔ.

3 We always thank God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, as we pray for you, 4 hearing of your faith in Christ Jesus and the love you cherish to all God’s people 5 because of the hope laid up for you in the heavens, about which you have already heard in the words of the truth of the gospel 6 which has arrived among you as it also is in all the world, bearing fruit and growing as it does among you too since the day that you heard and recognized God’s grace in truth 7 as you learned from our dear fellow-servant Epaphras, who is on your behalf a faithful agent of the Christ, 8 who also informed us of your love in the Spirit.

8 Ame si gblɔ lɔlɔ̃ si gbɔgbɔ la na mieɖena fiana la hã ŋu nya na mí. 9 Esia hã tae tso gbe si gbe míesee la, míedzudzɔ gbedodoɖa ɖe mia ta kpɔ o, eye míele kukuɖeɖe dzi be, eƒe lɔlɔ̃nu ŋuti sidzedze vavãtɔ la nayɔ mi fũu le nunya kple gbɔgbɔ me nugɔmesese katã me, 10 be miazɔ ale si dze Yehowa, ale be miadze eŋu bliboe, esi mieyi edzi le ku tsem le dɔ nyui sia dɔ nyui wɔwɔ me, eye miele tsitsim le Mawu ŋuti sidzedze vavãtɔ la me; 11 nye didie nye be wòatsɔ eƒe ŋusẽ triakɔ la ado ŋusẽ mi le eƒe ŋutikɔkɔe ƒe ŋutete la nu, ale be miado dzi bliboe le dzigbɔgbɔ blewu kple dzidzɔ me, 12 esi miedaa akpe na Fofo la, ame si na miedze na gomekpɔkpɔ le ame kɔkɔewo ƒe domenyinu la me le kekeli la me. 13 Eɖe mí tso viviti ƒe ŋusẽ la me, eye wòkplɔ mí yi Via lɔlɔ̃a ƒe fiaɖuƒe la me, 14 ame si dzi woto ɖe mí to tafe la dzi, si fia be wotsɔ míaƒe nu vɔ̃wo ke mí.

9 For this reason we on our part, since the day when we heard of it, never cease to pray for you and ask that you may be filled with awareness of his will in all spiritual wisdom and insight 10 to walk worthily of the Lord to give him all pleasure, bearing fruit in every good work and growing in awareness of God, 11 energized with all power in accordance with the mightiness of his glory for all persistence and patience, 12 joyously thanking the Father who qualified you for your share in the lot of God’s people in the light; 13 who delivered you out of the jurisdiction of darkness and transferred you into the kingdom of the Son of his love, 14 in whom we have redemption, the pardon of sins,

15 Eyae nye Mawu makpɔmakpɔ la ƒe nɔnɔme, nuwɔwɔwo katã ƒe gbãtɔ; 16 elabena eya dzie woto wɔ nu bubu siwo katã le dziƒowo kple anyigba dzi, nu siwo wokpɔna kple nu siwo womekpɔna o, woɖanye fiazikpuiwo, alo aƒetɔnyenyewo, alo dziɖuɖuwo, alo ŋusẽwo o. Wowɔ nu bubuwo katã to edzi na eya amea.

15 Who is image of the invisible God, firstborn of all creation, 16 because in him everything was created in the heavens and on earth, the visible and the invisible, be it thrones or lordships or governments or dominions everything has been created through him and to come to him, 17 and before everything he is, and in him everything holds together.

17 Etre dzɔdzɔ na nu bubuwo katã hã, eye eya dzie woto na nu bubuwo katã va dzɔ, 18 eye eyae nye ŋutilã, si nye hame la, ƒe ta. Eyae nye gɔmedzedze la, ŋgɔgbevi tso ame kukuwo dome, ne wòazu gbãtɔ le nuwo katã me; 19 elabena edze Mawu ŋu be yeana blibonyenye la katã nanɔ eya amea me, 20 eye be yeato eya ke dzi adzra ye kple nu bubuwo katã dome ɖo ake, esi wòto ʋu si Kristo kɔ ɖi le fuwɔameti la ŋu dzi wɔ ŋutifafa, woɖanye nu siwo le anyigba dzi alo nu siwo le dziƒo o. 21 Le nyateƒe me la, mi ame siwo nɔ adzɔge tsã, eye mienye futɔwo, le esi miaƒe susuwo nɔ dɔwɔwɔ vɔ̃ɖiwo ŋu ta la, 22 Mawu to ame ma ƒe ŋutilã si wokpɔna dzi gadzra mia kplii dome ɖo to eƒe ku me, ne mianye ame kɔkɔewo, mokakamanɔŋutɔwo kple ame siwo ŋu nutsotso aɖeke mele o le eŋkume, 23 nenye be mieyi edzi lé xɔse la me ɖe asi, woɖo mi ɖe eƒe gɔmeɖoanyi la dzi, mieli ke sesĩe, eye miena wote mi ɖa tso nya nyui si miese, si woɖe gbeƒãe le nuwɔwɔ siwo katã le dziƒoa te dome la ƒe mɔkpɔkpɔ gbɔ o ko. Nya nyui sia ƒe subɔlae nye, Paulo mezu.

18 And he is the head of the body, the church, he who is the beginning, the firstborn out of the dead, in order that he may take the first place in every respect, 19 because in him all the fullness was pleased to make its home 20 and through him to reconcile everything to him, making peace through the blood of his cross, through him whether it were the things on earth or the things in the heavens, 21 and you who had once been estranged and hostile-minded in your wicked deeds, 22 but whom he has now reconciled by his fleshly body through death to present you holy and unblemished and irreproachable before him 23 if so be that you keep to your faith, standing steady on solid foundations and not shifting from the hope of the gospel you heard, which was proclaimed in all creation under the heavens; of which I Paul became an agent.

24 Azɔ la, mele dzidzɔ kpɔm le fu siwo kpem mele le mia ta la me, eye mele xaxa siwo susɔ le Kristo ta la me tom le nye ŋutilã me ɖe eƒe ŋutilã, si nye hamea la ta. 25 Mezu hame sia ƒe subɔla le aƒedzikpɔkpɔdɔ si tso Mawu gbɔ, si wonam le mia ta, be maɖe gbeƒã Mawu ƒe nya la bliboe nu, 26 nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe si woɣla tso nuɖoanyi siwo va yi kple dzidzime siwo va yi la me ke. Ke azɔ woɖee fia eƒe ame kɔkɔewo, 27 ame siwo wòdze Mawu ŋu be yeana woanya nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe sia ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe ƒe kesinɔnuwo, si nye Kristo si wɔ ɖeka kpli mi, kple eƒe ŋutikɔkɔe ƒe mɔkpɔkpɔ la, le dukɔwo dome. 28 Eyae nye ame si míele gbeƒã ɖemee, eye míele nu xlɔ̃m ame sia ame hele nu fiam ame sia ame le nunya katã me, ne míatsɔ ame sia ame aɖo eŋkume bliboe le Kristo me. 29 Esia tae mele kutri kum ɖo, eye mele ʋiʋlim le eƒe ŋusẽ si le dɔ dzi sesĩe le menye la nu.

24 I rejoice now in my sufferings for you, and what stopped short of completeness in the Christ’s sufferings I am filling out in my flesh for his body, which is the church, 25 whose servitor I became in accordance with God’s charge given to me as errand to you, to present God’s word in its fullness, 26 the secret that had been hidden since the ages and the generations but has now been disclosed to his devout believers, 27 to whom God chose to make known what was the wealth of the glory of this secret design among the nations, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory; 28 whom we announce, admonishing every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, in order that we may present every man complete in Christ, 29 to which same end I am toiling and struggling as befits his energy that is powerfully at work in me.
Kolosetɔwo
Colossians

2 Elabena medi be mianya ale si gbegbe mele ʋiʋlim ɖe miawo kple ame siwo le Laodikea kpakple ame siwo katã mekpɔ ŋkunyeme kpɔ o la ta. 2 Mele esia wɔm be woƒe dzi nadze eme, ne woawɔ ɖeka le lɔlɔ̃ me, be woƒe asi nasu kesinɔnu geɖe si nye be woakpɔ kakaɖedzi blibo le woƒe nugɔmesese me la dzi, ale be Mawu ƒe nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe la, si nye Kristo ŋuti sidzedze vavãtɔ nasu wo si. 3 Eya mee woɣla nunya kple sidzedze ƒe kesinɔnuwo katã ɖo nyuie.

2 For I want you to know what a struggle I am having for you and the ones in Laodicea and as many as have not seen my face in person, 2 that their hearts may be encouraged, they being drawn together in love and instructed into the richest certitude of insight, to the recognition of God’s secret, Christ, 3 in whom all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge are hidden.
4 Mele esia gblɔm ale be ame aɖeke nagatsɔ aɖe ŋanɛ aflu mi o.
4 I say this in order that nobody may cheat you with plausible talk.
5 Togbɔ be nyemele mia gbɔ le ŋutilã me o hã la, meli kpli mi le gbɔgbɔ me, eye dzi le dzɔyem be miewɔa nu ɖe ɖoɖo nyui nu, eye miaƒe xɔse li ke le Kristo me.
5 For even if I am physically away, yet I am with you in the spirit, rejoicing and witnessing your good order and the solidity of your faith in Christ.

6 Eya ta ale si ko miexɔ Aƒetɔ Kristo Yesu la, miyi edzi miazɔ kplii le ɖekawɔwɔ me, 7 eye mianye ame siwo ƒo ke ɖe to, siwo wotu ɖe eya amea dzi, eye woli ke wo ɖe xɔse la me, abe ale si wofia mi ene, eye miaƒe akpedada nagba go.
6 So, in such fashion as you took over Christ Jesus the Lord, walk in him, 7 rooted and upbuilt in him and solidly settled in faith as you were taught, plentiful in thanksgiving.

11 Le miaƒe hadede kplii me la, wotso aʋa na miawo hã, menye kple asi o, ke boŋ to nu vɔ̃ ŋutilã la ɖeɖe ɖa me, aʋatsotso si nye Kristo tɔ lae wotso na mi. 12 Elabena woɖi mi kpakplii esi wonyrɔ mi abe eya ke ene, eye to miaƒe hadede kplii me la, wofɔ mi ɖe tsitre kpakplii to Mawu, ame si fɔe ɖe tsitre tso ame kukuwo dome la, ƒe ŋusẽdɔ si dzi miexɔ se la dzi. 13 Gawu la, togbɔ be mienye ame kukuwo tsã le miaƒe vodadawo kple aʋamatsomatso ƒe nɔnɔme, si me mienɔ le ŋutilã me la me hã la, Mawu gbɔ agbe mi kpakplii. Elɔ̃ faa tsɔ míaƒe vodadawo katã ke mí, 14 eye wòtutu sedede siwo wotsɔ asi ŋlɔ, sedede siwo tsia tsitre ɖe mía ŋu la ɖa. Eɖee ɖa le mɔa dzi esi wòklãe ɖe fuwɔameti la ŋuti.

8 Look to it that there be not somebody who carries you off by philosophy and empty deceit along the line of human tradition, of the world’s elements and not of Christ, 9 because in him all the fullness of deity is resident in bodily form, 10 and it is in him you have been brought to fullness, him who is the head of every government and dominion; 11 in whom, also, you were circumcised with a circumcision not done by human hands, in the stripping off of the body of flesh, in the Christ’s circumcision, 12 being buried with him in baptism, in which you were also raised with him through faith in the activities of God who raised him from the dead; 13 and you, when you were dead with your offenses and the uncircumcisedness of your flesh, he brought to life together with him, condoning all our offenses, 14 canceling the bond over us in decrees, which was opposed to us, and has taken it away, nailing it to the cross.
15 Eklo nu le dziɖuɖuwo kple ŋusẽwo ŋu, eye wòɖe wo fia le dutoƒo be woɖu wo dzi, eye wòkplɔ wo le aʋadziɖuɖu ƒe gbɔlɔlɔ gã aɖe me to fuwɔameti la dzi.
15 Disarming the governments and the dominions, he made a public show of them, celebrating his triumph over them on it.

17 Nu mawo nye nu siwo ava va la ƒe vɔvɔli, ke nua ŋutɔŋutɔ le Kristo la me. 18 Migana ame aɖeke si alakpaɖokuibɔbɔ kple mawudɔlawo subɔsubɔ dzɔa dzi na la nawɔe be fetu la nato mia ŋu o. Ame sia ƒomevi "tea tɔ ɖe " nu siwo wòkpɔ la dzi eye eƒe ŋutilãmetamesusu nana wòdoa eɖokui ɖe dzi glodzoo madzemadzee, 19 eye mekuna ɖe ta la ŋu sesĩe o, evɔ ta sia gbɔe ŋutilã blibo la kpɔa eƒe nunyiame tsonɛ, eye wòto ƒunukpeƒewo kple lãmekawo dzi lée ƒo ƒu ɖekae henana wòtsina, abe ale si Mawu di be wòatsii ene.

16 So let nobody pass judgment on you in matters of eating and drinking or in respect to festival or new moon or sabbath, 17 that are a shadow of what was to be but the body belongs to the Christ; 18 let nobody contrive a decision against you with willful humility and worship of the angels, entering into what he has seen, flimsily inflated by his flesh-mind, 19 and not keeping hold of the Head, out of whom all the body, supplied and conjoined through the joints and sinews, makes God’s growth.

20 Ne miegbe nu le xexea ƒe gɔmedzenuwo gbɔ heku kple Kristo la, ekema nu ka tae miele agbe nɔm abe ɖe mieganye xexea ƒe akpa aɖe ene hele mia ɖokui bɔbɔm ɖe se siawo te be: 21 "Mègatsɔe o, eye mègaɖɔe kpɔ alo aka asi eŋu o, " 22 si nye nu siwo katã dome gblẽna to wo zazã me, eye wonye amegbetɔwo ƒe sededewo kple nufiafiawo? 23 Togbɔ be nu mawo nye subɔsubɔ si ƒomevi ame ɖo na eɖokui kple alakpaɖokuibɔbɔ kpakple fuwɔwɔ ŋutilã la eye wodzena le gota abe nu siwo me nunya le ene hã la, womekpena ɖe ame ŋu wòɖua ŋutilã ƒe nudzodzrowo dzi o.

20 If you died with Christ away from the world’s elements, why, as if alive in the world, do you go in for decrees, 21 "do not take nor taste nor touch, " 22 altogether things that are bound to perish as they are consumed, in conformity with the commands and teachings of men? 23 which do have a show of wisdom in self-contrived religiousness and humility and severity to the body, not in some sort of honor for repletion of the flesh.
Kolosetɔwo
Colossians
3 Ke ne wofɔ mi ɖe tsitre kple Kristo la, ekema miyi edzi mianɔ nu siwo le dziƒo, afi si Kristo la nɔ anyi ɖe Mawu ƒe ɖusime le, la dim.
3 So, if you were raised with the Christ, aim at the things above, where the Christ is, sitting at God’s right hand.
2 Mina miaƒe susu nanɔ nu siwo le dziƒo la ŋu, ke menye nu siwo le anyigba dzi la ŋu o. 3 Elabena mieku, eye wotsɔ miaƒe agbe ɣla ɖe Kristo me le Mawu me.
2 Have in mind the things above, not the things on the earth; 3 for you did die, and your life is hidden in God with the Christ.
4 Ne woɖe Kristo, si nye míaƒe agbe la, ɖe go la, ekema woaɖe miawo hã ɖe go kplii le ŋutikɔkɔe me.
4 When the Christ, our life, comes to be seen, then so will you with him come to be seen in glory.

5 Eya ta miwu miaƒe ŋutinu siwo le anyigba dzi, le gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu, makɔmakɔnyenye, gbɔdɔdɔ ƒe dzodzro vɔ̃, nudzodzro vɔ̃, kple ŋukeklẽ, si nye trɔ̃subɔsubɔ la gome. 6 Nu mawo tae Mawu ƒe dziku gbɔna ɖo. 7 Nu mawo tututu miawo hã miewɔna le miaƒe tsãgbenɔnɔ me.

5 So give over to deadness the organism that rests on the earth, unchastity, uncleanness, passions, evil desire, and greed, which is an idolatry 6 things on account of which God’s anger comes; 7 with which you too occupied yourselves once upon a time, when you were alive in these.

8 Ke azɔ miɖe asi le nu siawo katã ŋu keŋkeŋ: dziku, dɔmedzoe, vɔ̃ɖinyenye, eye nya veamewo kple yakanyawo negado le mia nu o. 9 Migaka aʋatso na mia nɔewo o. Miɖe amenyenye xoxo la kple eƒe nuwɔnawo ɖa, 10 eye mido amenyenye yeye la, si wɔm wole yeyee to sidzedze vavãtɔ me le Ame si wɔe la ƒe nɔnɔme nu, 11 afi sia Helatɔ alo Yudatɔ, aʋatsotso alo aʋamatsomatso, amedzro, Skitetɔ, kluvi alo ablɔɖeme meli o; ke boŋ Kristo ye nye nuwo katã, eye wòle wo katã me.

8 But now, you too, discard everything, anger, passionateness, viciousness, abusiveness, offensive language out of your mouths, 9 do not lie to each other, stripping off the old man with his doings 10 and putting on the new man who is being reconstituted into intelligence after the likeness of his Creator, 11 where there is no such thing as Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, alien, Scythian, slave, freeman, but Christ is everything and in everybody.

12 Eya ta esi mienye Mawu ƒe ame tiatiawo, ame kɔkɔewo kple lɔlɔ̃tɔwo ŋuti la, mido dɔmetɔtrɔ, dɔmenyonyo, ɖokuibɔbɔ, tufafa kple dzigbɔgbɔ blewu. 13 Miyi edzi miado dzi anɔ anyi kple mia nɔewo, eye miatsɔ anɔ mia nɔewo kem faa ne nya aɖe le ame aɖe si ɖe nɔvia ŋu. Ale si ko Yehowa tsɔ ke mi faa la, miawo hã miwɔ nenema ke.

12 So, as holy and dearly loved chosen ones of God’s, put on compassionate hearts, kindness, humility, meekness, patience, 13 bearing with each other and mutually making allowances; if one has found a fault in somebody, in the same way as the Lord showed grace to you, do you the like.
14 Hekpe ɖe nu siawo katã ŋu la, mido lɔlɔ̃, elabena enye ɖekawɔwɔ ƒe nublanu deblibo.
14 And over all these love, which is the connecting link of perfection.
15 Mina Kristo la ƒe ŋutifafa naɖu dzi le miaƒe dziwo me, elabena ŋutifafa ma gbɔe woyɔ mi vɛ le ŋutilã ɖeka me. Eye minye akpedalawo.
15 And let Christ’s peace have the deciding voice in your hearts, that same peace into which you were called in one body; and be thankful-hearted.

16 Mina Kristo la ƒe nya la naxɔ aƒe ɖe mia me le nunya katã me. Miyi edzi mianɔ nu fiam mia nɔewo, eye mianɔ dzi dem ƒo na mia nɔewo kple psalmowo, Mawu kafukafu nyawo, kple gbɔgbɔmehawo dzidzi ŋudzedzekpɔkpɔtɔe, eye midzi ha le miaƒe dziwo me na Yehowa. 17 Nu sia nu si miewɔna le nya alo nuwɔna me la, miwɔ wo katã le Aƒetɔ Yesu ƒe ŋkɔ me, eye mianɔ akpe dam na Mawu Fofo la to edzi.

16 Keep the Christ’s word abiding in you richly, teaching and admonishing each other in all wisdom, singing in your hearts to God in thankfulness with psalms, hymns, spiritual songs; 17 and as to anything whatever that you do in word or in act, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.
18 Mi srɔ̃nyɔnuwo, mibɔbɔ mia ɖokui na mia srɔ̃wo, abe ale si wòdze le Aƒetɔ la me ene.
18 Wives, be in such subordination to your husbands as is the proper thing in the Lord.
19 Mi srɔ̃ŋutsuwo, miyi edzi mianɔ mia srɔ̃wo lɔ̃m, eye miganɔ dɔmedzoe dom ɖe wo ŋu helĩhelĩ o.
19 Husbands, love your wives and do not be cross to them.
20 Mi ɖeviwo, miɖo to mia dzilawo le nu sia nu me, elabena esia dzea Aƒetɔ la ŋu nyuie.
20 Children, obey your parents in every respect, for this is a winsome way in the Lord.
21 Mi fofowo, miganɔ dziku dom na mia viwo o, ale be dzi nagaɖe le wo ƒo o.
21 Fathers, do not nettle your children, so that they may not be disheartened.

22 Mi kluviwo, miɖo to amegbetɔ siwo nye miaƒe aƒetɔwo le nu sia nu me, menye ne woƒe ŋku le mia ŋu ko le ameŋudzedze ta o, ke boŋ le dzimekɔkɔ me, le Yehowa vɔvɔ̃ me. 23 Nu sia nu si wɔm miele la, miwɔe tso luʋɔ blibo me abe Yehowa ye miele ewɔm na ene, ke menye na amewo o, 24 elabena mienyae be Yehowa gbɔe miaxɔ domenyinyi ƒe fetu la tsoe. Misubɔ Aƒetɔ Kristo abe kluviwo ene.

22 Servants, obey in every respect those who are your masters in the way of flesh, not in eye-services as man-pleasers do but in single-heartedness, fearing the Lord; 23 whatever you are doing, work at it with a will, as doing it for the Lord and not for men, 24 knowing that you will be paid up for it by the Lord in your inheritance; you are in the service of the Lord Christ.
25 Ame si wɔa nu gbegblẽ la, axɔ nu gbegblẽ si wòwɔ la ŋuti fetu godoo. Ameŋkumekpɔkpɔ aɖeke mele eme o.
25 For he who does a wrong will have the wrong he did coming to him, and there is no favoritism.
Kolosetɔwo
Colossians
4 Mi aƒetɔwo, miwɔ nu si le dzɔdzɔe kple nu si sɔ la ɖe miaƒe kluviwo ŋu, eye minyae be Aƒetɔ le miawo hã mia si le dziƒo.
4 Masters, let your servants have justice and equal rights, knowing that you too have a master in heaven.

3 Le ɣeyiɣi ma ke me la, mido gbe ɖa ɖe míawo hã mía ta, ale be Mawu naʋu nya la ƒe ʋɔtru na mí, be míate ŋu agblɔ Kristo la ŋuti nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe, si tututu ta mele gaxɔ me ɖo la, 4 ne mate ŋu agblɔe eme nakɔ abe ale si wòdze be mawɔe la ene.

2 Keep praying, be on the alert in it, with thanksgiving; 3 praying, along with the rest, for us too, that God will open us a door for the word, for speaking the secret of Christ, that same for which I am in prison, 4 so that I may open it up as I have to speak.

5 Miyi edzi miazɔ le nunya me le nuwɔwɔ kple ame siwo le egodo la me, eye miwɔ miaƒe ɣeyiɣi ŋu dɔ le mɔ nyuitɔ nu. 6 Mina miaƒe nya nadze to ɣesiaɣi, eye dze nanɔ eme, ne mianya ale si wòdze be miaɖo nya ŋu na ame sia ame.
5 Behave wisely toward outsiders, making the best you can of the crisis; 6 let your talk be always in grace, seasoned with salt to know how you need to answer each one.
7 Nɔvinye lɔlɔ̃tɔ Tikiko, si nye subɔla wɔnuteƒe kple hati kluvi le Aƒetɔ la me la, agblɔ nu siwo katã dzɔ ɖe dzinye la na mi.

7 Tychicus, the dear brother and faithful errand-runner and fellow-servant in the Lord, will acquaint you with everything that relates to me; 8 I am sending him to you for this express purpose, to let you know about me and to let him cheer your hearts, 9 with dear and faithful brother Onesimus, who is one of you.
8 Mele edɔm ɖe mia gbɔ be mianya ale si míele, eye wòafa akɔ na miaƒe dziwo.
They will give you the news about everything here.

9 Mele eya kple Onesimo, nɔvinye nuteƒewɔla lɔlɔ̃a, si tso mia gbɔ la dɔm; woagblɔ ale si nuwo le le mía gbɔ afi sia la katã na mi. 10 Aristarko, si le gaxɔ me kplim, do gbe na mi, Barnaba ƒe ƒometɔ Marko hã (ame si ƒe nya míegblɔ na mi be ne eva mia gbɔ la, miaxɔe nyuie), 11 kple Yesu si woyɔna be Yusto, ame siwo nye aʋatsotsotɔwo, hã do gbe na mi.

10 My fellow-prisoner Aristarchus sends greetings, and Barnabas’s cousin Mark, about whom you received injunctions, if he comes to you, receive him, 11 and Jesus, known as Justus, these who represent the circumcised community; these are the only ones who are cooperators for the Reign of God, and they were a comfort to me.

12 Epafra, ame si tso mia gbɔ eye wònye Kristo Yesu ƒe kluvi la, do gbe na mi. Edoa gbe ɖa vevie ɖe mia ta ɣesiaɣi, be mlɔeba la, miasu te bliboe, eye kakaɖedzi sẽŋu nanɔ mia si le Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu blibo la me. 13 Elabena mele ɖase ɖim le eŋu be, edzea agbagba geɖe ɖe miawo kple ame siwo le Laodikea kpakple ame siwo le Hierapoli la ta.

12 Epaphras, who is one of you, sends greetings, a servant of Christ Jesus who is always wrestling for you in his prayers that you may be made to stand complete and convinced in everything that is God’s will; 13 for I can testify that he is deeply concerned for you and those at Laodicea and those at Hierapolis.
14 Luka, atikewɔla lɔlɔ̃tɔ la, do gbe na mi, eye Dema hã do gbe na mi.
14 Dear Doctor Luke and Demas send greetings.
15 Mido gbe na nɔvi siwo le Laodikea nam, eye mido gbe na Nimfa kpakple hame si le eƒe aƒe me la nam.
15 Give my greetings to the brothers at Laodicea and to Nymphas and the meeting at their house.
16 Eye ne miexlẽ agbalẽ sia vɔ la, miwɔ ɖoɖo woaxlẽe le hame si le Laodikea hã me, eye miawo hã miaxlẽ esi tso Laodikea la.
16 And when the letter is read to you, get it read in the Laodiceans’ meeting too, and get to read the one from Laodicea.
17 Migblɔ na Arkipo be: "Lé fɔ ɖe subɔsubɔdɔ si nèxɔ le Aƒetɔ la me ŋu nàwɔe ade goe. "
17 And tell Archippus "Look out for the office you were given in the Lord, to make good in it. "
18 Nye, Paulo ƒe gbedoname si metsɔ nye ŋutɔ nye asi ŋlɔ lae nye esi.
18 My greeting, Paul’s, with my own hand.
Miɖo ŋku edzi be mekpɔtɔ le ga me.
Remember my fetters.
Mawu ƒe amenuveve nanɔ kpli mi.
Grace be with you.
1 Tesalonikatɔwo
1 Thessalonians
1 Paulo, Silvano kple Timoteo le esia ŋlɔm na hame si le Tesalonika, si wɔ ɖeka kple Mawu Fofo la kple Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo:
1 Paul and Silvanus and Timothy to the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace and peace to you.

Amenuveve kple ŋutifafa woana mi. 2 Míeɖoa ŋku mi katã mia dzi le míaƒe gbedodoɖawo me hedaa akpe na Mawu ɣesiaɣi, 3 elabena míeɖoa ŋku miaƒe xɔsedɔwo kple dɔ siwo miewɔna le lɔlɔ̃ me kpakple miaƒe dzidodo le mɔkpɔkpɔ si le mia si le Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo me la dzi ɣesiaɣi le mía Mawu kple Fofo la ŋkume. 4 Nɔviwo, mi ame siwo Mawu lɔ̃, míenya be Mawue tia mi, 5 elabena nya nyui si míeɖe gbeƒãe la, menye nya si míegblɔ kple nu ko wònye o, ke míegblɔe le ŋusẽ kple gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe kpakple kakaɖedzi sẽŋu hã me, abe ale si ko mienya ame siwo ƒomevi míeva zu le mia dome le mia ta la ene.

2 We always thank God for you all as we make mention of you in our prayers, 3 continually recalling your work of faith and labor of love and steadfastness of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ before our God and Father, 4 knowing, brothers loved by God, your choosing, 5 that our gospel did not come to you in word only, but also in power and in Holy Spirit and profound conviction, as you know what we were like for your sake when we were among you.
6 Ale miezu míawo kple Aƒetɔ la srɔ̃lawo, esi mietsɔ dzidzɔ si gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔea nana la xɔ nya la le yometiti geɖewo me, 7 eye mieva zu kpɔɖeŋu na xɔsetɔ siwo katã le Makedonia kple Akaya.

6 And you became imitators of us and of the Lord, receiving the word with joy over the Holy Spirit while in much trouble, 7 so that you became an example to all the believers in Macedonia and in Achaea.
