12 Mi vinye lɔlɔ̃awo, mele eŋlɔm na mi, elabena wotsɔ miaƒe nu vɔ̃wo ke mi le eƒe ŋkɔ la ta.
12 I am writing to you, children, because your sins are forgiven you on account of his name.
13 Mi fofowo, mele eŋlɔm na mi, elabena mieva nya ame si li tso gɔmedzedzea me ke la.
13 I am writing to you, fathers, because you know the one that has been from the first.
Mi ɖekakpuiwo, mele eŋlɔm na mi, elabena mieɖu vɔ̃ɖitɔ la dzi.
I am writing to you, youths, because you have won victories over the Evil One.
Mi vinye suewo, mele eŋlɔm na mi, elabena mieva nya Fofo la.
I have written to you, boys, because you know the Father.
14 Mi fofowo, mele eŋlɔm na mi, elabena mieva nya ame si li tso gɔmedzedzea me ke la.
14 I have written to you, fathers, because you know the one that has been from the first.
Mi ɖekakpuiwo, mele eŋlɔm na mi, elabena ŋusẽ le mia ŋu, Mawu ƒe nya la le mia me, eye mieɖu vɔ̃ɖitɔ la dzi.
I have written to you, youths, because you are strong and God’s word dwells in you and you have won victories over the Evil One.
15 Migalɔ̃ xexea alo nu siwo le xexea me la o.
15 Do not love the world nor what is in the world.

Ne ame aɖe lɔ̃a xexea la, Fofo la ƒe lɔlɔ̃ mele eme o; 16 elabena nu sia nu si le xexea me ŋutilã ƒe nudzodzro kple ŋkuwo ƒe nudzodzro kple ame ƒe nunɔamesiwo fiafia adegbeƒoƒotɔe la metso Fofo la gbɔ o, ke boŋ xexea me wotso. 17 Azɔ hã, xexea kple eƒe nudzodzrowo nu va yina, ke ame si wɔa Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃nu la nɔa anyi yi ɖe mavɔmavɔ me.

If one loves the world the love of the Father is not in him, 16 because all that is in the world, the desire of the flesh and the desire of the eyes and the pretentiousness of our life, does not come from the Father but comes from the world; 17 and the world passes, and so does the desire of it, but he who does God’s will remains forever.

18 Vinye suewo, gaƒoƒo mamlɛtɔ lae nye esia, eye abe ale si miesee be Kristo ƒe futɔ la gbɔna ene la, Kristo ƒe futɔ geɖewo do fifia gɔ̃ hã xoxo, eye esia mee míenyae le be gaƒoƒo mamlɛtɔ lae nye esia.
18 It is the last moment, boys; and as you have heard that there is an antichrist coming, so there have now come to be many antichrists, from which we know that it is the last moment.
19 Mía domee wodo go tso, gake womele abe míawo ene o; elabena ne ɖe wole abe míawo ene la, anye ne woanɔ mía gbɔ ɖaa. Ke boŋ wodo, ale be wòadze nyuie be menye wo katãe le abe míawo ene o.

19 They went out from us, but they were not part of us; for if they had been part of us, they would have remained with us, but it was in order that it might be made apparent that they are not any of them part of us.
20 Kɔkɔetɔ la si ami na mi, eye sidzedze su mi katã si. 21 Menye esi mienya nyateƒe la o tae mele nya siawo ŋlɔm ɖo ɖe mi o, ke boŋ esi mienyae, eye esi alakpa aɖeke metso nyateƒe la me o tae.

20 And you have an anointment from the Holy One, and you all know; 21 I have not been writing to you because you do not know the truth, but because you know it and any lie does not belong to the truth.
22 Ame si gbe be menye Yesue nye Kristo la o la, menye eyae nye aʋatsokala oa?
22 Who is the liar but he who denies that Jesus is the Christ? this is the antichrist, he who denies the Father and the Son.
Ame si gbe nu le Fofo la kple Vi la gbɔ la, ame siae nye Kristo ƒe futɔ la. 23 Ame sia ame si gbea nu le Vi la gbɔ la, Fofo la hã mele esi o.
23 Anyone who denies the Son does not have the Father either; he who acknowledges the Son has the Father too.

Gake ame si ʋua Vi la me la, Fofo la hã le esi. 24 Ke miawo la, mina nu si miese tso gɔmedzedzea me la nakpɔtɔ anɔ mia me. Ne nu si miese tso gɔmedzedzea me la kpɔtɔ le mia me la, ekema miawɔ ɖeka kple Vi la kpakple Fofo la.
24 For your part, let what you heard from the first dwell in you; if what you heard from the first dwells in you, so will you dwell in the Son and in the Father.
25 Eye nu si ŋugbe eya ŋutɔ do na mí lae nye agbe mavɔ.
25 And the promise he made to us is this: eternal life.
26 Mele nya siawo ŋlɔm na mi ku ɖe ame siwo le didim be yewoaflu mi la ŋu.
26 These things I have written to you about those who are misleading you.

27 Ke le miawo ya gome la, ami si wosi na mi la kpɔtɔ le mia me, eye mehiã be ame aɖeke naganɔ nu fiam mi o; ke boŋ amisisiname si tso egbɔ la le nuwo katã fiam mi, eye wònye nyateƒe ke menye aʋatso o. Ale si tututu wòfia mii la, miyi edzi miawɔ ɖeka kplii.

27 And for your part, the anointment you received from him dwells in you, and you have no need that one should teach you; but as his anointment teaches you about everything, and is true and is not a lie, and as he did teach you, dwell in him.
28 Eya ta vinye lɔlɔ̃awo, miyi edzi miawɔ ɖeka kplii, ale be ne wova ɖee fia la, dzi naɖo mía ƒo míaƒo nu, eye míagatrɔ ɖa le egbɔ kple ŋukpe le eƒe anyinɔɣi la o.
28 And now, children, dwell in him, in order that if he makes his appearance we may have confidence and not be shamed away from him at his coming.
29 Ne mienya be dzɔdzɔetɔe wònye la, ekema mienyae hã be ame sia ame si wɔa nu dzɔdzɔe la, eya mee wodzii tso.
29 If you know that he is righteous, you take knowledge that everyone who does right is born out of him.
1 Yohanes
1 John
3 Mikpɔ lɔlɔ̃ si ƒomevi Fofo la tsɔ lɔ̃ míi ɖa, be woayɔ mí be Mawu ƒe viwo; eye míenye viawo hã nyateƒe.
3 See what love the Father has given us, that we should be called children of God’s, and are such!
Esia tae xexea medze si mí o ɖo, elabena medze si Mawu o.
This is why the world does not know us because it did not know him.
2 Lɔlɔ̃tɔwo, azɔ la míenye Mawu ƒe viwo, gake womeɖe nu si míava nye la fia mí haɖe o.
2 Dear friends, we are children of God’s now, and it is not yet made apparent what we shall be.
Míenyae be ne wova ɖee ɖe go la, míanɔ abe eya amea ene, elabena míakpɔe abe ale si wòle ene. 3 Eye ame sia ame si si mɔkpɔkpɔ sia le la, kɔa eɖokui ŋu abe ale si eya ŋutɔ hã le kɔkɔe ene.
We know that if he makes his appearance we shall be like him, because we shall see him as he is; 3 and everyone who has this hope rested on him purifies himself as he is pure.
4 Ame sia ame si tsɔ nu vɔ̃ wɔwɔ ɖo dɔe la tsɔ sedzimawɔmawɔ hã ɖo dɔe, eya ta nu vɔ̃e nye sedzimawɔmawɔ.
4 Everyone who commits sin is committing immorality too; and sin is immorality.
5 Mienyae hã be woɖee ɖe go be wòaɖe míaƒe nu vɔ̃wo ɖa, eye nu vɔ̃ aɖeke mele eya ŋutɔ ŋu o.
5 And you know that he made his appearance to take sins away, and there is no sin in him.
6 Ame sia ame si wɔ ɖeka kplii la metsɔa nu vɔ̃ wɔwɔ ɖoa dɔe o; ame si tsɔa nu vɔ̃ wɔwɔ ɖoa dɔe la mekpɔe alo dze sii o.
6 Anyone who dwells in him does not sin; anyone who sins has not seen him nor known him.
7 Vinye lɔlɔ̃awo, migana ame aɖeke naflu mi o; ame si yia edzi wɔa nu dzɔdzɔe la nye ame dzɔdzɔe, abe ale si ko eya hã le dzɔdzɔe ene.
7 Children, let nobody delude you.
8 Ame si tsɔ nu vɔ̃ wɔwɔ ɖo dɔe la tso Abosam me, elabena tso gɔmedzedzea me kee Abosam le nu vɔ̃ wɔwɔ dzi.
He who does right is righteous as He is righteous; 8 he who commits sin comes of the Devil, because the Devil has been sinning from the first.
Esia tae woɖe Mawu ƒe Vi la ɖe go ɖo, be wòagblẽ Abosam ƒe dɔwɔwɔwo me.
It was for this the Son of God made his appearance, that he might break up the Devil’s work.
9 Ame sia ame si wodzi tso Mawu me la metsɔa nu vɔ̃ wɔwɔ ɖoa dɔe o, elabena nuku si tso Mawu gbɔ la kpɔtɔ le eya amea me, eye mate ŋu anɔ nu vɔ̃ wɔm o, elabena Mawu me wodzii tso.
9 Anyone who is born out of God does not commit sin, because seed of his dwells in him and he cannot sin because he is born out of God.

10 Esia mee Mawu ƒe viwo kple Abosam ƒe viwo dze ƒãa le: Ame sia ame si mewɔa nu dzɔdzɔe o la metso Mawu me o, nenema kee nye ame si melɔ̃a nɔvia o hã. 11 Elabena esiae nye gbedeasi si miese tso gɔmedzedzea me, be míalɔ̃ mía nɔewo; 12 menye abe Kain, ame si dzɔ tso vɔ̃ɖitɔ la me, eye wòwu nɔvia ene o. Eye nu ka tae wòwui ɖo? Elabena eya ŋutɔ ƒe dɔwɔwɔwo vɔ̃ɖi, ke nɔvia tɔwo ya le dzɔdzɔe.

10 It is by this that God’s children and the Devil’s children are evident: anyone who does not do right does not come of God, nor the one who does not love his brother, 11 because this is the message you heard from the first, that we are to love each other 12 not as Cain came of the Evil One and cut his brother’s throat; and cut his brother’s throat on what account? because his doings were wicked, but his brother’s right.
13 Nɔviwo, megawɔ moyaa na mi be xexea léa fu mi o. 14 Míenyae be míeto ku me yi agbe me, elabena míelɔ̃a mía nɔviwo.
13 Do not wonder, brothers, that the world should hate you; 14 we know that we have passed from death to life because we love the brothers.
Ame si melɔ̃a ame o la tsia ku me.
He who does not love dwells in death.
15 Ame sia ame si léa fu nɔvia la, amewulae wònye, eye mienyae be amewula aɖeke makpɔ agbe mavɔ o.
15 Anyone who hates his brother is a killer, and you know that any man-killer does not have eternal life dwelling in him.
16 Esia me míeva dze si lɔlɔ̃ la le, elabena etsɔ eƒe agbe ɖo anyi ɖe mía ta; eye ele na mí be míatsɔ míaƒe agbe aɖo anyi ɖe mía nɔviwo ta.
16 We know love by this, that he laid down his life for us; and we are in duty bound to lay down our lives for the brothers.

17 Ke ame si si xexe sia me nunɔamesiwo le, eye wòkpɔ nɔvia hiã tui, gake eƒe dɔme metrɔ ɖe eŋu o la, aleke Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃ nɔa emee? 18 Vinye lɔlɔ̃awo, migana míatsɔ nya kple aɖe ko alɔ̃ ame o, ke boŋ míatsɔ nuwɔna kple nyateƒe alɔ̃ ame.

17 But one who has earthly resources and sees his brother to be in need and shuts his sympathies against him how is the love of God dwelling in him? 18 Children, let us not love with words nor with the tongue, but in action and in truth.

19 Esia mee míanyae le be míedzɔ tso nyateƒe la me, eye míana kakaɖedzi míaƒe dziwo le eŋkume 20 le nu sia nu si me míaƒe dzi abu fɔ mí le la me, elabena Mawu nye gã wu míaƒe dziwo, eye wònya nuwo katã.
19 By this we shall know that we belong to the truth; and we shall persuade our heart before him 20 that if our heart finds against us, God is greater than our heart and knows everything.

21 Lɔlɔ̃tɔwo, ne míaƒe dzi mebua fɔ mí o la, ekema dzi aɖo mía ƒo míaƒo nu le Mawu ŋkume, 22 eye nu sia nu si míebiae la, míaxɔe tso egbɔ, elabena míeléa eƒe seawo me ɖe asi, eye míewɔa nu siwo dzea eŋu.

21 Dear friends, if our heart does not find against us we have confidence to come to God, 22 and we receive from him whatever we ask, because we are keeping his commandments and doing what is pleasing before him.
23 Nyateƒee, eƒe sedede lae nye be: míaxɔ Via Yesu Kristo ƒe ŋkɔ dzi ase, eye míalɔ̃ mía nɔewo, abe ale si wòde se na míi ene.
23 And this is his commandment, that we should believe the name of his Son Jesus Christ and love each other as he gave us a commandment.
24 Hekpe ɖe eŋu la, ame si léa eƒe sewo me ɖe asi la wɔ ɖeka kplii, eye eya hã nɔa ɖekawɔwɔ me kplii. Le gbɔgbɔ si wòna mí ta la, míenyae be ekpɔtɔ le ɖekawɔwɔ me kpli mí.
24 And he who keeps his commandments dwells in him, and he in him; and by this we know that he is dwelling in us, from the Spirit that he gave us.
1 Yohanes
1 John
4 Lɔlɔ̃tɔwo, migaxɔ nya sia nya si wobe etso gbɔgbɔ me la dzi se o, ke boŋ mido nya si wobe etso gbɔgbɔ me la kpɔ be Mawu gbɔe wòtso hã, elabena aʋatsonyagblɔɖila geɖewo do go yi xexea me.
4 Dear friends, do not believe every spirit, but put the spirits to the test, whether they come from God, because there have many pretended prophets gone out into the world.

2 Nu si ana miadze si nya si tso Mawu ƒe gbɔgbɔ me lae nye esi: Nya sia nya si tso gbɔgbɔ me si ʋua eme be Yesu Kristo va le ŋutilã me la, tso Mawu gbɔ. 3 Gake nya sia nya si tso gbɔgbɔ me si meʋua Yesu me o la, metso Mawu gbɔ o. Gawu la, esiae nye Kristo ƒe futɔ la ƒe nya, si miese be egbɔna, eye azɔ ele xexea me xoxo.

2 You know God’s Spirit by this: any spirit that acknowledges Jesus Christ to have come in flesh comes from God, 3 and any spirit that does not acknowledge Jesus does not come from God; and this is that of the antichrist, which you have heard is coming, and it is already in the world now.
4 Vinye lɔlɔ̃awo, Mawu mee mietso, eye mieɖu ame mawo dzi, elabena ame si le mia dzi la lolo wu ame si le xexea dzi.
4 You come of God, children, and have won the victory over them because he who is in you is greater than he who is in the world.
5 Woawo la, xexea mee wotso; esia tae wogblɔa nya siwo tso xexea me, eye xexea ɖoa to wo.
5 They come of the world; that is why they speak words of the world and the world hears them.
6 Míawo la, Mawu mee míetso.
6 We come of God; he who knows God hears us, he who does not come of God does not hear us.
Ame si va dze si Mawu la ɖoa to mí; ame si metso Mawu me o la meɖoa to mí o.
It is from this that we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of delusion.
7 Lɔlɔ̃tɔwo, mina míayi edzi alɔ̃ mía nɔewo, elabena lɔlɔ̃ la tso Mawu gbɔ, eye ame sia ame si lɔ̃a ame la, Mawu mee wodzii tso, eye wòdze si Mawu.
7 Dear friends, let us love each other, because love is from God and everyone who loves is born out of God and knows God.
8 Ame sia ame si melɔ̃a ame o la medze si Mawu o, elabena Mawu nye lɔlɔ̃.
8 He who does not love never got to know God, because God is love.
9 Esia me woɖe Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃ ɖe go fia le le mía me, be Mawu dɔ eƒe Tenuvi la ɖo ɖe xexea me, be míakpɔ agbe to eya amea dzi.
9 God’s love was displayed in our case by this, that God has sent his only Son into the world in order that we may live through him.
10 Esia me lɔlɔ̃ la le, menye be míawo míelɔ̃ Mawu o, ke boŋ be eya lɔ̃ mí, eye wòdɔ Via be wòanye avulévɔsa ɖe míaƒe nu vɔ̃wo ta.
10 This is where love comes in, not that we have loved God but that he loved us and sent his Son to be a propitiation for our sins.
11 Lɔlɔ̃tɔwo, ne aleae Mawu lɔ̃ míi la, ekema ele na míawo hã be míalɔ̃ mía nɔewo.
11 Dear friends, if God loved us like that, we are in duty bound to love each other too.
12 Ame aɖeke mekpɔ Mawu ɣeaɖekeɣi kpɔ o. Ne míeyi edzi lɔ̃a mía nɔewo la, ekema Mawu kpɔtɔ le mía me, eye eƒe lɔlɔ̃ la de blibo le mía me.
12 Nobody has ever looked upon God; if we love each other God is dwelling in us, and his love has been carried to perfection in us.
13 Esia mee míenyae le be míekpɔtɔ le ɖekawɔwɔ me kplii, eye be eya hã kpɔtɔ le ɖekawɔwɔ me kpli mí, elabena ena eƒe gbɔgbɔ la mí.
13 That we are dwelling in him and he in us we know by this, that he has given us some of his Spirit.
14 Azɔ hã, míawo ŋutɔwo míekpɔ esia eye míele ɖase ɖim be, Fofo la dɔ Via ɖa be wòanye xexea ɖela.
14 And we have seen the sight and testify to it that the Father has sent the Son to be savior of the world.
15 Ame sia ame si ʋua eme be Yesu Kristoe nye Mawu ƒe Vi la, Mawu kpɔtɔ le ɖekawɔwɔ me kplii, eye eya hã le ɖekawɔwɔ me kple Mawu.
15 Whoever acknowledges that Jesus is the Son of God, God is dwelling in him and he in God.
16 Eye míawo míeva nya ale si gbegbe Mawu lɔ̃ míi, eye míexɔ esia dzi se hã.
16 And we know, and have believed, the love that God has in our case.
Mawu nye lɔlɔ̃, eye ame si lɔ̃a ame la wɔ ɖeka kple Mawu, eye Mawu hã wɔ ɖeka kplii.
God is love, and he who dwells in love is dwelling in God and God in him.
17 Aleae lɔlɔ̃ la de blibo le mía me, ale be dzi naɖo mía ƒo míaƒo nu faa le ʋɔnudrɔ̃gbe la, elabena ale si eya amea le la, nenema kee míawo hã míele le xexe sia me.
17 It is in this that love has been brought to perfection with us, that we should have confidence on the day of judgment because what he is we too, in this world, are.
18 Vɔvɔ̃ aɖeke mele lɔlɔ̃ me o, ke boŋ lɔlɔ̃ deblibo nyaa vɔvɔ̃ doa goe, elabena vɔvɔ̃ xea mɔ na mí. Le nyateƒe me la, ame si vɔ̃na la mede blibo le lɔlɔ̃ me o.
18 There is no fear in love, but perfect love throws fear out, because fear involves the idea of punishment and he who fears has not come to perfection in love.
19 Míelɔ̃a ame, elabena Mawu tre mí lɔlɔ̃.
19 We love because he loved us first.

20 Ne ame aɖe gblɔ be, "Melɔ̃ Mawu, " gake wòléa fu nɔvia la, aʋatsokalae. Elabena ame si melɔ̃a nɔvia si kpɔm wòle o la, mate ŋu alɔ̃ Mawu si kpɔm mele o la o. 21 Eye míexɔ se sia tso egbɔ be, ame si lɔ̃ Mawu la nalɔ̃ nɔvia hã.

20 If one says "I love God " and hates his brother he is a liar; for he who does not love his brother whom he has seen cannot love God whom he has not seen, 21 and we have from him this commandment, that he who loves God should love his brother too.
1 Yohanes
1 John
5 Ame sia ame si xɔna sena be Yesue nye Kristo la, Mawu ƒe vi wònye, eye ame sia ame si lɔ̃a ame si na agbe la, elɔ̃a Mawu ƒe Vi la hã.
5 Everyone who believes that Jesus is the Christ is born out of God, and everyone who loves the sire loves him who is born from him.
2 Esia me míedzea sii le be míelɔ̃a Mawu ƒe viwo, ne míelɔ̃a Mawu hewɔa eƒe sewo dzi.
2 It is by this we know that we love God’s children, when we love God and live up to his commandments.

3 Elabena nu si lɔlɔ̃ na Mawu fiae nye esi, be míalé eƒe seawo me ɖe asi; eye eƒe seawo menye agba o, 4 elabena ame sia ame si Mawu dzi la ɖua xexea dzi. Eye nu si míetsɔ ɖua xexea dzi dzidzedzetɔe lae nye míaƒe xɔse.

3 For this is the love of God, that we should keep his commandments; and his commandments are not burdensome, 4 because everything that is born out of God comes off victorious over the world; and this is the victory that has come off victorious over the world, our faith.

5 Ame kae ate ŋu aɖu xexea dzi? Menye ame si xɔe se be Yesue nye Mawu ƒe Vi lae oa? 6 Yesu Kristo siae nye ame si va to tsi kple ʋu me, menye to tsi ɖeɖe ko me o, ke boŋ to tsi kple ʋu me. Eye gbɔgbɔ lae le ɖase ɖim, elabena gbɔgbɔ lae nye nyateƒe la. 7 Elabena ɖaseɖila etɔ̃e li: 8 gbɔgbɔ la, tsi la, kple ʋu la; eye nu etɔ̃ siawo wɔ ɖeka.

5 And who is it that is victorious over the world but he who believes that Jesus is the Son of God? 6 This is the one that came by water and blood, Jesus Christ; not in the water only but in the water and in the blood; and the Spirit is what testifies, because the Spirit is the truth 7 because it is three who testify, 8 the Spirit and the water and the blood, and the three concur.
9 Ne míexɔa amegbetɔwo ƒe ɖaseɖiɖi la, ekema Mawu ƒe ɖaseɖiɖi la lolo wu. Elabena Mawu ŋutɔ le ɖase ɖim le Via ŋu.
9 If we receive men’s testimony, God’s testimony is superior; because this is God’s testimony, that he has testified about his Son.
10 Ame si xɔa Mawu ƒe Vi la dzi sena la kpɔa ɖaseɖiɖi le eɖokui me.
10 He who believes in the Son of God has the testimony in him.
Ame si mexɔa Mawu dzi sena o la doe aʋatsokala, elabena mexɔ ɖase si Mawu ɖi le Via ŋu la dzi se o.
He who does not believe God has made a liar of him because he has not believed in the testimony God has borne about his Son.
11 Eye ɖase si woɖi lae nye esi be, Mawu na agbe mavɔ mí, eye agbe sia le Via me.
11 And this is the testimony, that God has given us eternal life and this life is in his Son.
12 Ame si xɔ Vi sia la, agbe sia le esi; ame si mexɔ Mawu ƒe Vi sia o la, agbe sia mele esi o.
12 He who has the Son has the life; he who does not have the Son of God does not have the life.
13 Mele nya siawo ŋlɔm na mi, ne miadze sii be agbe mavɔ le mi ame siwo xɔa Mawu ƒe Vi la ƒe ŋkɔa dzi sena la si.
13 I have written these things to you in order that you may know that you have eternal life, to you who believe in the name of the Son of God.

14 Eye kakaɖedzi sia le mía si le eya amea me be, nu sia nu si míabia wòawɔ ɖeka kple eƒe lɔlɔ̃nu la, aɖo to mí. 15 Eye ne míenya be eɖoa to mí le nu sia nu si biam míele me la, ekema míenya be míakpɔ nu siwo míebia la, elabena eya si mee míebia wo le.

14 And this is the confidence we have for coming to him, that if we ask anything in accordance with his will he hears us; 15 and if we know that he hears us in whatever we ask, we know that we have the things we have asked him for.
16 Ne ame aɖe kpɔ nɔvia wòle nu vɔ̃ si mekplɔa ame yia ku me o wɔm la, nedo gbe ɖa ɖe eta, eye Mawu ana agbee, ɛ̃, ana agbe ame siwo mele nu vɔ̃ si kplɔa ame yia ku me o wɔm la.
16 If one sees his brother sinning, a sin not for death, he shall ask and give life to him, to those who are sinning not for death.
Nu vɔ̃ aɖe li si kplɔa ame yia ku me. Nyemegblɔ be wòaɖe kuku ɖe nu vɔ̃ ma ya ta o.
There is such a thing as a sin for death; it is not as to that that I say he is to solicit.
17 Nu madzɔmadzɔ ɖe sia ɖe wɔwɔ nye nu vɔ̃, gake nu vɔ̃ aɖe li, si mekplɔa ame yia ku me o.
17 Every wrong act is a sin, and there is such a thing as a sin not for death.
18 Míenyae be ame si nye Mawu ƒe vi la metsɔa nu vɔ̃ wɔwɔ ɖoa dɔe o, ke boŋ Mawu ƒe vi la dzɔa eŋu, eye vɔ̃ɖitɔ la mekpɔa ŋusẽ ɖe edzi o.
18 We know that anyone who has been born out of God does not sin, but he who was born out of God keeps him and the Evil One does not touch him.

19 Míenyae be Mawu me míetso, ke xexe blibo la katã le vɔ̃ɖitɔ la ƒe ŋusẽ te. 20 Ke míenyae be Mawu ƒe Vi la va, eye wòna nugɔmesese deto mí be míadze si nyateƒetɔ la. Eye míele ɖekawɔwɔ me kple nyateƒetɔ la, to Via Yesu Kristo dzi.

19 We know that we belong with God; and the world is all lying in the Evil One; 20 but we know that the Son of God has come and has given us a mind to know the True One; and we are in the True One, in his Son Jesus Christ.
Nyateƒetɔ lae nye Mawu vavã la kple agbe mavɔ dzɔtsoƒe la.
This is the true God, and eternal life.
21 Vinye lɔlɔ̃awo, mikpɔ mia ɖokui dzi le trɔ̃wo ŋu.
21 Children, guard yourselves against the idols.
2 Yohanes
2 John

1 Nye, ame tsitsi lae le agbalẽ sia ŋlɔm ɖo ɖe aƒenɔ tiatia la kple viawo, ame siwo melɔ̃ vevie, eye menye nye ɖeɖe ko o, ke ame siwo katã va dze si nyateƒe la hã, 2 le nyateƒe si kpɔtɔ le mía me, si anɔ kpli mí tegbee la ta. 3 Amenuveve, nublanuikpɔkpɔ kple ŋutifafa si tso Mawu Fofo la, kple Yesu Kristo, Fofo la ƒe Vi la gbɔ la, anɔ kpli mí le nyateƒe kple lɔlɔ̃ me.

1 The Elder to the chosen lady and her children, whom I love in truth, and not I alone but also all who know the truth, 2 because of the truth that abides in us and shall be with us forever: 3 grace, mercy, peace, shall be with us from God the Father and from Jesus Christ the Father’s Son, in truth and love.
4 Dzi dzɔm ŋutɔ esi mekpɔ be viwò aɖewo le zɔzɔm le nyateƒe la me, abe ale si ko míexɔ sedede tso Fofo la gbɔ ene.
4 I have been exceedingly glad to find some children of yours walking in truth as we received a commandment from the Father.
5 Eya ta fifia la, mele kuku ɖem na wò, aƒenɔ, be míalɔ̃ mía nɔewo.
5 And now, lady, not as writing you a new commandment but the one we had from the first, I pray you that we love each other.
(Menye se yeye wònye ŋlɔm mele na wò o, ke boŋ esi le mía si tso gɔmedzedzea me ke la koe.) 6 Eye lɔlɔ̃ lae nye be, míayi edzi azɔ le eƒe sededewo nu.
6 And this is love, that we should walk in accordance with his commandments.
Esiae nye sedede la, abe ale si miesee tso gɔmedzedzea me ene, be miayi edzi azɔ le lɔlɔ̃ me.
This is the commandment, as you heard from the first, that you should walk in it.
7 Elabena ameblela geɖewo do go yi xexea me, ame siwo meʋua Yesu Kristo me be eva le ŋutilã me o. Esiae nye ameblela la kple Kristo ƒe futɔ la.
7 Because there have come out into the world many deluders who do not acknowledge that Jesus Christ is coming in flesh: that man is the deluder and the antichrist.
8 Mikpɔ mia ɖokui dzi nyuie be nu si míewɔ dɔ kpɔ la nagabu ɖe mi o, ke boŋ be miaxɔ fetu blibo la.
8 Look out for yourselves that you do not lose what we worked for, but get paid in full.
9 Ame sia ame si ʋlina be yeayi ŋgɔ, gake melina ɖe Kristo la ƒe nufiafia me o la, mexɔ Mawu o. Ame si nɔa nufiafia sia me la, eyae nye ame si xɔ Fofo la kple Vi la siaa.
9 Anyone who moves on and does not remain in the Christ’s teaching does not have God; it is he who remains in the teaching that has both the Father and the Son.
10 Ne ame aɖe va mia gbɔ eye metsɔ nufiafia sia vɛ o la, migaxɔe ɖe miaƒe aƒe me alo ado gbe nɛ kura o. 11 Elabena ame si do gbe nɛ la kpɔ gome kplii le eƒe dɔwɔwɔ vɔ̃ɖiawo me.

10 If anyone comes to you and does not bring this teaching, do not receive him in a house and do not say good morning to him, 11 for he who says good morning to him is in fellowship with his evil deeds.

12 Togbɔ be nya geɖewo li maŋlɔ na mi hã la, nyemedi be mazã agbalẽ kple agbalẽŋlɔtsi atsɔ aŋlɔe o, ke mele mɔ kpɔm be mava mia gbɔ ahaƒo nu kpli mi ŋkume kple ŋkume, ale be miakpɔ dzidzɔ wòade edeƒe.
12 While I have much to write to you, I do not wish to with paper and ink, but hope to be with you and speak face to face, that your joy may be complete.
13 Nɔviwònyɔnu si nye ame tiatia la ƒe viwo do gbe na wò.
13 Your chosen sister’s children send greetings.
3 Yohanes
3 John
1 Nye, ame tsitsi lae le agbalẽ sia ŋlɔm ɖo ɖe Gayo lɔlɔ̃tɔ, ame si melɔ̃ vevie.
1 The Elder to dear Gaius, whom I love in truth:
2 Lɔlɔ̃tɔ, medoa gbe ɖa be nu sia nu nadze edzi na wò, eye nànɔ lãmesẽ me, abe ale si nu le edzi dzem na wòe ene.
2 Dear friend, I pray that you may prosper about everything, and have sound health, as your soul is prospering.
3 Elabena mekpɔ dzidzɔ ŋutɔ esi nɔviwo va heɖi ɖase be nèlé nyateƒe la me ɖe asi, eye be nèyi edzi le zɔzɔm le nyateƒe la me.
3 For I was exceedingly glad when brothers came and testified to your truth, as you are walking in the truth.
4 Nyemekpɔ dzidzɔ gã wu esia o: be mase be vinyewo yi edzi le zɔzɔm le nyateƒe la me.
4 I have no greater gladness than this, to hear that my children are walking in the truth.

Meɖe kuku, do mɔ ame siawo ne woayi woƒe mɔzɔzɔ si dze Mawu ŋu la dzi. 7 Elabena eƒe ŋkɔ la tae wodo yi ɖo, eye womexɔ naneke tso dukɔwo me tɔwo si o. 8 Eya ta ele na mí be míaxɔ ame siawo tɔgbi nyuie awɔ amedzro na wo, ale be míazu hadɔwɔlawo le nyateƒe la me.

5 Dear friend, you are doing a Christian thing in anything you are doing for the brothers who are at the same time strangers in your locality, 6 who have testified to your love before the church; to whom you will do well to give a send-off worthy of God, 7 for they went out for the Name, not taking anything from the heathen 8 so we ought to contribute to the support of such, that we may become cooperators with the truth.
9 Meŋlɔ nya aɖe na hamea, ke Diotrefo, si dina be yeanɔ nɔƒe gbãtɔ le wo dome la, mexɔa naneke tso mía gbɔ bubutɔe o.
9 I wrote something to the church; but Diotrephes, who is so fond of being first among them, will not give us a hearing.

10 Esia tae ne meva la, maɖo ŋku nu siwo wɔm wòle, si nye nya vlo siwo gblɔm wòle tsɔ le mía ŋu gblẽm la dzi. Eye esi nu siawo mesu eme nɛ o la, eya ŋutɔ mexɔa nɔviawo bubutɔe o, eye ame siwo di be yewoaxɔ wo la, edzea agbagba be yeaxe mɔ na wo, eye be yeaɖe wo le hamea me.

10 For this reason, if I come, I will bring up the matter of his actions in gabbling wicked words against us, and, not content with that, not giving the brothers a hearing himself, and also forbidding and expelling from the church those who would be willing to.
11 Lɔlɔ̃tɔ, mègasrɔ̃ nu vɔ̃ɖi wɔwɔ o, ke srɔ̃ nu nyui wɔwɔ boŋ.
11 Dear friend, do not imitate what is wrong but what is right.
Ame si wɔa nu nyui la, etso Mawu me. Ame si wɔa nu vɔ̃ɖi la, mekpɔ Mawu o.
He who does right comes of God; he who does wrong has not seen God.
12 Nɔviawo katã ɖi ɖase nyui le Demetrio ŋu, eye nyateƒea ŋutɔ hã ɖi ɖase le eŋu.
12 Demetrius is vouched for by everybody and by the truth itself; and we too vouch, and you know our testimony is true.
13 Nya geɖewo le asinye maŋlɔ na wò hafi, ke nyemedi be matsɔ nuŋlɔti kple agbalẽŋlɔtsi ayi nuŋɔŋlɔa dzi o.
13 I had much to write to you, but do not wish to write you by pen and ink; 14 but I hope to see you at once, and we shall speak face to face.
Ŋutifafa nanɔ kpli wò.
Peace be upon you.
Xɔlɔ̃awo do gbe na wò.
Our friends send greetings.
Yɔ xɔlɔ̃awo ŋkɔ ɖekaɖeka nàdo gbe na wo nam.
Give personal greetings to our friends.
Yuda
Jude

1 Yuda, Yesu Kristo ƒe kluvi, ame si nye Yakobo nɔvi, le esia ŋlɔm ɖo ɖe ame siwo woyɔ, siwo Mawu Fofo la lɔ̃, eye wòkpɔ wo ta na Yesu Kristo: 2 Nublanuikpɔkpɔ kple ŋutifafa kpakple lɔlɔ̃ nadzi ɖe edzi na mi.
1 Judah, servant of Jesus Christ and brother of James, to the called who are loved in God the Father and kept for Jesus Christ: 2 mercy and peace and love be yours in abundance.

3 Lɔlɔ̃tɔwo, togbɔ be menɔ agbagba dzem vevie be maŋlɔ xɔxɔ si mí katã míakpɔ ŋu nya ɖo ɖe mi hã la, mekpɔe be ehiã be maŋlɔ agbalẽ na mi atsɔ axlɔ̃ nu mi be miaʋli sesĩe hena xɔse si wotsɔ na ame kɔkɔewo zi ɖeka ɖe ɣeyiɣiawo katã nu la boŋ.

3 Dear friends, while I was doing my utmost to write to you about our common salvation, I have found it necessary to write you an exhortation to do battle for the faith once delivered to God’s people.

4 Susu si tae nye be, ame aɖewo va tra ɖe mia dome dzaa, ame siwo Ŋɔŋlɔawo ɖo ɖi hena ʋɔnudɔdrɔ̃ sia ɣeyiɣi didi aɖee nye esia; wonye ame mavɔ̃mawuwo, ame siwo trɔa mía Mawu ƒe amenuveve la wòzua mɔɖeɖe ɖe ŋukpenanuwɔwɔ dzimesesẽtɔe ŋu, eye womewɔa nuteƒe na míaƒe Aƒetɔ ɖeka kolia, si nye Yesu Kristo, ame si tɔ míenye la o.
4 For there have slipped in some men forewritten of old for this doom, impious men who shift the grace of our God into immorality and repudiate our only Master and Lord, Jesus Christ.

5 Togbɔ be mienya nu siawo katã nyuie hã la, medi be magaɖo ŋku edzi na mi be Yehowa ɖe dukɔ aɖe tso Egipte-nyigba dzi, gake emegbe etsrɔ̃ ame siwo meɖe xɔse fia o la. 6 Eye mawudɔla siwo menɔ afi si woda wo ɖo le gɔmedzedzea me o, ke boŋ wogblẽ woawo ŋutɔwo ƒe nɔƒe ɖi la, ede kɔsɔkɔsɔ mavɔwo wo, eye wòdzra wo ɖo ɖe viviti tsiɖitsiɖi me hena ŋkeke gã la ƒe ʋɔnudɔdrɔ̃. 7 Nenema kee Sodom kple Gomora kpakple du siwo ƒo xlã wo hã ƒo wo ɖokuiwo ɖe gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu me wògbɔ eme, eye wodze ŋutilã ƒe nudzodzro si mele dzɔdzɔme nu o la yome; wotsɔ wo wɔ nuxlɔ̃amekpɔɖeŋu na mí, esi wotsɔ dzo mavɔ he to na woe.

5 But I would remind you, though you know the whole once for all, that after the Lord had saved a people out of the land of Egypt he in the second instance destroyed those who did not believe, 6 and angels who did not keep their prerogative but left their domicile he has kept under darkness by everlasting fetters for the judgment of the Great Day, 7 as Sodom and Gomorrah and the cities around them, having run into debauchery and gone after another flesh in like manner with these, are on exhibition as an example, undergoing the penalty of eternal fire.
8 Ke hã, ame siawo hã kua drɔ̃e, woƒoa ɖi ŋutilã la, wodoa vlo ŋusẽ si ɖua wo dzi la, eye woƒoa nu gbegblẽ tso ŋutikɔkɔemewo ŋu.
8 However, in the same fashion these too, obsessed by dreams, pollute flesh, and set lordship aside, and vilify glories.

9 Ke esi nya ɖo mawudɔla gãtɔ Mikael kple Abosam dome, eye wòle nya hem kplii le Mose ƒe kukua ŋu la, mete kpɔ be yeagblɔ nya vlo aɖeke atsɔ abu fɔe o, ke boŋ egblɔ be: "Yehowa neka mo na wò. " 10 Gake ame siawo le nu gbegblẽ ƒom le nu siwo katã gɔme womese ŋutɔŋutɔ o la ŋu.

9 But the archangel Michael, when he was arguing with the Devil over the body of Moses, did not dare to prefer a defamation-charge, but said "The Lord rebuke you! " 10 But these vilify whatever they do not know; and what they do by nature make out like the brutes, in this they find their undoing.
Ke le nu siwo katã gɔme wose le dzɔdzɔme nu abe lã manyanuwo ene me la, woyi edzi le nu gblẽm le wo ɖokuiwo ŋu.
11 Woe to them, because they have traveled Cain’s road, and streamed over Balaam’s devious course for pay, and perished in Korah’s sedition.

11 Baba na wo, elabena woto Kain ƒe ʋe me, eye woƒu du dze Bileam ƒe mɔ vɔ̃ɖi la dzi hena fetu, eye wotsrɔ̃ le Kora ƒe nuƒoƒo aglãdzedzetɔe la me! 12 Ame siawoe nye agakpe siwo ɣla ɖe tɔ gɔme, siwo le nu ɖum kpli mi le miaƒe lɔlɔ̃kplɔ̃ɖoɖowo me, alẽkplɔla siwo nyia wo ɖokuiwo vɔvɔ̃manɔmee; alilikpo siwo me tsi mele o, siwo ya lɔna yina gbɔnae; ati siwo li va se ɖe kele ƒe nuwuwu, gake wometsea ku o, woku zi eve, eye woho wo; 13 wonye ƒutsotsoe dzeagbo siwo kplɔa woawo ŋutɔwo ƒe ŋukpenanuwo ƒe futukpɔ va kɔna ɖe gota; ɣletivi siwo mezɔna ɖe ɖoɖo aɖeke nu o, siwo wodzra viviti tsiɖitsiɖi ɖo ɖi na tegbee.

12 These are those "who in your love-feasts fearlessly feast with you, and are your sunken rocks, " shepherds that feed themselves, waterless clouds carried along by winds, twice-dead fruitless autumn trees uprooted, 13 wild sea waves frothing up their own shames, wandering stars for which the blackness of darkness is forever kept.

14 Ɛ̃, Enok, ame si nye adrelia tso Adam dzi, hã gblɔ nya ɖi tso wo ŋu, esi wògblɔ be: "Kpɔ ɖa! Yehowa va kple eƒe ame kɔkɔe akpeakpewo, 15 be yeadrɔ̃ ʋɔnu wo katã, eye yeabu fɔ ame mavɔ̃mawuwo katã le woƒe mawumavɔmavɔ̃nu siwo wowɔ le mawumavɔmavɔ̃ me, kple nya baɖa siwo katã nu vɔ̃ wɔla mavɔ̃mawuwo gblɔ tso eŋu la ta. " 16 Ame siawo nye liʋiliʋĩlĩlawo, ame siwo toa nyatoƒoe le esi nu medzea wo ŋu o ta, ame siwo zɔna le woawo ŋutɔwo ƒe nudzodzrowo nu, wotsɔa woƒe nu ƒoa adegbe gãwo, eye wodoa vivi ɖe amewo ŋu le woawo ŋutɔwo ƒe viɖe kpɔkpɔ ta.

14 And it was to these too that Enoch, seventh from Adam, prophesied "Here the Lord has come with his holy millions 15 to do justice upon all and to call all the impious to account regarding all their impieties that they have committed, and regarding all the hard words that impious sinners have spoken against him. " 16 These are faultfinding grumblers, going by their own desires, with mouths that pour out extravagant talk, deferring to persons for profit’s sake.

17 Ke miawo la, lɔlɔ̃tɔwo, miɖo ŋku nya siwo mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe apostolowo gblɔ do ŋgɔ la dzi, 18 ale si wonɔ gbɔgblɔm na mi be: "Le ɣeyiɣi mamlɛa me la, fewuɖulawo ava, ame siwo ati woawo ŋutɔwo ƒe mawumavɔmavɔ̃ ƒe nudzodzrowo yome. " 19 Ame siawoe dea mama amewo me, ame siwo le abe lãwo ene, siwo mebua gbɔgbɔmenuwo ŋu o.

17 But as for you, dear friends, remember the words spoken beforehand by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ, 18 how they told you "In the end of time there will be mockers going by their own desires for impieties. " 19 These are the discriminators, soul-men who have no spirit.

20 Ke miawo la, lɔlɔ̃tɔwo, mitu mia ɖokuiwo ɖo ɖe miaƒe xɔse kɔkɔetɔ la dzi, mido gbe ɖa le gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔe me, 21 eye minɔ Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ̃ la me ɖaa, esi miele mía Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe nublanuikpɔkpɔ lalam hena agbe mavɔ kpɔkpɔ.

20 But do you, dear friends, building yourselves up upon your most holy faith, praying in Holy Spirit, 21 keep yourselves in the love of God, watching for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ which brings us to eternal life.

22 Azɔ hã, miyi edzi mianɔ nublanui kpɔm na ame siwo me ɖikekewo le; 23 mihe wo do goe tso dzo la me ne miaxɔ wo ɖe agbe. Ke miyi edzi miakpɔ nublanui na ame bubuwo, eye miwɔ esia kple vɔvɔ̃, eye milé fu woƒe awu si ŋutilã la ƒo ɖii la gɔ̃ hã.
22 And convince some by proofs when they doubt, 23 and save some by snatching them out of fire, and pity some with fear, hating the very garment spotted by the flesh.

24 Ke ame si ate ŋu adzɔ mia ŋu be miagakli nu o, eye wòana mianɔ te anye mokakamanɔŋutɔwo le eƒe ŋutikɔkɔe la ŋkume le dzidzɔ gã me, 25 Mawu ɖeka kolia, si nye mía Xɔla to Yesu Kristo, mía Aƒetɔ dzi la, tɔ nanye ŋutikɔkɔe, gãnyenye, ŋusẽ kple dziɖuɖu tso ɣeyiɣi mavɔmavɔ siwo va yi kple fifia, heyi ɖe mavɔmavɔ me. Amen.

24 And to him who can guard you safe from stumbling and set you before his glory blameless and exultant, 25 the only God, our Savior, belong glory, majesty, might, and dominion, before all time and now and to all eternity; amen!
Nyaɖeɖefia
Revelation

1 Yesu Kristo ƒe nyaɖeɖefia si Mawu tsɔ nae be wòaɖe nu siwo ava dzɔ kpuie la afia eƒe kluviwo. Edɔ eƒe mawudɔla ɖa wòva ɖe wo fia eƒe kluvi Yohanes to dzesiwo me, 2 Yohanes ɖi ɖase le Mawu ƒe nya kple ɖase si Yesu Kristo ɖi la ŋu, ɛ̃, le nu siwo katã wòkpɔ la ŋu.

1 Jesus Christ’s revelation which God gave him to show his servants what must soon take place, and which he sent by his angel and indicated to his servant John, 2 who testified to the word of God and to the testimony of Jesus Christ, all that he saw.
3 Dzidzɔtɔe nye ame si xlẽa nyagblɔɖi sia me nyawo sesĩe kple ame siwo sea wo, eye woléa nu siwo woŋlɔ ɖe eme la me ɖe asi, elabena ɣeyiɣi ɖoɖi la tu aƒe.
3 Happy are he who reads and those who hear the words of the prophecy and keep what is written in it; for the time is near.

4 Yohanes le esia ŋlɔm ɖo ɖe hame adre siwo le Asia nuto me: Amenuveve kple ŋutifafa si tso "Ame si li, eye wònɔ anyi, eye wògbɔna " la gbɔ kple esi tso gbɔgbɔ adre siwo le eƒe fiazikpuia ŋgɔ la gbɔ, 5 kpakple esi tso Yesu Kristo, "Ðasefo Nuteƒewɔla la, " "ame kukuwo dome ŋgɔgbevi la, " kple "anyigbadzifiawo ƒe Dziɖula la " gbɔ la, nanɔ anyi kpli mi.

4 John to the seven churches in Asia: Grace to you, and peace, from him who Is and Was and Is Coming, and from the Seven Spirits that are before his throne, 5 and from Jesus Christ the faithful witness, the firstborn of the dead and the ruler of the kings of the earth.

Ame si lɔ̃a mí, eye wòna ablɔɖe mí tso míaƒe nu vɔ̃wo me to eya ŋutɔ ƒe ʋu me 6 eye wòwɔ mí míenye fiaɖuƒe kple nunɔlawo na eƒe Mawu kple Fofoa ɛ̃, eya tɔ nanye ŋutikɔkɔe kple ŋusẽ yi mavɔmavɔ me. Amen.

To him who loves us and liberated us from our sins with his blood, 6 and made us into a kingdom, priests to his God and Father, belong glory and might forever and ever; amen! 7 Lo, he is coming with the clouds, and every eye shall see him, and they who pierced him, and all the tribes of the earth shall wail over him.
7 Kpɔ ɖa!
Yes; amen
8 "Nyee nye Alfa kple Omega, " Yehowa Mawu, "Ame si li, eye wònɔ anyi, eye wògbɔna, Ŋusẽkatãtɔ la, " ye gblɔe.
8 I am the A and the Z, says the Lord God; the one who Is and Was and Is Coming; the Almighty.
9 Nye, Yohanes, mia nɔvi, si kpɔ gome kpli mi le xaxa kple fiaɖuƒe kpakple dzidodo me le Yesu ta la, menɔ ƒukpo si woyɔna be Patmo la dzi le nuƒoƒo tso Mawu ŋu kple ɖaseɖiɖi le Yesu ŋu ta.
9 I, John, your brother and fellow-participator in distress and royalty and endurance in Jesus, was in the island called Patmos for the word of God and the testimony of Jesus.

10 Gbɔgbɔ la kplɔm yi Aƒetɔ la ƒe ŋkeke la me, eye mese gbe sesẽ aɖe le megbenye abe kpẽ ƒe ɖiɖi ene, 11 gblɔ be: "Nu si nèkpɔ la, ŋlɔe ɖe agbalẽ me, eye nàɖoe ɖe hame adre, siwo le Efeso, Smirna, Pergamo, Tiatira, Sardes, Filadelfia kple Laodikea. " 12 Metrɔ be makpɔ ame si le nu ƒom kplim la, eye esi metrɔ la, mekpɔ sikakaɖiti adre, 13 eye ame aɖe le akaɖitiawo titina si le abe amegbetɔvi ene, edo awu ʋlaya legbe, si ɖo afɔgɔme nɛ, eye wòtsɔ sikanudziblanu bla akɔta. 14 Gawu la, eƒe ta kple taɖa fu tititi abe alẽfu ɣi alo sno ene, eye eƒe ŋkuwo le abe dzoƒaɖe ene, 15 eye eƒe afɔwo le abe akɔbli nyui si wode kpo me wòbiã hẽe ene, eye eƒe gbe le abe tsi geɖewo ƒe gbeɖiɖi ene. 16 Elé ɣletivi adre ɖe nuɖusi, eye yi ɖaɖɛ nuevee legbe aɖe le dodom tso eƒe nu me, eye eƒe mo le abe ɣe si le keklẽm sesĩe ene.

10 I was in the spirit on the Lord’s day, and heard behind me a loud voice, as if it were the sound of a trumpet 11 saying "What you see, write in a book and send to the seven churches, to Ephesus and to Smyrna and to Pergamum and to Thyatira and to Sardis and to Philadelphia and to Laodicea. " 12 And I turned around to see the voice that was speaking with me; and when I turned around I saw seven golden lampstands, 13 and in the midst of the lampstands the like of a son of man dressed in a long robe and belted at the breast with a golden belt, 14 his head and hair white like white wool, like snow, and his eyes like flame, 15 and his feet like green gold as if it had been refined in a furnace, and his voice like the sound of much water; 16 with seven stars in his right hand and a sharp two-edged sword coming out of his mouth; and his appearance like the sun when it shines its strongest.
17 Esi mekpɔe la, medze anyi ɖe eƒe afɔnu abe ame kuku ene. Eye wòda eƒe nuɖusi ɖe dzinye gblɔ be: "Mègavɔ̃ o.
17 And when I saw him I fell at his feet like a dead man; and he put his right hand on me, saying
Nyee nye Gbãtɔ la kple Mlɔetɔ la, 18 kple ame si le agbe, eye meku kpɔ, ke kpɔ ɖa, mele agbe tegbetegbe, eye ku kple Tsiẽƒe ƒe safuiwo le asinye.
"Do not be afraid; I am the first and the last, 18 he who is alive and was dead and is alive, lo, forever and ever, and has the keys of death and the grave.
19 Eya ta ŋlɔ nu siwo nèkpɔ kple nu siwo le dzɔdzɔm fifia kpakple nu siwo gbɔna dzɔdzɔ ge le nu siawo megbe la ɖi.
19 So write what you saw, and what is, and what is to be after this.

20 Ke nya ɣaɣla kɔkɔe si le ɣletivi adre siwo nèkpɔ le nye nuɖusi me kple sikakaɖiti adreawo ŋu lae nye esi: Ɣletivi adreawo le tsitre ɖi na hame adreawo ƒe dɔlawo, eye akaɖiti adreawo le tsitre ɖi na hame adreawo.

20 The secret meaning of the seven stars that you saw lying in my right hand, and the seven golden lampstands: the seven stars are the angels of the seven churches; and the lampstands seven, seven churches.
Nyaɖeɖefia
Revelation

2 "Ŋlɔ ɖo ɖe hame si le Efeso la ƒe dɔla be: Nya siwo ame si lé ɣletivi adreawo ɖe eƒe nuɖusi, eye wòzɔna le sikakaɖiti adreawo domee la, gblɔe nye esi: 2 ‘Menya wò dɔwɔwɔwo, wò kutrikuku kple wò dzidodo, eye be màte ŋu aɖe mɔ ɖe ame vɔ̃ɖiwo ŋu o, eye èdo ame siwo gblɔna be apostolowo yewonye evɔ womenyee o la kpɔ hekpɔe be aʋatsokalawo wonye. 3 Azɔ hã èle dzi dom, eye nènɔ te ɖe nu geɖewo nu le nye ŋkɔ la ta, eye ɖeɖi mete ŋuwò o.

2 "To the angel of the church in Ephesus write, ‘Says he who holds the seven stars in his right hand, he who walks in the midst of the seven golden lampstands: 2 I know your deeds and your labor and endurance; and that you cannot bear bad men, and you tested those who call themselves apostles and are not, and found them liars; 3 and you have endurance, and have borne things on account of my name and are not tired.

4 Ke hã, nya si le asinye ɖe ŋuwòe nye be, ègblẽ lɔlɔ̃ si nɔ asiwò gbã la ɖi. 5 "‘Eya ta ɖo ŋku afi si nège tso la dzi, eye nàtrɔ dzi me, eye nàwɔ dɔ siwo nèwɔna tsã la. Ne menye nenema o la, mava gbɔwò, eye maɖe wò akaɖiti la ɖa le enɔƒe, negbe ɖe nètrɔ dzi me ko hafi.

4 But I have against you your having left off your first love; 5 so remember what you have fallen from, and repent and do the deeds that you did at first; else you shall find me coming, and I will move your lampstand out of its place if you do not repent.
6 Ke hã, mekpɔ nu nyui sia le ŋuwò be: èlé fu Nikolai ƒe kɔmama la ƒe nuwɔnawo, siwo nye hã melé fui.
6 But this you have, that you hate the deeds of the Nicolaitans, which I too hate.
7 Ame si to li na la nese nya si gblɔm gbɔgbɔ la le na hameawo: Ame si ɖu dzi la, maɖe mɔ nɛ wòaɖu agbeti, si le Mawu ƒe paradisoa me la ƒe ɖe.’
7 Let him who has an ear hear what it is that the Spirit is saying to the churches. To the victor I will give the privilege of eating from the tree of life that is in God’s paradise.’

8 "Ŋlɔ ɖo ɖe hame si le Smirna la ƒe dɔla be: Nya siwo ‘Gbãtɔ la kple Mlɔetɔ la,’ ame si ku, eye wògagbɔ agbe la, gblɔe nye esi: 9 ‘Menya wò xaxa kple ahedada, gake kesinɔtɔ nènye, eye menya ame siwo gblɔna be Yudatɔwo yewonye, evɔ womenyee o, ke boŋ Satana ƒe ƒuƒoƒe me tɔwo wonye la, ƒe busunyagbɔgblɔ.

8 "And to the angel of the church in Smyrna write, ‘Says the First and the Last, he who was dead and came to life: 9 I know your distress and your poverty (but you are rich) and your vilification on the part of those who profess to be Jews and are not but are a congregation of Satan.
10 Mègavɔ̃ fu siwo nàva kpe kpuie la o. Kpɔ ɖa! Abosam ade mia dometɔ aɖewo gaxɔ me bena woado mi akpɔ bliboe, ne miakpɔ xaxa ŋkeke ewo.
10 Do not be afraid of what you are to suffer: lo, the devil is to throw some of you into prison that you may be tested, and you shall have ten days’ distress.
Wɔ nuteƒe va se ɖe ku me ke, eye mana agbefiakuku wò.
Be faithful even to death, and I will give you the wreath of life.
11 Ame si to li na la nese nya si gblɔm gbɔgbɔ la le na hameawo: Ame si ɖu dzi la, ku evelia mawɔ nu vevii o.’
11 Let him who has an ear hear what it is that the Spirit is saying to the churches. The victor shall not be hurt by the second death.’

12 "Ŋlɔ ɖo ɖe hame si le Pergamo la ƒe dɔla be: Nya siwo ame si si yi ɖaɖɛ nuevee legbe la le la gblɔe nye esi: 13 ‘Menya afi si nèle. Eyae nye afi si Satana ƒe fiazikpui le; gake èyi edzi lé nye ŋkɔ me ɖe asi sesĩe, ègaxɔ dzinye se kokoko, mègbe nu le gbɔnye le Antipa, nye ɖasefo nuteƒewɔla si wowu le mia gbɔ, afi si Satana le la, ŋɔli gɔ̃ hã o.

12 "And to the angel of the church in Pergamum write, ‘Says he who has the sharp two-edged sword: 13 I know where you live where Satan’s throne is; and you hold on to my name, and did not deny my faith even in the days of my witness Antipas, my faithful one, who was killed in your town, where Satan lives.

14 "‘Ke hã, nya ʋɛ aɖewo le asinye ɖe ŋuwò: eyae nye be ame siwo lé Bileam ƒe nufiafia me ɖe asi la le gbɔwò afi ma; ame sia fia Balak be wòada nukikli ɖe Israel-viwo ŋgɔ, ne woaɖu nu siwo wotsɔ sa vɔ na trɔ̃wo, eye woaƒo wo ɖokui ɖe gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu me.

14 But I have a few things against you, because you have there people who hold the teaching of Balaam, who taught Balak to lay a snare to trip up the sons of Israel, to eat things sacrificed to idols and to have immoral relations between the sexes.
15 Nenema kee ame siwo lé Nikolai ƒe kɔmama la ƒe nufiafia me ɖe asi la hã le gbɔwò.
15 Just so you too have men who similarly hold the teaching of the Nicolaitans.
16 Eya ta trɔ dzi me. Ne menye nenema o la, megbɔna gbɔwò kaba, eye matsɔ nye numeyi legbe la awɔ aʋa kpli wo.
16 So repent; else you shall quickly find me coming, and I will make war on them with my mouth-sword.

17 "‘Ame si to li na la nese nya si gblɔm gbɔgbɔ la le na hameawo: Ame si ɖu dzi la, matsɔ mana ɣaɣla la ƒe ɖe anae, eye mana kpe ɣi aɖe si dzi woŋlɔ ŋkɔ yeye aɖe ɖo lae; ame aɖeke menya ŋkɔ ma o, negbe ame si xɔe la ko.’

17 Let him who has an ear hear what it is that the Spirit is saying to the churches. To the victor I will give a portion of the hidden manna; and I will give him a white stone, and inscribed on the stone a new name which no one but the receiver knows.’

18 "Ŋlɔ ɖo ɖe hame si le Tiatira la ƒe dɔla be: Nya siwo Mawu ƒe Vi la, ame si ƒe ŋkuwo le abe dzoƒaɖe ene, eye eƒe afɔwo le abe akɔbli nyui ene la, gblɔe nye esi: 19 ‘Menya wò dɔwɔwɔwo, wò lɔlɔ̃, wò xɔse, wò subɔsubɔdɔ kple wò dzidodo, eye wò dɔwɔwɔ fifitɔwo wu tsãtɔwo.

18 "And to the angel of the church in Thyatira write, ‘Says the Son of God, he who has eyes like flame and feet like green gold: 19 I know your deeds, and your love and faith and service and endurance, and that your last deeds are more than your first.

20 "‘Ke hã, nya si le asinye ɖe ŋuwòe nye be: èɖe mɔ na Izebel, nyɔnu ma si yɔa eɖokui nyagblɔɖila, eye wòfiaa nu nye kluviwo heflua wo be woaƒo wo ɖokuiwo ɖe gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu me ahaɖu nu siwo wotsɔ sa vɔ na trɔ̃wo. 21 Mena ɣeyiɣii be wòatrɔ dzi me, gake egbe dzimetɔtrɔ tso eƒe gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenua me. 22 Kpɔ ɖa!

20 But I have against you your permitting the woman Jezebel, her who calls herself a prophetess and teaches and misleads my servants to have immoral relations between the sexes and to eat things sacrificed to idols, 21 and I gave her time to repent and she is not willing to repent of her immorality.

Matsɔe aƒu dɔba dzi kpuie, eye made ame siwo le ahasi wɔm kplii la xaxa gã aɖe me, negbe ɖe wotrɔ dzi me hetrɔ tso eƒe dɔwɔwɔwo me ko hafi. 23 Eye matsɔ dɔvɔ̃ dziŋɔ awu viawo, ale be hameawo katã nanyae be, nyee dzroa dzimesusuwo kple dziwo me kpɔ, eye maɖo eteƒe na mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe ɖe eƒe dɔwɔwɔwo nu.

22 Lo, I will stretch her on a couch, and throw those who commit adultery with her into great distress if they do not repent of her dealings, 23 and will kill her children with an epidemic, and all the churches shall know that I am he who searches hearts and bosoms; and I will give to each of you according to his deeds.

24 "‘Ke hã, mele egblɔm na mi ame mamlɛ siwo le Tiatira, ame siwo katã meléa nufiafia sia me ɖe asi o, ame siwo menya naneke tso nu siwo yɔm wole be "Satana ƒe nu goglowo " ŋu o la be: Nyemele agba bubu aɖeke dam ɖe mia dzi o.

24 But you others in Thyatira, as many as do not have this teaching, those who do not, as they say, know the deep things of Satan, to you I say, I put on you no other burden; 25 what you have, though, hold till I come.

26 Ame si lé nye dɔwɔwɔwo me ɖe asi va se ɖe nuwuwu eye wòɖu dzi la, mana ŋusẽe ɖe dukɔwo dzi, 27 eye wòatsɔ gatikplɔ akplɔ wo, ale be woagbã gudugudu abe anyinuwo ene, abe ale si ko mexɔ ŋusẽ tso Fofonye gbɔ ene. 28 Eye mana ŋukeɣletivi lae.

And to the victor, 26 the man who keeps my dealings till the end, I will give dominion over the nations, 27 that he should drive them with an iron rod as earthen dishes are shattered, as I too received from my Father; 28 and I will give him the morning star.
29 Ame si to li na la nese nya si gblɔm gbɔgbɔ la le na hameawo.’
29 Let him who has an ear hear what it is that the Spirit is saying to the churches.’
Nyaɖeɖefia
Revelation
3 "Ŋlɔ ɖo ɖe hame si le Sardes la ƒe dɔla be: Nya siwo ame si si Mawu ƒe gbɔgbɔ adreawo kple ɣletivi adreawo le la, gblɔe nye esi: ‘Menya wò dɔwɔwɔwo, èxɔ ŋkɔ be èle agbe, gake èku.
3 "And to the angel of the church in Sardis write, ‘Says he who has the Seven Spirits of God and the seven stars: I know your deeds, that you have the name of being alive and are dead.

2 Nɔ ŋudzɔ, eye nàdo ŋusẽ nu siwo susɔ siwo le kukum la, elabena nyemekpɔe be èwɔ wò dɔwo bliboe le nye Mawu ŋkume o. 3 Eya ta nɔ ŋku ɖom nu si nèxɔ kple nu si nèse la dzi, eye yi edzi nàlé eme ɖe asi, eye nàtrɔ dzi me.

2 Get awake, and strengthen what is left, that was about to die; for I have not found work of yours accomplished before my God; 3 so remember how it was that you received and heard, and keep it and repent.
Ke ne mènyɔ o la, mava abe fiafitɔ ene, eye mànya gaƒoƒo si dzi mava do ɖe dziwò la kura o.
So if you do not keep awake I will come like a thief, and you shall not know at what hour I will come upon you.
4 "‘Ke hã, ame ʋɛ aɖewo le mewò le Sardes, siwo meƒo ɖi woƒe awuwo o, eye woazɔ kplim le awu ɣiwo me, elabena wodze.
4 But you have a few names in Sardis that did not soil their clothing, and they shall walk with me in white, because they are worthy to.
5 Ame si ɖu dzi la, woado awu ɣiwo nɛ, eye nyematutu eƒe ŋkɔ ɖa le agbegbalẽ la me akpɔ o, ke boŋ maʋu eƒe ŋkɔ me le Fofonye ŋkume kple eƒe dɔlawo ŋkume.
5 The victor shall be thus clad in white clothing; and I will not blot out his name from the book of life, and I will acknowledge his name before my Father and before his angels.
6 Ame si to li na la nese nya si gblɔm gbɔgbɔ la le na hameawo.’
6 Let him who has an ear hear what it is that the Spirit is saying to the churches.’

7 "Ŋlɔ ɖo ɖe hame si le Filadelfia la ƒe dɔla be: Nya siwo ame si le kɔkɔe, ame si nye nyateƒetɔ, ame si si David ƒe safui la le, ame si ʋunɛ ale be ame aɖeke metunɛ o, eye wòtunɛ ale be ame aɖeke meʋunɛ o la, gblɔe nye esi: 8 ‘Menya wò dɔwɔwɔwo. Kpɔ ɖa, metsɔ ʋɔtru aɖe si le ʋuʋu ɖi la ɖo ŋkuwòme, si ame aɖeke mate ŋu atu o.

7 "And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write, ‘Says the Holy, the True, he who has David’s key, who opens and nobody shall shut, and shuts and nobody shall open: 8 I know your deeds; lo, I have set before you an open door which nobody can shut, because you have a little power and have kept my word and not disowned my name.
9 Kpɔ ɖa, mana Satana ƒe ƒuƒoƒe me tɔ siwo gblɔna be Yudatɔwo yewonye, evɔ womenyee o ke boŋ aʋatso kam wole la, nava bɔbɔ ɖe wò afɔnu ade bubu ŋuwò, eye mana woanyae be melɔ̃ wò.
9 Lo, I grant men out of Satan’s congregation, of those who profess to be Jews and are not but are lying, lo, I will make them come and do reverence before your face and know that I have loved you.
10 Esi nèlé nye dzidodo ŋuti nya la me ɖe asi ta la, nye hã makpɔ tawò le dodokpɔ ƒe gaƒoƒo si gbɔna anyigbadzinɔlawo katã dzi be wòado ame siwo katã le anyigba dzi kpɔ la me.
10 Because you kept my word of endurance, so will I keep you from the hour of testing that is to come all over the world of men, to test those who live on the earth.
11 Megbɔna kpuie. Lé nu si le asiwò la me ɖe asi goŋgoŋ, ale be ame aɖeke nagaxɔ wò fiakuku la o.
11 I am coming quickly; hold what you have, that no one may get your wreath.

12 "‘Ame si ɖu dzi la, mawɔe wòanye sɔti le nye Mawu ƒe gbedoxɔ la me, eye magado le eme akpɔ o, eye maŋlɔ nye Mawu ƒe ŋkɔ kple nye Mawu ƒe du si nye Yerusalem Yeye, si le ɖiɖim tso dziƒo tso nye Mawu gbɔ la ƒe ŋkɔ kple nye ŋkɔ yeye la ɖe eŋu.

12 The victor I will make a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall never again go outside; and I will inscribe on him the name of my God and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem that is coming down out of heaven from my God, and my new name.
13 Ame si to li na la nese nya si gblɔm gbɔgbɔ la le na hameawo.’
13 Let him who has an ear hear what it is that the Spirit is saying to the churches.’

14 "Ŋlɔ ɖo ɖe hame si le Laodikea la ƒe dɔla be: Nya siwo Amen la, ɖasefo nuteƒewɔla kple nyateƒetɔ, ame si nye Mawu ƒe nuwɔwɔ ƒe gɔmedzedze la, gblɔe nye esi: 15 ‘Menya wò dɔwɔwɔwo, be mèfa o, eye mèxɔ dzo hã o.
14 "And to the angel of the church in Laodicea write, ‘Says the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of God’s creation: 15 I know your deeds, that you are neither cold nor hot.
Ðe madi be nàfa alo nàxɔ dzo hafi. 16 Eya ta esi nèle yɔyrɔe, mèxɔ dzo o eye mèfa hã o ta la, matu wò aƒu gbe tso nye nu me.
I wish you were cold or hot! 16 Thus, because you are lukewarm and neither hot nor cold, I am going to vomit you out of my mouth.

17 Elabena ègblɔna be, "Kesinɔtɔ menye, eye kesinɔnuwo le asinye, eye naneke mehiãm kura o, " ke mènya be hiãtɔ, nublanuitɔ, ame dahe, ŋkuagbãtɔ kple amamanɔla yenye o; 18 mele aɖaŋu ɖom na wò be nàƒle sika si wolólo le dzo me hedza eŋu la le asinye be nàzu kesinɔtɔ. Ƒle awu ɣiwo, ne awu nanɔ ŋuwò, be màganɔ amama eye ŋu nakpe wò o. Eye nàƒle ŋkutike be nàsi ɖe wò ŋkuwo ne nàkpɔ nu.

17 Because you say "I am rich, my fortune is made, I am in no want of anything, " and do not know that you are the very one who is wretched and pitiable and poor and blind and naked, 18 I advise you to buy of me fire-refined gold so that you may be rich, and white clothes so that you may be clad and the shame of your nakedness not be exposed, and eye-salve to put on your eyes so that you may see.
19 "‘Ame siwo katã gbɔ nyemelɔ̃a nu le o la, mekaa mo na wo, eye mehea to na wo.
19 As many as I love I reprove and discipline; so be jealous and repent.
Eya ta do vevie nu eye nàtrɔ dzi me. 20 Kpɔ ɖa! Mele tsitre ɖe ʋɔtrua nu le ʋɔa ƒom. Ne ame aɖe se nye gbe, eye wòʋu ʋɔa la, mage ɖe eƒe aƒe me, eye maɖu fiẽnuɖuɖu kplii, eye eya hã aɖui kplim.
20 Here I am standing at the door and knocking: if one hears my voice and opens the door I will come in to him and have supper with him, and he with me.
21 Ame si ɖu dzi la, maɖe mɔ nɛ wòabɔbɔ anɔ nye fiazikpui la dzi kplim, abe ale si nye hã meɖu dzi, eye mebɔbɔ nɔ Fofonye ƒe fiazikpui dzi kplii ene.
21 To the victor I will give a seat with me on my throne, as I too won the victory and took the seat with my Father on his throne.
22 Ame si to li na la nese nya si gblɔm gbɔgbɔ la le na hameawo.’ "
22 Let him who has an ear hear what it is that the Spirit is saying to the churches.’ "
Nyaɖeɖefia
Revelation

4 Le nu sia megbe la, kpɔ ɖa, mekpɔ ʋɔtru aɖe le ʋuʋu le dziƒo, eye gbe gbãtɔ si mese la le abe kpẽ ƒe ɖiɖi ene, eye wògblɔ nam be: "Va dzi afii, ne mafia nu siwo ava dzɔ la wò. " 2 Le esia megbe la, Mawu ƒe gbɔgbɔ va dzinye enumake, eye kpɔ ɖa, mekpɔ fiazikpui aɖe le dziƒo, eye ame aɖe bɔbɔ nɔ fiazikpui la dzi. 3 Ame si bɔbɔ nɔ edzi la ƒe dzedzeme le abe yaspis-kpe kple sardis-kpe ene, eye anyieʋɔ si le abe emerald-kpe ene la ƒo xlã fiazikpui la.

4 After this I saw, and there in the sky was an opened door; and the first voice that I had heard, as if of a trumpet talking with me, saying "Come up here and I will show you what must take place after this. " 2 At once I was in the spirit, and there a throne stood in heaven, and on the throne one was sitting; 3 and he who was sitting there was in aspect like a jaspid stone and a sard; and a rainbow around the throne, in aspect like an emerald.
4 Eye fiazikpui blaeve vɔ ene ƒo xlã fiazikpui la, eye mekpɔ ametsitsi blaeve vɔ ene wobɔbɔ nɔ fiazikpui siawo dzi, wodo awu ʋlaya ɣiwo, eye sikafiakukuwo le ta na wo.
4 And around the throne twenty-four thrones, and sitting on the thrones twenty-four aged men clad in white clothes, and on their heads golden wreaths.

8 Eye aʋala ade li na nu gbagbe eneawo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe; ŋkuwo yɔ aʋalawo ŋuti kple wo me fũu. Eye wole gbɔgblɔm madzudzɔmadzudzɔe zã kple keli be: "Kɔkɔe, kɔkɔe, kɔkɔe nye Yehowa Mawu, Ŋusẽkatãtɔ la, ame si nɔ anyi, eye wòli, eye wògbɔna. " 9 Ɣesiaɣi si nu gbagbeawo tsɔ ŋutikɔkɔe, bubu kple akpedada na Ame si bɔbɔ nɔ fiazikpuia dzi, Ame si le agbe tso mavɔ me yi mavɔ me la, 10 ametsitsi blaeve vɔ eneawo tsyɔa mo anyi ɖe Ame si bɔbɔ nɔ fiazikpuia dzi la ŋkume, eye wodea ta agu na Ame si le agbe tso mavɔ me yi mavɔ me la, eye wotsɔa woƒe fiakukuawo dana ɖe fiazikpuia ŋgɔ henɔa gbɔgblɔm be: 11 "Yehowa, mía Mawu, wòe dze be nàxɔ ŋutikɔkɔe, bubu kple ŋusẽ, elabena wòe wɔ nuwo katã, eye wò lɔlɔ̃nu ta woli, eye wowɔ wo ɖo. "

5 And out of the throne go lightnings and noises and thunderclaps; and there are seven torches of fire burning before the throne, which are the Seven Spirits of God; 6 and before the throne is what seems as if it were a sea of glass, like crystal; and in the middle of the throne and round about the throne four creatures full of eyes before and behind, 7 the first creature being like a lion and the second creature like a steer, and the third creature with a face like a man’s, and the fourth creature like a flying eagle, 8 and all four creatures with six wings apiece; they are full of eyes all around and inward, and they have no rest day and night saying "Holy, holy, holy is the Lord God, the Almighty, the one who Is and Was and Is Coming. " 9 And when the creatures give glory and honor and thanks to him who sits on the throne, him who lives forever and ever, 10 the twenty-four aged men will throw themselves down before him who sits on the throne and do reverence to him who lives forever and ever, and drop their wreaths before the throne saying 11 "Worthy art thou, our Lord and God, to receive glory and honor and power, because thou didst create all things, and at thy will they were and were created. "
Nyaɖeɖefia
Revelation

Woŋlɔ nu ɖe agbalẽa me kple egodo siaa, eye wotsɔ nutrenu adre tre enu sesĩe. 2 Eye mekpɔ mawudɔla sesẽ aɖe le gbeƒã ɖem kple gbe gã aɖe be: "Ame kae dze aɖe nutrenuawo ɖa ahaʋu agbalẽ xatsaxatsa la? " 3 Gake ame aɖeke menɔ dziƒo alo anyigba dzi alo anyigba te, si te ŋu ʋu agbalẽ la alo kpɔ eme o.

5 And I saw lying in the right hand of him who sat on the throne a book written on the inside and on the back, sealed up with seven seals; 2 and I saw a strong angel making proclamation in a loud voice "Who is worthy to open the book and break its seals? " 3 and nobody in heaven nor on earth nor under the earth could open the book or look at it.
4 Eye mefa avi ʋuu, elabena womekpɔ ame aɖeke si dze aʋu agbalẽ la alo akpɔ eme o.
4 And I wept much because nobody worthy to open the book or look at it was found.

Kpɔ ɖa! Dzata si tso Yuda-toa me, ame si nye David ƒe kè la, ɖu dzi, eya ta ate ŋu aɖe nutrenu adreawo ɖa, eye wòaʋu agbalẽ la. " 6 Eye le fiazikpui la kple nu gbagbe eneawo titina kple ametsitsiawo titina la, mekpɔ alẽvi aɖe le tsitre ɖi, edze abe ɖe wowui kpɔ ene, eye dzo adre kple ŋku adre li nɛ; ŋku siawo tsi tsitre ɖi na Mawu ƒe gbɔgbɔ adre siwo wodɔ ɖo ɖe anyigba blibo la dzi. 7 Enumake alẽvi la va xɔ agbalẽ la le Ame si bɔbɔ nɔ fiazikpuia dzi la ƒe nuɖusi me.

5 And one of the aged men said to me "Do not weep; here, the Lion out of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has won the day to open the book and its seven seals. " 6 And in the middle of the throne and the four creatures, and in the middle of the aged men, I saw standing a lamb looking as if it had been slaughtered, with seven heads and seven eyes, which are God’s Seven Spirits sent out into all the earth; 7 and it came, and it took it out of the right hand of him who sat on the throne.

8 Esi wòxɔ agbalẽa la, nu gbagbe eneawo kple ametsitsi blaeve vɔ eneawo tsyɔ mo anyi ɖe Alẽvi la ŋkume, eye saŋku kple sikakplu siwo yɔ fũu kple dzudzɔdonu ʋeʋĩ la le ametsitsiawo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe si.

8 And when it took the book the four creatures and the twenty-four aged men threw themselves down before the lamb, having each one a harp, and golden saucers full of incense which are the prayers of God’s people.

(Dzudzɔdonu ʋeʋĩ la le tsitre ɖi na ame kɔkɔewo ƒe gbedodoɖawo.) 9 Eye wodzi ha yeye le gbɔgblɔm be: "Wòe dze be nàxɔ agbalẽa, eye nàɖe eƒe nutrenuawo ɖa, elabena wowu wò, eye nètsɔ wò ʋu ƒle amewo tso to sia to kple gbegbɔgblɔ sia gbegbɔgblɔ kple ame ƒomevi ɖe sia ɖe kple dukɔ sia dukɔ me na Mawu, 10 eye nèwɔ wo wonye fiaɖuƒe kple nunɔlawo na mía Mawu la, eye woaɖu fia ɖe anyigba la dzi. " 11 Eye mekpɔ mawudɔla gbogbo aɖewo ƒo xlã fiazikpui la kple nu gbagbeawo kpakple ametsitsiawo, eye mese woƒe gbe, eye woƒe xexlẽme nye akpe ewo teƒe akpe ewowo kpakple akpe teƒe akpewo, 12 eye wole gbɔgblɔm kple gbe gã aɖe be: "Alẽvi si wowu la dze, be wòaxɔ ŋusẽ kple kesinɔnu, nunya, ŋutete, bubu, ŋutikɔkɔe kple kafukafu. " 13 Eye mese nuwɔwɔ ɖe sia ɖe si le dziƒo kple anyigba dzi kple anyigba te kple atsiaƒu dzi, kpakple nu siwo katã le wo me la le gbɔgblɔm be: "Ame si bɔbɔ nɔ fiazikpui la dzi kple Alẽvi la tɔ nanye kafukafu, bubu, ŋutikɔkɔe kple ŋusẽ tso mavɔ me yi mavɔ me. " 14 Eye nu gbagbe eneawo gblɔ be: "Amen! " Eye ametsitsiawo tsyɔ mo anyi hede ta agu.

9 And they sing a new song, "Worthy you are to take the book and open its seals, because you were slaughtered and bought men for God with your blood out of every tribe and language and people and race, 10 and made them a kingdom and priests for our God, and they shall reign on the earth. " 11 And I saw and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the creatures and the aged men; and their number was thousands of thousands and millions of millions, 12 saying in a loud voice "Worthy is the slaughtered lamb to receive power and wealth and wisdom and strength and honor and glory and blessing. " 13 And every created thing that there is in the heavens and on the earth and under the earth and over the sea, and everything in them, I heard saying "To him who sits on the throne, and to the lamb, belong blessing and honor and glory and might forever and ever. " 14 And the four creatures said "Amen "; and the aged men threw themselves down and did reverence.
Nyaɖeɖefia
Revelation

6 Esi mekpɔ Alẽvi la wòɖe nutrenu adreawo dometɔ ɖeka ɖa la, mese nu gbagbe eneawo dometɔ ɖeka gblɔ kple gbe si le abe dziɖegbe ene be: "Va! " 2 Eye kpɔ ɖa, mekpɔ sɔ ɣi aɖe, eye ame si bɔbɔ nɔ edzi la lé dati ɖe asi, eye wotsɔ fiakuku nɛ, eye wòdo go yi ɖale aʋa dzi ɖum be yeawu yeƒe aʋadziɖuɖu la nu.

6 And I saw when the lamb opened one of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four creatures say in a voice that sounded like a clap of thunder "Come! " 2 And I saw, and there was a white horse with a rider that had a bow and was given a wreath and went out victorious and to win victories.

3 Esi wòɖe nutrenu evelia ɖa la, mese nu gbagbe evelia gblɔ be: "Va! " 4 Eye sɔ bubu aɖe do, ebiã hɛ̃, eye woɖe mɔ na ame si bɔbɔ nɔ edzi la be wòaɖe ŋutifafa ɖa le anyigba dzi, ne amewo nawu wo nɔewo, eye wotsɔ yi gã aɖe nɛ.

3 And when he opened the second seal I heard the second creature say "Come! " 4 and another horse went out, a red one, with a rider to whom it was given to take peace from earth and that they should slaughter each other; and he was given a great sword.
5 Esi wòɖe nutrenu etɔ̃lia ɖa la, mese nu gbagbe etɔ̃lia gblɔ be: "Va! "
5 And when he opened the third seal I heard the third creature say "Come! "

Eye kpɔ ɖa, mekpɔ sɔ yibɔ aɖe, eye ame si bɔbɔ nɔ edzi la lé nudanu ɖe asi. 6 Mese gbe aɖe abe nu gbagbe eneawo domee wòɖi le ene gblɔ be: "Lu kuart ɖeka naxɔ denario ɖeka, eye ƒo kuart etɔ̃ naxɔ denario ɖeka; eye mègawɔ vɔ̃ aɖeke ami kple wain o. "

And I saw, and there was a black horse with a rider that had a balance in his hand; 6 and I heard what seemed to be a voice among the four creatures say "A quart of wheat for a shilling and three quarts of barley for a shilling; and do not injure the oil and the wine. "

7 Esi wòɖe nutrenu enelia ɖa la, mese nu gbagbe enelia ƒe gbe wògblɔ be: "Va! " 8 Eye kpɔ ɖa, mekpɔ sɔ aɖe si fu kpii, eye ame si bɔbɔ nɔ edzi la ŋkɔe nye Ku. Eye Tsiẽƒe le eyome tututu. Eye wona ŋusẽ wo ɖe anyigba ƒe akpa enelia dzi, be woatsɔ yi legbe, dɔwuame, dɔvɔ̃ wuame kple anyigbadzilã wɔadãwo awu amewoe.

7 And when he opened the fourth seal I heard the voice of the fourth creature saying "Come! " 8 And I saw, and there was an ashy horse with a rider whose name was Death, and the Grave followed with him, and they were given dominion over a fourth of the earth to kill by sword and by starvation and by epidemics and by the beasts of the earth.
9 Esi wòɖe nutrenu atɔ̃lia ɖa la, mekpɔ ame siwo wowu le Mawu ƒe nya la kple ɖase si woɖina ta la ƒe luʋɔwo le vɔsamlekpui la te.
9 And when he opened the fifth seal I saw underneath the altar the souls of those who had been slaughtered because of the word of God and of the testimony that they had.

10 Eye wodo ɣli kple gbe gã aɖe le gbɔgblɔm be: "Aƒetɔ Dziɖulagã, kɔkɔetɔ kple nyateƒetɔ, ɣekaɣie nàdrɔ̃ ʋɔnu anyigbadzinɔlawo ahabia hlɔ̃ wo ɖe míaƒe ʋu ta? " 11 Eye wona awu ʋlaya ɣi wo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe; eye wogblɔ na wo be woalala vie, va se ɖe esime wo hati kluviwo kple wo nɔvi siwo wu ge woala abe ale si wowu woawo hã ene la ƒe xexlẽme nade.

10 And they cried out loudly "How long will it be, holy and true Master, before thou wilt do justice and avenge our blood upon those who live on earth? " 11 and they were each given a white robe, and were told to rest a little while longer till the number of their fellow-servants and their brothers, who were to be killed the same as they had been, should also be completed.

14 Eye dziƒo bú abe agbalẽ aɖe si woŋlɔ́ ene, eye woɖe to sia to kple ƒukpo sia ƒukpo ɖa le wo teƒe. 15 Eye anyigbadzifiawo, dziɖuɖumegãwo, aʋafiagãwo, kesinɔtɔwo, ŋusẽtɔwo, kluviwo kple ablɔɖemewo katã ɣla wo ɖokuiwo ɖe agadowo me kple towo ƒe agakpewo dome. 16 Eye wole gbɔgblɔm na toawo kple agakpeawo be: "Mimu dze mía dzi, eye miɣla mí tso Ame si bɔbɔ nɔ fiazikpuia dzi la ŋkume, kple Alẽvi la ƒe dziku la nu, 17 elabena woƒe dzikuŋkeke gã la ɖo, eye ame kae ate ŋu anɔ te ɖe enu? "

12 And I saw when he opened the sixth seal, and there was a great earthquake, and the sun became black like haircloth, and the whole moon became like blood, 13 and the stars of the sky fell to the earth as a fig-tree shaken by a great wind throws off its green fruit, 14 and the sky broke away like a sheet of paper rolling up, and every mountain and island were moved out of their places; 15 and the kings of the earth and the magnates and the generals and the rich and the strong and every slave and freeman hid themselves in the caves and among the rocks of the mountains, 16 and kept saying to the mountains and to the rocks "Fall on us and cover us away from him who sits on the throne and from the lamb’s anger, 17 because the great day of their anger has come, and who can stand? "
Nyaɖeɖefia
Revelation

7 Le esia megbe la, mekpɔ mawudɔla ene wole tsitre ɖe anyigba ƒe dzogoe eneawo dzi, eye wolé anyigba ƒe ya eneawo ɖe asi goŋgoŋ, ale be ya aɖeke nagaƒo ɖe anyigba dzi alo ɖe atsiaƒu dzi alo ɖe ati aɖeke dzi o. 2 Eye mekpɔ mawudɔla bubu aɖe wòdo tso ɣedzeƒe le dzi yim, eye Mawu gbagbe la ƒe nutrenu aɖe le esi; eye wòdo ɣli kple gbe gã aɖe ɖo ɖe mawudɔla ene siwo wona ŋusẽ be woawɔ vɔ̃ anyigba kple atsiaƒu la, 3 le gbɔgblɔm be: "Migawɔ vɔ̃ anyigba alo atsiaƒu alo atiawo o, va se ɖe esime míetre mía Mawu ƒe kluviwo ƒe ŋgonu vɔ hafi. " 4 Eye mese ame siwo nu wotre la ƒe xexlẽme, wotre ame akpe alafa ɖeka blaene vɔ ene nu le Israel-viwo ƒe toawo katã me: 5 Le Yuda-toa me la, wotre ame akpe wuieve nu; le Ruben-toa me la, wotre ame akpe wuieve nu; le Gad-toa me la, wotre ame akpe wuieve nu; 6 le Aser-toa me la, wotre ame akpe wuieve nu; le Naftali-toa me la, wotre ame akpe wuieve nu; le Manase-toa me la, wotre ame akpe wuieve nu; 7 le Simeon-toa me la, wotre ame akpe wuieve nu; le Lewi-toa me la, wotre ame akpe wuieve nu; le Isakar-toa me la, wotre ame akpe wuieve nu; 8 le Zebulon-toa me la, wotre ame akpe wuieve nu; le Yosef-toa me la, wotre ame akpe wuieve nu;

7 After this I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth holding the four winds of the earth, that no wind might blow over the land nor over the sea nor on any tree; 2 and I saw another angel coming up from the eastern horizon with the seal of the living God, and he cried out loudly to the four angels to whom it was given to injure the land and the sea 3 "Do not injure the land nor the sea nor the trees till we have sealed the servants of our God on their foreheads. " 4 And I heard the number of the sealed, a hundred and forty-four thousand sealed out of every tribe of the sons of Israel: 5 out of the tribe of Judah twelve thousand sealed, out of the tribe of Reuben twelve thousand, out of the tribe of Gad twelve thousand, 6 out of the tribe of Asher twelve thousand, out of the tribe of Naphtali twelve thousand, out of the tribe of Manasseh twelve thousand, 7 out of the tribe of Simeon twelve thousand, out of the tribe of Levi twelve thousand, out of the tribe of Issachar twelve thousand, 8 out of the tribe of Zebulun twelve thousand, out of the tribe of Joseph twelve thousand, out of the tribe of Benjamin twelve thousand sealed.

le Benyamin-toa me la, wotre ame akpe wuieve nu. 9 Le nu sia megbe la mekpɔ, eye kpɔ ɖa, ameha gã aɖe si ame aɖeke mete ŋu xlẽ o la, tso dukɔ sia dukɔ, to sia to, ame ƒomeviwo katã kple gbegbɔgblɔ sia gbegbɔgblɔ me, le tsitre ɖe fiazikpui la ŋgɔ kple Alẽvi la ŋkume, wodo awu ʋlaya ɣiwo, eye wolé deʋayawo ɖe asi. 10 Eye wole ɣli dom kple gbe gã aɖe le gbɔgblɔm be: "Míaƒe xɔname tso mía Mawu, ame si bɔbɔ nɔ fiazikpui la dzi kple Alẽvi la gbɔ. " 11 Eye mawudɔlawo katã le tsitre ƒo xlã fiazikpui la kple ametsitsiawo kpakple nu gbagbe eneawo, eye wotsyɔ mo anyi ɖe fiazikpui la ŋgɔ hede ta agu na Mawu, 12 le gbɔgblɔm be: "Amen!

9 After this I saw, and there was a great crowd, that no one could count, out of every race and tribe and people and language, standing before the throne and before the lamb, clad in white robes and with palms in their hands, 10 and they cried loudly "Salvation belongs to our God who sits on the throne and to the lamb. " 11 And all the angels stood round about the throne and the aged men and the four creatures, and threw themselves down on their faces before the throne and did reverence to God, 12 saying "Amen, blessing and glory and wisdom and thanks and honor and power and strength belong to our God forever and ever; amen. " 13 And one of the aged men answered by saying to me "Who are these that are clad in the white robes, and where did they come from? " 14 Said I to him, "Sir, you know. "
Mía Mawu la tɔ nanye kafukafu, ŋutikɔkɔe, nunya, akpedada, bubu, ŋusẽ kple ŋutete tso mavɔ me yi mavɔ me. Amen. "
And he said to me "These are the ones who come from the great distress, and who washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the lamb.

Eye wògblɔ nam be: "Ame siawoe nye ame siwo do go tso xaxa gã la me, eye wonya woƒe awu ʋlayawo, eye wowɔ wo ɣie le Alẽvi la ƒe ʋu la me. 15 Esia tae wole Mawu ƒe fiazikpuia ŋgɔ ɖo, eye wole subɔsubɔdɔ kɔkɔe wɔm nɛ zã kple keli le eƒe gbedoxɔ la me; eye Ame si bɔbɔ nɔ fiazikpuia dzi la akeke eƒe agbadɔ la ɖe wo dzi. 16 Dɔ magawu wo azɔ o, eye tsikɔ hã magawu wo azɔ o, ɣe kple ŋdɔkutsu magaɖu wo o, 17 elabena Alẽvi si le fiazikpuia gbɔ la, akplɔ wo, eye wòafia mɔ wo ayi agbetsidzidziwo gbɔ. Eye Mawu atutu aɖatsi sia aɖatsi ɖa le woƒe ŋkume. "

15 This is why they are before God’s throne and worship him day and night in his temple, and he who sits on the throne will spread his presence over them; 16 they will hunger no more and thirst no more, nor shall the sun strike upon them, nor any heat, 17 because the lamb in the center of the throne will take care of them and guide them to springs of waters of life; and God will wipe away every tear from their eyes. "
Nyaɖeɖefia
Revelation
8 Esi wòɖe nutrenu adrelia ɖa la, ɖoɖoe zi le dziƒo anɔ abe gaƒoƒo afã ene.
8 And when he opened the seventh seal there came a silence in heaven for a half-hour.
2 Eye mekpɔ mawudɔla adre siwo le tsitre ɖe Mawu ŋkume la, eye wotsɔ kpẽ adre na wo.
2 And I saw the seven angels who stand before God; and they were given seven trumpets.

3 Mawudɔla bubu aɖe si lé sikadzudzɔdosonu ɖe asi la va tsi tsitre ɖe vɔsamlekpui la xa, eye wotsɔ dzudzɔdonu ʋeʋĩ gbogbo aɖe nɛ be wòado dzudzɔ ɖe sikavɔsamlekpui si le fiazikpuia ŋgɔ la dzi esi wose ame kɔkɔewo ƒe gbedodoɖawo.

3 And another angel came and took his stand on the altar with a golden censer, and was given much incense to use for the prayers of all God’s people on the golden altar before the throne; 4 and the smoke of the incense went up before God out of the angel’s hand for the prayers of God’s people.

4 Eye dzudzɔdonu ʋeʋĩ si le mawudɔla la si me ƒe dzudzɔ kple ame kɔkɔewo ƒe gbedodoɖawo de dzi le Mawu ŋkume. 5 Ke mawudɔla la tsɔ dzudzɔdosonu la enumake, eye wòɖe dzo le vɔsamlekpuia me de eme wòyɔ, eye wòtsɔe ƒu gbe ɖe anyigba dzi.

5 And the angel took the censer, and he filled it with fire off the altar and threw it on the earth, and there came thunderclaps and noises and lightnings and an earthquake; 6 and the seven angels that had the seven trumpets prepared to blow.

6 Eye mawudɔla adre, siwo si kpẽ adreawo le la, dzra ɖo be yewoaku kpẽawo. 7 Mawudɔla gbãtɔ ku eƒe kpẽ la. Eye kpetsi kple dzo kpakple ʋu tsaka dza ɖe anyigba dzi; eye anyigba ƒe akpa etɔ̃lia fiã, eye atiwo ƒe akpa etɔ̃lia fiã, eye gbe mumuwo katã fiã. 8 Mawudɔla evelia ku eƒe kpẽ la.

7 And the first blew, and there was hail and fire mixed with blood, and it was thrown on the earth; and a third of the earth was burned up, and a third of the trees were burned up, and all green herbage was burned up.

Eye wotsɔ nane si le abe to gã aɖe si le bibim ene la ƒu gbe ɖe atsiaƒu me. Ale atsiaƒu ƒe akpa etɔ̃lia trɔ zu ʋu; 9 eye nu gbagbe siwo le atsiaƒu me la ƒe akpa etɔ̃lia ku, eye tɔdziʋuwo ƒe akpa etɔ̃lia gbã.

8 And the second angel blew, and what seemed like a great mountain on fire was thrown into the sea; 9 and a third of the sea turned to blood, and a third of the live creatures in the sea died, and a third of the shipping was wrecked.
10 Mawudɔla etɔ̃lia ku eƒe kpẽ la. Eye ɣletivi gã aɖe si le bibim abe akaɖi ene la ge tso dziƒo, eye wòge dze tɔsisiwo ƒe akpa etɔ̃lia me kple tsidzɔƒewo. 11 Woyɔa ɣletivi la be Gbe Veve.
10 And the third angel blew, and there fell out of the sky a great star blazing like a torch; and it fell on a third of the rivers and on the springs of water; 11 and the star was named Wormwood.
Eye tsiwo ƒe akpa etɔ̃lia le vevem abe atsa ene, eye tsiawo wu ame geɖewo, elabena tsiawo le vevem.
And a third of the waters turned to wormwood, and many of the men died of the waters because they were turned bitter.

12 Mawudɔla enelia ku eƒe kpẽ la. Eye woƒo ɣe ƒe akpa etɔ̃lia kple ɣleti ƒe akpa etɔ̃lia kpakple ɣletiviwo ƒe akpa etɔ̃lia, ne woƒe akpa etɔ̃lia nado viviti, eye ŋkeke ƒe akpa etɔ̃lia nagakpɔ kekeli o, eye zã hã nenema ke.

12 And the fourth angel blew, and a third of the sun was blasted and a third of the moon and a third of the stars, so that a third of them should be darkened and the day should not be light for a third of it, and likewise the night.
13 Mekpɔ hɔ̃ aɖe wòle dzodzom le yame ʋĩi, eye mese wògblɔ kple gbe gã aɖe be: "Baba, baba, baba na anyigbadzinɔlawo le kpẽ susɔe siwo mawudɔla etɔ̃awo le kuku ge la ta! "
13 And I saw, and I heard an eagle flying in the zenith say loudly "Woe, woe, woe to those who live on the earth, from the remaining trumpet-notes of the three angels that are to blow. "
Nyaɖeɖefia
Revelation
9 Mawudɔla atɔ̃lia ku eƒe kpẽ la. Eye mekpɔ ɣletivi aɖe ge tso dziƒo va dze anyigba, eye wotsɔ aʋlimesafui la nɛ.
9 And the fifth angel blew, and I saw a star from the sky fallen to the earth, and it was given the key to the well of the abyss.
2 Eye wòʋu aʋli la nu, eye dzudzɔ tu tso eme abe kpodzo gã aɖe me dzudzɔ ene, eye dzudzɔ la na ɣe do viviti, yame hã do viviti.
2 And it opened the well of the abyss, and smoke came up out of the well like the smoke of a great furnace, and the sun and the air were darkened from the smoke of the well.

3 Eye ʋetsuviwo do tso dzudzɔ la me va anyigba la dzi, eye wona ŋusẽ wo, abe ŋusẽ si tɔgbi le dziɖegbe siwo le anyigba dzi la si ene. 4 Eye wogblɔ na wo be woagawɔ vɔ̃ anyigbadzinu miemie, gbe mumu, alo ati aɖeke o, negbe ame siwo Mawu ƒe nutrenu mele ŋgonu na o la ko. 5 Womeɖe mɔ na ʋetsuviawo be woawu wo o, ke boŋ be woawɔ fu wo vevie ɣleti atɔ̃, eye fu si wowɔ wo la le abe veve si ame sena ne dziɖegbe tee ene. 6 Eye le ŋkeke mawo me la, amewo adi ku, ke womakpɔe akpɔ o, eye adzro wo vevie be yewoaku, gake ku asi le wo gbɔ.

3 And out of the smoke grasshoppers came out upon the ground, and they were given such powers as the scorpions on the ground have, 4 and were told not to injure the grass of the earth nor any green thing nor any tree, anything but the men who do not have God’s seal on their foreheads; 5 and it was given to them not to kill them, but that they should be tortured five months (and their torture was like the torture of a scorpion when it strikes a man), 6 and in those days men should look for death and not find it, and should desire to die and death should be fleeing away from them.

7 Ʋetsuviawo ƒe dzedzeme le abe sɔ siwo wobla akpa na hena aʋawɔwɔ ene; eye nane le ta na wo abe sikafiakukuwo ene, eye woƒe mo le abe amegbetɔwo ƒe mo ene, 8 ke woƒe ɖa le abe nyɔnuwo ƒe ɖa ene. Woƒe aɖuwo le abe dzatawo tɔ ene, 9 eye woƒe akɔtakpoxɔnuwo le abe gayibɔkɔtakpoxɔnuwo ene. Eye woƒe aʋalawo le ɖiɖim abe tasiaɖam siwo sɔwo le hehem yina aʋa la ƒe ɖiɖi ene.

7 And the semblance of the grasshoppers was like horses prepared for war; and on their heads were what seemed to be wreaths like gold, and their faces were like faces of human beings, 8 and they had hair like women’s hair, and their teeth were like those of lions, 9 and they had coats of armor like iron armor, and the sound of their wings was like the sound of many-horsed chariots galloping to war.
10 Eye asike kple ti le wo si abe dziɖegbewo tɔ ene, eye woƒe asikewo mee woƒe ŋusẽ le be woawɔ nu vevi ameawo ɣleti atɔ̃.
10 And they have tails like scorpions, and stings; and in their tails is their power to injure men five months.
11 Fia le wo nu, eyae nye mawudɔla si le aʋli la nu. Woyɔnɛ le Hebrigbe me be Abadon, ke woyɔnɛ le Helagbe me be Apolion.
11 They have over them a king, the angel of the abyss; his name in Hebrew is Abaddon, and in the Greek language he bears the name Apollyon.
12 Fuwɔame ɖeka nu va yi. Kpɔ ɖa!
12 The one Woe has gone; two more Woes are coming after.

Fuwɔame eve bubu ava ɖe nu siawo yome. 13 Mawudɔla adelia ku eƒe kpẽ la. Eye mese gbe aɖe tso sikavɔsamlekpui si le Mawu ŋkume la ƒe dzowo me, 14 wògblɔ na mawudɔla adelia si si kpẽ le la be: "Tu ka mawudɔla ene siwo wobla ɖe Frat-tɔsisi gã la to. " 15 Eye wotu ka mawudɔla eneawo, siwo le dzadzraɖoɖi na gaƒoƒo la, ŋkeke la, ɣleti la kple ƒe la, be woawu amewo ƒe akpa etɔ̃lia.

13 And the sixth angel blew, and I heard one voice from the horns of the golden altar before God, 14 saying to the sixth angel, the one who had the trumpet, "Unchain the four angels that are chained at the great river Euphrates. " 15 And the four angels that were kept in readiness for the hour and day and month and year, to kill a third of mankind, were unchained.
16 Eye sɔdolawo ƒe aʋakɔ la ƒe xexlẽme le akpe blaeve teƒe akpe ewo: Mese woƒe xexlẽme.
